Description: Bleach blonde curtains are an effortlessly cool style for guys who want to stand out with length, texture and color. Whether you want a carefree surfer look throughout the year or just a slightly tousled and windblown finish, this cut features a prominent center part, curtain bangs that fall to the cheekbone, and an undercut that draws attention to the top of the hair.

Nom: Cool Textured Quiff with Low Bald Fade
Description: The cool textured quiff with a low bald fade is stylish, rugged, and packs enough sex appeal to make any man irresistible. This modern quiff is a fashionable look that can be easy to pull off with a comb and some texturizing pomade. The low bald fade draws the eye upward, so it’s great for guys who want to play up their eyes.

Nom: Blowout with Mid Fade and Line Up
Description: The blowout with mid fade and line up cut is ideal for men who prefer a style that makes a statement. The hair on the top and in the front is a few inches long, and it slowly tapers to a shorter length in the back and blends into the mid fade on the sides. A blow dryer and some strong styling product are all it takes to create the voluminous look on top.

Nom: Thick Short Hair with High Taper Fade
Description: Thick short hair with a high taper fade is a simple, clean-cut hairstyle for guys who have naturally thick locks. The barber or stylist simply trims the top of the hair short but leaves a small section in the front slightly longer. This section is brushed up and back for the cut’s defining volume, and the high taper fade adds contrast to the look.

Nom: Brushed Up Quiff with Low Faded Sides
Description: The brushed-up quiff with low faded sides is an interesting, yet subdued cut ideal for casual and formal events alike. It features a bit of length on top that has been brushed up and back into a quiff, and the low faded sides create a perfect transition that brings the entire look together.

The buzz cut fade is a rugged and masculine haircut that is ideal for business professional men who don’t like to spend much time styling. With a high skin fade, this clean-cut look works beautifully with a short, thick beard. For a modern twist, feature a line up or shave in a hair design.

Nom: Short Curly Afro with Low Fade
Description: The short curly afro with a low fade highlights the texture of natural curls without being too over the top. Shorter than the traditional afro, the curls are carefully defined for a more modern and fashionable style. The low fade adds some interest to the cut, and an impeccable line up along the forehead, temples, and sideburns adds neatness and shape.

Nom: Thick Messy Quiff with Short Sides
Description: A thick messy quiff with short sides can be a stylish way to create volume, flow and dimension. A cool textured hairstyle is a fresh and chic choice for college guys and young men who want to show off their beautiful locks while maintaining some structure.

Nom: Thick Curly Hair with Low Skin Fade
Description: Thick curly hair with a low skin fade is suitable for guys who want to showcase their hair’s natural texture without too much volume and weight. The curly style rests at the front and falls over the forehead to create a thick fringe. The curls slowly get shorter toward the crown, and the fade creates the perfect transition to the skin just above the ears. To define and lift the curls, apply a light hold mousse to wet hair, scrunch gently, and allow it to air dry.

Nom: Classic Ivy League with Mid Fade
Description: The classic Ivy League with mid fade is a neat, clean-cut style that suits just about every face shape and hair type. The hair on top is one to two inches long, brushed up slightly in the front, and styled in a loose side part. The mid skin fade starts at the temple area and finishes about an inch above the ear.

Nom: Short Hair with Long Fringe and Tapered Sides
Description: Short hair with long fringe and tapered sides is a trendy look that offers plenty of styling versatility. The top section of hair is cut in layers that are longer in the front and somewhat shorter along the sides and back. The long hair in front creates a tousled fringe, and the tapered sides pull the cut together. For formal events, slick the hair straight back. To style a casual look, just let the hair fall naturally.

There’s nothing quite like the classic quiff for men who want to look handsome and put-together. The hair on top and in front is about three inches long, and it’s brushed up, back, and slightly off to one side to add height. The sides are tapered starting at the forehead, and the hair is styled in a way that creates the illusion of a subtle side part.

Nom: Comb Over with Low Taper Fade
Description: The classic comb over with a low taper fade is a gentlemanly and masculine look for guys who prefer a sophisticated and charming appearance. A deep side part serves as the dividing line between tapered sides and the thick, full hair on top, which is combed over and slightly back.

The cool middle part is a romantic, youthful, and sexy cut. The medium-length hair is expertly snipped into layers, then loosely parted in the middle. A bit of tousling is all it takes to create the soft windblown look. This style works best for guys who have some natural wave or curl in their hair.

Nom: Crew Cut with Spiky Front and Undercut
Description: The crew cut with a spiky front and undercut is both fun and fashionable, so it’s great for guys who don’t want to be taken too seriously. The classic crew cut is brushed up in the front, brushed forward from the crown, and then brushed down at the side at the corner of the forehead. The undercut gives this look some trendy freshness.

Nom: Short Wavy Hair with Mid Skin Fade
Description: Short wavy hair with a mid skin fade is a masculine and sexy cut that is relatively simple to style at home. The cut features two-inch long hair on top from just behind the forehead to the crown, and a mid drop fade creates a gentle transition to the skin just above the ear. To style, apply a generous amount of strong-hold mousse to damp hair, then brush it straight up from the roots, give it a quick scrunch, and allow it to dry.

The modern mullet is a bold style that makes a rebellious and fashion-forward statement. The cut features short hair on the top and sides along with textured cropped bangs. Paired with some flow in the back, the hair at the crown comes tousled for a spiky rock-and-roll look.

Nom: Curled Up Top with High Taper Faded Sides
Description: A curled up top with high taper faded sides haircut is certainly unique, and it’s sure to turn a lot of heads. A deep side part separates the high taper fade from the much longer hair on top. The main feature of this cut is the wave-like curl on top, which is both fun and whimsical. A blow dryer and a round brush are the best tools to recreate this style.

The modern mohawk fade adds a few trending style elements to the classic mohawk. The cut is slightly wider than a typical mohawk, and the “spiky” look is far more subtle. The hair at the front is styled similarly to a quiff, and the abrupt taper on the sides eases the transition between the voluminous top section and the bald head just above the ears.

A modern mop top is a cute and boyish cut that frames the face and draws attention to the eyes. This medium-length style covers both the forehead and part of the ears with vertical fringe, and it looks great on guys with some natural wave or texture in their hair. For a textured look or well-defined curls, try working in some texturizing pomade.

Nom: Modern Pompadour Comb Over with Undercut
Description: The modern pompadour comb over with an undercut is a classy and interesting style for guys who take pride in looking fashionable. The hair at the front and top is left a few inches long, then combed over from a deep side part. The pompadour at the front adds incredible volume, and the undercut creates the illusion of more height. The shaved line adds a touch of personality.

The longer shaggy haircut is cute, charismatic, and fun. The medium-length hair is layered, then loosely parted in the center. The hair in front is brushed over the forehead to create fringe, while the rest of the hair follows the natural direction of growth. A tousle with the fingers is all it takes to create the sexy and trendy messy look.

The faux hawk with a high fade is an edgy attention-getter, and it’s relatively simple to do. The hair on top is about three inches long, and it is styled in slightly messy spikes. The high fade at the corner of the forehead serves as a transition point between the faux hawk and the buzzed or shaved hair at the sides. For easy styling, use a strong hold product and blow dry the hair straight up from the top.

Nom: Flat Top with High Skin Fade
Description: The flat top with a high skin fade is neat and clean, and it’s perfect for guys who want an interesting look that doesn’t require much effort. The hair on the top is trimmed short – about an inch and a half long – and brushed forward from the crown. The front section of hair is brushed straight up to create the flat appearance, and the high skin fade creates a seamless blend between the top section of hair and the shaved head on the sides.

The Ivy League with a high taper is a simple, fashionable, and chic look with just a hint of attitude. The top looks like the classic Ivy League – short hair brushed forward from the crown, and slightly longer hair in the front brushed up and over to one side. The high taper makes this cut interesting and unique.

Nom: Long Comb Over with Mid Skin Fade and Hard Part
Description: The long comb over with a mid skin fade and hard part is a fashionable and fresh take on a classic cut. The prominent hard side part that is cut in with clippers is the defining feature. The hair on the short side of the part features a mid fade to skin about an inch above the ear. The three-to-four-inch hair on the opposite side of the part is brushed up, over, and back to create a voluminous and sophisticated style.

Nom: Long Curly Fringe with Tapered Sides
Description:
Long curly fringe with tapered sides will fashionably highlight your natural curls while delivering height, volume and visual appeal. The interest is at the top and front of the hair, which is several inches long and brushed forward over the forehead to create the fringe. The tapered sides start at the corner of the forehead and create the transition between the long hair on top and the very short hair at the sides and nape.
Textured Long Slick Back
The textured long slick back is a sexy, irresistible cut perfect for a true heartthrob. The five-to-six-inch hair on top is combed upward and back for a slightly wavy and fluid look. To keep the style in place, use a strong-hold mousse or gel. A wide-tooth comb can help create the texture and definition that give this cut its eye-catching glow.

Nom: Short Crew Cut with Mid Fade
Description: The short crew cut with mid fade is a contemporary take on a classic military style. With a cropped top, the mid fade creates a tapered transition into the skin. Pair this look with a line-up and groomed facial hair for a refreshing and eye-catching look.

The long quiff is a modern hairstyle that delivers height, volume and flow for a flattering look. Paired with a high taper, the short sides complement the longer hair on top, elongating the face and drawing attention to your features. Fun and fresh, this haircut style will turn heads everywhere you go.

Nom: Long Side Swept with Temp Fade
Description: The long side swept with temp fade haircut mimics the 50s greaser look with a bit of modern flair. This timeless classic requires medium-length hair grown out to the top of the cheekbone. To style, apply a styling gel to still-wet locks, create a slightly off-center side part, and comb the hair on the short side of the part down and back. Then comb the other side of the hair off to the side and let the hair dry. The comb creates texture while the gel lends to the iconic wet look.

Nom: Medium Tousled Hair with Scissored Sides
Description: The medium tousled hair with scissored sides style is a cool windblown look with volume. The longer hair on top features a very loose side part, and it flows upward and back. The top of the cut blends into the shorter hair on the sides with a perfectly scissored taper, which creates the illusion of even more lift.

Nom: Messy Brush Up with Mid Taper Fade
Description: The messy brush up with a mid taper fade combines sophistication and class with an edgy attitude. The front top section of hair is three to four inches long, and it is brushed upward and back for drama. The rest of the hair is casually combed over from a deep side part that serves as the transition point for the mid taper fade. You’ll need a strong pomade, wax or clay to maintain this look all day.

The faux hawk with shaved sides is a very bold and daring look that is both clean-cut and edgy at the same time. A neatly shaved line even with the top of the forehead serves as the separation between the faux hawk and the shaved hair on the side. The three- to four-inch-long hair on top is brushed up and slightly forward from the crown, then straight up at the front.

The messy long hair trend continues, and it’s packed with volume and sex appeal. This layered cut features longer hair at the front of the head and shorter hair toward the back. The hair is swept to the side from a deep and loose side part, then tousled for added volume. Texturizing pomade is ideal for creating the sectioned look.

Nom: Modern Blowout with Low Taper Fade
Description: The modern blowout with a low taper fade is a refreshing and youthful cut that works well for thick, coarse or wavy hair. The hair at the front is the longest but gradually tapers to a shorter length at the very back. A blow dryer and some matte pomade will provide the signature lift and texture. The seamless taper fade adds an element of neatness to the style.

Nom: Modern Brushed Back Hair with Undercut
Description: Modern brushed back hair with an undercut combines traditional “bad boy” looks with clean-cut military style. The hair on the top of the head is five to six inches long, and it is combed straight back from the forehead. The undercut starts high, creating a sharp contrast between the lengths. To style, use a strong hold gel and use a wide-tooth comb to create the texture.

Nom: Modern Side Part with Low Fade
Description: The modern side part with a low fade is classy and charming, but it’s unique enough to stand out in a crowd. The long hair on the top features a handsome upward swoop that begins at a deep side part. The low fade brings a bit of balance to the opposite side of the part and adds a hint of clean-cut masculinity.

Nom: Textured Wavy Hair with Undercut Fade
Description: Textured wavy hair with an undercut fade is an elegant and contemporary cut for guys blessed with thick waves or loose curls. The stylist or barber creates strategic layers that add natural lift, and some texturizing pomade further defines individual waves. The undercut fade creates the illusion of additional volume while the neatness contrasts with the unruly waves.

Nom: Short Crew Cut with High Skin Fade
Description: The short crew cut with a high skin fade is a handsome and rugged style. The cut is favored by the military for its simplicity and easy maintenance, so it is ideal for guys who don’t enjoy styling. The top is trimmed very short from front to crown, and the skin fade adds a masculine touch. A shaved line gives this look some personality.

The side swept undercut is a low-maintenance style that keeps the top long, stylish, and naturally parted to the side. Ask your barber for an undercut to showcase the volume on top and a well-maintained beard.

Nom: Short Textured Spikes with Low Skin Fade
Description: Short textured spikes are a youthful and reliable cut that every man should try in his life. Leave the front longer than the back and it’ll be simple to style with a medium hold pomade. A low skin fade helps provide contrast.

Nom: Curly Twists with High Skin Fade
Description: Curly twists are a great way to add unbeatable style for men blessed with this unique hair type. A shape up keeps the cut looking crispy and a high skin fade helps add height.

If you want a trendy haircut, talk to your barber about a mohawk with a burst fade on the sides and back. This punk look is elevated by the burst fade, making for a softer cut compared to the traditional hawk. Stock up on hair gel because you’ll need to keep your hair on point every day.

A messy crew cut is perfect for the man who doesn’t want to deal with the hassle of long hair. Ask your barber to take the top down to an inch or two and add some texture. A hair clay will help with separation and messiness.

Nom: Buzz Cut with Temp Fade and Shape Up
Description: The buzz cut is a short military-inspired haircut for guys who want an effortlessly masculine look. Pair this with a temp fade and shape up for an unbeatable style and edge.

The brush back is a classic look that delivers volume, texture and flow for a cool style. The front of the hair is typically left longer for you to brush back and hold with pomade. Cropped sides give a tidy finish.

For the summer, take your spiky hair down a few notches. Ask your barber to leave an inch and a half on top with layers to provide stylish texture. A fade will help take the back and sides in tight to keep you cool.

Layered and irresistible, the textured comb over is ideal for fashionable guys who like to brush their hair to the side. Long and sweeping, the top is pushed to the side with pomade while a slight taper helps frame the face and show off your masculine features.
Rocking long hair with an undercut is a suitable look for more active men. Let the top grow loose for movement and clipper the back and sides for a cleaner cut.

A messy quiff is a good cut for the younger gentleman. The height of the style adds character to your appearance and the fade helps the cut last long. A medium hold product can aid in maintaining the structure of the look.

The temp fade is a modern haircut style that creates a tapered finish around the temples. Popular with black men, this faded cut can be paired with an afro, buzz cut, mohawk or high top to add extra flair and dimension. With a line up and skin fade finish, this bold and trendy look makes a statement.

Nom: Textured French Crop with Drop Fade
Description: The textured French crop is a trendy style for guys who like a relaxed look. Have your barber add a variety of layers to add fun to the look. A drop fade adds weight to the back of the head while keeping the sides short and easy.

Nom: Thick Crop Top with Low Skin Fade and Line Up
Description: Going short with thicker hair can be tricky, but this version of the crop top helps to elevate your natural allure. A low skin fade and line up keeps hair in its place and can transform guys from basic to ballin’.

A hard side part is a flawless choice for the man who likes order and organization. This version of the side part shaves a line where the hair naturally parts for precision. This cut is just begging for a sick fade to finish it off.
Full of texture and precision, the curtains hairstyle is given layers so it falls naturally over the back and sides. A lightweight product will help lock in the look without weighing your style down.

Nom: Spiked Bangs with Shaved Sides and Line Design
Description: Unleash your inner rock star and ask your barber to give you spiked bangs. Trust us when we say that this sharp cut is popular for its messiness and charisma. Go rogue with shaved sides and a line design to let people know that you’re built different.

A modern quiff is an easy go-to for the man who likes a reliable haircut. Medium length and messy on top, this variation is updated by going for an undercut fade up to the temple, which adds structure to your face.

The thick brush up is a humble option for the boy next door type. The back and sides are tapered slightly to add more weight to the top, which is brushed back with the help of a blow dryer. You can hold the look in place all day with some gel.

The time has come to embrace your natural curls, gentleman. Bring this picture to your barber so they know to leave the top with some length to play with and to take the sides in close with a taper. A spritz of sea salt spray on wet hair will give you an excellent beachy vibe.

Nom: Hard Comb Over with Shaved Sides
Description: Getting a hard comb over means you always know how to style your hair in the morning. The hard part keeps the sections of your head distinct and the higher fade with shaved sides, in this case, keeps the head shape round and clean.

You’re going to need to learn how to use your blow dryer for this cut, boys. To achieve the high volume style, you’ll need to push the front cup with a brush and lock it in with a good pomade. The undercut fade heightens it further and makes your face appear longer.

A short faux hawk fade is an outstanding choice for the guy thinking about a mohawk but isn’t ready to go full punk. Ask your barber to put texture on the top and push your hair towards the middle with gel for the illusion of a hawk. Complete the look with a fade for the ultimate finish.
The modern pompadour is the essence of classy. This impressive cut goes long on top with an exaggerated bump and the high keeps the look symmetrical. Pomade and hairspray solidify this look.

Nom: Thick Crew Cut with Bald Fade
Description: The thick crew cut is a short and classic option for the guy who likes a straightforward look. The hair is faded from the front of the head toward the back, leaving it slightly longer in front. A bald fade takes it straight to the skin with a razor for an extreme result.
The buzz cut fade is a military-inspired haircut for guys who don’t want to put effort into their hair. Have your barber use a number two or three on top and fade out the sides for this sleek cut.

The comb over fade is a flattering look for any man with any hair type. For those blessed with natural curls, part them to the side with pomade for a dapper style that won’t quit. A fade will help this cut stay cleaner for days.

Nom: Brushed Up Fringe with Short Taper
Description: The brushed up fringe is a great refreshing cut for the modern busy guy. Try out a strong hold pomade to keep your style locked in for hours. The short taper strengthens your jawline and seals the deal on this manly cut.

Nom: Brushed Forward Top with Mid Fade
Description: To take your fringe cut to the next level, brush it forward and up for a style no one will see coming. Use a strong clay for lasting hold and pair it with a mid fade for those clean-cut lines.

Nom: Blunt Crop with Low Bald Fade
Description: A blunt crop is a popular barbershop haircut for guys who want a decisive and daring look. The fringe is cut straight and bald and a low bald fade neatens up the look and keeps your hair off the ears. With this cut, it’s clear that you know what’s trending and when to jump on it.

Nom: Full Brush Back with Classic Tapered Sides
Description: The full brush back is an old-fashioned look that harkens back to the movie stars of the past. This cut relies on strong layers to create a wavy look that cascades when pushed back. A classic taper takes the sides just short enough to style without showing too much skin.

Nom: Hard Comb Over with Low Fade
Description: A hard comb over with a low fade is a cool haircut that allows guys to create a clean and textured cut. The deep shaved part keeps your look segmented, and the low fade helps accentuate manlier features, like your jawline.

Nom: Spiky Hair with Disconnected Undercut Fade
Description: Spiky hair is a modest go-to haircut that can be achieved at any barbershop. Simply add texture to the top without taking off too much length and opt for a strong hold pomade to style. A disconnected undercut fade paired with this will make for an irresistible look.

A blowout is great for the guy who isn’t afraid of a bombastic look with volume. A blow dryer and gel are your new pals for this look, as you’ll need them both to nail this cut. The beard fade freshens up the face and will keep people on their toes when they try to come for your fit.

Rocking the slick back look with shaved sides is not for the faint of heart. The sides are taken high up to the round of the head and the hair towards the center is left long enough to push back. Asking your barber for this cut lets the world know that you’re adventurous and ready for anything.

For you guys looking to let the top get wicked and long, try tying it into a top knot to keep your unruly locks in check. Then get yourself to the barbershop and ask for a high fade. This cut will show every man out there that you’re willing to try anything.

Nom: Loose Comb Over with Mid Taper
Description: The loose comb over is an update on the modern look, and more and more guys are asking for layers on top to help with texture and body. Getting a mid taper with this cut allows for a subtler flair and using pomade will let your ruggedness shine.

A wavy bro flow is a handsome cut that works well for guys who don’t want to waste time styling their mane. Ask your barber for layers to help debulk the top. You can leave your locks natural or spritz sea salt spray for a beachy look with texture.

Whether you’re aiming for a short look for the summer or a low-maintenance cut throughout the year, the high and tight is what you’ll want to ask for. Cut with clippers, ask for a number four on top with a high skin fade to maximize your masculinity. You’ll want to invest in a beard trim for a sexy style.

The modern mullet fade is a trendy look for guys who want to experimenet with this updated retro style. This awesome take on the divisive cut goes for a tight fade on the sides and texture throughout the top and into the back. Apply a styling mousse or a light cream to keep the party in the back going all day long.

Nom: Long Fringe with Mid Skin Fade
Description: A long curly fringe with a mid skin fade can be a cool style that elevates your look. Try letting the top grow and ask your barber for a mid skin fade to emphasize the height and bounce of your natural locks.

Like the faux hawk we described earlier, this variation takes it up a notch by going even tighter on the back and sides, leaning closer to a traditional mohawk. A strong matte product can help make this look unbeatable by creating separation and flair.

The modern quiff is a classic and timeless style that lets the gents with thicker hair embrace their natural volume. Utilize a strong pomade to help your look defy gravity and ask for a high fade to lengthen your face. This makes your hair look fuller and healthier.

The curly taper fade is a versatile and modern hairstyle for guys who want a sharp look that will always impress. Whether you want a low, mid or high fade, this curly hairstyle will offer control, definition and contrast to achieve the perfect finish. With a short cut on the sides and back, you can choose cropped curls for a low-maintenance look or longer hair for extra volume and flair.

Nom: High Fade with Short Curly Hair and Line Up
Description: Short curly hair with a high fade on the sides is a stylish and sleek look for modern men who prefer a fresh and masculine style that pairs well with a beard. Short curls are a good option for the low-maintenance guy, and throwing in a high fade keeps the top looking full while helping you survive the scorching summer heat. Finish with a line up to keep this style trendy.

A low fade with curly hair is a classic choice for modern men that will suit any desired look. The low taper fade is a timeless and cool cut that will highlight your natural curls. As the focal point, this curly hairstyle is low-maintenance and always handsome.

A mid fade with curly hair is a stylish and balanced haircut for guys who prefer a daring look that can still look business professional. The medium fade offers a gentle and versatile cut that contrasts the longer curls on top. Modern and cool, this faded curly style is a favorite in barbershops around the world.

Nom: Long Curly Hair with Low Drop Fade
Description: A long curly hairstyle with a low drop fade can be a simple way to embrace your texture with a trendy look. Going for a drop fade will keep the back and sides clean and using a bit of sea salt spray will go a long way to add texture and grit to your kinky stands.

Nom: Brushed Forward Wavy Hair with Low Taper and Beard
Description: For the gent with wavy hair, try brushing it forward for a new way to add volume to your everyday look. Pair it with a well-trimmed beard to help sharpen your jaw and a low taper to keep the look stylish and subtle.

Nom: Long Curly Hair Fringe with Mid Fade and Shaved Line
Description: A fringe with long curly hair is a fashionable style that will emphasize your natural waves and give your style a strong edge. A mid fade lets you bare some skin without getting too wild and shaving in a line adds personality. This modern haircut for teen boys and young men simply can’t be beat.

Nom: Curly High Top with Mid Skin Fade
Description: A curly high top with a mid skin fade is a modern style that take things back to the 80s with a retro twist. Simply put, the high top is a classic look that is making a well-deserved comeback. For the guy who wants to stand out, this haircut is kept long and voluminous while the sides are taken in to build up the look.

Nom: High Volume Curly Hair with Mid Bald Fade
Description: For a refreshing reset to your style, keep your curly hair tall by asking your stylist for layers on top and applying some strong styling product to build texture. Get a mid bald fade to keep your looking fresh day after day.

Nom: Long Curly Hair with Low Fade
Description: What makes this curly hair look different from the options above is that the low fade only goes an inch all the way around while keeping weight at the corners of your head. Let your locks flow over your forehead for a fresh look that’s a cinch to style in the morning.

Nom: Loose Curls with Mid Bald Fade
Description: Keeping your curls loose is a charming look that lets people know how laid back you are and getting skin tight sides will make your hair easier to manage. A bit of pomade will go a long way here to add shine and definition.

Nom: Low Taper Fade with Mini Curls
Description: Tighter, mini curls are the best way to keep your unruly texture under control and a low taper fade helps the look last longer and feel fresher. This is an excellent look for the fashionable man who wants to be two steps ahead of the trend.

Nom: Curly Hair with Mid Fade and Line Up
Description: For the guy with curly hair who wants to own up to his masculinity, try asking for a mid fade and line up. These options will keep the look rugged and easier to style.

Nom: Tousled Curls with High Undercut Fade
Description: This look is for the heartthrob who doesn’t mind putting a bit of effort into his look. Search for a quality mousse to keep your tousled curls locked in and ask for a high undercut fade to show off the texture. It may take a while to master, but it’ll be worth it once you do.

Nom: Long Curls with Mid Skin Fade
Description: A mid skin fade is a cool way to keep your long curls looking fresh. It gives men more to work with on top without having to manage long, unruly sides. A clay product, in this case, will add texture and body.
For a clean-cut look, cut your curls short and bite the bullet with a high fade. Styling with a bit of pomade will take seconds and you’ll be irresistible to the ladies.

A low drop fade with curls is a classy way to let your texture shine without having to cut too much off. In this case, a little skin is left at the bottom of the fade for contrast while the top is left longer for a flattering finish.

Nom: Curly Side Part with Low Fade
Description: A side part is a traditional cut for any hair texture. Keeping your hair to one side with pomade adds volume and the low fade tidies everything up. Owning this cut will bring out your boyish charm.

Nom: Messy Curly Hair with High Undercut Fade
Description: Try keeping your curly hair long and messy for this popular option for the skater who wants to look good zooming through the streets. A high undercut fade lets your curls fall unevenly over the sides allowing for a wide variety of looks to try.

Nom: Curly Hair Fade with Shape Up and Beard
Description: This curly fade hairstyle will freshen up your look with a high skin fade and line up. The short faded sides add an edge to the cut and accentuate your texture, while a shape up and beard complete the look.

Every guy should be able to rock a mohawk once in their life regardless of their texture. Men with curly hair have an advantage here thanks to the natural volume of the curls. Seal the deal with a fade and you’re ready for the concert.

Nom: Curly Hair All Over with Low Taper Fade and Line Up
Description: For a soft conservative style, ask your barber for a simple taper fade. Even with a fade as subtle as this one, curls of any length will be sure to stand out.

Nom: Loose Blonde Curls with Low Taper and Beard
Description: For a daring new look, keep your curls loose and feature some color to create a brilliant finish. A low taper and sharp beard make for a natural look that lets your hair texture do all the talking.

Nom: Full Curls with Mid Bald Fade
Description: Full curls are a fantastic way to show off your natural texture and a mid bald fade keeps this cut interesting for days after you leave the chair. Use mousse to lock the look in place for hours.

Nom: Short Curly Crop with High Drop Fade
Description: A short crop is ideal for curly hair because it helps keep your look predictable. The uniformity of the length on top is only heightened by the high drop fade that adds flair and intrigue to this simple cut.
If you want to take an original approach to your look, try fading your cut into your beard. Doing this will keep your face symmetrical and showcase your curls with intensity.

A curly drop fade is a cool style for men who want to embrace and control their curls with a stylish look. The drop fade will keep the cut crisp and different from every other faded look in the room, while the shaved part creates separation and drama.

Nom: Curly Twists with Low Fade and Shape Up
Description: A curly twist style with a low fade and shape up is a modern option for guys who want to show off their kinky texture. A shape up keeps the strands in line, while a low fade ties it all together.
Wearing messy curly hair with a taper fade is a unique take on an easy style. Not much effort is needed to achieve the look and all you’ll need is a blow dryer and a dime-sized amount of pomade.

The curly blowout fade is a cool haircut style for guys who want to experiment with the latest trends. This style lightly fades the sides for a rounder finish, while leaving the curls natural and playful. Use a small amount of gel to finish the look.

Nom: Thick Curly Hair with Mid Bald Fade
Description: This thick curly fade haircut is a cool style that will make a statement and stand out. The mid bald fade makes certain that the look creates a clean-cut finish, while using some pomade will accentuate the natural texture and provide extra volume.

Nom: Long Curly Fringe with High Drop Fade
Description: The fringe isn’t just for guys with straight hair! Grow your curls long and let them flow onto your forehead for an instantly iconic haircut. Finish it off with a high drop fade to keep your style interesting and sexy.

Nom: Long Curly Fringe with Low Skin Fade
Description: If you don’t want to commit to the high drop fade, try asking for a low skin fade. This will let the long curly fringe stand out without going too tight on the back and sides.

Nom: Loose Short Curly Hair with Low Taper
Description: For a look that adds softness and control, rock your curls looser and shorter with a low taper fade. To get this look, apply pomade onto your hands and rake it through your hair, making sure you tousle it for more bounce.

Nom: Messy Short Curls with Mid Skin Fade and Design
Description: Short messy curls are an easy style that will always look good for young guys. If you want to build on this look, try shaving a design into the heavier part of the skin fade to show off a unique style that is all your own.

Nom: Thick Curly Hair with Classic Taper
Description: What’s great about this look is that you can keep your curly hair nice and thick while remaining dapper and classy with a simple taper. If you’re the type of guy who frequents banquets and can rock a tux, then this is the haircut you’ve been looking for.
Adding texture to curly hair is perfect if you want to add body and versatility to your drip. Ask for a fade and all you’ll need is a bit of clay to keep the look solid all day long.

The curly high top fade is a go-to for men with curly hair because of its iconic texture and finish. Mess around with the look by throwing in a fade and invest in a curl sponge for greater versatility in how you style the top.

Nom: Long Curly Top with Low Bald Fade
Description: This curly fade hairstyle is a masculine and cool look for guys who want to lean into their high-volume curls that can get out of control. A low bald fade screams clean-cut while a long curly top makes for a fashionable style in the front.

A brush back is the perfect cut for the young professional. A high taper and tight sides focus your attention on the textured longer hair on the top. Using a blow dryer for styling, this stylish and modern brushed back style can suit any occasion.

A messy spiky hairstyle is a reliable look for any man that prefers easy styling. With a textured finish, this short spiked style will make you feel like you’re the frontman of a rock band. Simply, have your barber point cut the top to add angles to your spikes. Gel is your go-to product for as long as you have this cut.

The textured French crop is simple and elegant, requiring very little effort to style. The short hair has been brushed forward from the crown while some texturizing pomade creates chunky texture. The short fringe, tapered sides, and groomed beard create a cohesive style that works with different textures and face shapes.

Nom: Choppy Bangs with Low Drop Fade
Description: Choppy bangs and a low drop fade can offer a cool look for the young man who wants boyish charm and messy styling! This modern style is fun for someone who wants to be stylish without using a brush, hair dryer, or products. Have your barber add texture and keep the cut low-maintenance with a skin fade. Just run a clay hair product over the top and you’re set.

The classic comb over is a handsome haircut for modern men who want a clean business professional style. Similar to the Don Draper look, this timeless hairstyle is a popular choice because it helps the jawline stand out. The back and sides are kept short, but not much needs to be taken off for the look to pop. Apply a medium-shine pomade through and all eyes will be on you.

A hard side part is a classic style with a modern twist that offers definition and edge. Classy yet slightly rebellious, ask your barber for a side part but with a line shaved in with trimmers, creating strong contrast. Paired with pomade and a quick blow dry, you’ll create dimension and volume that lasts all day.

The side swept style is as low-maintenance as it is chic. This smooth cut adds layers on top to give the look texture and flow. It doesn’t matter if you want the back and sides kept long or clipped short, this style that lends itself to versatility and is great for the guy who wants to embrace his inner fashion model.

A buzz cut with a high fade is a low-maintenance style that suits every guy at any age. This short haircut features a cropped top achieved with clippers and keeps the look uniform while taking the sides to the skin for a drastic contrast. You won’t need hair products for this look.

Nom: Long Side Swept Style with Undercut
Description: The long side swept cut is a modern style for the guy who wants a daring look. The undercut will highlight the drastic difference between the top and sides. Let your hair air dry after the shower for a naturally messy look.

Long textured hair is a bold style for the modern guy who wants to look like a Hollywood heartthrob. Much like Jason Momoa’s hairstyle, adding layers can do a lot to enhance this look by adding volume and movement to your flowing locks.

Being born with curly hair can be daunting, but it doesn’t take much to look fresh. Make your day easier by going in tight on the sides with a fade and letting the top grow longer to show off its natural bounce. Style it up with some mousse and you’ll never have to struggle with your tight locks again.

Nom: Sharp Quiff with Low Fade and Hair Design
Description: The sharp quiff is a refined look for young men who want to feature natural flow with a spiky touch. The modern quiff is known for being angular and bold. When paired with a low fade, the cut is a favorite pick at barbershops around the world. Express yourself further by shaving in a design to stand out in the crowd.

Nom: Short Curly Hair Fringe with Low Drop Fade
Description: For guys blessed with tight, curly hair try asking for a short fringe. Let the curls run over your forehead for a youthful look that some guys don’t naturally have. And get a low drop fade for a cut with a ton of contrast without going too short. A pump of sea salt spray will give this style bounce.

Nom: Thick Faux Hawk with Undercut Fade
Description: The faux hawk is here to stay and for a good reason. Stylish and modern, the hair is kept long and thick on top and held up with a strong pomade. A disconnected fade lets the hawk shine in all its glory.

Messy and thick curly hair is a masculine and handsome look for guys who want to embrace their natural texture. To enhance your thick messy curls, take in the sides to add some contrast and use mousse to tousle the top for the perfect red carpet look.

Nom: Short Messy Hair with High Skin Fade
Description: If you want a versatile look, this short messy hairstyle is an edgy choice that comes with texture. You’ll want to ask your barber for a high skin fade to achieve this fashionably drastic contrast. Run a matte product over the top for irregular spikes and you’ll be good to head out the door in no time.

Nom: Short Slick Back with Mid Fade
Description: As a popular cut, a short slick back with a mid fade provides a low-maintenance and effortlessly stylish finish. The tapered fade that blends into the skin pairs naturally with the sleek hair on top, keeping the look uniform while ensuring that not a single hair is out of place.

Nom: Side Swept Ivy League with High Taper
Description: The side swept Ivy League is an easy style that shows off strong features. A high taper is a clean-cut look that keeps weight at the corners while still blending naturally into the sideburns. Using strong pomade adds great texture and shine to complete the look.

The French crop is a trending short haircut for men who want a textured and low-maintenance style. This charming hairstyle is layered and textured on top and lets the bangs fall carelessly over the forehead. The back and sides are kept tight to highlight your more masculine features. Lastly, finish it with a low-shine pomade for dimension.

The long ear tuck is an attractive hairstyle for guys who want to experiment with a low-maintenance and charming look. There is no complicated way to get this style, you simply just have to grow it out. It’s great for the guy who wants to focus on other things in his life and when life gets dapper, simply tuck your hair behind your ears and smooth over the top with a splash of water to pull it all together.

A thick and long fringe with faded sides is a layered hairstyle that will make a bold statement. To achieve the look, grow out your hair so the bangs fall closer to your eyebrows and take the back and sides higher to emphasize the different textural elements. A low-shine product is your friend here.

Nom: Loose Comb Over with Taper Fade
Description: For a charming look, the loose comb over is a cut that will pull all eyes on you. Use pomade to push your hair out of your face and ask for a taper fade to keep the look tight and crisp. Everyone will want to copy your look.

A man bun is a simple look that never goes out of style. Getting it to the right length may stress you out, but once you’re there you’ll be rewarded with luscious locks that you can pull up into a righteous bun. Rock a beard to add rugged definition.

Like a fringe with less work, having medium messy hair gives guys a carefree look with tons of flair. No fade or neat tricks here, just a ton of layers on top and a light hold product to showcase texture.

The time to get the middle part haircut is NOW. It’s best for the guy who doesn’t like to keep their hair too long or too short and wants to be irresistible to all the ladies. Ask for layers to help soften the part and give some life to what could easily be a flat look.

The modern mullet is back and here to stay. It’s edgy and bold and not everyone can wear it well. You already know the drill, the hair is kept long over the top and into the back and you can opt for a fade to keep the sides stylish and short.

It’s time to let your inner bro out. The natural bro flow is a unique and smooth style for the guy who wants to relax and take things slow. For an irresistible look, use pomade to keep your locks in place.

The pompadour fade is a cool hairstyle that offers volume, height and flow for an eye-catching look. You’ll need to keep the hair at the front longer to create the trademark pomp and a fade on the sides to underscore the height. Pomade will be your product of choice to keep the look solid from morning to night.

To be trendy is to try every look there is to rock. The shag takes little to no effort to achieve and is great for the guy who doesn’t mind being rugged and messy. Ask your barber to add some layers to give it shape and ditch the products in this case because this look is for someone who has other things to care about.

Nom: Short Comb Over with High Taper
Description: The short comb over is a timeless and masculine look for the modern gent. It’s a cinch to achieve and asking for a high taper only modernizes this classic cut. Use pomade and a comb to get the style right every single time.

If you’re looking to keep your hair long and manly try the slick back undercut. The sides are cut short and disconnected from the top for wicked contrast and gel is used to push the top back. Your friends won’t even believe how easy it is to achieve.

A textured quiff is a sexy cut for the modern man. The height of the style is enhanced by adding texture on top letting the world know that you like to have a good time. A medium-hold styling cream can help produce a lasting, natural hold.

Nom: Textured Short Crop with Low Bald Fade
Description: Getting a textured short crop is a stylish way to beat the heat in the summer. The top is cut to no more than an inch and a low bald fade helps bring out your jaw without looking severe. This iconic look is sure to bring out the tough guy in you.
Textured spikes are a fun way to try something bold. Ask your barber for layers on top and to keep the sides short but not too close to the skin. Lastly, keep it high and stiff with gel or pomade.

Nom: Thick Crop Top with Shaved Sides
Description: Just because you have thick hair, doesn’t mean you can’t rock a crop. Short and textured on top with a blunt fringe, the thick crop top is a breeze to style with hair clay. Take the sides high and tight to stand out from every other guy.

Nom: Thick Crop with Spiked Fringe and Low Taper
Description: If you want a longer variation of a thick crop, keep the front longer so you can spike the fringe with a strong product. Throwing in a low taper keeps things neat around the ears and tidy.

The top knot fade is a modern style for guys who like to stand out in any room. The longer hair on top is tied tightly while the back and sides are taken down to the skin to add gravitas. While you don’t need product with this look, a small amount of castor oil can keep your hair shiny and sleek.

Nom: Brushed Over with Short Sides and Beard
Description: Hair that is brushed over with short sides and a beard is funky, unique, and somehow irresistible. The long locks on top have been highlighted in a way that adds texture, and they flow up and over from one side. The short sides balance the height while a trimmed beard gives some ruggedness.

Nom: Short Textured Spikes with Low Skin Fade
Description: Short textured spikes with a low skin fade is a universally sharp and clean-cut look. The hair on top is short, slightly longer in the front, and “spiked” with a generous amount of texturizing pomade and a comb. For a clean-cut professional look, the skin fade and beard deliver a neat and classy style.

Nom: Slick Back with Pomp and Undercut Fade
Description: The slick back with a pomp and undercut fade combines contemporary elements with a 50s-style cut to create a smooth and dapper style. A strong hold gel is applied to the longer top and combed up and back to achieve the classic pomp. The undercut fade offsets the height of the pomp, which offers a perfectly handsome look overall.

Textured spikes with a taper fade is a sexy, flattering, and interesting style designed for every guy’s inner heartthrob. The longest section of hair is in the front and can be swept up and over like a quiff. Slightly shorter hair along the top moves gently to one side, and the taper fade creates a perfect transition to very short hair near the nape and around the ears.

Nom: High and Tight with Cropped Sides
Description: The high and tight with cropped sides is a simple, yet refined look that is ideal for no-nonsense guys with little patience for styling. With marginal contrast, a small amount of pomade applied with the fingertips can achieve a slightly messy look.

The short spiky crew cut breathes new life into an iconic style that has been favored by the military for decades. This style shares the same shape as the classic crew cut, but it is slightly longer. To create the spikes, apply styling gel to damp hair, comb to one side from an invisible part, then use the comb to lift the hair in the opposite direction.

A longer side part with a taper is a boyish and dapper style with personality. The hair length is about four inches and flows over the top from a deep side part. The sides are snipped shorter and brushed straight back, and a swirl of fringe that reaches the eyebrow serves as this cut’s focal point.

Nom: Long Brushed Up Fringe with Tapered Sides
Description: Long brushed up fringe with tapered sides is a fantastic cut for guys with natural texture in their hair. Three-to-four-inch-long locks flow forward from the crown of the head. The hair is tousled for the characteristic messy look, and then the fringe is brushed upward and out for lift. Tapered sides offset the height and give this cut shape.

The wavy mohawk with a drop fade is a subtle modern spin on a timeless style. Rather than long spikes down the center of the head, this cut features medium-length waves that are coiffed into a smooth and slightly textured mohawk. The traditional undercut has been replaced with a mid drop fade, which creates a more subdued transition.

Nom: Long Side Swept Bangs with High Undercut
Description: Long side swept bangs with a high undercut is a uniquely fluid look that offers youthfulness and charm. The fringe is the longest part of the hair, but it blends nicely with the textured top. Everything is swept over to the side, and the high undercut puts even more focus on the chunky waves.

Nom: Short Texture Spiky Hair with Shaved V-Shape Design
Description: Having short, textured spiky hair is the perfect cut to have as you venture into the v-shaped design trend. What makes this style unique is the disconnection in the fade and how high the arch goes from the back to the sides.

Nom: Brush Back with Skin Fade Neckline
Description: A brush back with a design is a simple way to add contrast and flair. As the hair is pushed back on top, it dovetails into the design, which is faded on the sides and comes to a non-faded point in the back. This version adds weight where it is needed.

For the man rocking a ton of volume, the angled neckline design is great in connecting the fade in the back to the beard up front. It provides a cohesive style that shows the intent of your trendy mind. Every guy will want to copy you.

If you want to keep things subtle while still upgrading your standard high fade, try having your barber fade it down to a “V” in the back. This design mimics the typical drop fade but leans bolder by not fading out the design.

Nom: Messy Spikes with Shaved V Design
Description: A shaved V design is a great companion to the messy spikes look. They add depth and direction and keep your look unpredictable because you don’t know where the style will land. In this example, the line stands out further because it’s placed between the faded line and the rest of the hair.

A bold angular neckline is the embodiment of an edgy haircut style for guys. This design gains inspiration from geometrical patterns and shapes to emphasize the cut and your neckline. Whether you go simple or intricate like the picture, you can bet that your look will be impressive.

Nom: Curly Hair Fade with V Shape Neckline
Description: For guys with a curly hair fade, spice up your look with this straightforward design. The hard line extends from the back to the side of the head and pulls the design through for a complete style. This bit of edge will add volume and character to your luscious curls.

The faux hawk is the perfect cut that will benefit from a v-shaped fade. Since the hair already comes to a point on top, the visual in the back helps draw the design completely from the front to the back of the head. With this look, you’re only steps away from a true mohawk.

Adding a V-shape design to your skin fade is another subtle choice to try if you want to update your style. The design helps add weight to the occipital region of the head while two shaved lines by the V add unbeatable individuality.

A semi-burst fade is improved upon with this simple design. The shaved line starts where the fade ends on the side and goes toward the back to meet the neckline. Versatile and stylish, this cool v-shaped haircut is easy to get and will transform your style.

For the man who loves anime, this cut is as close as you’re going to get in real life. The blowout offers dimension and the drop bald fade creates a cool modern finish. If you want a unique style with a V-shape cut, this look is clean and subtle, making it unlike anything else.

Nom: Textured Slick Back Undercut Fade with V Design
Description: A textured slick back can get stale over time, so try having some fun by shavings lines to your drop fade. With volume and texture on top, the undercut offers the perfect canvas for a trendy design in the back. With a double shaved V-cut, this cut is edgy and sleek.

Nom: Sponge Burst Fade Mohawk with Cool V Design
Description: This V-shape design creates a tribal façade with parallel lines and sharp edges. The intricacy of this pattern only enhances the trendiness of the sponge burst fade.

A low taper fade with a V-shape cut can be a classy look for guys who want a hint of attitude. For the businessman who likes to show off a bit of style, this subtle taper is versatile and universally flattering. While similar to a drop fade, the light neckline tapering sets this style apart, allowing you to stand out and be on-trend.

Nom: Curly Hair Fade with Shaved V-Cut Neckline
Description: Men, it’s time to be bold with your curls and try something new. This shaved V-cut neckline screams epic with its separation between the fade and the neckline. The sharp lines bring an edginess that will highlight your strong manly features.

Nom: Crew Cut with Y-Shaped Neckline Design
Description: Rocking a crew cut tells the world that you like things simple and easy, but rocking a Y-shaped neckline design tells the world that you’re not someone who follows trends. You set them! While the back goes down to a point, the fade is separated by a hard line, allowing for more versatility in the design.

A low fade faux hawk can operate like a mullet for a subtle approach. Also known as a fohawk fade, the long drop fade complements the short spiky styling on top. In the front, this is all business and traditional, but as you turn to see the back, the fade tapers into a “V” for a stylish twist. No one will see it coming. Feature stubble or a short beard for a rugged touch.

This bold slick back is iconic for being hard rock and punk. This layered design takes the style to the next level by adding contrast with every section and depth from every angle. Push the hair back with a strong high-shine product so everything is on-point.

Nom: Buzz Cut with Shaved Sides and Hair Design
Description: A buzz cut with shaved sides and a cool hair design is a bold and modern haircut style for guys who want a low-maintenance and casually cool look. Instead of the usual high skin fade, get a sick design that mimics two slashes in the fade. It’s a look that is equal parts daring and manly.

For a heavier look in the back that doesn’t take the fade too tight, a layered neckline design can help add character to an otherwise bland cut. The alternating layers of the fade catch the light in diverse ways and tell people that you’re always down to try something new.

Nom: Thick Curls with Temp Fade and V-Neckline
Description: Going for a temp fade offers plenty of style opportunities. The thick curls exude volume and life while providing contrast to the fade. Meanwhile, the sly design at the neckline gives a tiny nod to folks that you like to stand out from the crowd.

Nom: Heavy Mid Drop Fade with Low V-Neckline Design
Description: This mid drop fade keeps the back of the hair very dense and heavy, allowing for more texture and body to be added in. In this case, keeping the design low on the neckline pulls the focus lower and helps balance the cut. You’ll need some gel to finish this look.

An undercut is a modern and stylish haircut choice for guys who want to create a cool look, but there are still ways to enhance the style. Forget going up to the crown for your usual undercut and take it lower toward the neckline to create a sharp V-cut with shaved sides and lines.
Adding v-shaped cuts to your fade is a hot way to stand out from the crowd. Have your barber curve them up ever so slightly to imitate waves and shave a line through to fully embody the edginess.

If you’re getting a low fade, ask your barber to try something new and have it taper into a sharp angle just above the neckline. This design may be straightforward, but the style is effective and simple to achieve.

Nom: Long V-Shape Neckline with Shaved Sides
Description: A longer v-shaped neckline will emphasize the weight and volume of the hair on top. Designed to look like a blown-out faux hawk, the mid skin fade creates fashionable contrast and highlights the longer textured style. A matte pomade will help keep the waves in place while the shaved sides offer a low-maintenance and sleek finish.

If you’re looking to keep your hair long but you still like to add a bit of pop to your style, then grab pomade and slick your long hair back for this timeless look. The clean V at the tail of the cut shows that your style is precise.

Nom: Shaved Sides with V-Shaped Neckline and Cool Design
Description: To upgrade a simple shaved sides look, ask your stylist to add a cool design on top of the v-shaped neckline. In this example, a small cross design was added as a focal point to the back of the cut. The sky’s the limit on how you want to express yourself.

This modern v-shaped pattern is a cool design that will make a bold statement. This edgy and creative pattern will take a talented barber to pull off, but you can rest assured that you will be popular if you rock this cut. Generally speaking, awesome hair designs will get you noticed everywhere.
To take your undercut game up a notch, let your hair grow long enough to a ponytail and then shave the v-shaped design around that for an unbeatable style.

Another restrained choice, this cut keeps the top disconnected from the sides and adds a shaved line that creates two V’s in the back of the head above the neckline. A bald fade is best for this look to keep the design looking fresh for weeks.

Nom: Short Sponged High Top with Temp Fade and V-Shaped Neckline
Description: Adding a design to a short sponged high top is a flawless way to update this modern cut. The temp fade keeps the top of the head nice and tall, while the designed neckline balances the look by adding intrigue and style.

This creative design will add irresistible depth to your look. In this cut, they’ve gone ahead and expertly faded a deep V in the back and finished the look by shaving in two lines that look like contrasting straight razors.

Nom: Sharp V-Back with Razor Faded Sides and Neckline
Description: With shaved sides like this, you have to choose where you add your design wisely as you’ll have less to work with. By shaving lines on either side of the fade in the back, they’ve created a mindful design that is fashionable and enviable.

Nom: Full Brush Back Undercut Fade with V-Neckline
Description: A brush back with an undercut fade is a mature and versatile option for any man with style. The design at the neckline is tactfully placed very low to keep the look professional without giving up amusement.

Nom: Custom Design with Mid V-Fade Cut
Description: Intricate and entertaining, this custom design can be done in so many ways. In this case, it looks like a maze guiding the eyes from the top of the fade to the neckline. Talk with your barber about new ways to guide the eyes through the cut to provide an entertaining style.

For a daring and drastic pattern, a V-fade with a shaved spiky design in the back can be a badass choice. Choppy and jagged, this messy style looks stunning with this unique finish. This haircut isn’t for the faint of heart.

Requesting a V-cut to improve your basic mid fade is a fresh way to try something new. The V-lines add a little extra charisma to the cut without going too high up on the fade and distracting from the impressive ponytail.

Nom: Textured Brush Back with Low Taper
Description: The textured brush back with a low taper combines a clean-cut style with an edgy attitude to create this stylish look for white men. The cut features long hair on top that has been brushed straight back and slightly off to the side. The low transitional taper delivers a cohesive finish that is versatile enough for any event.

Nom: Low Skin Fade with Messy Fringe
Description: The low skin fade with messy fringe is a fresh and adventurous look that works nicely with natural curls or waves. The scissor cut on top is longest in the front and falls forward over the forehead to form the tousled bangs. A low fade brings much-needed contrast while the design and subtle line up add definition.

The hard side part fade is a cool and casual haircut for guys who want a style that can still be classy enough for the office and formal events. The hair sweeps over and slightly back from a shaved-in side part, which serves as the most prominent feature. A high fade creates contrast that keeps the focus up top.

Nom: Short Sides with Long Hair on Top
Description: Short sides with long hair on top is a modern haircut style that offers versatility and styling flexibility for a fashionable finish. This hairstyle can create a comb over fade or a cropped undercut, making it versatile enough to wear with jeans and a tee, a dress shirt and blazer or a full suit. The long choppy layers in the front fall forward to create windblown fringe. The shorter hair on the sides offsets that length and adds a gentlemanly element to the cut.

The high-volume brush back is bold, loud, and uniquely charming. The longer hair is combed up and over to build the signature lift. To personalize the look, wear it with a fade or undercut. Using a mid-hold pomade and adding highlights or lowlights can enhance this cut’s fun texture.

While a short crew cut may seem boring, the addition of color and texture can bring it to life. To style this look, ask your barber for a standard crew cut, but leave the sides just slightly longer. Use color to create contrast between the tips and roots, then use a high-hold product to spike the short hair.

The youthful quiff with a low taper is an excellent cut for guys who like the slightly messy and tousled look. Like the traditional version, the front section of hair behind the forehead is the longest. This modern quiff is brushed straight up to create the signature volume and lift. Shorter tapered sides offer a smooth transition. Some tousling with matte pomade gives this cut its windblown look.

The curly hair fade highlights the texture of curly hair in a masculine, rugged way. The hair at the top is longer at the front and shorter toward the back while the high fade gives needed contrast. A little mousse massaged into the hair from root to tip provides lift and defined curls.

The stylish French crop with a skin fade is both fashionable and fun. The top section is about an inch and a half long and moves forward from the crown to create a short fringe. Work some texturizing pomade into small sections for texture and wear it with a skin fade to draw the eye upward.

The modern pompadour with an undercut fade is a lively cut that is sure to attract plenty of attention. The hair on top and in the back is longer and brushed upward and slightly over to achieve the classic voluminous pomp. To create the illusion of even more height, go for an undercut skin fade.

The buzz cut fade is uncomplicated and attractive, which makes this cut perfect for guys who want to look their best without much effort. The hair is clipped extremely close to the skin on the top, and the high skin fade adds intrigue. Wear this cut with a full beard or goatee for a more rugged appearance.

The short spiky hair fade is an exceptional cut for guys who prefer a hint of boldness. The two-inch top and front sections of hair stand straight up in spikes. The hair on the sides offers some variation, and the high fade blends smoothly into the skin just above the ears for a smooth finish.

The modern mohawk with a burst fade is a bold and fun style packed with rebellious attitude. This iconic style features a wide strip of longer hair that starts at the forehead, curves around the crown and ends at the nape. Styling gel or pomade can help create the texture and lift, and a burst fade further highlights the shape.

Nom: Textured Brush Up with Skin Fade
Description: A textured brush up with a skin fade is a trendsetting look for guys who shy away from the ordinary. The hair on top and in front features a quiff-like lift, and the hair on the sides slowly fades into the skin to add a clean-cut finish. A shaved line high on the head adds another fun visual element.

This long layered style pays homage to the 90s with the side-swept fringe. The long layers on the top and sides fall neatly from a hidden side part, and the scissored layers underneath add some depth. Deep lowlights and platinum highlights give this cut its personality.

The modern mullet maintains the shape of its old-school predecessor, but the shorter length and choppy shape give this cut a fresh new look. True to form, the hair at the back of the head is longer than in the front. The addition of chunky layers, texture, and a unique burst fade that stops at the ear adds some edgy flair.

A classic slick back with tapered sides is a versatile everyday look that suits a broad range of face shapes. The three-to-four-inch hair is slicked up and back, then tousled for a perfectly imperfect look. The tapered sides create a smooth transition, and a short beard adds character.

The comb over fade is a handsome play on an original style. The glamorous volume at the front and top contrasts nicely with the angled fade on the sides. The deep, prominent side part serves as a focal point and balances the height on top with the short hair around the ears.

Rugged curtains suit a wide range of face shapes and hair types. Long layers on the top fall to the sides from a slightly off-center part to create curtain fringe on either side of the face. The bright blonde highlights and styling product offer manly texture that works well with or without facial hair.

The modern flat top is a cool haircut for men who want to style a popular retro look. The longer hair on top is about three inches long and styled straight up from forehead to crown. The resulting texture is slightly chunky, which pairs nicely with the skin fade on the sides.

Nom: Thick Brushed Up Hair with High Skin Fade
Description: Thich brushed up hair with a high skin fade is an ideal style for guys who want something easy that will stand out. The longer hair is brushed forward from the crown and upward from the forehead. This cut looks great with full facial hair, especially when worn with a high skin fade for contrast.

The slicked back undercut offers significant versatility for guys with virtually any hair type. The long hair in the front and on top is slicked straight back with plenty of product to hold it in place. Meanwhile, the undercut along the sides helps draw the eye upward. Depending on the hair length, this cut would look fantastic in a slicked back ponytail.

The blowout with a low taper fade is an omnidirectional chunky style that’s sure to turn heads. Similar to a traditional gentleman’s cut, the taper fade creates a smooth transition all the way to the nape. A blow dryer and some styling product position the top section of hair backward and upward with a textured finish.

A good short messy style should be chic and textured, and this one certainly fits the bill. The long waves flow from a hidden side part to create a sexy side-swept fringe. With the tousle and fade, this cut is fit for a true heartthrob.

Nom: Hard Side Part with Mid Bald Fade
Description: A hard side part with a mid bald fade combines smooth lines with symmetrical texture for a dapper and intriguing cut. The hair flows over from a shaved side part, and a slight lift in the front adds extra height. Highlights, styling products, and careful combing make for stunning texture.

The high and tight is ideal for guys who prefer no-fuss military-style cuts. The hair is trimmed very short, either with scissors or a trimmer. From the corner of the forehead downward, the head can be completely shaved or buzzed to stubble. A trimmed full beard completes a masculine look.

The mullet fade with a curly back is great for guys with super thick natural curls or waves. The short feathery layers contrast perfectly with the prominent curls in the back, while the fade delivers some extra flair. For curl definition and the wet look, use a high-shine styling gel.

The long middle part style is a soft, fresh, and fashionable cut that offers plenty of youthfulness and charm. The wavy layered locks flow to the side from a very subtle center part while the sides and back are snipped slightly shorter. Applying a matte mousse to wet hair can help create volume and definition.

The long side swept style is mysterious, romantic, and versatile. The top section of hair is several inches long, and the sides and back are trimmed with scissors. This look is as simple as flipping the hair to one side from a deep part. Styling mousse can supply some additional lift and hold where needed.

If you want to be a heartthrob, the man bun with a beard is the perfect choice for modern hipsters. The man bun style can be as simple as tying long, flowing locks in the back of the head, then allowing a few ends to hang free. This look is easy, casual, and packed with sex appeal, especially when paired with a majestic full beard.

Long fringe with tapered sides is best described as wild and carefree. The longer locks are brushed forward from the crown and up, and the hair at the forehead creates or long, chunky fringe. The tapered sides and short full beard offer some flattering balance.

The messy comb over with a beard perfectly combines chic style and masculinity. The cut features longer hair that flows off to each side of a slightly off-center part. The scissored hair on the sides is significantly shorter for contrast, and the full neatly-trimmed beard adds a rugged touch.

A long flowing style is a sexy choice for modern gents who prefer a fun and flirty look. The long hair flows effortlessly from a deep side part, which creates gentle volume at the front of the head. Choppy layers along the sides and the back give the look shape, and the stubbly facial hair ties the look together.

The spiked front with short sides look is a stylish option for guys who like to be the center of attention. This style features long hair on the top and in the front that stands straight up to provide textured spikes. The hair toward the back of the head gradually gets shorter, and the tapered sides offer contrast. This cut looks great with fun colors and unique facial hair.

Messy side swept fringe combines punk rock attitude with surfer boy style in a way that simply works. The style sweeps over in the same direction seamlessly, resulting in a natural flow. The tousled fringe falls over one side of the face to frame it. A mid taper or even an undercut works perfectly for this look.

Nom: Thick Short Curly Hair with Faded Sides
Description: Thick short curly hair with faded sides is a bold yet flattering cut for guys who want to show off their charming curls. The cut is just long enough to make the curl pattern visible and is styled forward to create a short curly fringe. Faded sides offer the illusion of extra volume, and neat facial hair balances the style.

Nom: Side Swept Crew Cut with Shaved Sides
Description: A side swept crew cut with shaved sides is a great option for guys who like the simplicity of the classic crew cut, but who prefer a little more edge. With a similar shape, the styling on top is left just slightly longer so it can gently sweep to one side. Texturizing pomade is essential for creating texture.

Nom: Hard Side Part with Mid Bald Fade and Beard
Description: The hard side part with a beard look is equal parts edgy and glamorous. The top section of hair flows perpendicular to a prominent deep part, but the hair in the front is brushed up and back just slightly for volume. The skin fade and short facial hair make this cut perfect for any occasion.

The edgy quiff takes a classic eye-catching style to a brand-new level with its extreme height. The cut features the traditional quiff shape, but the hair is four to five inches long in the front and stands straight up. The style moves forward from the crown to create cohesiveness, while the tapered sides provide some much-needed contrast. This look requires some seriously strong products that can hold the hair in place while offering texture.

The buzz cut is a short military haircut that offers a clean and bold look for men who want an easy style. The buzz cut fade offers a modern and high-contrast look that can take your style to the next level. Guys can choose between a low, mid or high fade haircut on the sides and back to create an edgy and stylish finish. To take it a step further, you can ask your barber to further tailor the cut with a skin fade that will taper the hair into the scalp. For a rugged handsome look, you can pair a full beard with your cut.

Nom: Modern Caesar Cut with High Taper
Description: The modern Caesar haircut style is a bold choice for fashionable men who want a masculine and clean look. You can get a straight fringe to frame your face and tie it all together with a high taper for an irresistible finish. When styling, use a matte clay product to create separation and texture.

Nom: Spiked Fringe with Skin Faded Sides
Description: A spiked fringe can be combined with bald faded sides to create a timeless look. Ask your barber to cut your hair down to finger length while adding texture for the iconic spiky look. Combined with a skin fade and beard, this masculine military-style haircut will look good on a guy with strong facial features.

The crew cut is one of the most common short haircuts for men who want a business professional style that always looks great. A crew cut can be a great way for military men to get a masculine look while maintaining longer hair. The fade offers tapered short hair on the sides and back with a slightly longer length on top, adding definition and style for the perfect finish. When styling, guys can brush the hair forward, sweep it to the side for a comb over or leave it messy for a casual look. Whether you’re a cop or in the Army, the hairstyle is a universally-flattering and charming option.

The French crop is a trendy and charming hairstyle for guys who prioritize texture and dimension. This cropped style features a thick, layered fringe to complement the short faded sides. Use a low-shine pomade for definition and a textured finish.

The hard side part can be a stylish and simple way to make a bold statement. This side part features a shaved line where the hair naturally combs over to create a precise separation. A low or mid skin fade will add contrast while a strong matte pomade can lock in your look and provide texture and volume.

The military fade is a popular haircut for men to get on the sides and back, offering a sharp and modern style that will elevate your look. The fade haircut involves gradually tapering the hair, going from long to short down the sides. There are many different types of fades to consider, including the low, mid and high fade. For an edgy vibe, guys can also feature a bald or skin fade.
Some guys like to add a low fade to their military cut for a soft and versatile finish, while others choose a mid or high fade to create a very short and masculine look. For a bold touch, a skin fade haircut can blend your hair into the scalp and give you a sleek style. The fade can be combined with a buzz cut, crew cut, high and tight, flat top or hard part for the perfect hairstyle.

Nom: Modern Textured Cut with Disconnected Fade
Description: A modern textured cut with a disconnected fade will take your style to the next level with a popular look. The brushed forward hair and spiked front complement the high skin fade and heavy stubble to achieve a masculine finish. Thinning shears and point cutting can be used to debulk the hair, giving it life. The disconnected fade will give the illusion that the hair on top is longer than it is.

The bowl cut is a classic military style that has transformed into a trendy choice in barbershops around the world. With military vibes, this modern variation keeps the back and sides extra short with slightly longer hair on top, creating bangs that hang over the forehead. To style, use a low-shine product to spike or brush forward.

The Ivy League is a smart and classy men’s hairstyle that will allow you to create a side swept look, resulting in a cool and preppy style. The Ivy League haircut combines a taper on the sides and back with a longer crew cut on top. Guys can add a fade to get a military-inspired look.
