With extra length and volume, you’ll want to style the Ivy League by sweeping the hair in front to the side for a classic gentleman’s style. You can use a matte styling product for a textured finish or a high-shine pomade to get a retro wet look.

Nom: Brushed Up Fringe with Mid Taper
Description: A modest cut for every man, the brushed up fringe exudes boyish charm. You’ll need to let the top get longer and ask for a mid taper to retain some length while creating contrast. To finish, use a styling gel to hold your locks in place all day.

The slick back fade is a trendy cut that flows naturally for easy styling and a sleek look. If you’re willing to forget the regulations, let the top grow a few inches so you can slick it back with gel or a strong pomade. Clean up the look by fading the sides nice and high.

The induction cut is a very short military haircut for guys who want a masculine look that requires no styling. The induction hairstyle is given to recruits on the first day of boot camp and can be cut using hair clippers with no guard. To experiment with this very short cut, you’ll want to ask your barber for a high skin fade on the sides and back to create some contrast with the hair on top. Similar to a shaved head, this look is suited for men with a square head shape and sharp facial features like a chiseled jawline.

This trendy textured spiky hair fade features short layers for a messy and textured look. With a high skin fade and shaved line design, this haircut is a solid choice for men. Don’t think too hard about how to style it – all you need to do is run some matte product through and you’re set.

The regulation cut is a longer Army haircut that has become a barbershop favorite for business professional men. A regulation haircut starts with a taper fade on the sides and back with a short crop on top that allows guys to style a side part. This military style is easy to maintain, looks good and works for most occasions. You’ll want to apply a medium to strong hair product for control and volume, resulting in an elegant and clean-cut style.

Nom: Short Side Swept Ivy with High Taper
Description: A side-swept Ivy League with a high taper is a modern and trendy play on the classic and conservative version. The hair is left long enough to style to the side while the tapered sides lend a subtle touch.

The flat top is a short haircut characterized by the hair on the top being cut flat and styled upright. With a fade on the sides and back, the flat top haircut is an edgy military style that looks great with thick, straight hair. Similar to a high and tight, you’ll need a strong styling product to keep your hair spiked all day. For a softer and more natural finish, guys should use a matte pomade or gel.

Nom: Thick High and Tight with Shaved Sides
Description: A high and tight with shaved sides can be a cool and really short haircut style that requires minimal styling. Much like the Peaky Blinders look, you’ll need to leave the top chunky and messy with texture and get the sides shaved high just before the round of your head. Scrunch your hair with a matte product to create separation.

A faux hawk fade is an excellent choice for the guy who wants a mohawk but can’t commit. Ask for some texture on the top and style your hair towards the middle for the hawk façade. Fade the back and sides to really get to the point.

The high and tight is a very short hairstyle for guys who want a shorter variation of the crew cut. The high and tight haircut can be characterized by a high fade on the sides and back with short hair on top, creating a simple and youthful style. You can ask your barber for a high skin fade to focus all the attention above. Whether you style your hair messy or sweep it to the side, the high and tight military hairstyle is a functional cut that you can get at home with clippers.

The butch cut is a modern haircut that comes with short hair all-around for a masculine look. Butch haircuts are great styles for military men and athletes who need functional cuts that minimize styling and distractions. There are many different types of butch hairstyles, ranging from the shorter burr to the longer brush cut. For a stylish look, talk to your barber about getting a medium to high fade on the sides and back. When trimming the hair on top, you’ll need a number 1, 2 or 3 clipper guard depending on short you want to cut your hair.

A high and tight recon is ideal for rebellious guys who prefer shaved sides with a short flat top on top. This high and tight style requires thick hair and a strong facial structure to work. Use a strong styling product to spike or brush the top forward.

Nom: Short Crop with Spiked Fringe and Low Bald Fade
Description: The short crop with a spiked fringe is a fresh take on the traditional crop haircut. With limited layers, the top is left heavier with enough at the front to push up with pomade. A low bald fade helps create rugged intrigue.

The burr cut has become a popular style for guys who need a very short and low-maintenance look. A burr is a type of butch haircut that is cut to less than 1/4 inch of hair on top. The burr cut hairstyle looks best with a skin fade or shaved undercut on the sides and back, giving you another dimension and some necessary contrast. Great for guys with thin or thinning hair, this military haircut offers an aggressive vibe that would be perfectly acceptable for a Marine or MMA fighter.

Nom: Thick Buzz Cut with High Skin Fade
Description: A thick buzz cut with a high skin fade is a cool style that will show off your fullness on top. Using longer guards, this cropped hairstyle can go as high up as a number six to leave more density. Pair it with a high skin fade for a ton of contrast and edginess.

The comb over is a classic men’s hairstyle that has become a fashionable look for modern gentleman. The comb over haircut is a style that starts with a fade or undercut on the sides and longer hair on top that is combed to one side for a parted finish. As a stylish business professional cut, the comb over fade offers a versatile look and can be a great look for military men. Whether you have straight, wavy or curly hair, you’ll want to experiment with this charming style.

A longer tousled-up style can be a chic look for younger men who want to venture away from a strict military style. Use hair mousse to give your locks body and ask for a high undercut to elongate your face and heighten natural volume.

The police haircut is a short style that looks clean-cut and professional while being convenient and practical. Police officer hairstyles have utilitarian features and tend to include styles like the short crew cut with a high skin fade, comb over tape, high and tight, buzz cut, flat top and shaved head. Similar to military styles, your short hair can be tailored to create the perfect look to suit your needs. With a fade on the sides and back, your cop haircut will look stylish and flattering all around.

The skin fade is a military-style haircut that blends the hair on the sides and back into the scalp to create a fresh cut. The skin fade haircut can be added to any modern hairstyle, making the style low-maintenance and cool. Great for the Marines, Navy, Army and all branches of the military, there are several fade haircut styles to explore for a stylish look.

The hard part has been a classic haircut for gentlemen who like to comb their hair to the side. The hard part cut features a thick shaved line into your hair with a razor. The part can separate the sides and top of your head or where you style your parted hair. This military style can be a unique way to get a cool and classy look.

A shaved head is a popular military-inspired style that provides the ultimate “no-maintenance” look. Shaving your hair can save you time, money and styling effort, but you’ll need to trim regularly to keep the clean, smooth look. Shop around for a good razor and shaving cream; your scalp will thank you.

The slicked back undercut is a popular haircut for guys who want a trendy look that blends classic and modern styling. This stylish hairstyle works with short to medium-length hair, and styling the look is as simple as blow-drying your hair back while using a brush to control the direction. Finishing with a matte pomade will hold this style in place all day or night.

Nom: Long Comb Over with Low Fade
Description: The long comb over with a low fade offers a bold, classy hairstyle for men who want a versatile look. The deep part adds contrast and height to the style while the low fade keeps the sides and back neat and clean cut. Styling with a low-shine pomade affords you some control without making your hair stiff.

As a popular hairstyle, the quiff is a cool look that continues to be a favorite in barbershops around the world. This voluminous haircut gives your look personality, and the skin fade on the sides enhances the height on top while providing a clean-cut style. It works best when your hair is three to four inches long on top, and you can style it with a pomade or wax that offers moderate to high hold to keep it looking stylish all day.

The modern side swept hairstyle is a trendy and sexy option that can look extra masculine with a full beard. It’s perfect for men who have thick hair between 3 and 5 inches long. To style it, simply brush your hair to one side, being sure to leave it textured and messy in the process. A medium hold pomade with low shine or a matte finish is ideal.

Nom: Short Textured French Crop with Taper Fade
Description: If you have curly or wavy hair, a short textured hairstyle with a high fade on the sides and back looks professional enough for the office, but still casual for a night out. As a short sides, longer top haircut, you’ll need 2 to 3 inches of length on top that tapers down to a close bald fade on the sides and toward the nape of the neck. All you need to complete the look and keep it amazing all day is a matte hair product such as pomade, wax or clay.

Men with long hairstyles and beards are able to combine sexy and masculine for a fashionable look. As more guys grow out their hair and style medium-length to longer styles, this popular hair trend continues to go strong. Messy and textured or naturally shiny and pulled back, this trendy long men’s hairstyle with a short beard is the way to go. To style it, apply a small amount of styling cream or mousse to damp hair, then use your fingers or a blow dryer to tousle it gently before allowing it to air dry. This will maximize volume, flow and movement for long hair men.

The comb over hairstyle isn’t just for men with longer hair. In fact, all you need to pull off a comb over is a minimum of 3 inches of length. While most guys get a comb over fade, pictured above is a clean-cut example of a chic undercut comb over. This short sides, long top style with sharp edges is perfectly offset by a cool long fringe in the front. As a popular haircut for men to style, the look is easy and simple to get. Just apply some of your favorite matte pomade and brush your hair to one side.

This curly hair fade is one of the best hairstyles for men with curly hair. If you view your curly hair as a curse, this taper fade haircut may just change your mind. With just 2 to 3 inches of length in the front and 1 inch or so in the back, this curly hairstyle is as easy as towel-drying your curls, applying some matte or low-shine curl-enhancing cream, and walking out the door.

If you’re a fan of modern messy styles, this thick medium-length look is sure to be a hit. The length in the front gives your style some personality, and the medium taper adds some classic edge. It’s just as suitable for a day at work as a pub crawl, and when paired with a thick, full beard, it oozes sex appeal. Styling with your favorite low-shine pomade is quick and easy.

The modern pompadour is another good haircut for guys that like clean-cut, trendy styles. With a disconnected undercut and an amazing line up, this textured pompadour is sure to turn heads. It’s best for men with thick, straight hair. To style a pompadour and keep it in place all day, just apply a strong wax or pomade to towel-dried hair, then blow dry your locks into place. Start by brushing your hair up and back to create height and volume in the front. Feel free to finish with a shine-free hairspray.

Nom: Daring Short Sides, Long Top Style
Description: For some men, hair is all about expression, and this long-on-top style says it all. Here, the longer hair length on top stands out with the help of some bright blond highlights, and the fresh skin fade on the sides and back adds even more contrast. Grow a full beard and trim it down with a stubble trimmer for a heavy stubble beard that looks manly and hot.

Nom: Wavy Slicked Back Hair with Mid Skin Fade
Description: Slicked back hairstyles have been around since the beginning of time, but this one – perfect for thick, wavy hair – adds two modern touches. The first is the skin fade on the sides and back, and the second is the short beard that balances the look with shaved sideburns. To do a slicked back fade, just add some matte or low-shine pomade and brush your wavy hair back, taming fly-away hair as you go.

The textured crop, also known as the French crop, is an awesome way to introduce some fringe into your style. In this photo, the textured style stands out even more with the addition of some blond highlights, and the edge up adds another layer of personality. Style this one by adding wax or pomade, then twisting sections of hair at the ends with your fingers.

Nom: Long Hair Brushed Back with Low Bald Fade
Description: Many of today’s hottest styles are all about height, and while you’ll definitely need a good product to keep things in place, it all starts with the right cut. For this one, you will need hair between four and six inches long on top toward the front that gradually gets shorter toward the back and fades on both sides. A medium- to high-shine product finishes the look.

With so many men opting for spiky textured crops, the faux hawk continues to gain popularity. The modern look foregoes the standard shiny gelled spikes for something that is subtle, but still offers some texture. A matte product makes it easy to spike your hair and hold it in place all day, and the skin fade makes it stand out.

Nom: Side Part with High Bald Fade
Description: If you have fine hair and you’re looking for a modern style that doesn’t require the same volume as a pompadour or quiff, this side part style is a great alternative. You’ll need a product with some shine to create the look, which is easy enough to do with nothing more than a comb. The bald fade draws attention to the bold part.

Nom: Long Crew Cut with Tapered Sides
Description: While the crew cut has long been associated with the military, today’s barbers have found some unique ways to make it modern, sexy, and fun. This long and textured crew cut is the perfect example; a simple cut can be transformed with a bit of moderate-shine pomade and your fingertips. Pairing the cut with tapered sides creates the illusion of additional height.

If you like the idea of spikes but a mohawk (or even faux hawk) is too bold for your taste, this spiky hairstyle with a short fade may spark your interest. Just apply some pomade to damp hair and use a brush to pull hair up and slightly over to one side, using your fingertips to style the textured spikes.

This sexy and modern long hair curly fade is one of the best ways to embrace your natural curls simply and effortlessly. The length on top shows off the curls, especially if you choose a good styling cream, and the skin fade on the sides enhances the look.

Nom: Long Brushed Back Hair with Undercut
Description: Long hair is incredibly versatile thanks to the dozens of different ways to wear it. This stunning brushed back style is easy to achieve. The short sides offer contrast and the illusion of extra height on top, which you can style yourself with a brush, a blow-dryer, and a high-hold product applied to towel-dried hair.

Your hair can make quite the statement depending on your choice of styles, and this unique swept back undercut fade is the perfect example. The shape up draws attention to the longer hair on top, and the drop skin fade is just different enough to stand out. Pair it with a short, well-groomed beard for the full effect.

Nom: Medium Brushed Up Waves with High Skin Fade
Description: If you want your cut to make your face appear longer and more masculine, this medium-length hairstyle and high skin fade is a fashionable look that can elevate your look. The wavy hair on top, the full beard, and the clean fade with line up make this style worth asking about at the barbershop.

If you think of a quiff as a modern style that requires every hair in its proper place, think again. This messy quiff breaks every one of the rules to add some edge and personality to your style. This haircut can be perfect for guys who have thick and wavy or curly hair, and it’s super easy to style with a matte pomade or wax.

Though plenty of men still appreciate classic greaser hairstyles, this style adds a modern twist. This slick back still requires a high-hold product with shine, but in this case, it’s brushed back and to the side for a natural flow.

Not all mohawks are a foot tall, colorful, and gelled into sharp points, and this amazing mohawk fade is the perfect example. Hair in the center stands straight up to form something resembling tousled spikes while the close-cropped fade and short beard adds another dimension of interest.

The clean-cut side part is making a huge comeback, especially when paired with a skin fade. To get this style, you will need a product that offers quite a bit of shine, and even a styling gel can do the trick. Add it to damp hair, comb out from the bold part, and then comb the front upward to create the stylish swoop or pomp.

There are many ways to style a quiff, but this undercut fade is the most popular since it works so well for a variety of hair types and lengths. The undercut keeps styling simple while drawing the eye to the texture and touchable flow on top. Use a product that offers up some hold to keep the volume, but be sure that it still allows for some movement at the same time.

Nom: High Skin Fade with Messy Spiky Hair
Description: Messy spiky hair continues to be a top hairstyle for men. Modern and cool, the skin fade on the sides plays up the textured spikes. The choppy cut creates a nice canvas for you to use a high-hold matte product to twist your hair into an awesome spiky style.

Nom: Low Fade with Thick Wavy Hair
Description: This popular style for thick, wavy hair is by far one of the best haircuts. It starts with a simple cut that keeps hair longer on top and in the front, then fades toward the nape and the ears. A pomade with shine finishes the look; just add a small amount to damp hair and comb it back. Finish with hair spray to tame fly-away hair and keep your style fresh all day.

Men who live no-nonsense lifestyles often go for very short hairstyles that require little to no effort on their part, and this cool buzz cut fade is a great choice. The perfect shape up makes the short style look striking, and the two lines on the sides as hair designs add some extra interest. Easy to get, simple to style and low-maintenance to keep, the buzz cut is a wash-and-go style that looks good on most any man.

Nom: Short Naturally Curly Hair with Low Drop Fade
Description: Naturally curly hair often takes on a life of its own, but by keeping it cut short, it’s possible to gain more control over your locks. This fantastic style incorporates a bit of length on top that gradually fades to skin right at the nape. Styling is simple with some matte pomade, and the edging around the ears adds some personal flair.

Fringe adds youthfulness to a hairstyle in the best possible way, and it can also draw attention to your eyes. This gorgeous textured cut is perfect for men who have wavy hair and who want something that looks high-maintenance without the hassle. Just apply some mid-shine pomade to damp hair and separate into sections with your fingers, pulling it forward as you go.

A short quiff is an excellent choice for men who want to take the first step toward modern styles. This one starts with a classic cut that is longer on the top and the front than in the back, and it incorporates a skin fade on the sides and nape. The unique beard shape really sets it off, and the messy texture gives it additional creativity.

A short side-swept crew cut is a cool hairstyle for guys who want a simple and classic look. The short texture on top paired with the nearly-shaven sides looks somehow professional and playful at the same time. It’s the perfect choice if you have fine hair with natural waves. Styling is incredibly easy with a pea-sized amount of pomade and your fingertips.

Making a personal statement with your hairstyle is all about choosing one that you love – and one that you enjoy styling each day. This taper fade comb over may look high maintenance, but it’s actually relatively easy to get. The bold part and the swept-over height are the base of the look, and the two lines near the neck add a unique twist.

Nom: Medium Comb Over and Low Taper Fade
Description: A medium-length taper fade is another excellent option if you’re interested in a bad boy look. The base of the style is a classic masculine cut, but the length on top gives you the ability to style it in many ways. Here, the longer hair on top has been combed up and over to give it a slightly messy appearance. It pairs well with the full, trimmed beard.

Nom: Textured French Crop with High Skin Fade
Description: If you want to keep your hair short, that doesn’t mean you have to sacrifice style. This textured short cut is easy to achieve and maintain with nothing more than a brush and some matte pomade. Just apply a tiny amount of pomade to your palms, work it through the top section of your hair, and then use a comb to brush hair forward and up.

The high fade pompadour is a favorite among men who prefer masculine clean-cut styles. Here, longer hair in the front is paired with shorter hair in the back that gradually fades to skin near the ears and nape. The height requires some product with hold, and the slight texture is effortless to achieve with a wide-tooth comb.

A high and tight fade is a cool military-inspired haircut that can complement a beard for a masculine look. The short hair on top is less than half an inch in length, gradually blending into the high bald fade on the sides of the head. The shaved-in part gives the style some interest.

Nom: Spiky Quiff with High Taper Fade
Description: This spiky quiff with mid taper fade and hard part just looks stylish and handsome. The style requires quite a bit of length on top, particularly in the front, and a longer fade on the sides and back. Some high-shine, high-hold pomade will let you create the height and keep it in place all day.

A skin fade comb over is one of the bolder styles you can choose, especially for guys with longer hair. As you can see, the hair is quite long in this example, and the skin fade on the side makes it appear even bolder. Despite its complexity, it’s easy to style with a medium-hold product.

Nom: Short Tight Curls with Mid Bald Fade
Description: This short style is perfect for playing up your curls, but in this case, the product you choose for styling is just as important as the cut. The high fade draws attention to the curls on top, so be sure you choose a styling cream or pomade that is meant for texturizing and defining hair while holding it in place.

Thick hair is great for creating many of today’s most popular voluminous styles, including the quiff, slick back, pompadour, fohawk, comb over, and side part hairstyle. This variation of the classic quiff requires short-to-medium thick hair brushed upward in front and forward from the back. The undercut fade adds some definition.

This slicked back taper fade is another excellent choice for men who have thicker hair. It’s slightly textured on the top, and because it is brushed back, it creates a couple inches of height. The taper fade makes it look clean and balanced, which pairs nicely with the full medium-length beard. All you need to style this modern slick back is a medium-hold and medium-shine pomade with a wide-tooth comb.

This textured crop top is all about the perfect edges, which gives it a clean-cut, modern look. The high skin fade draws even more attention to the style, making it painless to do at home with almost any good men’s hair product. Because it’s short, it’s easy to maintain with frequent trips to the barber.

This sexy style incorporates several of today’s trendiest modern cuts and meshes them together to create stunning textured spiky hair. The quiff-like flip in front, when paired with the spiky texture on top and the skin fade on the sides and back, makes it look far more high-maintenance than it really is.

This tapered comb over offers amazing height, and it’s best for men who have straight, thick hair for this reason. After getting the perfect cut (4 to 6 inches of length on top and a classic taper on the sides and back), just add some matte wax or pomade to damp hair and blow dry up and over for volume.

This faux hawk with a low fade is an edgy haircut that offers attitude and style. The longer hair creates visual interest and drama while the tapered sides keep the cut clean and low-maintenance. The small pomp in front makes a bold statement for a memorable finish.

Also known as a hi-top, the high top fade is a retro haircut with a modern twist that creates height and fullness. The high top enjoyed mainstream attention in the 80’s and early 90’s, but has been making a comeback in recent years, especially when paired with a clean line up complementing natural curls. The high skin fade on the sides adds more interest to the height, and the trimmed thin mustache and goatee finish the look.

A short pompadour with a high undercut fade can be a stylish hairstyle for modern guys who want to take a youthful and refreshing approach. This toned-down version of the modern pomp is relatively easy to style with a high-hold product, and it’s versatile enough for a slicked back or combed-over look.

Nom: Hard Side Part and Low Fade
Description: A high side part is the perfect way to bring a bit of professionalism into your style. It’s a classic Wall Street or frat boy look that, when paired with a short-cropped beard, suddenly becomes masculine and fun. Style this one with a high-shine pomade and a fine-tooth comb to achieve this look.

This brushed-back style is picture perfect with every hair in its proper place. You’ll need a talented barber to help you achieve this look along with a matte pomade or wax for styling. Once you get the hang of it, the clean-cut finish takes minutes in the morning and lasts all day.

The disconnected quiff is one of the most popular hairstyles for guys this year. The blond highlights and high skin fade with a disconnected undercut amplify height and increase contrast. High-hold products will keep your hair in place all day, and you can use a wide-tooth comb to create texture similar to that in the photo.

Nom: Buzz Cut with Low Bald Fade and Line Up
Description: If you want to take your simple bald fade buzz cut to the next level, a barber who has mad line up skills will be your best friend. Just choose your favorite design – abstract or geometric – and ask your barber to work his magic. There’s no maintenance for this cut other than frequent trips to the barber’s chair, making it ideal for busy men.

Nom: Long Side Swept with Undercut and Short Beard
Description: There’s something uniquely provocative about a man with voluminous hair offset by a short beard, and as this photo shows, it’s sexy and intellectual at the same time. The undercut brings the eyes to the height, which is swept over to one side with tousled fringe and held in place with high-hold products.

Another example of messy, spiky hair combines a little bit of quiff with a whole lot of texture. The swept-up length in the front perfectly offsets the incredible spiky texture on top, which pairs nicely with the tapered fade on the sides and back. To style, just use your fingertips and a matte pomade to create the texture and use a natural-bristle brush to brush up the hair in front.

The mohawk hairstyle conjures images of tall, perfect spikes and shaved sides, you might be surprised to know there are several other options out there. This one is nice and short (for a mohawk) and plays on a guy’s natural curls. The burst fade creates the illusion of more height.

This faux hawk is more classic than others, but it still foregoes the sharp, shiny spikes for something slightly more textured and natural. The buzzed sides truly set the style off, making it easy to do at home with some high-hold matte wax and a natural-bristle brush. You can use your fingertips to style the spiky texture on top.

Nom: Long Fringe with High Taper Fade
Description: Bold fringe is ideal for men who want a boyish, high-maintenance look without all the work. It all starts with the cut, which is perfectly angled to allow the length to come to a point on one side of the face. The texture on top along with the high taper fade makes this an interesting cut.

Nom: Short Spiky Fringe with Crew Cut Fade
Description: The timeless crew cut is handsome enough, but when it’s paired with short quiff-like spikes in the front and a fade on the sides, it instantly becomes more modern. The textured look suits men who have thick wavy hair, and pairing it with a beard makes it appear even more masculine.

With so many cool ways to style a pompadour, the side-swept look is one of the most popular, especially when it’s offset by a short undercut. This style works best for men who have thick, straight hair with plenty of natural volume, but it can also be adapted for wavy hair. Paired with a thick beard, it screams sex appeal everywhere you go.

Nom: Short Cropped Hair with Taper Fade and Part
Description: This short cropped haircut features a taper fade and shaved part to create a stylish and daring look. The tapered sides and faux part trimmed into the side make it even more interesting. When paired with a clean-shaven face, it’s youthful, fun and striking.

Nom: Short Comb Over and Low Fade
Description: The short comb over with a low fade on the sides is a great blend of professionalism and modern style. The hair on top is only a couple inches long – just enough to create the combed-over look. To do it, use a medium-shine pomade or wax and a regular comb to gently coax hair into position. Finish with hairspray if needed to keep things in place all day.

Nom: Short Sides and Textured Long Hair on Top
Description: With many of today’s most popular styles being all about the volume, it comes as no surprise that men will defy gravity to create unbelievable volume and flow. In this case, hair about 6 inches long styles a modern combed over pompadour with a twist, and the extra-short sides with a bald fade make it appear even taller.

Nom: Classic Side Swept Hair with Scissor Cut Sides
Description: If you have thick, wavy hair, it may seem as if your hairstyle options are numbered. Fortunately, you can easily get the side-swept look that is professional, trendy and relatively easy to get. All you need is a moderate hold and shine pomade to coax hair into place with a brush.

Nom: Long Hair Slicked Back with Shaved Sides
Description: If your preferred style is somewhere between classic punk and new-age hipster, then this slicked back is great for you. The shaved (or closely buzzed) sides contrast nicely with the ultra-shiny slick back hair in the center. Pairing it up with a long, full beard creates a badass masculine finish.

Nom: Long Curly Hair with Mid Drop Fade
Description: If you want to do something fun and modern with your super-thick, super-curly hair, this style plays on its natural volume with a unique approach. The taper gradually builds up to the thick, long curls on top, which you can style with your favorite volumizing mousse for shine and all-day hold.

Flowing hair is a symbol of romance, and this amazing style with its low taper is a great way to achieve it. You will need to style medium-length hair on top in textured pieces that seem to flow backward from the front and offer a small bit of fringe and height in the front.

This slicked back side part is a great choice for men who want a badass hairstyle, but don’t want to sacrifice their high-maintenance look. The cut takes the hard work out of the style, which can be easily achieved with a wet-look gel and a wide-toothed comb. You’ll need a skilled barber to give you a shape up along your hairline and beard to duplicate this look.

Women dream of running their hands through a man’s long, wavy locks, and if that suits your fancy, then this style is one to consider. It’s perfectly shaped at the back and on the sides, but the top flows naturally. Just apply a bit of matte pomade and brush hair back from the sides and top, then use your fingertips to muss the top section and allow it to fall naturally.

If you like the idea of a quiff but it seems a bit high-maintenance, this faded quiff haircut is a good choice. With very short sides and a short to medium length top, all you have to do is apply some pomade, brush up your hair, and leave it spiked and messy. Styling the quiff is easier than you might think, and the end result looks amazing.

Thick hair can take on a life of its own, and for some men, styling it seems impossible. If you embrace its messy nature, this stylish hairstyle is a modern, fun and professional look for guys. A pomade applied to damp hair will help you achieve this look; just apply it evenly and then tousle hair with your fingertips.

The military buzz cut is a tapered buzz that is just slightly longer on top than on the sides. This bald fade trims the sides very short, shaving the hair down to the skin at the nape and ears. Low-maintenance and effortless, the buzz cut fade hairstyle is still popular.

Nom: Short Curly Hair with Low Drop Fade
Description: Men’s curls seem to take on a life of their own when they are cut short, and the unique look is perfect for many of today’s popular textured styles. It’s a simple cut that fades into skin at the back and the ears and pairs nicely with a shaped beard.

Nom: Medium Side Swept Brush Up with Classic Taper
Description: The classic taper is one of the most popular cuts among men, and it’s been transformed into numerous styles like this one. Here, the hair on top is medium-length and swoops over from a very slight side part. Some mid-shine pomade and wide-tooth comb make it easy to achieve this style at home, and it pairs nicely with a clean face, some stubble, or a full beard.

An undercut pairs just as nicely with short hair as with medium-length or long hair, and that’s evident with this style. Naturally thick wavy hair adds height, volume, and texture, which is only accentuated by the short hair on the sides.

Men who are blessed with incredibly tight and small curls are more limited in their styles, but this relatively short flat top is a great option. The skin fade on the sides creates the illusion of even more height. A small amount of product will help hair hold its shape throughout the day.

Nom: Textured Thick Spiky Hair with Mid Fade
Description: Thick spiky hair with a mid fade is another extremely sexy masculine look that requires longer hair on top swept up and over from a subtle side part. Adding some mid-shine pomade to damp hair and creating texture with a wide-tooth comb really helps set this look apart from others.

Nom: Long Comb Over and High Fade
Description: A long comb over is a trendy men’s style, but when paired with a high fade, the hairstyle truly stands out. In this case, the comb over is styled with volume and flow. Moreover, the comb over fade is always easy to do, especially for men who have thick, stick-straight hair.

Nom: High Volume Brush Back with Short Sides
Description: This hairstyle for men with long hair defies gravity. You’ll undoubtedly need some firm-hold product and a blow dryer to achieve it, but this is one of those styles that become easier with time as you train your hair to slick back. It’s loud, bold, and sure to make a few heads turn your way.

Nom: Long Side Swept Fringe with Low Bald Fade
Description: Fringe is a popular part of many of today’s best styles, but in this case, it’s the star. The bald fade is perfect, especially with such thick, dark hair. Plus, the short textured style looks amazing with the thicker, longer fringe. Though it seems high-maintenance, all you need is a brush, some pomade, and your fingertips to coax the style in place.

Nom: Short Sides, Long Curly Hair on Top
Description: Long, curly hair on top can look better than you might think, and this picture is proof. The unique shape of the cut – and the amazing curly fringe in the front – is nicely paired with short faded sides to make a personal statement. It looks great with the full beard, but it also looks amazing with a clean-shaven face.

Nom: Long Spiky Hair with High Skin Fade
Description: Long, blunt spikes are a bit more difficult to style than some of the other cuts shown here, but it’s definitely a unique style that many men have embraced. Three inches of hair on top twisted into blunt spikes with a matte product is perfectly complemented by the near-bald sides and perfectly-shaped beard.

Nom: Messy Textured Pompadour and Low Fade
Description: This messy pompadour pairs wonderfully with a beard and a low fade. It’s not a style for the faint of heart, but this pomp fade will certainly help you stand out in any crowd, especially with this kind of height and movement. It works well for thick, straight hair, but can also be styled with somewhat wavy hair.

This short, combed back undercut offers up a more rounded look, which can help you develop a unique, personal sense of style. The undercut is very short and high up on the sides to maximize contrast. A matte pomade, a blow dryer, and a wide-tooth comb can help when styling this cool hairstyle.

Ivy league haircuts are popular among men of all ages and from all walks of life, and this one, which resembles something of a modified textured crew cut, is simple, yet incredibly masculine. Start with a tapered crew cut, then sweep hair up and to the side with some high-hold pomade to keep in in place all day.

The European French crop is a modified version of the classic crop that mixes in some spikes and strands of bangs in varying lengths alongside a symmetrical edge at the hairline. It’s more popular among younger men, but it can be changed in many ways to suit your needs.

A short faux hawk offers you the opportunity to be a little bold, but in a much subtler way than with a traditional mohawk. You can create some textured spikes, like in the photo here, or you can comb hair in one direction for something a little more professional. It’s more versatile than it looks, and it works well with many different hair types.

Nom: Short Messy Spiked Up Hair with Fade
Description: Short spikes suit men of all ages and they are ideal for various types of styles. This one is one of the most popular because it’s short, it’s simple, and it’s bold enough to turn heads. The spikes stand out against the skin fade, making it a great choice for men who have dark hair, and it looks amazing with facial hair.

Nom: Slick Back Hair with Disconnected Undercut and Beard
Description: Something about a disconnected undercut screams badass, but at the same time, it’s also oddly formal and classy. The slicked back hairstyle is perfectly disconnected from the short undercut, and when paired with the gorgeous full beard with its amazing curls, you’re sure to impress men and women with your sense of style.

Nom: Brush Back Comb Over with High Fade
Description: Medium-length hair doesn’t have to be tousled to look sexy, and this style is proof of that. The bold side part clearly defines the length of the hair, which is carefully coiffed and perfectly textured. The high fade brings a clean look that makes this style appear harder to achieve than it truly is. It’s ideal for almost all hair types.

Nom: Short Wavy Fringe with Low Skin Fade
Description: Short wavy hair is touchable, flirty, masculine, and fun, so if you aren’t playing yours up, consider trying this style on for size. It’s pretty conservative, but the side-swept texture and fringe give it a hint of boyish flirtation that only really works with wavy hair. It pairs well with or without facial hair, which makes it a versatile style.

The short fade hairstyle looks good on men with naturally wavy hair. It’s professional enough for a day at work, but with a bit of pomade and a quick tousle, you can be ready for date night or a night out with your friends. In this case, it looks perfect with a well-manicured beard, but it pairs nicely with a clean-shaven face.

Nom: Messy Longer Hair with Low Fade
Description: A messy hairstyle can look great with all textures and lengths. All you need is the right cut, some pomade or wax, and enough time to tousle your hair and move it into place before walking out the door. The skin fade makes the messy look truly stand out.

Nom: Hard Side Part Fade with Spiked Front
Description: This youthful look is perfect for surfers, playboys, and would-be stock brokers alike. It’s a clever twist on a classic style that is best for men who have wavy, thick hair. It does take some coaxing to train hair into place, but over time, styling becomes easy with a natural-bristle brush and the matte pomade or wax of your choice.

The term blowout refers to the use of a blow dryer, and while it may sound like a lot of trouble, the result is well worth it. This wavy look can be accomplished by using a pomade on damp hair, then blow drying it back from the top and sides. When your hair is almost dry, use a tad more pomade on the tips of your fingers to create a textured blowout hairstyle.

Nom: High Temp Fade with Short Spiked Wavy Hair
Description: With the fade starting high at the temples, this modern look for wavy hair is ideal for work or play. It’s great for men who have thick or fine hair since it’s easy to create the swept-up look in front with a bit of styling cream or pomade. All in all, it’s a great modern take on one of the most classic men’s cuts of all time.

The undercut quiff is a voluminous style that is just as masculine as it is modern. When paired with a short undercut, the thick quiff looks even more elegant. The shape up at the temples helps to define the jaw and the forehead, and this is excellent for men who prefer to remain clean-shaven.

There’s nothing wrong with keeping your hair super short, but that doesn’t mean it has to lack interest. There are dozens of line-up options from which you can choose to add interest, and the best part is that since they grow out in a matter of weeks, you can choose a new one every time you see your barber. It’s low-maintenance and fun, which is perfect for incredibly busy men.

Nom: Short Sides and Back with Brushed Back Top
Description: If you’re a fan of the punk or skater culture, this haircut will undoubtedly appeal to you. The classic undercut is the base of the style, but it’s the flowing bleached-blond pieces that make this cut stand apart from all the rest. It’s textured, it’s messy, and it’s a great way to show off your personality.

If you want to look professional, but you admit it’s time for some modern flair, the faux hawk taper fade is a fantastic starting point. The fohawk is easy to style with a strong pomade or wax and a comb.

Nom: Crop Top Fade with Choppy Fringe and Line Up
Description: Not all men are fans of high volume styles, making the crop fade with a fringe a great choice. It’s a classic look with just a hint of texture, and the fringe in front creates a unique finish. The line-up at the temples and along the beard helps to reinforce your masculine features.

Short wavy hair works well with textured styles. Pictured above is an example of one of the best hairstyles for men with wavy hair. With a fade or undercut on the sides and short cropped hair on top, guys should tousle this look with pomade to get excellent movement and flow.

The Asian fade is a versatile haircut that creates a short style on the sides and back to complement the longer hair on top. Whether you get a low, mid or high taper fade, the contrast will highlight your hairstyle. To further tailor the cut, ask your barber to add a drop, temp or bald fade that blends the hair into the skin. As the most popular choice for modern gentlemen, the taper fade offers a clean-cut and low-maintenance look that will transform your style.

The Asian undercut is a cool and stylish choice for guys who want a short style that can make a statement. The hair on top is roughly four inches long and must be swept up and back for a windblown and carefree look. The undercut starts at the forehead, and while many men prefer the bald look, a very short buzz would also work well with this style.

Nom: Short Sides with Long Hair on Top
Description: The short sides with long hair on top look is a contemporary style that has become popular with K-pop stars and younger men. The four-to-five-inch hair on top tapers down to a very short clip near the ears. This cut adds some extra volume and movement to the hair, while the loose side part offers an effortlessly chic and breezy finish.

The French crop with high fade is a simple cut that is easy to maintain with regular trims. With the brushed-up hair from the crown ending in blunt fringe at the center of the forehead, this look boasts all the features of the classic French crop with a little extra pizzazz. The high fade adds some extra visual interest that takes the style to the next level.

Asian hair is perfect for a flowing long hairstyle. Its thick nature gives it a natural lift and adds movement, especially when long layers are involved. To achieve this look, grow the hair on the top and sides out so it barely covers the ears, and trim the back along the neck relatively short. Choose a loose middle part and let the hair fall freely to either side of the face. This is a romantic and youthful cut that suits virtually any face shape well.

The slick back hair look is a retro style with a modern twist that offers a timeless style for guys. To style, slick the longer hair on top straight back with a high-hold gel, and pair it with a high fade or undercut to create contrast. Using a comb to slick the hair back will add some extra texture, and swooping the hair slightly back to one side can make this look even more appealing.

A fringe with tapered sides is a versatile haircut for Asian men that creates a unique contrast for a rebellious finish. The longer fringe style naturally carries a youthful vibe, making it a fun option for teenage and college guys. Like a French crop, this cut consists of hair that is brushed forward from the crown, but the fringe is much longer and choppy rather than short and blunt. When paired with tapered sides, this style is fresh, fashionable, and easy to maintain.

Curtains are a trendy option for guys with longer hair who want to feature a middle part with bangs for a casually cool style. The defining feature is the bangs that carefully frame the face. They can be any length, but the current trend features eyebrow-length fringe that gently falls from a side part.

The modern mullet is a fashionable take on the classic style that features choppy layers with a thick fringe and tapered undercut. This handsome and rugged cut has a 1980s rock-and-roll vibe without being too over the top, and with regular trims, the look is easy enough to style and maintain at home.

Messy curly hair can be a cool way to rock this unique texture for a low-maintenance and effortlessly chic look. The hair on top and at the fringe is left long while the sides and back are trimmed shorter. A bit of curl-defining mousse, hair gel or texturizing pomade can create some definition, and a quick tousle with the fingers can add the “messy” element to the cut.

Nom: Brushed Forward Hair with Side Fringe
Description: Brushed forward hair with side fringe is the perfect cut for guys who have stick-straight fine hair. The hair is left a little long on the top, then brushed forward and off to one side where it ends in a side-swept fringe. Paired with a shaved or buzzed undercut, this style is handsome, youthful, and on-trend.

The timeless middle part will always be a fashionable look for guys with beautiful long locks. This style features flowing hair with blunt ends and a sharp, well-defined center part. While easy, this longer hairstyle does require a commitment to keeping your locks healthy and trimmed.

Nom: Brushed Up Front with Low Bald Fade
Description: The brushed up front with low bald fade cut combines the elements of a classic quiff with the fresh and dapper look of the mid bald fade. The hair is longest in the front behind the forehead and gradually becomes shorter toward the crown. The front section is brushed straight upward into a quiff, and the sides are neatly tapered downward to the skin about an inch above the ear.

The buzz cut fade is the perfect look for no-nonsense guys who want a handsome, rugged look that doesn’t require much at-home styling. Rather than a simple buzz cut all over, the fade starts even with the top of the forehead and gradually becomes shorter until it reaches skin about an inch above the ears. A simple line-up gives this masculine cut some added definition and style.

The classy comb over is the perfect haircut for everyday wear. It looks great with a pair of jeans and a tee, but it looks just as nice paired with a tux. The cut itself is just a little longer than a classic gentleman’s cut, and it involves creating a slightly off-center side part, then combing the hair over from there. It’s perfect for clean-cut guys who want their hair to be as charming as their personalities.

Nom: Crew Cut with High Bald Fade
Description: A crew cut with high bald fade is often thought of as a militant style, and while it’s certainly easy to maintain, it’s also quite stylish. The crew cut is a very short style that tapers from the front to back, and rather than gradually tapering to the skin, this style tapers abruptly which creates the illusion of more height.

Long spikes with a low taper can be an aggressive and edgy style that requires growing the hair on the top and sides a few inches longer. When styling, you’ll need to use a pomade or gel to create thick, textured spikes in every direction. Because the hair gradually tapers to a shorter length around the ears and the neck, the cut is versatile and offers a range of styling options.

Nom: Long Side Swept Style with Low Taper
Description: The long side swept style with a low taper is a bold and fashionable cut that looks great with a wide variety of hair types and textures. The hair on top is several inches long, and it sweeps over from a deep side part that is even with the corner of the forehead. The low taper helps to create a transition between the very short hair around the ears and the long hair on top.

Nom: Fluffy Short Style with Low Taper
Description: A fluffy short style with a low taper can create a cool and choppy texture for a unique look. The taper starts just above the ears to transition the style from the long and disconnected top to the closely cropped sides and nape. This cut is fun, youthful and original.

The gentleman’s ivy league cut can only be described as dapper and sleek. The underlying cut is the same as a classic crew cut, but the hair on top is significantly longer. In this variation, the hair at the top is brushed upward and back to create lift and height that contrasts with the much shorter hair at the sides. It’s perfect for the office and formal events, but it also works well for more casual days.

Nom: Hard Comb Over with Mid Fade
Description: The hard comb over with mid fade is a very sharp and sleek style that is perfect for guys who like to draw a little attention to themselves. Similar to the side swept crew cut, this style moves slightly to one side from a hard shaved part. The mid fade creates the illusion of more height.

The faux hawk fade is one of many examples of classic 80s styles that have been revamped for the modern era. The hair on top is clipped and shaped in a way that resembles a mohawk. Rather than sharp, long spikes, this cut features a choppier, more subdued look. The high fade and lineup at the temples draw attention to the height and texture. This is a subtle variation of an insanely popular cut that looks great on guys of all ages.

For a casual bohemian look, dreadlocks are a trending style that will help you stand out in the crowd. The hair needs to be as long as possible, and once twisted into dreads, they require an above-average level of care. It’s possible to adorn the dreads with beads, wraps, and other charms to personalize the style.

The K-pop haircut is a trendy style for Asian guys who want a flattering look and extra volume on top. The most popular K-Pop hairstyle is the two block with a thick fringe and disconnected sides that highlight the styling above. Popularized by members of Korean boy bands, this layered cut will take your look to the next level.

The long side part is a classic gentleman’s hairstyle that balances between casual and classy for a timeless finish. The style can be shoulder-length or longer, but most guys choose a shorter version with volume in the fringe paired with tapered sides. This look can suit any length and texture but wavy hair can add a unique dimension.

A blowout with a taper fade can offer a unique style for bold and adventurous guys. With tapered sides, the blowout look starts with a strong pomade or gel product, then using a blow dryer to style the hair up and back, creating a textured and somewhat spiky look.

This long spiky hairstyle features a textured pomp in the front and a classic taper on the sides. Whether you have shorter or longer locks, this spiked style can suit a soft or defined finish. The current trend is a softer look with some exceptional height that is enhanced by a low taper.

The classic mullet is a daring retro style for guys who want to make a statement that will stand out. With subtle contrast, this layered mullet features a shorter cut in the front and sides combined with longer hair in the back.

The masculine buzz cut is a military-inspired style that screams low-maintenance bad-boy. The modern buzzed haircut often features a mid to high fade on the sides and back with thick, short hair on top. You can use clippers to create this look at home or visit the barber for a quick trim. Maintaining the length requires frequent trims but the style is effortlessly handsome.

The man bun with an undercut fade is a highly functional and fashionable look that’s suited for just about every face shape and hair type. Since a man bun requires longer locks, the hair can easily become heavy and hot. Pairing the bun with an undercut reduces the weight and makes the style much more comfortable. It also adds a masculine element to the style, especially when paired with facial hair.

A hard side part fade is a semi-casual, semi-formal look that is versatile enough for any event. The hair on top is left a few inches long and brushed or combed over from a deep side part. The high fade helps to transition the hair from the longer locks on top to the much shorter sides and back. This cut looks great with a clean-shaven face, but it can be worn with a beard or goatee for a more rugged style.

Nom: Crop Top with Blunt Bangs and Low Fade
Description: The crop top with blunt bangs and a low fade is a simple military-inspired style that looks great with minimal effort. Also known as French crop, this style comes with a choppy and textured fringe. The low fade serves as a transition point between the long hair on top and the short hair near the ears. Guys with straight hair will find this one easy to style; just use a little texturizing pomade and comb the hair forward, creating a piecey texture in the process.

Guys who want to make a bold statement with their hair will love the modern pompadour with a mid fade. The hair on top gradually gets longer from the crown to the forehead, and the fringe is swept straight upward and back to create the classic “pomp”. It’s all about the height, and the mid fade to skin draws the eye upward and helps to create the illusion of more height.

The mullet with undercut style is a contemporary version of one of the world’s most well-known looks. Compared to the traditional mullet, this one is quite subdued. This cut features choppy layers on the top and back of the head, and the undercut provides a peekaboo effect that adds masculinity and flair. The slightly tousled look is a common styling option.

The modern brush back with an undercut is formal and chic, and it’s easy to style at home. Start with a classic gentleman’s cut but leave the hair at the front and on top slightly longer. Use a strong hold gel with some shine and comb all the hair on top straight back and slightly off to one side. The undercut can reduce the volume of the hair and will give you a more formal appearance.

Nom: Modern Faux Hawk with Low Skin Fade
Description: The modern faux hawk with a low skin fade is ideal for guys who want to hold onto their youthful sense of style in a way that isn’t too edgy or bold. The hair on top is much longer than the hair on the sides, and it’s swept upward toward the center in a series spikes from fringe to crown. The low skin fade on the sides is ideal for creating a subtler transition, and it tones down the overall look.

The man bun with drop fade is great for guys who want to transform a classic look into a unique work of art. The classic bun is positioned at or just below the crown of the head, and all the interest comes from the fun drop fade. Rather than a fade that follows a straight path around the head, the drop fade starts high in the front and curves down around the ears. Add in a shaved design and a unique line-up for a one-of-a-kind look.

A medium layered style with a part offers up exceptional versatility for guys who like to style their hair in different ways. For example, it’s possible to wear this look much like a K-Pop haircut by creating a side part, lifting the front of the hair, and allowing the fringe to curl downward over one side of the forehead. Another option might include pairing the layers with an undercut, which creates a far more masculine style.

Nom: Textured Two Block with Classic Taper
Description: The textured two block with a classic taper is a popular haircut for Asian men who want longer hair on top with a shorter cut on the sides and back. Whether you get a fade, taper or undercut, the contrast and dimension are generally disconnected and play to the stylish volume. You can feature a messy finish or choose curtain bangs.

Swooping fringe with short sides is a flattering hairstyle for Asian guys who want a modern and effortlessly chic look that will always impress. This cool style starts with longer hair on top that moves forward from the crown to the longer fringe. Like a side part, this look involves swooping the fringe over from one side of the forehead to the other while a low taper keeps the sides and back of the hair much shorter and puts the focus on the bangs. This fashionable gentleman’s haircut style can be a great choice for professional Asian men who need to look polished at the office while still preferring a trendy vibe in their personal life.

A thick, messy crop is youthful and effortlessly stylish. The long hair on the top blends into the shorter hair at the back and sides, but rather than layering the longer sections of hair, they’re left all one length. This stacking of the hair creates volume in the fringe and at the top of the head. A quick tousle with the fingers is all it takes to create the coveted messy look.

The textured spiky high and tight takes the classic military style to the next level. The classic high and tight features very short hair along the sides and back that sharply transitions into the longer hair on top without any kind of fade or taper. Rather than the smooth look of the classic high and tight, this version has a textured and somewhat spiky top that sweeps upward from the forehead.

The quiff is a popular men’s hairstyle that looks handsome, youthful and sexy. The modern quiff often features textured spikes in the front that flow straight up and back paired with a clean fade on the sides. The result is extra styling flexibility and dimension.

Nom: Side Swept Brush Up with Shaved Line and Fade
Description: The side swept brush up with a shaved line and fade is the perfect style for bold professionals. The shaved line serves as a hard part from which the hair on top is brushed over, up, and back for height. The fade begins right at the shaved line, which adds a handsome touch to this contemporary cut.

Nom: Spiky Hair with Low Bald Fade
Description: Spiky hair with a low bald fade is a more contemporary take on the classic quiff. The hair on the top and around the crown is longer than the hair on the sides, which are tapered in a way that creates a seamless blend from the length on top to the bald fade near the ears. Brushing the hair straight upward and holding it in place with a pomade or strong hair spray creates a spiky look.

The short bro flow is a casually cool option that can be refreshing and elegant. As a face-framing look, this short flowing hairstyle generally provides movement with choppy layers and a middle part that draws attention to facial features.

The classic pompadour is an iconic hairstyle that has become known for its incredible volume and eye-catching look. The lifted hair on the top is much longer than the hair on the sides and in the back, and a beautiful fade makes the transition between lengths perfectly seamless. The pomp requires a talented stylist and a little effort, but with the right products and a little patience, it’s a charming and sexy look.

Nom: Shaved Sides with Short Comb Over
Description: A short comb over with shaved sides is a modern and rebellious style that can be simple to pull off while looking masculine and handsome. The high shaved undercut creates a strong disconnect for a clean finish, while the combed over styling still offers some classic charm. Like a crew cut, this style features a clear boundary between the long hair on top and the shaved sides. The patch of hair on top is significantly longer, so it can be styled into an iconic combover.

Shaggy hair is another of the latest trends sweeping the globe. This short style features hair on the top and sides that falls to about the top of the ears and tapers to a shorter length from there. The hair falls to the side, back and front from a center part, and it’s slightly tousled for a windswept look. This cut is flexible and works with different hair lengths, but a little natural texture or wave is perfect.

Like a Caesar, this cropped cut with a long fringe is a short style that requires you to brush your hair forward. The blunt bangs are long and end just above the brows, but the overall shape is a modern variation. A little matte pomade can help to create the perfect texture.

The classic side part is a cool, dapper cut with roots in the 1950s era. The hair is slightly longer all over than the standard gentleman’s cut, which means that it flows over from the side part in a stylish, yet flattering way. This handsome cut is perfect for guys who don’t like to spend too much time in the stylist’s chair, and it requires only a little styling at home with some gel and a comb or brush.

The textured comb over fade transforms thick, straight hair into a modern work of art. The hair in the front and on top is left slightly long, and the high fade helps create the transition to skin about an inch above the ear. Some texturizing paste is essential for creating the textured and piecey look that makes this cut unique. The thicker the hair, the more voluminous it appears after styling.

The long ponytail can be worn in several ways, ranging from a simple loose knot at the nape to this flowy half-up, half-down look. Medium-length layered hair is the perfect canvas for this style. Just pull the hair from the ears and above to the back and secure it into a ponytail. Some loose strands at the forehead and sideburns can add a carefree look.

Nom: Brushed Forward Short Hair with Drop Fade
Description: Brushed forward short hair with a drop fade is boyishly handsome with just a hint of boldness. The hair at the top of the head is left longer than the rest, and the length slowly tapers down the sides and back. The drop fade creates a smooth transition to very short hair around the ears and at the nape. The real fun is the “flip” at the front that mimics a subdued quiff.

This shaggy medium center parted style embraces the classic bad boy look and transforms it into a contemporary cut. The hair at the top and sides is several inches long, and it abruptly transitions to shorter hair just above the ears, around the back of the head, and at the neck. Creating this look is as easy as parting the hair in the center and tousling it with a bit of texturizing pomade.

Long wavy hairstyles are a cool trend that provide layers, movement and bounce, giving this look a youthful and refreshing vibe. The longest layer stops right at the shoulders and the shortest creates a deep side-parted fringe around the forehead. It’s great for naturally curly or wavy hair, but guys with straight hair can easily recreate it with a curling iron.

Nom: Textured Slick Back with Low Undercut Fade
Description: The textured slick back with a low undercut fade is bold and masculine, but relatively easy to style at home. The hair at the front of the head is several inches long, and a neat taper keeps it shorter and shorter down the sides and toward the back. To style, use a wide-tooth comb and some styling paste to brush the longest section of the hair straight back. The comb creates the texture, and the undercut highlights the definition.

The man bun with a low fade is a modern iteration of a classic and trendy style. Rather than pulling all the hair up into a bun just behind the crown of the head, this one incorporates a noticeable part at the temple that flows into a low fade. Men with thick hair love this look because it helps to reduce weight and volume, but when it’s worn with a full beard, it takes on a rugged and masculine appearance.

Nom: Blunt Short Crop with Mid Skin Fade
Description: A short and blunt crop with a mid skin fade can be an edgy style that looks masculine and youthful. Like the traditional crop, the hair on top is kept relatively short and combed forward from the crown. This cut gets its edgy look from the texture, which is easy to create with some styling gel and a comb. The skin fade makes this cut a real head-turner that’s ideal for fashion-forward guys.

Nom: Messy Spiky Style with Temp Fade
Description: If you want to stand out from the crowd, this messy spiky style with a temp fade is a sure way to get noticed. The hair is kept relatively short but the clearly defined angle along the temple gives it some serious attitude. While the temp fade will draw focus, use pomade to style the hair forward and create spikes. The playful silver hair color makes this an attention-getter.

The top knot with an undercut is positioned slightly higher on the head. Guys who prefer to wear their hair long will love this elegant, unique look for formal gatherings and corporate events. The undercut gives this style some real personality, especially with the two shaved lines that serve as an optical part. For a sleek and flattering look, slick the hair back with a high-shine gel before securing the knot.

Nom: Two Block with Low Skin Fade
Description: The two block with low skin fade is a unique and captivating look with a youthful flair. The hair on the top and in the back is significantly longer than the hair on the sides, and the low skin fade creates the illusion of even more volume. To recreate this look, use a texturizing pomade on the fingertips to create the piecey texture, and make sure the fringe hits about an inch above the brows.

Nom: High and Tight with Shaved Sides
Description: The high and tight with shaved sides is a classic military look that is masculine, rugged, and incredibly simple to maintain. The hair at the top and in the front is short, and the taper that separates the top from the sides is barely noticeable. Use a high-shine gel to create a textured and somewhat spiky look, and for some extra fun, stand the hair behind the forehead straight up.

Nom: Low Drop Fade with Textured Spiked Hair on Top
Description: Men who want a youthful and playful style should consider a low drop fade with textured spiked hair on top. This fun look can be achieved by leaving the hair on top from front to crown significantly longer than the hair on the rest of the head, then using a matte styling paste to create the textured spikes. The low drop fade blends into the skin at the temples, which offers the visual illusion of more height.

Permed hair with short sides can be a stylish look that will transform your style with handsome boyish curls. In this cut, the hair on top is left a few inches long and permed into large, loose curls. The curls are held in place with copious amounts of high-shine gel, which makes the hair appear wet and textured. The sides are significantly shorter and curl free, which gives this look its signature contrast.

Nom: Mid Bald Fade with Short Thick Hair
Description: If you have short thick hair, a mid bald fade is a balanced haircut on the sides and back that can complement any hairstyle. Versatile enough for any occasion, this fade looks fantastic with or without facial hair. Start the tapering slightly higher for round face shapes to create length or lower if your face is oval.

Nom: Textured Side Swept with Tapered Sides
Description: A textured side swept hairstyle with tapered sides is an on-trend look that will add volume and dimension. Just brush the hair over from a deep side part and then muss it slightly, using a texturizing gel or spray to keep it in place. Tapered sides add contrast, but they are optional.

Nom: Low Skin Fade with Thick Brushed Up Hair
Description: If you really want your cut to stand out, this thick brushed up look is for you. The best way to create this look at home is to flip your head upside down and blow dry at the roots, then apply some texturizing gel throughout. Pair this one with a low skin fade to create the illusion of more height.

Nom: Messy Medium Style with Undercut and Beard
Description: Let your rebellious side shine with a messy medium style that flows over from a deep part. There are countless ways to wear this one, but if you’re going for the rugged look, try it with an undercut and beard.

Nom: Mid Skin Fade with Textured Crop and Line Up
Description: A textured crop can offer the perfect balance between professional and casual, making it an easy choice for any occasion. Use a comb and pomade to sweep the hair forward and slightly to one side. A mid skin fade balances the length on top, and a crisp line up adds more interest to the overall look.

Nom: Buzz Cut Fade with Line Up and Shaved Design
Description: The traditional buzz cut will always be a classic, but that doesn’t mean it has to be boring. Including a fade makes it far more interesting, and the line up creates a clean appearance. The shaved design can be as simple or as intricate as you like.

Nom: Messy Curls with Short Tapered Hair on the Sides and Back
Description: Messy curls with short tapered hair on the sides and in the back are a playfully handsome and youthful style. A short beard can add balance, but feel free to wear a goatee or no facial hair at all.

Nom: Short Pomp with Mid Drop Fade
Description: A short pompadour with a mid drop fade is a fashionable look for guys who want a longer fringe but find the extra height in front a little too outgoing. The front of the hair is still voluminous, but its toned-down appearance makes it far more wearable.

Nom: Spiky Quiff with High Skin Fade
Description: The spiky quiff is a casually cool option for guys who want an eye-catching look. As a trendy style, add some texture to the hair with a good gel or pomade and pair it with a high skin fade to draw attention to the top.

The modern mullet is a fun style that combines longer hair in the back with a shorter cut on the sides and front. By making a comeback, the new mullet can be seen everywhere as guys confidently wear the look.

Nom: Thick Short Hair with Low Skin Fade
Description: A short haircut with a low skin fade can be a great look for guys with very thick hair who prefer an easy option. The styling options are endless as you could spike it up, comb it to one side, or use some gel and create a messy look. The blurring effect of the low skin fade is boyish and charming.

A hard side part fade can be a classy style worth wearing at work or a formal event. With a little effort, a modern gentleman will look clean-cut and sophisticated. A fade that starts at the temple can bring some personality to the cut without making it too informal.

Nom: Textured Long Brush Back with High Fade and Full Beard
Description: If you want to highlight your luscious locks, a textured long brush-back is ideal. Pairing it with a high fade creates the illusion of even more volume, which draws the attention where you want it – to the long hair on top. Wear this one with a full beard to add a hint of rugged masculinity.

Nom: Short Curly Hair with Tapered Sides
Description: Short curly hair can be a blessing or a curse, but when you use a product to define your curls and add some tapered sides, the result is boyishly handsome. Ask your stylist to leave your curls slightly longer from the crown forward and start the taper high.

Nom: Thick Wavy Hair with Low Drop Fade and Line Up
Description: With endless possibilities, a short wavy hairstyle is a unique style that naturally features textures and volume for a beautiful look. As a popular cut, ask your barber for a low drop fade and to crop the top short for a fuller finish. Edgy and sexy, these thick waves look phenomenal on guys who have darker hair and the sharp line up takes it to the next level.

Nom: High Volume Style with Low Taper
Description: Volume is in, and if you’re trying to give your hair some serious lift, a blow dryer will be your best friend. Just flip your head over and blow dry at the roots, then use a brush or comb to move everything into place. A low taper can add structure and pizzazz.

The blowout taper is a thicker style that requires some length on top to achieve. You will want to keep the hair on the top and in the front slightly longer but taper the rest in any way you choose. Blow dry the sides and front straight back and slightly upward, then use a strong-hold pomade for long-lasting sleekness.

A hard comb over is fantastic for guys who like to appear confident and committed to their appearances. You can add it to a variety of different cuts, or you can aim for the classic comb over and pair it with the fade of your choice.

Nom: Textured Modern Quiff with Drop Fade
Description: The textured quiff is a modern style that looks effortlessly cool yet classy. With enough length, this cut will allow you to change things up and get a comb over or messy look with incredible volume. Adding the drop fade to the look balances the texture on top.

Nom: Long Brushed Up with Tapered Sides
Description: A long brushed-up cut is all about the height, so it’s best for guys who have extra-thick hair. If you can’t seem to get your locks as high as you’d like, try pairing the style with tapered sides (or even an undercut). It can create the illusion of even more volume.

Nom: Crew Cut with Low Fade and Blunt Fringe
Description: If you want to make an everyday style like the classic crew cut look more professional, try adding some blunt fringe. It takes this cut from simple to stylish, especially when paired with a low fade. Experiment with different lengths and fade heights to personalize this look.

Nom: High Razor Fade with Comb Over
Description: If you want your haircut to help you stand out, a high razor fade paired with a comb over is a superb choice. The traditional hard part creates a crisp and clean appearance while the high razor fade adds a bit of edge. Wear it with a beard, a goatee, or a clean-shaven face.
This short pompadour fade is the modern variation of the classic style that offers comparable volume and height. Easy to wear, the fade can add visual interest and definition to the cut.

Structured cuts aren’t right for every man, especially if you prefer a more relaxed and youthful vibe. Fortunately, free-flowing curtain bangs are making a huge comeback. The nose-length bangs flow to either side from a part in the middle and frame the face for some added boyish charm.

Nom: Disconnected Quiff with Tapered Sides and Stubble
Description: A disconnected quiff separates the long hair on top from the shorter hair on the sides with a hard difference in length. This is a great cut for guys who have fine or thin hair. Some stubble can add ruggedness to the look.

Nom: Low Fade with Shape Up and Short Twists
Description: Short twists are a trendy haircut style for black men who want a fresh and fashionable look. These hair twists offer a unique texture and length, while the low fade and shape up complements the styling on top. It’s a confident and fashionable look perfect for work and play.

The modern mohawk is a bold style that comes with a fade for a more universally-accessible look. In the 80s and 90s, the mohawk was a rebellious haircut that featured shaved sides and long spikes. Shorter and with less volume, this cool cut is paired with a burst fade to create the classic shape.

A textured wavy quiff is a great option for guys who have naturally thick waves. Leaving your locks a little longer in the front and at the crown helps to capture your natural wave pattern, which creates lift. The taper fade at the sides offers a bit of flair to the cut.

Nom: Short Sides with Thick Longer Hair on Top
Description: As a cool haircut must-have, short sides with longer hair on top is a trendy look that works well with almost every type and texture. The thicker style will contrast with the fade or undercut sides to create a fresh cut.

Nom: Messy Combed Over Style with Short Tapered Sides
Description: The messy look is in, but it can often be a bit too unprofessional for some men. Pairing it with a combed over style and short tapered sides creates harmony, and if you pair it with a full, neat beard, you can get the perfect balance between rugged and polished.

The faux hawk is making a comeback, but it has arrived with a new and modern twist: brushed up texture. Keep the hawk part two to three inches long, brush it straight upward, and hold it in place with matte pomade. Then, pair it with a classic fade for a cleaner, more cultured look.

Nom: High and Tight with Shaved Sides
