Description: The high and tight is popular for its sharp transition from long hair on the top and at the crown to short hair or skin at the sides and in the back. In this case, shaved sides give the cut a bolder and more self-assured look that is still perfectly refined.

A messy curly hair fade can be a great way to keep your curls under control while still maintaining volume and texture. This curly style is a popular look for guys who want to add definition with a good styling product and pair the cut with a short fade.

While some guys prefer a subtle style, others want the world to take notice. If you fall into the latter category, the long pompadour is perfect for you. The incredible height at the front is sure to turn heads. Pairing the pomp with a low fade helps to create additional contrast.

Nom: Spiky Fringe with Short Textured Top and High Fade
Description: This look might resemble a quiff, but it’s a bit more involved. The spiky fringe is left noticeably longer than the rest of the hair for effect. The short textured top flows slightly forward and, when paired with a high fade, the bangs stand out even more.

This messy curly hairstyle will emphasize your natural texture to elevate your look. While unruly, longer curls are unique styles that allow you to show off your volume and flow. While you could grow it out further, the most popular variations tend to be easy to care for and style.

The short buzz fade is a military-inspired haircut for guys who want a low-maintenance and effortless style. Easy to get and simple to style, this cropped cut looks amazing the second you roll out of bed in the morning.

Whether you’re naturally blonde or you prefer highlights on your slightly long locks, this thick blonde side-swept style will highlight your golden tresses. It frames the face and adds dimension to your look, and it’s especially handsome with a thick, full beard.

Nom: Stylish Messy Style with Tapered Cut
Description: If you want to look great without being too meticulous about it, a stylish messy style paired with a tapered cut might be right for you. The idea here is to create interest by moving chunks of hair in opposite directions, and the taper on the sides helps to keep the look slightly more refined.

A cut that includes textured spikes is ideal for guys who have a fearless sense of style. It mimics a quiff, but instead of brushing your hair upward and backward from the forehead, you brush it upward and out. Add some chunky spikes with pomade and a skin fade for the finished look.

The short textured crew cut is another excellent choice for guys who like to look their best without any styling effort in the morning. It’s just slightly longer than the classic crew, and you can create the texture with a strong-hold pomade or sea salt spray. Try brushing your hair to one side before texturizing to create symmetry.

Nom: Masculine Buzz Cut with High Razor Fade
Description: The buzz cut is the most low-maintenance haircut of them all, but that doesn’t mean it has to be boring or tasteless. Adding a high razor fade to a classic buzz makes it sophisticated, refined and classy. A clean-shaven face makes it more youthful while a full beard or stubble makes you look irresistible.

Nom: Slick Back with Low Shaved Sides
Description: A classic slick back with low shaved sides can reflect your bold and daring personality. To style this trendy vintage look, texturize it just slightly with a wide-tooth comb and pomade, then pair it with a low taper or razor fade. As an iconic style, it will make you an instant heartthrob.

Nom: French Crop with Shape Up and Low Taper Fade
Description: The French crop is closely related to the classic crew cut, but the hair on top falls forward to create an extremely blunt fringe. It’s great for guys who love a structured and put-together look, especially with a shape up and low taper fade.

The slicked-back trend isn’t going away, so if you’re looking for some alternative ways to wear it, pairing it with an undercut fade is an option. To get the most out of an undercut, it’s best to leave the hair on top several inches long. It makes the style more versatile and adds interest to the look.

Nom: Sleek Hard Side Part with Low Taper
Description: A sleek hard side part is one part glamorous and chic to one part boyish and charming. Letting a few strands of hair fall forward over the forehead adds just a touch of boldness, and a low taper subtly freshens things up. It’s a contemporary take on a timeless classic that looks fantastic on almost anyone.

Guys with naturally textured hair who prefer preppy cuts often lean toward the wavy Ivy League style, which is essentially a crew cut that is long enough for a side part. Try a classic fade to keep the style neat, especially when the fade starts at the temple.

Nom: High Volume Brush Back with Low Fade
Description: With an off-center part, this high-volume brush back is a modern take on a classic style from the 90s. The medium-length hairstyle starts by volumizing at the root, and the low fade creates contrast and the illusion of additional lift. Use a matte styling product for the perfect textured look.

The bedhead look continues to gain status and fame. There are no rules with this one, so just grow out your locks to a length you like and tousle them up. A shaved face can add some boyish charm while a full beard provides some rugged sex appeal.

If you have an oblong face shape or a large forehead, adding some long, textured fringe to your ‘do is a fantastic way to balance your features. As an example, you could start with a classic French crop, let your fringe grow out, and use some pomade to create a choppy, textured look.

Nom: Very Short Cut with Thick Beard
Description: Low-maintenance men who don’t like spending a lot of time in front of the mirror might opt for a very short cut, such as a buzz or even a closely cropped crew cut. A neatly trimmed thick beard leads to a more chiseled appearance, and a longer, scruffier beard is ideal for a disheveled or rugged look.

A medium-length wavy mohawk is a fantastic way to show off your hair’s natural thickness and texture, especially when paired with a drop fade that follows the shape of the mohawk. The subtler, neater transition lends to a more refined appearance overall.

Nom: High Undercut Fade with Slicked Back Pomp
Description: If you want a fresh contemporary cut, you can’t go wrong with a slicked back pomp, which is shorter and more refined than the classic pompadour. Rather than being brushed mostly upward, it flows upward and back. It’s sophisticated and elegant, especially when paired with a high undercut fade.

This long curly hairstyle is a stylish choice for guys who want to maintain extra length that will draw attention. To style, you will need to brush your hair up and to the side, sweeping the fringe and creating a subtle part. Flirty and romantic, your curls will need a light hairspray or serum to stay in place.

Nom: Textured Spiky Hair with High Skin Fade
Description: Textured spiky hair is a style that’s daring without being over the top. Using a strong pomade or wax, just spike your hair straight up and combine with a high skin fade for balance.

If you want to show off your inner punk but the classic version is too edgy for your needs, a short mohawk could be the solution. By combining with a burst fade, you can tone it down even further and create a look that is fun and refined.

Pairing a short faux hawk with a traditional fade is perfect for guys who want their rock-and-roll personalities to shine. If you like the gallant look, leave the center hair longer and go for a shorter taper. For a toned-down, almost classy version of this style, keep the hair shorter and add a longer taper.

The low taper fade is a classic haircut that gradually gets shorter down the sides for a subtle and elegant cut. While the bald fade blends into the skin, the taper leaves very short hair at the end. Starting around the ears and curving down to the neckline, a low cut taper works well with short and long hair on top for a stylish men’s hairstyle.

The low skin fade is a modern haircut for guys who want an edgy and trendy cut. As a fresh and clean-cut style, the low skin fade haircut is tapered into extremely short shaved hair, creating a heavy contrast that looks cool. With very short hair on the sides and back, the longer hair on top comes into focus and allows guys to style some popular hairstyles.

The medium low fade offers a balance between the low and mid fade haircuts, giving guys a shorter cut on the sides for a simple style. Combine your low mid cut with short, medium-length or long hair with a textured finish for a hairstyle that will always look thick and full.

The low bald fade is a type of haircut that blends the hair into the skin. Also known as a skin fade, you can ask your barber for a low cut bald fade when you want him to taper the hair very short for a clean finish. Guys with business professional hairstyles often request a razor low for an edgy touch to their classy cut.

The low fade undercut is one of the more popular haircuts for stylish men. Some guys maximize the contrast by pairing a low skin fade with an undercut for an edgy disconnected cut. You can also combine an undercut and low taper for a clean, smooth look. This style transitions quickly from very short at the bottom to medium-short in the middle to full-length long hair on top. This undercut will highlight the volume and fullness of your hair. The low undercut style is most flattering if you want to comb your hair back, achieve a spiky hairstyle, or want to maintain a pomp in the front.

A low fade is a popular cut to pair with short hair, giving guys a masculine and stylish hairstyle. From a textured crop top to a hard side part to a messy style, the low fade will complement a short haircut by keeping the sides trimmed and naturally drawing the eyes to the styling above. You can ask your barber for a taper fade for a professional look or go for a bold cut with a low skin fade. For a thicker and fuller look, apply a matte product to your short men’s hairstyle to create a textured finish. Great for all hair types, you can’t go wrong styling short hair with this cut.

Nom: Low Fade with Long Hair on Top
Description: For a versatile and cool hairstyle, you’ll want to get a low fade with long hair on top and experiment with different styles. From medium length to longer hair, guys can pull off a low taper fade haircut for a smooth and handsome look that will work for any occasion. If you want an edgy vibe, a skin fade can be added to a long hairstyle to maximize the contrast and keep the sides really short. Whether you style a textured comb back or casual bro flow, you can soften the transition by featuring your long hair for the perfect blended haircut.

A low fade with a beard is a great way to blend your facial hair into your haircut. Also known as a beard fade, this style starts at the ears and gradually tapers the sides into the facial hair. Some guys prefer a taper fade so the trimming process is more subtle, while others like a bald fade that cuts the sides into the skin for a stronger contrast. From short to long, it works with many different beard styles.

The blowout with a low fade is a bold, fresh cut with volume that looks stylish. This style is achieved by blow-drying and brushing your hair up immediately after washing. Normally, you should apply some medium-hold hair product to it to maintain its shape. This is an eye-catching hairstyle that has a slimming effect through the face. Commonly worn by guys who have straighter or thinner hair, the length on top will also give you other styling options day-to-day.

The low fade and side part is a classy haircut for men who want a sleek and elegant look. The side part hairstyle features short to medium hair that is swept to one side along your natural part. Easy to style and always sharp, this distinct cut can be worn to the office or at parties for a charming look. When it comes to gentleman’s haircuts, the low fade side part is one of the most popular options in barbershops around the world.

Nom: Low Fade with A Crew Cut
Description: The crew cut with a low fade takes this cool short men’s haircut to the next level. While the classic cut features short hair on top with shorter sides, the modern crew cut comes with a fade haircut for extra contrast and minimal styling. This classy hairstyle offers a fashionable finish for guys who need an all-around clean look. You can add a low skin fade for a bald cut on the sides or keep it tapered for a gentleman’s style.

Nom: Low Fade with A Slicked Back Hair
Description: A low fade with slicked back hair on top contrasts perfectly to create a bold, classy look. This combination provides more subtlety than would a high fade with any degree of length, making it a more functional style for any occasion. One possible drawback is that this kind of haircut requires a bit of styling every day. Depending on your hair type and thickness, you will have your choice of styling products. You can use a pomade, wax or gel when slicking back your hair, while a thickening product like clay may be well-suited for guys with thin hair. Adding an undercut or beard can round out this look nicely.

A quiff with a low fade is a trendy hairstyle that requires some length on top for a striking look. Unlike the similar pompadour, a quiff is styled by brushing the hair forward and up. The cool look and height make this modern style eye-catching. The quiff is incredibly flattering for all face shapes since it elongates your features. Great for most hair types, the quiff is a chic style that continues to trend.

Nom: Low Fade with A Comb Over
Description: The comb over is a classic hairstyle for men who want a classy and sleek look. For a professional style, many guys choose to pair a low fade with their comb over haircut. When styling the low fade comb over, you’ll want to apply a matte hair product for a natural textured finish. Stylish and flattering, there are many modern and classic styles to experiment with. While you may expose your hairline by combing your hair to the side and back, make sure to wear this style with confidence.

Nom: Low Fade with A Faux Hawk
Description: A faux hawk with a low fade is a less dramatic haircut than the classic mohawk. Instead of shaved sides, the low taper fade offers a subtle transition to the spiked hair on top, giving guys the versatility to style different hairstyles. The fohawk can be styled down and to the side in a professional setting, and then spiked up for a night out without compromising the cut.

Nom: Low Fade with A Buzz Cut
Description: The buzz cut with a low fade is a masculine style for guys who want an easy, edgy look. As a casual and fresh haircut, the sides and back pair perfectly with different buzz cut styles to create a clean aesthetic for guys. The fade around the ears and behind the head gives a deliberate touch that makes it a fashion statement. Asking your barber to clean up your hairline with a straight razor at the end of your appointment will only add to your sleek appearance.

Nom: Low Fade with A Messy Pompadour
Description: The pompadour is a timeless style that looks fashionable, offering height and flow for a trendy style. If you want an easy hairstyle, this newer take on the pomp fade could be an excellent look for you.

The low fade with spiky hair offers the perfect balance between classy and bold. The spiky hairstyle on top is edgy and cool, while the low fade haircut is subtle and sophisticated. When styling short spiky hair, consider a skin fade for extra contrast in your casual hairstyle. With a taper on the sides and back, you can also spike your hair all over, style a faux hawk, or create a unique look with spikes in different directions. Make sure to apply a matte high-hold hair product for a textured natural look.

Nom: Low Fade with Short Textured Hair on Top
Description: Textured hair on top is a trending style for men and can be easily paired with a low fade. Combining textured hair with a low taper fade is a great way for guys to create a popular short haircut. There are many popular men’s hairstyles that leverage a textured top, including a crop top, crew cut, Ivy League, and short fringe. As a clean-cut look, you’ll want to style your hair with a light-hold matte pomade for a layered cut. A textured hairstyle can work well with thick, curly and wavy hair, but is especially useful for guys with thin hair who need a fuller appearance.

Nom: Low Fade with A Pompadour and Hard Part
Description: When it comes to stylish hairstyles, the pompadour looks great with a low fade and hard part, giving guys an edgy finish to a classic look. A fade with a hard part is a modern style that can be added to any cut. This look caters to teenage guys and young men who want to curate a bad boy look. If you’re confident in styling your pompadour neatly, then the part would accent the volume and height of your hairstyle. Since the line in a hard part tends to grow out after a week, we recommend regular trims to keep the cut looking sharp.

Wavy hair works well with a low fade and can be a great way to leverage the unique texture of your waves. Guys with wavy hair have many hairstyle options, and the low fade haircut allows you the freedom to focus your styling efforts on the hair on top. For a casual look, try pairing a low bald cut with short to medium-length wavy hair and styling a comb over. For a smart casual style, partner a taper with medium to longer hair and applying a light product for naturally textured waves.

When you want a nice hairstyle for medium short hair, a low fade with a fringe can be a trendy look. While some fringe styles can be messy and casual, a textured fringe with bangs that cover part of your forehead can be edgy and fun. Perfect for teenage boys and young men, you’ll want to start with a fade haircut on the sides and then get a short cut on top, leaving extra length in the front. Use a light to medium hold pomade, wax, or clay product to style the hair forward. This deliberately chill hairstyle has a youthful feel to it, while the tapered sides still make it classy for semi-formal occasions.

Make your curly hair stand out and easy to manage with a short crop on top with a low fade on the sides. The curly hair fade haircut embraces your hair’s natural texture, giving you volume and bounce while keeping the sides and back trimmed short. Whether you pair your curly hairstyle with a taper or skin fade, the style will show off your curls for a flattering finish.

A brush up with a taper fade is a modern and flattering haircut that showcases the volume on top. To achieve a polished appearance, comb the hair upward with a quality styling product that creates texture and volume. You can also ask your barber for shorter sides to achieve striking contrast and dimension.

If you still have a good head of hair in your golden years, get a textured thick brush back. This hairstyle is smooth and textured but has immense body and lift that lends the look movement and flow. Style your brush back with sleek short sides or a taper fade for a bold and daring result.

The comb over is a classy and versatile hairstyle for older men who want a timeless look that will suit any occasion. Whether you have thick or thinning hair, the short hair on the sides and back will complement the longer style on top. Clean-shaven or paired with a beard, the comb over will make you look good and feel confident in the office and at home.

A buzz cut with a beard is an edgy and low-maintenance cut that lets you showcase your rugged side. Whether you want to completely buzz the top or prefer a slightly longer style, this short haircut can pair perfectly with a full beard or modern goatee.

A classy slicked back undercut is one of the most popular haircuts for older men as it offers a sleek and timeless look that’s easy to maintain. You can seamlessly blend the back and sides with an undercut fade or go bold and dramatic with hard parts and shaved lines. To create a trendy textured finish, use a strong-hold matte pomade to slick back your hair.

Nom: Buzz Cut with Salt and Pepper Beard
Description: A buzz cut with a salt and pepper beard gives older guys the chance to showcase their grays in a cool and refreshing way. The pops of white and gray throughout a longer beard always look striking, but you can also achieve a clean-cut appearance with natural stubble or a short scruff.

Nom: Wavy Slick Back with Short Sides and Beard
Description: A wavy slick back is one of the most low-maintenance hairstyles for older men that works extremely well with short sides and a manly beard. Slick the front pieces back with a lightweight gel and let the rest of your locks hang loose for a bohemian and carefree result.

Nom: Short Side Swept Hair with Clean Shave
Description: As a popular haircut for mature men, short side swept hair is an easy way to showcase strong features while maintaining a youthful appearance. The slick side sweep disguises thinning sides, and you can easily disguise patches near the crown with clever styling. For the ultimate clean-cut appearance, rock this style clean-shaven.

A classic comb over offers an elegant and soft appearance that works well on guys with thicker locks. You can channel your inner George Clooney with a connected beard and a flattering chin strap or rock your style clean-shaven. If you’re experiencing thinning and want to prevent further breakage, use gentle strokes to pull the hair over.

The classic crew cut is an ideal choice for older gentlemen who want an effortless style with a youthful edge. The shorter length of this cut makes it relatively easy to maintain, and you can pair it with a modern taper fade and a rugged beard for visual interest.

Curly short hair can be a striking option for men blessed with natural volume and texture. Keeping your curls short makes them easy to maintain for a simple everyday look. If your coils are tight, balance any curls on the crown with a well-groomed goatee or manly stubble.

Nom: Curtain Bangs with Heavy Stubble Beard
Description: For guys with longer hair, rocking romantic and flowing curtain bangs with a heavy stubble beard can look irresistible. The elegant curtain bangs will effortlessly frame your face, while the stubble offers your features a rugged and masculine edge that will stand the test of time.

A comb over mid fade is an excellent way to balance faded sides and impressive volume on top. You can pair this masculine cut with a light scruff for a youthful feel or rock it entirely clean-shaven if you work in a professional setting.

Nom: Thick Slick Back Undercut Fade and Beard
Description: A thick slick back is a popular and timeless style for older men, but you can channel your inner daredevil with a rugged beard and badass fade. When styling the hair on top, choose a high-quality pomade and work the hair backward with a sturdy comb to create height and prevent breakage.

Nom: Short Curly Afro with Long Gray Beard
Description: The short curly afro with a long gray beard is a popular choice among older black men with natural texture. The length of your beard will balance the short locks on top and can also disguise a weaker chin and jawline. If you’re a guy who appreciates modern trends, throw in a fade or tapered sides.

Dealing with thinning hair can be difficult for guys as they age, but you can disguise lost volume with a pompadour and short sides. You’ll need to crop the sides and carefully style your pompadour with texturizing products to lift your strands. To draw focus downward, pair this cut with a light scruff around the chin.

A very short crop top is an excellent haircut for older men as it requires minimal maintenance to look sleek and stylish. Generally worn with a short back and sides, you can add a bald fade if you want to embrace your edgy and daring side.

Flowing waves can be difficult to maintain without regular trims, but they look soft and refreshing on free-spirited men. To give your locks more shape, ask for slightly longer hair on top and a long back and sides. For effortless texture, gently tousle pomade through your locks.

A short quiff with a beard is a simple and elegant cut that works extremely well on thicker locks. The sleekness of the hair gives older men a distinguished appearance, making it a great choice for professional guys who want a dapper hairstyle. To contrast the slick quiff, experiment with light scruff or a messy full beard.

Older men who are blessed with thick locks can experiment with handsome long hair and a beard for the ultimate silver fox look. This style is extremely attractive on men with natural waves, but you can add a spritz of sea salt spray to create a flowing and textured style that complements full facial hair.

Nom: Hard Part with Low Bald Fade
Description: A hard part with a low bald fade uses subtle transitions and sharp lines to create a style that’s packed with visual interest. The gradual fade keeps this cut youthful and refreshing, but you can also add a clean-cut chin strap or light stubble to highlight chiseled facial features.

Nom: Modern Comb Over with Low Taper Fade
Description: The modern comb over with a low taper fade is a smart and classic hairstyle that looks dapper on older guys. This gentleman’s style can hide thinning hair and a receding hairline, while the short back and sides create the illusion of volume. For a smooth finish, you’ll want to style your hair with a light to medium-hold wax, gel or pomade.

Short messy brushed-up curls are an ideal choice for older men who are struggling with thinning hair. Brushing the longer hair upward will highlight the natural texture of your coils. Let your curls shine without product or add definition with a matte pomade or a few scrunches of light gel.

If you’re struggling with thinner hair on the sides, a gentleman’s side part can easily disguise it. This cut is characterized by an extreme side part and a short length, making it a low-maintenance style that’s easy to manage. For a classy and textured look, comb the hair backward with pomade to create extra volume before settling it to the side.

Nom: Short Ivy League Style with Beard
Description: The classic Ivy League cut is a staple for men of all ages, and the gentle side sweep can draw attention away from thinning sides. This short hairstyle works well with a rugged beard to instantly dial up your sex appeal.

The high and tight fade is a popular haircut for older men that pairs short and clipped sides with slightly longer hair on top. You can choose a high fade for a dramatic and military-inspired look or a low fade for a wearable style. Rock your cut with a full beard for an effortlessly masculine appearance that instantly turns heads.

The layered quiff with a mid fade is a classic style for older men who want a sophisticated cut with a modern feel. You’ll need a full head of hair to achieve height at the crown, but you can draw attention away from thinning by closely cropping the sides.

Nom: Long Comb Over with Brushed-Up Fringe
Description: A long comb over with a brushed-up fringe offers older guys with thick locks a professional style that’s ideal for everyday wear. Brushing the hair upward creates serious volume and lift at the roots which perfectly complements a tidy and well-groomed beard.

Nom: Long Crew Cut with Side-Swept Fringe
Description: A long crew cut with a side-swept fringe gives you the chance to create a cool and masculine style that highlights the sexy length on top. Having shorter sides creates attractive visual interest that showcases strong features, but it’s the smooth side sweep that will turn you into a complete heartthrob.

Short curly hair is a fantastic way to showcase your coils while maintaining a professional and clean-cut appearance. Whether you want to experiment with fades or prefer traditional cropped sides, keep your style under control with regular barber visits and a slick of gel.

Nom: Long Wavy Hair with A Short Beard
Description: Long wavy hair is naturally relaxed and laid-back, making it an ideal choice for men who want a low-maintenance look. To avoid your locks looking flat, muss them with texturizing products before flipping your hair to one side for a bohemian vibe. For a rugged feel, add a short beard to the mix.

Nom: Longer Brushed Back Style with Shaved Sides
Description: Rocking a longer brushed back style with shaved sides allows you to create dimension and movement with volume. To achieve breathtaking height, use a strong-hold product to brush the hair upward and keep the sides bald for incredible contrast that looks sharp and stylish.

Nom: Low Fade with Hard Side Part
Description: A low fade with a hard side part is a stacked and sleek style that creates the illusion of thickness. By separating the hair into different lengths, you can draw attention to the volume on top by combing over any thinning patches. Balance your locks with a sharp full beard for a well-rounded finish.

If you don’t want to spend much time styling long locks each day, a messy bro flow is a winning cut. Not only will it give you a rugged and windswept look, but you can gently muss your strands with styling products for attractive movement that showcases light layers.

By styling thinning hair in a messy and short style, you can create effortless volume that pulls focus away from patchiness. Getting a choppy cut is a great way to add texture, and using products that add grit to your strands will boost hair on top for an instant lift.

A pompadour fade is a timeless style that combines a voluminous pompadour with faded hair along the sides. This graduated look adds structure to any face, and the dazzling volume from the pompadour beautifully showcases thick strands. For a more relaxed take on this classic style, rock a messy pompadour with a full beard.

A short wavy style looks handsome on most older men since it offers texture and dimension without looking overly styled. To avoid a frizzy or poofy look, don’t cut the hair too short and keep everything at a uniform length to pull attention away from thinning temples. For a bad boy vibe with a touch of authority, pair your cut with a full beard.

Nom: Messy Spiky Hair with Low Taper
Description: You can’t beat messy spiky hair with a low taper if you want a masculine and dimensional style. The textured spikes near the crown will elongate your features, but it’s the shorter sides that create contrast with the volume on top. Dye your hair for a youthful vibe or embrace your grays with pride.

Nom: Salt and Pepper Slick Back with Pomp
Description: A salt and pepper slick back with a pomp in the front can help you embrace your natural color with a stylish look. You don’t need ridiculous volume on top, but there should be enough hair to slick back with a gel or pomade for a sleek finish. Tie your look together with a sexy full beard that blends into your sideburns.

Nom: Short Crew Cut with Low Taper Fade and Beard
Description: A short crew cut with a low taper fade and beard combines minimal length on top with gently tapered sides and manly facial hair. You can play around with short spikes at the front for a fun look or a sleek line up if you’re not struggling with a receding hairline.

Nom: High and Tight with Short Beard
Description: If you’re starting to lose your hair, rocking a high and tight style with cropped sides and a short beard can be a flattering choice. The tapering near the top offers a minimalist and clean look, while the structured beard adds structure to the jawline for a manly result. For a hint of shine, use a small amount of water-based pomade to sculpt the top.

Nom: Short Hair All Over with Messy Beard
Description: Having short hair all over with a messy beard is an easy way to create a slightly unstructured style that’s easy to pull together in the mornings. Keeping your hair short hides thinning areas or a lack of volume, while the messy beard perfectly balances your features for an undone and bedhead vibe.

If you’re a fan of classic Ivy League cuts but want to showcase your bohemian side, a few choppy layers can instantly lift your look. The playful sweep of the fringe pulls eyes away from thinning temples, while the shorter sides keep the cut manageable and slick. For more texture, lightly muss the hair on top with a matte pomade for an undone feel.

Nom: Short Side Part with Tapered Sides and Clean Shave
Description: A short side part with tapered sides pairs perfectly with a clean shave for a handsome finish that flatters strong jawlines. You’ll want to leave a small amount of volume at the front of the head while closely tapering the sides. You should regularly trim your strands to maintain your style, but this elegant cut is worth pulling out your clippers.

Short spiky hair can be a cool and fun way to reconnect with the punk rocker days of yesteryear. Spikes are tricky to style, but including tapered sides and gently brushing the hair upward creates a gorgeous structure that shaves years off your appearance.

Nom: Short Textured Brush Up with High Skin Fade
Description: If you want to embrace your inner daredevil without sacrificing any volume on top, try a short textured brush up. Although you can wear this style with cropped sides, adding a high skin fade creates a dramatic transition that commands attention. For an all-day hold, secure your short hair in place with styling products.

Nom: Wavy Side Part with Low Taper Fade
Description: A side part with a low taper fade is a flattering way to showcase volume and gray hair without the upkeep of more complicated styles. The subtle tapering offers a clean-cut look, while the striking side part easily disguises thinning and patchiness.

Nom: Side Swept Ivy League with Short Sides
Description: When it comes to achieving a stylish and modern look, the side swept Ivy League is a business professional hairstyle for older guys who still want to look handsome. This polished cut looks excellent with short sides, and the side sweep lets you add attractive volume that can be secured with a strong-hold pomade or wax. Rock this cut clean-shaven or pair it with a disconnected beard for visual interest.

A textured brush back taper is a popular and sexy style that will take thick locks to new heights. Ask your barber for tapered sides before brushing the hair back with texturizing pomade for serious oomph. Complement your sleek cut with a rugged goatee for a masculine finish.

Nom: Textured Side Part with Tapered Sides
Description: A textured side part with tapered sides can offer a low-maintenance and handsome style with gorgeous flow. The softness of the sweeping locks on top balances the neat tapered sides and works well on all hair types. It’s worth growing light stubble for charming ruggedness or staying clean-shaven if you like looking polished.

Nom: Thick Comb Over with High Undercut
Description: The thick comb over with a high undercut is a trendy and youthful style that takes advantage of exceptional volume on top. You can distract from thinning sides and temples with a striking undercut which also draws attention to the modern comb over.

A thick bro flow is a stylish and deliberate way to highlight a head of gray hair without losing length or volume. Stick with a uniform length for a bohemian look that you can tousle and pull to either side. If you want more movement, a few long layers can add dimension to your strands.

Nom: Thick Volume on Top with Tapered Sides and Short Beard
Description: If you’re proud of your gray locks, draw attention to thick hair on top by getting tapered sides and a playful short beard. This style works particularly well on curly wavy hair as the natural texture offers lift and volume at the front of the head.

Nom: Wavy Front with Short Tapered Sides
Description: Fashioning your wavy hair with tapered sides can be a beautiful way to highlight natural texture and strong features. Simply brush up the front, gently pull the hair to the side and closely taper your sides.

A low bald fade is a trendy and modern haircut for men who want a classy look. The low fade haircut starts right above the ear and subtly tapers into the hair on top. This versatile bald fade can be paired with a short comb over, longer quiff or faux hawk to create a fashionable finish. To complement, combine the cut with a rugged beard for a masculine style.

A mid bald fade is an attractive and balanced haircut that provides contrast for a cool look. The mid fade can be a bold style for guys who want a strong taper that will complement a business professional hairstyle. Starting in the middle, a medium faded haircut can be paired with short, medium and longer styles on top such as the French crop, side part or slick back.

The high bald fade is an edgy haircut for men who want short hair on the sides and back to create a masculine style. With minimal tapering, the high fade offers strong contrast and can suit very short to medium-length styles for a sharp finish. This bald fade can be combined with a buzz cut, comb over, top knot or spiky hair to achieve a fresh and ruggedly handsome appearance.

A bald taper fade is a modern haircut style for guys that provides a clean and smooth look. The taper fade offers a blended cut on the sides and back that will complement the longer hair on top for a stylish look. Using clippers, bald taper fade can be combined with a low, mid, high, drop or burst cut to create a unique style.

A bald temp fade is a trendy haircut that offers a unique and cool style. Popular with black men, the temp fade can complement a buzz cut, afro, high top or naturally curly hair, pairing perfectly with a handsome line-up for a bold and dapper finish. By creating a striking fade around the temple, sides and back, the bald temple fade haircut creates a stark transition that draws attention to the hair on top.

The bald drop fade is an edgy haircut style for any man who appreciates unique texture, contrast and volume. The drop fade curves around the head and follows the hairline to the back of the head. This cut can add a fresh and flattering touch to your hairstyle.

A zero bald fade is a very short cut that effectively shaves the sides and back to design a sleek and clean finish. Daring and badass, a zero fade can be combined with a faux hawk, slick back, mohawk or comb over to take the style to the next level.

The bald fade undercut is a stunning haircut that combines these bold styles for a sexy vibe. The undercut fade tapers the cut while still providing a disconnected contrast. With an abrupt transition, this style can be intense and looks amazing when pulled off by a skilled barber.

Short hair with a bald fade is a natural style for men who want a low-maintenance and masculine look. The bald taper fade can be combined with several popular short hairstyles such as the buzz cut, crop top, crew cut, and high and tight for a ruggedly handsome finish. You can keep the hair on top slightly choppy for a disheveled feel or style into a deep side part for a clean-cut result.

A bald fade with long hair is a bohemian and modern cut that gives you flexibility when it comes to styling. From the man bun to the top knot, these long hairstyles are trendy choices that will be complemented by the bald taper fade on the sides and back. With longer hair on top, these tapered styles can help create a masculine and modern look that will boost your sex appeal.

Nom: Bald Fade with Medium Length Hair
Description: The bald fade with medium length hair offers excellent contrast for men who aren’t afraid to experiment with outlandish styles. For a sleek professional look, gently work pomade through the hair for a glorious pompadour or side-swept style. If you enjoy the biker-chic look, roughly brush the hair upwards for a laid-back vibe.

A bald fade with a curly hairstyle can be a simple way to embrace your natural texture. Whether you want short or long curls, a curly hair fade is an effortlessly stylish look that can be easily maintained with regular trims. With some facial hair, your hairstyle will look timeless and irresistible to women.

A buzz cut with a bald fade is a military-inspired haircut that offers a low-maintenance and masculine look. For a next level vibe, this short style can feature shaved lines, a breathtaking beard and a striking line-up for a sharp finish. For the ultimate badass feel, rock an eyebrow slit that will draw attention.

A French crop with a bald fade is a bold statement that comes with attitude thanks to the sharp transition across the sides and the completely shaved nape. Brush your hair forwards to draw attention to the crown using a medium-hold product for an all-day hold that will pull your style together.

A comb over with a bald fade is a timeless haircut for guys that can help create a clean-cut and classy style. To prevent your style from looking abrasive, keep the fade subtle and fashion a deep side part for a classic and flattering finish.

A faux hawk with a bald fade is difficult to pull off, but this edgy style is ideal for wannabe punk rockers who want to make a statement. The extreme skin fade across the back and sides draws focus to the volume on the top which you can balance with a rugged beard. If you’re feeling adventurous, experiment with blond or colored dyes.

Men with a strong bone structure can easily soften their look by getting a quiff with a bald fade. By leaving impressive volume on top, you’ll get a striking contrast with the almost clean-shaven back and sides for an eye-catching result.

If you want to add next-level texture to your hair, spiky hair with a bald fade is an efficient way to create contrast while retaining volume on top. This style gives you the perfect balance of defined lines and concentrated volume for a sleek result that can be elevated further with a dapper beard.

The pompadour bald fade is a cool choice for men who are blessed with natural volume and chiseled cheekbones. Keep the fade extreme for greater contrast or dial it back for a subtle and professional feel. Throw in a Van Dyke or Viking beard for an extreme hit of masculine energy.
A textured top with a bald fade can achieve a thicker look with dimension that will highlight strong features. Textured hair is a popular style for guys who struggle to tame their natural locks.

An afro bald fade is a flattering and fashionable cut that works seamlessly with textured and coarse locks. This trendy style pairs a low, medium or high fade with a daring line-up to create contrast with the curly hair left on top for a sharp and refined look that lets your natural texture shine.

A bald fade mohawk is an eye-catching style that can be rocked with a low or high fade depending on your preference. Spike the hair upwards with a strong-hold product or let it flop slightly for a relaxed bedhead vibe.

Fashionable guys who appreciate contrast can create breathtaking lines and transitions by asking for a bald fade with a hard part. The extreme fade on the sides, the hard shaved line and the volume across the top work beautifully with a chin strap for the ultimate punk-rocker feel.

A high top bald fade is a fashionable style for black men who want to experiment with retro cuts while incorporating sleek faded sides. This fresh cut should be rocked with volume on top, a trendy line-up and a connected beard for a style that screams sophistication and modern elegance.

A bald fade always looks effortlessly stylish, but incorporating a bold shaved design allows guys to embrace their creative side. Lines and geometric patterns work best, but don’t be afraid to experiment with hard parts, swirls or lightning bolts.

A skin fade with a trendy line keeps your look sleek and stylish while injecting a touch of personality into your cut. Your part line can go back toward the nape or stop just above the back of the ear for a touch of edgy asymmetry.

A V-shaped bald fade is an excellent choice for men who want a slightly different take on traditional styles. To achieve this bold and striking look, ask your barber for a faded back and sides that taper into a V-shape at the back. For even more impact, keep your sides completely shaved.

Nom: Hard Side Part with Bald Fade
Description: A hard side part with a bald fade is an edgy and daring cut that is certain to add a military edge to your style. If you’re looking for something wearable, keep plenty of volume on top and gently brush it to the side in a modern comb over. For a bolder vibe, buzz the hair short.

Nom: Low Bald Fade with Short Curly Hair on Top
Description: If you have short curly hair on top, styling your hair with a low bald fade will create eye-catching contrast that you can’t beat. Refine your style with a line-up or keep your cut casual but fashionable by tousling your curls for a bohemian feel.

A bald fade with a line up can help you draw attention to the professional hairstyle and volume on top. When getting a haircut at the barbershop, an angular line-up and slick comb over are guaranteed to look sensational with a sharp suit.

If you want to add dimension to your style while highlighting natural volume, a bald fade with a beard is ideal. The messy and disheveled top creates eye-catching contrast with the slick faded sides and the rugged beard for an unbeatable bad-boy finish.

Sponged hair with a bald fade allows guys with natural texture to create effortless contrast without sacrificing their loc curls. It’s a good idea to keep the fade subtle, but you can add angularity to your look with a line-up and beard.

If you haven’t been blessed with naturally thick hair, a blowout with a bald fade will give you a stylish and voluminous appearance that you can hold in place with pomades. A low fade gives you subtle dimension, but you can dial your look up significantly with near-shaved sides and spiked-up hair on top.

Nom: Low Bald Fade with Comb Over and Beard
Description: A low bald fade is a stylish look on its own, but it can look truly unforgettable with a comb over and beard. Although a high fade looks incredibly striking when joined up with a full beard, keeping the fade subtle offers a more effortless transition into the sleek comb over on top.

Slicked back hair with a bald fade is a flattering choice for gentlemen who prefer clean-cut styles. You can choose subtle fading for versatile styling or go all-out with a high fade and a strong pomade for greater contrast with the volume on top.

Nom: Modern Textured Style with Bald Fade and Beard
Description: A modern textured style with a bald fade can be a great look for men with thick hair who want to highlight their fullness and volume. Using a matte styling product, you can brush your hair forward to create a spiky style while seamlessly transitioning your faded sides into your beard for a manly result.

A crew cut with a bald fade is a youthful and refreshing style that looks amazing on young guys who want a low-maintenance and preppy cut. Ask your barber to keep the hair on top neat and short while seamlessly tapering the sides and back for a chic finish.

Nom: Thick Short Hair with High Bald Fade
Description: If you’re struggling to tame thick short hair, try wearing it with a high bald fade for a lightweight feel that will take your style to new heights. To create more contrast, ask for a close skin shave and leave a small amount of hair close to your part for a smooth transition.

Nom: Short Spiky Hair with High Zero Fade
Description: Rocking short spiky hair with a high zero fade makes a bold statement that looks especially striking with colored dyes and bleached locks. Style this cut by spiking the hair upward with strong hold products for a sexy and disheveled feel. To take things further, shave an edgy hard part into your sides to neatly break up the fade transition.

Nom: Textured Quiff with Bald Fade and Beard
Description: A textured quiff with a bald fade and beard is a simple and rugged style that makes thick hair easier to manage. Brushing up the hair with a pomade will instantly add flattering texture and contrast to the edgy fade, while the manly beard frames the face to create the illusion of a chiseled jawline.

Nom: Buzz Cut Fade with Shape Up and Beard
Description: A buzz cut fade with a shape up and beard is a fresh and contemporary take on an age-old military style. The shape up gives this style uniformity and structure, while the neatly buzzed hair on top flatters men with strong features and enviable jawlines.

Nom: Slicked Back Hair with Mid Bald Fade and Beard
Description: Slicked back hair with a mid bald fade and beard can be suited for men with straighter locks who want to use styling products to achieve this sleek look. For the most dapper finish, you should keep the beard disconnected from the fade for visual interest and ensure there’s enough hair on top for a voluminous slick back.

Nom: Messy Wavy Hair with Low Bald Fade
Description: Styling your messy wavy hair with a low bald fade is a playful and refreshing way to showcase your natural texture while adding dimension to your locks. The longer hair on top can be left to fall forwards for a sexy and youthful vibe or slicked to the side for a retro look that contrasts with the striking modern fade.

If you have a thick afro, a temp fade can be a trendy way to add dimension and contrast to your hairstyle. The faded sides will emphasize the volume on top while lending your look a polished and sleek vibe. Pair this cut with a beard or rock it clean-shaven.

Waves look incredibly eye-catching with a temp fade, creating a clean-cut and refreshing look that highlights your bone structure. It has a minimalist feel thanks to its short length, but the light texture creates a cool and youthful result. Throw in a striking temple fade for the ultimate heartthrob look.

Embrace your natural texture by rocking a curly blowout and a flattering temp fade. From nappy to to tight curls, the volume from the afro blowout creates a modern and voluminous shape at the back of the head while the faded edges create attractive lines that draw the eyes upwards.

Nom: Buzz Cut with Temp Fade and Beard
Description: The military buzz cut is a practical style that looks effortlessly masculine on any guy. To avoid the one-dimensional look of a classic buzzed head, throw in light fading around the temples and bold facial hair for a rugged feel that leans contemporary. For a badass finish, shave a deep line or designs into your sides.

The bald temp fade comes with sharp lines and an angular structure that make it the perfect choice for fashion-forward men who want a cut with dimension and contrast. This style is bold and dramatic, creating a graduated effect that looks exceptionally daring when maintained with regular visits to the barber.

Nom: Curly Hair Mohawk with Temp Fade
Description: Curly mohawks aren’t easy to pull off but they can be a unique way to showcase your wild side with shaved sides and impressive volume. Simply ask your barber to create a high temp fade using clippers for a punk-rock look that’s bound to turn heads.

Nom: Long Hair Twists with Temp Fade
Description: Long twists are a popular hairstyle for Afro-textured hair that allows you to create low-maintenance contrast that looks edgy and stylish. The temp fade will draw attention to the breathtaking volume on top while adding irresistible texture to your style.

Nom: Textured Spiky Hair with High Temple Fade
Description: Textured spiky hair is designed to be eye-catching, but you can channel your inner daredevil with short sides that instantly pull the look together. You can dye the tips of your hair for a youthful finish, but all-over color and a sharp drop fade are enough to add visual interest to your cut.

Whether you want to highlight your natural waves or keep your locks short, the low temp fade is guaranteed to make you look fresh and dapper. Start your fade from just above the ear and keep the contrast light for a wearable style that’s perfect for the office.

For breathtaking contrast and maximum drama, the high temp fade is an ideal choice. It pairs beautifully with a natural afro for a sleek and masculine feel that retains fashionable volume. However, you can also rock the sharp angles and daring lines of this style with a buzz cut to slim your face or draw attention to strong cheekbones.

Nom: Waves with Mid Temp Fade and Beard
Description: Nothing screams confidence like a perfectly groomed beard and timeless waves. Keeping your line up precise lends this look instant sex appeal while the softness of the waves on top keeps things polished, approachable and suave. Throw in a sharp shaved line for a finish that shows you mean business.

Dreads are far more casual than other fade hairstyles, offering guys a modern look that feels cool and casual. Keep your hairline well-groomed for contrast and opt for a high temp fade if you want a hint of drama. For an undeniably manly hairstyle, rock a Viking beard or a hint of facial hair on your chin.

Nom: Blonde Curly Blowout with Skin Temp Fade
Description: A blonde curly blowout boosts your cut with an injection of color for a modern look with tons of contrast. Contrast the voluminous hair on top with a dapper line up and skin fade which edges around from the sides to the back of the head for a sharp finish.

Nom: Man Bun with Temp Fade and Thick Beard
Description: Guys with shoulder-length locks can throw their hair into an iconic man bun for a fashionable and practical look with an old-school feel. To achieve effortless contrast between the bun and your fade, shave a hard line into the hair and rock a medium-stubble beard to outline your sexy jawline.

Nom: Short Sponge Hair with Low Temp Fade and Beard
Description: Sponge hair is created using a twist or loc sponge to form everything from relaxed curls to tight coils. To achieve a cohesive and trendy appearance, rub the sponge against your hair in one direction to create curls. You can pull things together with a gradual low fade and a dapper beard for a polished result.

Nom: Long Messy Fringe with Temp Fade
Description: A long messy fringe gives any temp fade a boyish and relaxed look that’s perfect for surf dudes and younger guys. Depending on the length of your hair, you can choose a dramatic sweep or lightly style your hair to the front for a more uniform look. Pair it with a high temp fade for maximum drama or gently add contrast with a subtle low fade.

If you want your cut to stand out, the modern mullet is an excellent option. A low temp fade gives you an easygoing feel that has just enough stylish contrast to lift your look, while high temp fades paired with a rugged beard are effortlessly masculine. For a relaxed feel, keep plenty of length on the top and sides to create the illusion of height.

Nom: Short Brush Up with Temp Fade
Description: Take advantage of natural volume with a trendy brush-up and a textured temp fade. There are several ways to wear this style, but gently spiking the hair upward will create a sophisticated look that ladies love. If you prefer an undone look, pair it with a strong beard.

Nom: Short Textured Crop with High Temp Fade
Description: A textured crop allows you to embrace your youthful and boyish charm with a modern style that’s runway ready. To create a daring contrast between the textured top and the rest of the scalp, choose a high temp fade that blends seamlessly toward the back. For more edge, throw an undercut into the mix.

The pompadour fade is a fashionable and dapper style that will take your style into James Bond territory. Whether you prefer your drinks shaken or stirred, maintain a polished and contrasting fade with strong hold gel and regular trips to the barber.

Nom: High Bald Fade with Big Afro
Description: If you have natural hair with unbeatable volume, consider creating a unique look with a high bald fade. By transitioning from a full head of head to virtual baldness, you’re bound to have all eyes on you in an instant. For something more subtle, gently taper the sides and add a lineup for a sleek finish.

Nom: Buzz Cut with Temp Fade and Line Up
Description: Men on the hunt for a practical and minimalist hairstyle are bound to appreciate the classic buzz cut. Use clippers to trim the hair down before carefully edging along the hairline to create an exceptional lineup. The extent of the temp fade is up to you, but a low fade creates interesting contrast while remaining ultra-wearable.

Nom: Short Curly Top with Bald Temp Fade
Description: Show some love for your natural texture with a bald temp fade. You can easily make this cut look extreme by keeping plenty of length on top and creating a large gap between your hairline and facial hair. For a sophisticated finish with a modern edge, try a shape up and a uniform beard that lines up with the middle of your earlobe.

Nom: Loose Brushed Back Hair with Temp Fade and Design
Description: When you want to rock the “just rolled out of bed” look, a simple brush-back can be a stylish choice for guys. You’ll need a decent amount of length to make this style a reality, but you can add flair to your locks with deliberate spikes, shaved designs and a connected beard.

Nom: Thick Wavy Cropped Top with Temp Fade and Shape Up
Description: Thick and wavy cropped hair is a playful and handsome style that never fails to impress. A temp fade adds effortless contrast to natural waves while the shape up keeps the style slick and clean-cut. Don’t be afraid to ask your barber for an extreme fade if you have angular features or a daring personality.

Nom: Thick Blowout with Tapered Temp Fade
Description: A thick blowout is a fashionable look for guys with textured hair, and you can easily jazz things up with expert tapering. The front of your hair should be voluminous with irresistible lift while the toned-down fade into the back and sides should offer low-key but wearable contrast. Top things off with a groomed beard and stylish mustache for a look worthy of any red carpet.

Nom: Short Afro with Sponge Twist and Temp Fade
Description: The short afro with sponge twists is a laid-back and cool option for guys who want an eye-catching style that highlights their natural hair. You’ll want to add a hint of texture to your afro with a subtle temp fade and an elegant shape-up for a badass finish that draws attention to the top of the hair.

Nom: Thick Short Hair with Low Temp Fade
Description: Thick short hair can easily be styled with a timeless temp fade for a sophisticated and elegant style that requires little effort to maintain. The fade enhances the short length on top while the fade creates gentle contrast for a clean-cut style that is equally attractive at the office and the club.

This modern and voluminous hairstyle is a sexy option for men who want to showcase thick and coarse hair in all its glory. Maintain your afro’s rounded shape and add subtle texture with a low fade or go all-out with a high or bald fade.

Nom: Short Hair with Skin Temp Fade
Description: For a look that’s sleek, suave and easy to maintain, you can’t go wrong with a short style paired with a skin temp fade. It creates refreshing contrast between the top and the sides that looks breathtaking. If you want a contemporary edge, blend the fade into your beard line for a manly feel that oozes sex appeal.

Nom: Hard Part Comb Over with Low Temp Fade
Description: A comb over can hide a multitude of sins for guys with thinning hair, but adding a hard part creates an edgy and daring appearance that you’re bound to appreciate. Keep your hair in place with a matte pomade and brush the hair to one side for a sleek and timeless finish. For more contrast, don’t be afraid to experiment with a dazzling undercut.

Nom: Long Dreads with High Temp Fade
Description: Long dreads allow you to work with exciting length and texture to create a striking look. Wear your hair loose for a casual bohemian feel or pile it on top of your head in a man bun for a sophisticated appearance that will take any suit to the next level. Complete the look with a stylish beard and a line up to accentuate your facial features.

If you’re facing a daily battle with unruly thick hair, embracing your natural curls and adding contrast with a temp fade can look incredible. A barely-there fade works best to highlight the hair on top, but you can create dimension with sharp lines, shaved designs or subtle stubble.

Nom: Brushed Up Fringe with Mid Temple Fade
Description: A brushed up fringe paired with a mid-temple fade is a youthful and charming style that’s ideal for guys with thicker locks. Depending on your taste, you can spike it up for a boyish feel, comb it to one side to create a masculine pompadour or leave it natural for a rugged bedhead vibe.

Nom: Thick Waves with Bald Temp Fade and Beard
Description: Thick waves give you endless styling opportunities thanks to their natural texture and volume. You can lean edgy with a razor-sharp line up and short hair on top or retain a bit of length for a relaxed feel. Perfect on guys with dark locks, this daring and sexy style is one for the books.

Nom: Buzz Cut with Shaved Hair Design
Description: A buzz cut with a trendy shaved design strikes the perfect balance between military dapperness and new-age fashion. Shorter cuts are popular with low-maintenance guys, but you can keep things slightly longer to create intense contrast with crisp design lines.

Nom: Nappy Afro Temple Fade and Beard
Description: Try this suave style if you’re blessed with immense natural volume and are trying to create a seamless graduation between your top and sides. It’s best to choose a low temp fade for a cohesive look, but you can add a rugged and manly charm to your appearance with an attractive beard and a shape up.

Nom: Classy Temp Fade Afro with Thin Beard
Description: Make your hair the star of the show by pairing a voluminous afro with a thin beard. You’ll want to keep the hair on top relatively uniform and choose a low temp fade that transitions effortlessly into your beard for a stylish and cohesive finish.

Nom: Slick Back Style with Low Temp Taper
Description: Slicked-back hair is an ideal choice for guys who want to embrace retro styles that make them appear cool and confident. To maintain a flattering and boyish look without glaring contrast, try a low temp taper with your hair gently pushed back with a medium-hold product. For a more severe look, use a comb to pull the hair directly backward.
The high top temp fade is a classic haircut for black men who want a cool ’80s look. The high top will require you to grow out your hair to feature volume and height, allowing the style to stand out.

Nom: Short Curly Hair with Low Temp Taper Fade
Low Temp Fade with Faux Hawk and Part
Low Temple Fade with Buzz Cut
Temp Fade with Waves and Beard
Low Drop Fade with Edge Up

Description: The high top taper fade is a classic haircut style for black men who want shape and dimension to achieve a stylish look. This modern and refreshing cut should be styled with volume on top and an edgy flat top for impressive contrast against the almost bare sides.

If you a naturally curly hair, a high top fade can be an eye-catching way to add contrast and depth to your hairstyle. Keep the sides and back heavily faded and add a sleek line up to highlight your masculine features. For more shape, throw in a well-groomed beard.

For a flattering cut that pairs well with a coarse afro, try a low high top fade. This iconic style uses dimension and fading to create timeless contrast but remains sharp enough for professional settings.
Tame your natural texture by rocking a short high top fade. This style works best with an extreme fade and a modern line up for a sleek and fashionable finish that instantly draws the eye upwards.

While a classic high top fade can be tricky to maintain without regular barber visits, it’s a youthful style that will turn any guy into a heartthrob. You can keep your fade light for a wearable look, but a sexy shaved line with a high fade is bound to turn heads.

Guys with slightly longer curls can create breathtaking contrast with a daring fade across the back and sides. To avoid a one-dimensional style, ask your barker for a sharp line up and slightly graduated length as you move toward the back of the head.

Nom: Round High Top with Taper Fade and Beard
Description: The round high top is a fashionable style on its own, but you can dial things up with lines and angles by incorporating a strong taper fade and beard. Make sure to keep your hair longer on top and embrace your creative side with a rugged beard and edgy shaved designs.

Nom: Sponged High Top Fade and Goatee
Description: A sponged high top allows guys to create a relaxed and trendy style using a loc sponge. For a dramatic finish, twist the curls upwards into a bold high top. To showcase your masculine side, pull this look together with a subtle low fade and a sexy line up.

Men with strong features and an enviable bone structure can fashion their locks into a high top with braids. This creates incredible volume on top and gives you the freedom to experiment with a high fade and light stubble for a manly appearance that speaks to your cultural roots.

If you want to channel your inner 90s kid, experiment with short twists, blonde tips and a pronounced fade. This style gives you the perfect mixture of sharp lines and natural texture. Throw in a sexy beard and a slim mustache for a refined finish.

You can try out this refreshing style if you want to take advantage of natural volume and killer cheekbones. Nappy curls give you immense lift at the crown and on top, while the delicate low fade offers dimension and contrast. For a hint of boyish charm, add rugged facial hair to the mix.

Nom: High Flat Top with Skin Fade and Beard
Description: For a more edgy high top cut for guys, take the plunge with a skin fade and beard. A high fade will give you exceptional contrast between the flat top and a long beard. But don’t be afraid to play around with shaved designs to express your unique style and fiery personality.

Nom: Low Flat Top with Skin Fade
Description: A low flat top and a blended skin fade can help keep your style sleek and stylish. The effortless taper between the lengths of the top and sides will give you a suave appearance that pairs wonderfully with medium-length stubble and a daring line up.

A high top taper with twists is an excellent option for men who want to rock their afro-textured hair in a low-maintenance way without sacrificing style. Keep the tapering light for a professional and refined feel or go all-out with a high fade for ravishing contrast.

Nom: Long Afro High Top with Mid Bald Fade
Description: To draw attention to any volume on top, consider pairing a long afro with a dapper line up and an edgy mid bald fade. The striking transition between voluminous locks and a complete shave looks effortlessly eye-catching and modern. Just remember to keep up with regular barber visits to maintain a sleek and meticulously shaped finish.

Nom: High Top Dreads with Undercut and Shaved Part
Description: Adventurous guys who aren’t afraid to rock dreads should pair this natural style with an undercut and shaved part. A sharp, shaved line will create a striking separation between your high top and dreads. For a style that looks instantly put together, incorporate a blended beard for a handsome touch.

Nom: High Top with Low Drop Fade and Twists
Description: If you have an impressive afro but want to add dimension and shape to your style, try a low drop fade and stylish twists. A line up and a sleek shaved design can instantly lift this look, but it’s the fashionable drop fade that will have all eyes on you.

The high top fade with a part adds another dimension to an already trendy hairstyle. When you have a longer high top, combining a fade on the sides and a part in the hair just brings more attention to the different elements of the cut.

Nom: Thick High Top with Fade and Design
Description: When you want to channel your inner daredevil, a thick high top with a daring fade and edgy shaved designs is perfect. You’ll need length on the top and medium volume at the back to create contrast for your shaved lines. Feel free to etch tribal patterns, angular shapes and words of wisdom into your hair.

Sporting a high top with curly bedhead hair is a playful and youthful look that never fails to impress. The fade adds contrast to the flowing waves on top while the sleek line up gives the cut structure and angularity. Don’t be afraid to rock a daring high or bald fade if you’re a risk-taker.

Nom: Short Dreaded Twist with High Skin Fade
Description: A short dreaded twist is an excellent way to tame natural hair into submission without losing volume or lift. You’ll need a decent amount of hair wax and patience to achieve this sexy style, but the contrast between the fade, line up and youthful spikes on top is worth waiting for.

An afro high top fade is a fashionable and irresistible style that you can easily jazz up with color and contrast. Purple and blue dyes pop beautifully against deep black roots, but you can easily create dimension with a charming line up, low fade and angular beard for the ultimate bad boy feel.

This modern and refreshing hairstyle is a sexy option for men who want to highlight their natural volume without losing any edge. The addition of a high or bald fade creates a contemporary and modern feel that pairs equally well with a clean shave or a Viking beard.

For a pop of color and tons of contrast, a highlighted high top with chic dreads is the way to go. For an effortlessly undone look, rock a low fade with dreads draped over the forehead. Complete the look with a bohemian goatee or a stylish beard to complement your facial features.

Pairing your high top fade with a volumizing blowout creates an incredibly bouncy and modern style that always looks attractive. To create more dimension, ask your barber for a lineup and a gentle fade between your temples and beard for a rugged look that leans retro.

Nom: Short High Top Fade with Shape Up
Description: A short high top fade incorporates sharp angles and a sleek shape up for a practical but trendy style that is ideal for fashion-forward guys. You can keep things subtle with a charming low fade or create dimension and interest with a bald or high fade.

A sponged high top fade is a fresh and modern style that you can dial up with a shaved part and an extreme fade for the ultimate wow factor. This dapper style is naturally flattering and the shaved design through the beard or around the temple are ideal for guys who love to stand out.

Nom: High Top Skin Fade with Curly Hair
Description: Curly hair isn’t always easy to manage, but its natural volume and texture can look sensational with a groomed high top. Contrast the bouncy volume on top with a smooth skin fade that sweeps around the back of the head for a dapper appearance that looks undeniably slick.

A high top mohawk is an edgy style that helps you channel your inner punk rocker with bold shaved sides and unreal volume on top. Ask your barber to add a well-groomed beard to your look for shaping around the face that will highlight your jawline and cheekbones.

Nom: High Top Fade with Side Part
Description: For an intimidating style that puts your high top center stage, incorporate a fade with a strong side part into your look. Slightly choppier coils lend this look a rugged feel, while a flat top gives the cut a polished appearance. Shave a hard side part and a line up into the hair for a dramatic finish.

Nom: Kinky High Top Low Fade with Line Up
Description: This stylish haircut showcases the natural volume and texture found in afro hair. Rocking this cut with a subtle low fade and a line up creates a sharply defined style with attractive angles. To contrast your playful kinky coils, pair this cut with a dapper beard that seamlessly blends into your fade.

Nom: Medium High Top with Temp Fade
Description: A medium high top allows you to work with exciting volume and texture without the maintenance that comes with longer styles. For a trendy and professional feel, choose a low temp fade that blends into the back. If you want to make a statement, a bald or high fade will instantly attract attention.

Nom: 80s High Top with Shaved Sides and Parts
Description: For a real blast from the past, pair a voluminous high top with completely shaved sides and a hard part that extends to the back of the head. For a true 80s appearance, fluff up your afro with a comb to create extra roundness at the top.

A high volume flat top is a sophisticated and elegant choice that is ideal for guys wanting to minimize styling time. Just remember to add a high temp fade and keep up with regular trips to the barber to maintain your slick style.

Nom: Textured Curls with High Top Taper
Description: A high top taper with textured curls is a youthful style that’s perfect for young guys seeking a laid-back look. You can lightly style looser coils with styling products if you’re struggling with frizz.

Nom: Classic Tall High Top Taper Fade
Description: A tall high top makes a strong statement on natural hair that always looks handsome with a striking taper fade. A low taper is a versatile option for working men, but you can add flair to your style with a high fade or shaved design.

Nom: Short High Top Dreads with Fade
Description: If you’re in the early stages of growing dreads, keeping your cut short and adding an eye-catching fade is a stylish choice. Keep things simple with light dimension or go all-out with an edgy shape up and shaved lines.

A short rounded top is a simple and clean-cut style that makes textured hair easier to manage. Elevate your look with refined tapering around the sides or keep the length longer for a youthful and old-school feel that offers subtle contrast.

A thick blonde afro is a cool and contemporary option for guys who want a fresh and eye-catching style. This look works best with lots of volume on the top as it creates dazzling contrast when paired with a high fade and connected beard.

Guys with straighter locks can use pomades and wax to form their hair into a striking flat top style. For an edgier feel with glorious dimension, ask your barber for a drop fade that adds depth near the crown and contrast around the temples.

Nom: Thick Sponged High Top and Beard
Description: If you’re blessed with natural volume and texture, use a loc sponge to mold your hair into tight coils. When paired with a line up, blended beard and a high fade, this style will boost your masculinity.

Nom: Cool High Top Low Bald Fade with Hair Design
Description: A stylish high top with a low bald fade and designs on the sides can take your style to the next level with a modern and edgy look. For a cool and confident cut with sharp contrast, connect a deep hard part with an eyebrow shave to show you’re not to be messed with.

A short high top fade with braids is a playful and classic cut for black guys who want to experiment with protective styles. The shorter braids are easy to manage and can be pulled into buns and left loose around the front for a refreshing bohemian feel.

Men with shorter dreads can use a high top to draw attention to their natural texture without committing to long locks. A high fade is an excellent option for creating contrast, but you can stick with a shape up and a handsome low fade if you’d prefer a timeless heartthrob look.

The twisted high top fade is a flattering cut from the 80s that is back with a bang. You can style your twists directly upward and in one direction for a cohesive and neat appearance, or pull strands out for an edgy and rugged feel.

Pairing a high top taper with a unique shaved design is the easiest way to inject your haircut with personality. A large and thick swirl design that curves around to the back of the skull is an attractive option. But don’t be afraid to play around with jagged lines or symbols for a more daring design.

Nom: Very Short High Top with Mid Skin Fade
Description: A very short high top with a mid-skin fade strikes the perfect balance between practicality and edginess. You can easily maintain your style with regular trips to the barber and bring out your wild side with intricate shaved designs or colored dyes.

The crew cut is a simple short hairstyle that offers a timeless and classy look. This classic men’s haircut features short hair on top with an even shorter cut on the sides and back. Most guys will ask their barber for a fade or undercut to complement the longer top. The crew cut hairstyle can be styled textured, messy, spiky, or swept to the side. To style the crew cut, you’ll want to use a good men’s hair product like a matte pomade, wax or clay. Guys with thin or thinning hair should use clay for a textured finish that will make their hair look thicker.

The comb over is a modern men’s hairstyle that exudes class and style. With short sides and longer hair on top, the comb over haircut is typically cut with a fade or undercut. You can choose from many different types of fades, including the low, mid, high, skin and drop fade. The short comb over works well with all hair types, creating a business professional hairstyle for guys who want an elegant and versatile look. For an edgy touch, you can always ask your barber to shave a hard part for a more defined style.

The fade is a short haircut to get on the sides and back, giving guys a low-maintenance and modern cut that looks sleek. The fade haircut will taper the sides and blend the hair shorter for a seamless finish. This haircutting technique can be paired with many different hairstyles to create contrast with the longer hair on top. The low taper fade is ideal for business professional styles, while the high fade provides an edgy and sexy cut. The mid fade can be the perfect option between high and low, tapering the hair for a balanced look.

The quiff has become one of the most popular hairstyles for men, offering a stylish and classy look that works great with short hair. The quiff haircut is often paired with an undercut or fade that shows off the texture and styling of the longer hair on top. When styling, use a strong pomade or wax to maximize volume and create a casual look. If you’re looking for a fashionable style, the quiff continues to be a cool barbershop trend.

The buzz cut is a very short haircut that looks great with thick hair for a rugged style. This military-inspired hairstyle comes with short hair all over the head, making it a low-maintenance cut for guys who want an effortless and simple look. For a modern variation, you can ask your barber for a fade haircut on the sides and back. The buzz cut fade can be paired with a line up to clean the hairline and accentuate the sharp masculine haircut. Whether you want to cut your own hair at home with professional clippers or just need a classic cut to get at the barbershop, this style is worth experimenting with.

The French crop is a charming men’s style that features short hair on the sides and a longer fringe. This crop top haircut is cut with a fade to accentuate the shorter hairstyle on top. Similar to the Caesar cut, the crop top fade is often styled by applying a matte pomade and then brushing the hair forward. The bangs in the front can be choppy or blunt, but the look is undeniably chic and natural. Well-suited for guys with thick, straight and wavy hair, this cropped style can be a way to transform your style.
