Description:
If you want the latest popular hairstyles, the hottest men’s haircuts are moving in an experimental direction this year. And because short sides, long top haircuts continue to be barbershop favorites, the different types of fade haircuts and undercut hairstyles will remain some of the year’s most fashionable looks. As for cutting and styling your hair on top, medium-length and long hairstyles offer versatility.
Cool hairstyles like the quiff, hard part comb over, textured brush back, faux hawk, long fringe, and spiky hair are awesome styles to try. While short haircuts will always be good, clean, easy hairstyles to get, the current trend is definitely longer hair.
For guys with short hair who want more traditional, classic haircuts, the crew cut, French crop, buzz cut, side swept Ivy League, and gentleman’s side part are timeless styles. Professionals can rest assured that these cuts will never go out of style. These popular short men’s haircuts are still perfect for an easy transition between work and social life.
To add a cool edge to cropped cuts and short hairstyles, use a matte hair product for a natural, textured finish. This will allow you to style your hair naturally yet pull off a sleek look.
Let’s take a look at the best hairstyles for men. Somewhere on this list is a new haircut and modern men’s hairstyle you’ll love!

The quiff haircut has been a very cool men’s haircut for years now. The modern quiff offers a balance between retro charm and contemporary styles. With a short fade or undercut on the sides and a messy textured quiff hairstyle on top, guys will have a very fashionable look.
To get the quiff, your barber will need to leave the hair at the front of your head longer, getting progressively shorter towards the back. Try a high skin fade on the sides for an edgy look that emphasizes the flowing finish. Others like to combine this hairstyle with an undercut or taper to keep it neat and classy.
As one of the best haircuts for men with thick short to medium-length hair, guys can’t go wrong with a quiff. Just remember that styling the quiff will require good hair products and time. To style a quiff, you’ll need a good pomade, wax or cream to maximize hold, volume and texture.
The beauty of the quiff hairstyle is you can leave it messy, textured, spiky, brushed back or any combination.

The comb over hairstyle is another excellent example of a trendy haircut any guy can wear. The comb over is well-known for its refined simplicity. Whether you have short, medium or long hair on top, combing your hair to one side can look good on any guy.
The modern version of this classic style is the comb over fade. With faded sides that accentuate the styling on top, guys can add a hard part and loosely brush over their hair for a unique look. Use a matte styling product with moderate to low hold for a casual, flowing finish.
If you’re looking for a good gentleman’s hairstyle that screams smart yet fun, the comb over could be the perfect cut and style for you.

The modern slicked back haircut is simple yet cool. As one of the best men’s hairstyles, there are many ways to slick back hair. From the slicked back undercut to the slick back fade and textured brush back, guys have plenty of options for the look.
Start with a short sides, long top haircut and run product through your hair. We recommend a matte pomade for a natural look and flow. Then use a comb to pull everything back.
Slicked back hairstyles work with all hair types. With longer, curly hair, slick back hair will have more texture and bounce. On the other hand, guys with straight thick hair can brush it back into a sleek, sexy style.

The undercut has become a great short hairstyle for guys to get, providing a stylish and low-maintenance style that works with many popular cuts. As a cool hair trend, the undercut is versatile enough to work with all types of haircut styles, including the quiff, comb over, slick back, faux hawk, and fringe.
Stylish and badass, the essence of the undercut is short sides that are all one length. Variations on just how short those sides are and how high the cut starts are numerous. However, guys do have a choice between the disconnected undercut and undercut fade.
Both are edgy and require no styling, but do need regular cuts to maintain. On the flip side, guys can always get a shaved sides hairstyle.
The undercut hairstyle for men looks great with short and long hair on top. Undercuts also pair very nicely with full beard styles for a manly look.

The fade haircut is the basis for the best hairstyles for guys. And with so many different types of fades to choose from, there’s a fade cut for every look.
For instance, the low fade haircut is a great understated yet dapper style. The low fade is clean, elegant and easy to get.
The high fade haircut offers a quick taper from long to short, resulting in a striking contrast that is stylish and masculine. The high fade leaves very little hair on the sides and back, focusing the attention the styling on top.
The mid fade haircut starts below the temples and just above the ear for a more subtle trim. The medium fade is ideal for gentleman who want to avoid exposing too much scalp but want short sides for simple styling.
Lastly, guys need to decide just how short the fading will go. Ask your barber for a bald fade haircut if you want to blend your hair into the skin, while a taper fade will end with a very short haircut.

Like a fade, the taper involves shortening the hair gradually down the side of the head. However, the taper haircut stops before the hair gets super short and does not blend into the skin. Depending on your preferences, a tapered hairstyle can be achieved with longer hair on the sides if the barber uses scissors instead of clippers.
For a regular haircut that looks much like a classic gentleman’s hairstyle, a taper could be a good option to consider. Leaving more length by choosing a taper haircut will create a more relaxed, traditional look.

The pompadour is another timeless iconic cut. Like the quiff, the pompadour hairstyle comes with a number of variations. You can get a short or long pomp with a shaved hard part and paired with an undercut or fade on the sides.
To style a pompadour, you’ll need to create a separate and distinct “pomp” in the front. Most of the volume is concentrated in this one section. Use a good styling product to style your hair up and back.

Spiky hairstyles have been bold and fashionable for decades. Plus, spiky hair looks good on all guys, and a spiked up hairstyle can be an easy way to change your look throughout the week. From short spiky hair to long textured spikes in the front, there are several different ways to wear spiky hair.
To spike your hair, you’ll need a strong hair product such as pomade, wax or clay. Simply use your pomade and twist sections of hair upwards.

The cool faux hawk haircut is a hairstyle with spiky hair that is less intense than the mohawk. As a good look for little boys, college guys, and young men, the faux hawk styles spiked hair towards the middle of the head.
Unlike the shaved sides of a mohawk, the hot fohawk fade hairstyle comes with short tapered sides. The result is a cool style that is flattering and easy to wear. It’s especially trendy when styled with textured, messy hair on top.

For a tried and true cut that is understated and professional, look no further than the Ivy League. Also known as the Harvard and Princeton cut, the Ivy League haircut is trimmed much the same way as a crew cut.
In this iconic short hairstyle, the hair on the sides are cropped short with a fade or taper, and must be cut shorter than the hair on top. The signature look of the Ivy League is the side swept hair in the front. The end result is a classy, smart styling reminiscent of the side part.

The crop top haircut for men is simple yet stylish and certainly trending strong in barbershops all across Europe. The short hair on top of the head is low maintenance, as are the even shorter sides. The textured French crop features an element of high fashion in the front – a short cropped fringe.
The cropped top is not your everyday military crew cut. Styled with all the hair pulled forward, the French crop looks perfect textured and messy. As one of the best short haircuts for guys, we recommend you try the crop top.

The crew cut is often summed up as a short back and sides haircut. Whether you want a crew cut fade or high and tight, the crew cut hairstyle suits almost every face shape, doesn’t require frequent trips to the barber, and is appropriate for all occasions.
Although the crew cut is a classic style worn by many men, everyone wears it differently. For a clean-cut, masculine short haircut that’s easy to style, ask your barber for a crew cut.

The fringe hairstyle has become a hit these days as men’s bangs are cool once again. Men like the fringe because of its carefree, effortless styling.
Whether you want to get a short fringe or the longer angular fringe, the look styles well tousled and natural using a matte styling cream and blow dryer.

Men with wavy hair are often trying to find a hairstyle that showcases their hair’s natural texture without making it unruly or uncontrollable. The best men’s wavy hairstyles include the quiff, faux hawk, comb over, fringe and slick back.
Wavy hair styles and cuts can be short or long, depending on your preferred look. Short wavy hair can be easy to tame and style, but long waves can really take advantage of your natural texture. Applying a strong pomade or cream to control your locks for sleek styling.

Curly hair is notoriously difficult to control, but the best hairstyles for men with curly hair leverage this unique texture. Rather than resisting your natural curls, styles like the curly hair fade, fringe, quiff, comb over and crew cut can incorporate your hair type.
Similarly, guys should use curly hair products to enhance and tighten their curls. Curly hairstyles are in fashion, so let your hair do its thing and showcase it to the world.

Women love hot guys with long hair. While some men may be hesitant to grow out their hair, cool long hairstyles can still be super masculine and sexy. With medium-length to longer hair, guys have more styling options and the ability to change up their look frequently.
Popular long haircuts may mean additional care and maintenance, but that doesn’t have to be the case. Using a good shampoo and conditioner will moisturize and soften your hair, allowing you to wear long hair naturally. From long and straight to the man bun, ponytail, braids, and top knot, longer men’s hairstyles are modern and trendy.

Textured haircuts are some of the most modern fashionable styles. Fresh and nice, guys can add texture to short, medium and long hair. Textured hairstyles are easy to achieve, but they do require a few basic styling tools. The minimum requirements are a matte pomade and comb.
Whether you’re styling short or long textured hair, run a small amount of product through your hair and work it in thoroughly. If you need to use a comb to style your look, do so gently but smooth over neat portions of hair with your fingers for a natural finish.

A temp fade with waves results in a clean, fresh look. This temple fade haircut starts high and is highlighted by a line up along the hairline. The short buzz cut on top is starting to show waves. To complete the style, grow a full beard for a masculine finish. Sexy and modern, this temp fade and 360 wave combination will look good on any black man.

This drop fade with waves offers a nice, tight cut. Short on the sides, the low drop skin fade curves around the ear and down the neckline for a sleek trim. The 360 waves will start to get deeper and more defined as you continue to brush. The shape up around the temples and hairline cleans up stray hairs, and women will love the long beard.

This low fade with waves is the perfect example of how a low haircut can accentuate the pattern created by your deep 360 waves. A low taper fade is great for professional black men. The line up curves along the hairline and down the sides for a clean-cut look. If you’re not into exposing too much scalp, get a low cut with your waves.
Getting a mid fade with waves can be the perfect balance for some guys. With a mid skin fade on the sides and back and waves that spiral all around, this badass haircut is both classy and handsome.

A high fade with waves looks edgy and stylish. The high bald fade starts near the top of the head and quickly tapers down to the skin for a cool cut. For a little less skin, consider a high taper fade haircut that simply gets shorter but leaves very little hair at the bottom. As one of the most popular waves haircuts, everything about this hairstyle is perfect.

Modern and bold, a bald fade with waves is great if you want a very short haircut. Also known as a skin fade, the bald fade haircut can start high, low or in the middle and will gradually taper down to shaved sides. With short black hair, this 180 waves fade would look chic with a part or design.

A taper fade with waves is a fashionable black men’s hairstyle. This taper fade haircut comes with an edge up and 360 waves for a fresh style. Whether you’re Black, White or Hispanic, this is the ideal wave pattern to create.

Deep 360 waves take time, dedication and regular brushing. Pictured is a low taper fade haircut with waves and an edge up. Paired with a thick beard, this cut is sexy and hot. Our guide can show you how to get waves this good.

A fade haircut with 360 waves and a part combine to create a very stylish look. The deep waves offer texture on top, and the low taper fade on the sides focuses the eyes to the styling above. The shaved part adds a cool touch and fits well with the wave pattern.

If you want to get creative, there are limitless 360 waves haircut designs to try. Pictured is an awesome heart design shaved into deep 360 waves. However, black men have endless hair design ideas, ranging from shaved lines to zig zags to whatever you want.

A waves haircut with a beard can be a great pairing. Manly and badass, black men with full beards just look good. Naturally, you’ll want to keep your facial hair clean, groomed and neat. We recommend you get a quality beard shampoo and conditioner as well as beard balm or oil. Get waves and a beard for a flattering style women will notice.
The half moon haircut is a curved part that’s shaved into the top of your hair. Get your wave fade, develop your wave pattern, and then add a half moon part for a new look.
Waves works for black men and boys of all ages. With a low taper fade, line up, and part, this kid’s 360 waves look badass.

Not all black guys want 360 waves. If you prefer very short hair on the sides and back, then you’ll likely ask your barber for a high bald fade haircut. 180 waves style just as nicely and are actually easier to get and simpler to keep. Talk to your barber about the best way to get a 180 waves fade for your hair.

Perfectly trimmed all over, here’s an excellent example of a clean hairline and shape up, thick shaved part in the wave pattern, and a well-groomed beard design.
There are all types of hair waves, so if you’re curious about trying a waves haircut, just pick a cut and show your barber.

The low fade slick back is perfect for business professionals who don’t want to expose too much scalp. The low fade haircut on the sides starts the blending process right above the ears and curves around near the neckline.
For a timeless, clean-cut men’s hairstyle you can wear anywhere, try slicking back your hair with a low fade.

The high fade slick back offers a more modern and badass twist to your hair. As a very short haircut on the sides, the high fade is slick and hot. With the emphasis on the thicker, longer hair on top, this kind of slick back hairstyle works well for guys of all hair types, especially men with receding hairlines or a widow’s peak.
Simply ask your barber for a high taper fade or high skin fade on the sides and leave at least 3 inches of hair on top. If you prefer more length, you can always grow your hair out longer. Afterwards, you have the option of styling a textured brush back with volume and height or slicking back your hair with a strong pomade.

The slick back taper is a great haircut if you don’t want your barber to buzz down to the skin. The difference between a taper and a fade is that the taper isn’t as short, leaving hair at the end of the gradient. On the other hand, the fade trims all the way down to the skin on the back and sides.
In the end, the slick back taper resembles more of the traditional look. We’d recommend the classic slick back for older men who want a handsome, mature style for their age.

The skin fade slick back is one of the most fresh and modern slick hairstyles you can get, bringing an additional dimension to the cut. The bald fade is edgy and fashionable, allowing your barber to taper down to the skin on the back and sides. This effortless blend provides a sexy contrast and truly focuses the eyes on the brushed back hair on top. Combining a skin fade with a slick back hairstyle is one way to make sure you stand out in a crowd.

Nom: Mid Fade + Textured Slick Back Hair + Part
Hipster Slicked Back Undercut + Full Beard + Mustache
Undercut + Shape Up + Long Slick Hair
Short Slick Back Hair + High Skin Fade
High Bald Fade + Short Slick Back Hair + Beard
Medium Length Slick Back Hair + Taper Fade
Thick, Textured Long Slick Back Hair + Beard
Traditional Combed Back Hair + Shaved Sides
Long Wavy Slick Back Fade + Line Up + Full Beard
Undercut Fade + Thick Slick Back Pomp
Thin Slicked Back Undercut Hair + Long Beard

Description: This faux hawk fade starts with very short sides and finishes with long, messy spikes on top. The natural, textured look offers good volume and flow, and should be styled with a matte product like pomade or wax.
This undercut faux hawk is paired with thick hair and a full beard. As one of the best hairstyles for men with thick hair, the fohawk can be styled in many ways.
This low fade faux hawk features a thick shaved line on the sides and a thick beard. The short to medium spikes are rebellious and hot, emphasizing the styling on top.

This high fade faux hawk is styled with short hair. With a bald fade on the sides that blends directly into the skin for an edgy look, this good-looking men’s faux hawk hairstyle is super fashionable and easy to get.

This messy faux hawk requires longer hair. Tousled and textured for natural flow and movement, the low fade on the sides emphasizes the length on top. Use hair cream, wax or clay for control and low shine.

The fohawk taper is one of the most popular haircut styles for guys. This taper is buzzed around the ears and drops down to the neck for a clean cut look. The short faux hawk on top is spiked in the front with the rest of the hair styled forward, making it dapper and dashing.

Nom: Long Fohawk + High Undercut Fade + Beard
High Bald Fade + Spiky Faux Hawk
Low Taper Fade + Textured Faux Hawk + Colored Hair
Messy Faux Hawk Styles + Low Taper Fade + Beard
Wavy Hawk + Mid Shaved Sides + Full Beard
Mid Razor Fade + Textured Hawk + Line
Short Faux Hawk + Low Skin Burst Fade
Faux Hawk Style + Short Sides + Full Beard
Textured Bro Hawk + Low Bald Fade
Long Faux Hawk Hair + Mid Taper Fade
Layered Faux Hawk + Low Fade + Full Beard
Tapered Sides + Spiky Hawk + Hipster Beard
Low Fade + Shape Up + Short Spiky Fohawk
Thick Full Faux Hawk + Classic Taper
Short Fohawk + Skin Fade + Thick Beard

Description:
The fade is a timeless and stylish haircut. Black men have the option to pick a high, mid, or low taper fade haircut on the sides and back to complement their longer hair on top. To make the cut edgy and bold, ask your barber for a bald fade that blends the hair into the skin.
Pictured is one of the most popular thot boy fade haircuts. With a low skin fade on the sides and messy curly hair on top, this look is attractive and fun. For a fresh hairline and clean edges around the temples, get a line up. The long twists are easy to style with a curl-enhancing smoothie and hair twist sponge.
Like the example above, this high bald fade and short to medium-length curly thot boy hairstyle is classy and hot. The faded sides are low-maintenance and sleek, while the long curls on top look natural and nicely styled. To get this curly hairstyle for black hair, you’ll need to grow out your hair at least 3 inches long.
This style works for a number of haircuts, hair lengths, and face shapes. Simply use a leave-in conditioner and work the product into your hair with a sponge to get the desired look.

Dread styles have always been fashionable for black guys. Much like a high top fade, most dreadlock hairstyles look best with short faded sides that emphasize the styling on top. To get cool dreads, your hair will need to be tightly twisted into locks.
Here is a good example of a temp skin fade cut and shape up. With short dreads on top, women find this look irresistible.
Alternatively, you can choose to get a low taper fade on the sides and back that drops down to the neckline. With long dreads on top and a short beard, this dreads haircut is masculine and seductive.

Nom: Fade with Curly Hair on Top
Description:
While curly hair can sometimes be a pain to style and maintain, there are certainly ways to manage and tame curls. With a curly hair fade, the faded sides are cut very short to minimize styling, and the longer top is trimmed to create tight curls. A cool beard or hair design can add extra flair.
This thot boy curly fade haircut starts with a low taper fade on the sides with thick, curly hair on top. The faded sides shave the sideburns and then drop down to the neckline. The thick curls are styled messy but tight for a handsome finish. The short beard is short and well-groomed for a rugged but clean finish.
Another example is this low skin fade with a shaved part on the sides. The blending drops in the back for a smooth neck fade. On top, the curls are more defined and distinct as a result of applying a light styling product. The additional benefit is that curly hair products for men minimize frizz while offering control. The heavy beard stubble is manly and flattering.

The burst fade mohawk continues to be one of the best black men’s haircuts in barbershops around the world. With a burst taper fade on the sides and a thick mohawk on top, this trendy hairstyle is a favorite for guys with long black hair.
This mohawk fade features a high taper fade, edge up, and long curl twists. Black men can dye their hair different colors, including blonde, red, and platinum, to spice up the look. A thick long beard with short mustache can be a good complement.
Other haircut ideas include a good burst skin fade, fresh line up around the temples and hairline, and a thick nappy mohawk. The neckline is trimmed with a unique cut, and the faded sides add a badass dimensions to the overall look. The end result is thot boy hair that is modern and dope, helping you stand out in any crowd.

Thot braids require minimal upkeep yet look great all the time. Braided hair can be left loose and flowing or tied up in a ponytail when needed.
A$AP Rocky is known for his awesome box braids. Although there are plenty of ways to get and style cornrows, the rapper has sported his signature look impressively for years.
However, guys can always combine a taper fade with braids. This low fade on the sides paired with thick, braided hair on top creates a fashionable style. Letting a couple braids hang over your forehead while pulling the rest back into a ponytail can allow you to change up your look based on the occasion.

For an easy cut and simple style, short curly hair is always an option. Although a thot boy hairstyle traditionally requires long curls, twists, or dreads, short cuts offer an alternative.
Very short haircuts for black men with curly hair can save a lot of time, effort, and headache. The low drop fade highlights the short thick curls. The long goatee and well-groomed sideburns provide a nice touch. The complete look still screams player and thot boy.
Similarly, this buzz cut fade with waves is also a sexy thot boy haircut. The low skin fade and shape up are perfect, obviously cut by a skilled barber. The waves may take some time to develop, but the hairstyle is definitely worth trying if you prefer short hair.

Nom: Short Sides, Long Thot Boy Hairstyle
Description:
If the other thot boy styles are too bold and edgy for you, then you’ll love these classy haircut styles. An Afro or high top delivers the necessary thickness and length to change up your look.
Try this mid skin fade, edge up, and high top. Black men with blonde highlights and a small shaved part can create a unique finish.
Otherwise, this perfect temp fade with a shape up and two lines shaved in can give you a balanced style for formal and informal occasions. Run a sponge through your hair to produce the desired texture and finish.

Longer styles have been a popular trend this year. This thick and textured fringe on top is coupled with a low taper fade on the sides for a stylish look. And with just enough length on top to let your hair become wavy, we highly recommend this cool men’s haircut for young guys!

Nom: 2. High Fade with Fohawk and Design
Description: There are endless variations of hair designs, but this one is paired with an awesome fade haircut. What makes the fade so cool is how versatile yet low maintenance it is. Whether you pick a high, mid, low, bald, or taper on the sides, a fade works well with any modern short cut for men.

Getting the pompadour haircut is easy, and requires only a good pair of clippers and 3 to 5 inches of hair on top. For the sides, guys can get a fade or undercut. Styling your pomp will require a quality pomade or wax, allowing you to add height and style. This pompadour incorporates a clean skin faded undercut and a full beard.

Nom: 4. High Fade with Hard Part and Quiff
Description: To get the quiff, you will need at least 3 inches of hair on top of your head. The sides will then be buzzed into a taper fade – how short is up to you. Guys have the option of a high, low, mid, or skin fade. For an extreme look, a very short clipper setting will create a lot of contrast, while those wanting a classic look can choose a gentler taper.

Nom: 5. Long Messy Hair with Low Fade
Description: This fresh low bald fade and line up balance the messy, textured hairstyle up top. By working a small amount of pomade into your hair, guys can create a natural look that stays in place all day.

With enough length, any section of your hair can be braided. While braided hair is a unique style, it can add some flair. This pompadour combines high skin fade, thick razor par, and some braided hair.
The man bun’s popularity has slowly waned, but that doesn’t mean you shouldn’t get the look if you have long hair. Paired with a beard, the man bun hairstyle looks masculine and strong.

Nom: 8. High Bald Fade with Cropped Fringe
Description: As one of the newest men’s haircuts to hit the scene, this cropped fringe features a high bald fade. Styled in a natural, textured way, this hairstyle is good for guys of any hair type, including fine or thin hair.

Nom: 9. Short Sides with Medium Length Hair on Top
Description: This low skin fade is combined with a spiky side swept fringe and short textured hair in the back. Coupled with a cool beard, this look will make the girls swoon.

Nom: 10. Classic Short Hair with High Skin Fade and Crew Cut
Description: The crew cut is another short hairstyle that’s stylish yet easy to maintain. The high skin fade and line up also make this a clean look.

Nom: 11. Slicked Back Hair with Short Sides
Description: The slick back has traditionally been a retro style, but the modern version works best worn loose and textured.

Nom: 12. Modern Faux Hawk with Low Burst Fade
Description: Depending on how extreme you want your fohawk hairstyle to look, the sides should be clipped between a number 2 and 5, or simply trimmed shorter with scissors. Styling the faux hawk requires some gel or pomade in order to create the point in the middle of the head. Comb product through your hair in an upwards motion, and then press it together until it forms the style you want.

Nom: 13. Hard Part Pompadour with Mid Bald Fade
Description: A hard part or line adds something extra to any haircut. This fresh mid bald fade cut comes out perfect next to a hot pompadour on top.

Nom: 14. Low Fade with Thick Long Hair Quiff
Description: The quiff has been trending higher as of late, and it’s easy to see why. The trendy hairstyle works for every hair type, from straight to curly, and looks great when styled up and natural.

Nom: 15. Top Knot Undercut with Cool Design
Description: While the top knot is mostly a hipster or Millennial style, if you have the hair for it, you should definitely try this cut and style. With shaved sides or a design, the ponytail offers a different style.

Nom: 16. Mid Fade with Side Part and Long Fringe
Description: The side part haircut, like a comb over, is a classic look that every barber knows how to cut and style. This particular example comes with medium length hair on top, a hard part, mid fade, and full facial hair!
The mohawk fade has been getting more attention this year. While some mohawks are extreme, there are new variations that are more subtle.

Nom: 18. Tall Thick Spiky Hair on Top
Description: Spiky hair continues to be a simple yet sexy style guys can get any morning. And with classic tapered sides, this look is versatile enough to be styled many different ways.

Nom: 19. Low Skin Fade with Long Wavy Hair
20. Side Quiff with Classic Tapered Sides
22. Classic Messy Long Hair with Thick Beard
23. High Fade with Hard Part and Curly Hair
25. Slicked Back Undercut with Long Hair
28. Faux Hawk with Burst Fade and Shape Up
29. Bald Fade with Long Natural Curls on Top
30. High Fade with Braids and Long Spiked Hair

Description: If you loved these cuts and styles, then check out more short haircuts, including fades and undercuts combined with quiffs, pomps, comb overs, and medium-length hairstyles.

Textured Combed Back Hair + High Undercut
Long Slick Back Hair + Shaved Undercut

Short Sides Long Top Slicked Back
Undercut Fade + Hard Part + Messy Brushed Back Hairstyle
Long Slicked Back Hair + Long Undercut + Full Beard
Modern Combed Back Hair + Undercut + Stubble Beard
Swept Back Hair with Undercut Hairstyle

Description:
There are numerous ways to achieve sexy short textured hair, whether your classic look is a crew cut, short spikes, or even something more Ivy League. Although each of these is well-suited for shorter hair, keep in mind that you will need at least two inches of length to get the a tousled look with a natural finish.
The crew cut is longer on top and fades down into a taper or skin fade. For edgy short hair, definitely get a high bald fade or a razor fade with shaved sides. Tousling the hair on top using a matte pomade or wax can help you create this look.
Short spikes are also easy to create with a small amount of styling product. Just apply the strong-hold product and shape the spikes in any size and direction you’d like with the option of getting a faux hawk. Even Ivy League haircuts can be transformed into something textured and trendy. Apply your product and then create your side swept look for that natural finish.

Medium textured hair is the easiest to style and provides you with the most options. You can do a textured comb over, faux hawk, mohawk, quiff, or pompadour in a matter of minutes.
For styles like the pompadour and quiff that rely on extra volume, you’ll want a thick wax or clay pomade that offers moderate hold. Apply it to barely-damp hair and use a natural hair brush at first to move your hair in the right direction and help develop lift and flow. Then use your fingertips to put the defining details and get your desired style.
Although you can style men’s textured haircuts with hair of any length, medium-length styles offer the most versatility and styling options.

Long textured styles are incredibly hot right now. If your hair is shoulder-length or longer and you’re lucky enough to have some natural wave, consider a cut with long layers. When you style, try a light-hold styling cream or clay, apply it to the ends of your hair, and separate a few sections for a beachy, tousled look.
If you have straight hair, you can also apply the cream or pomade before wrapping your hair up in the ever-popular man bun. Ultimately, long textured hair is the best long hairstyle for guys who want a natural look.

The textured crop is a stylish modern version of the old school mushroom or bowl styles from the late 80’s and early 90’s. The crop top haircut is best for men with short, thick hair. By combining faded sides or a high undercut with a very short haircut on top, the crop top offers an easy-to-get, simple-to-style look.
Simply put, it’s a longer, thicker version of a buzz cut with a more distinct fade. For more contrast, we recommend the high skin fade on the sides and back. Once you have the cut, just apply your matte pomade or wax and mess it up for a cool, casual finish.

A textured fade hairstyle looks best on short and medium-length styles. This classic tapered haircut on the sides requires a scissor cut to create the perfect blend. The hair on top must be longer to avoid clashing with the sides and back. As a conservative business professional hairstyle, the textured fade looks good with many of today’s top trends.
Just note that there are many different kinds of fade haircuts – whether you want a high, mid, low, or bald fade, fades offer a fresh, clean-cut finish.

Messy textured hair is incredibly popular these days, but not the sort that looks like you just rolled out of bed. The best textured messy hairstyles require some styling. This sort of style works for men with short, medium, or long hair, and it’s all about sectioning off bits of hair to create a disheveled look for a natural finish.
If your hair is short, opt for a thick clay or wax; if it is medium-length, use a matte pomade; and if you have long hair, go with a light cream that offers light hold and very little shine. Apply the product to your damp hair, run your hands through your hair in all different directions, and then let it air dry.

The textured fringe is a great hairstyle for men with curly or wavy hair. The men’s fringe haircut often requires longer hair on top with short sides. Guys have the option of a high or low taper fade and styling the fringe messy or swept to the side.
The bold messy fringe needs a light to medium product to texturize the hair, while a side-swept, angular fringe lays flat on the forehead.

Textured spiky hairstyles continue to be fun, cool styles for guys. You can keep your spiked hair subtle with a short haircut and a low taper fade, or you can be bold with long spiky hair, a high bald fade, and line up. Guys also have the option of shaping their spiky style into a fohawk for a distinct, edgy look.
In either case, you’ll need a medium-hold pomade, clay, or wax with a matte finish. You can have a few thick spikes or several short, pointy ones. The sky is truly the limit with this style, so don’t be afraid to experiment.

Undercut hairstyles are great for textured hair, especially if you’re considering a slick back, comb over, or brush up look. These textured undercut haircut styles work well for guys who have thick hair that is at least two to three inches long on top.
It all starts with the cut; undercut requires that your barber trim the sides high and short while leaving the hair on top longer. You can even ask your stylist for a disconnected undercut where he will shave or buzz the sides and back of your head for more contrast. As one of the best short sides long top styles, textured undercut hairstyles like the brush back and pompadour are chic and sexy.

The modern textured quiff has become a hot men’s haircut around the world. You’ll need a good styling product to keep the quiff for all-day wear, but the cut and style is worth the effort.
Whether you have short or medium-length hair, a textured quiff is as easy as applying your product to damp hair, sweeping it upward with a brush, then using your fingers to define the strands. This swept-up hairstyle looks perfect with many different types of fades, and styles nicely with a messy, natural finish.

If you have thicker hair, then you are the envy of every man who has always wanted to style all the coolest hairstyles. The natural volume makes thick textured hairstyles incredibly simple and fashionable, but you’ll need to be a little more selective with your hair products.
Guys with thick hair need a matte finish with a strong hold for neat, structured styles or a light hold for tousled, free-flowing looks. Start with a small amount of product and gradually add more as needed to texturize thick hair. Work it in from root to tip and use your fingers to style the best textured haircut.

Nom: Fade and Texture Hair on Top
Description: A fade haircut with a messy textured hairstyle on top offers a fresh cut and versatile style. The fade on the sides and back will deliver strong contrast to the natural styling of your hair.

Titre: 29 Short Hairstyles with Beards For Men
Nom: Best Men’s Short Haircuts and Beards
Description:
If you’re excited to try these manly haircuts with beards, check out these modern cuts and styles with epic beards to get ideas on how to grow, trim, and style your look.
For example, one of the hottest cuts and styles for young men and boys is the undercut with beard. The undercut is a very short haircut for guys that accentuates the longer hair on top, and a full beard simply plays on that contrast in shading.
Similarly, the fade haircut offers all types of different cuts. Men’s fades allow for a high, low, mid or bald cut to determine where the tapering starts and how short the hair will go. Guys can always choose to get shaved sides or a shaved head with a cool beard.
With so limitless styling options, many of the best short haircut styles look good with beards. Finding a good beard style for your short hair is easy with the pictures below!

Description:
The classic pompadour is one of the most popular men’s haircuts of all time. This old yet iconic hairstyle lives on barbershops today with a fade or undercut on the sides and textured styling on top. If you want the traditional retro version of the style, guys should apply a high hold pomade with shine for a slick, wet finish.
If you’re more interested in the modern pompadour, try a matte hair product for a natural look. Either way, this classy men’s hairstyle is edgy and bold.

Old-fashioned slicked back hair is another barbershop favorite. As one of the hottest men’s hairstyles throughout history, guys love it because it’s easy to style and maintain. Just use a strong, shiny hair product and brush your hair straight back.
To try the modern slick back, look at the slick back undercut or fade. The short sides and back will highlight the long hair on top, making for a classy yet sexy haircut women can’t resist.

The old quiff looks very much like the textured modern quiff. Popularized by James Dean, the quiff hairstyle offers a casual, natural styling with volume and length on top. Although you can use a strong hair product to create a less messy, neater version of the look, we recommend a light to medium hold pomade, wax or cream for maximum movement and flow. The end result is a classic men’s hairstyle that will never go out of style.

The side part represents a handsome gentleman’s hairstyle. Generally, men’s parted haircuts were common among the sophisticated elite. Ivy League boys, privileged young men, and professional businessmen could be seen wearing the old school side part along with their suit and shiny shoes.
Styling a side part is super easy – simply find you hair’s natural part, brush one side all the way over and the rest down. Modern side part haircuts sometimes add a thick line shaved into the hair to accentuate the parting.

The classic comb over is often confused with the side part. Although both hairstyles are known for their smart, dapper look, the comb over hairstyle flows more and doesn’t offer the same structured finish as the part. The vintage comb over haircut requires short tapered sides cut with scissors, and a short to medium length top styled with shiny pomade.
However, the comb over fade is a much cooler modern variation. Guys have the choice of a high, mid, or low fade on the sides, with the option of tapering or fading into the skin. Similarly, you can pick an undercut for a one-length cut. Lastly, the hair on top is often textured for a more natural look. The final look is a trendy style that’s hard to beat in terms of versatility.

Gangsters and Hollywood celebrities were the trendsetters for much of the 20th century. However, old school gangsters and mobsters did try their best to blend in, meaning they preferred professional haircuts that made them look like reputable businessmen. These classic gentleman’s haircuts were clean cut and classy with short sides and short to medium length hair on top. The best gangster haircuts you’ll find are the slick back and side part.

While many old-fashioned styles kept hair on top longer, some stayed short all over. Pictured is an example of a clean short sides and back haircut with a short fringe on top. The textured messy styling looked good under the hats worn back in the day. Speaking of, the fringe and French crop have been trending this year.
This rebellious Rock and Roll hairstyle was huge in the 40’s and 50’s. Named the Jelly Roll, it was common among guys of the Rockabilly and greaser era.

The finger waves hairstyles were a good look among guys with wavy or curly hair. Much like a side part, the longer hair on top was brushed to one side, where the curls or waves were left tousled. Although handsome for the time, the styling hasn’t appeared much since the 20’s.

The old school bad boy haircut doesn’t change much from decade to decade. This example shows short sides that are tapered with scissors, medium-length to long hair on top, and a stubble beard. The free-flowing, natural hairstyle offers volume and movement that defies the prevailing gentleman’s style of the day, therefore exuding the bad boy image. The modern version would be today’s hot hipster haircuts paired with a thick beard.

The short sides, thick brushed back hair, and full handlebar mustache provide the perfect cowboy hairstyle. Because cowboys were known to be alpha males, this old-western hairstyle symbolizes their rebellious and masculine style.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description: Here are the best haircuts for men by face shape. From the fade and undercut on the sides to the comb over, quiff, pompadour, slick back, crew cut, crop top, fringe, brush back, and faux hawk hairstyles on top, guys will find fresh trendy styles according to their face.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
A round face is quite common for men, and if the outline you drew in the mirror remotely resembles a circle, then you likely have a round head shape. Round faced men are defined by equal widths and lengths, and guys who have round face shapes do not have especially angular faces. Specifically, round faces are soft without sharp jawlines or cheekbones. The best haircuts for round faces are those that make the head appear longer and give the illusion of a more angular, chiseled appearance.
For one, keep the sides and back of your hair short; longer hair in these areas can actually make your head look wider and have the opposite effect. For the hair on top, you’ll want to choose a modern hairstyle with a little height and volume or something you can style asymmetrically to lengthen the face. A side swept fringe, comb over, side part, or Ivy League cut trick the eye into believing your head is longer than it really is and minimize the roundness of your face.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
The best round face hairstyles for men include spiked hair, the faux hawk fade, any parted styles, textured quiff, pompadour, and other naturally brushed up looks. A little fringe can provide a lengthening effect as long as the hair doesn’t lie flat and you use a blow dryer to create a flowing style.
We highly recommend guys ask their barbers for an undercut or faded sides, specifically a high skin fade. A beard can work as long as it accentuates the angles of your jawline rather than hiding them. The perfect beard would be thick stubble or a long, full beard.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
The oval face shares many of the same characteristics as a round face, but is generally more elongated. The distinct features of the oval face shape are softer. With a face that is longer than your cheekbones, a forehead that is wider than your jaw, and a head shape that is curved rather than angular, the best hairstyles for the oval face man require volume on top.
In this case, it’s best to avoid styles like bangs and fringes that fall across your forehead since these can make the rounder lines of your face more prominent. Your goal should be to balance the roundness of your face visually, and the best way to do this is with a cut that is short on the sides and longer on the top. You can use wax or clay for a textured finish that will add extra volume and height, if necessary.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
The best men’s haircuts for oval faces are styles that follow the short on the sides, long on top hair trend. Fortunately, oval faced men have a number of cool hairstyles to choose from. For example, the pompadour and quiff are very popular right now. Similarly, the faux hawk, comb over fade, and slick back undercut are also ideal cuts.
Overall, short to medium-length hair is perfect for styling good oval face hairstyles. Further, men with oval faces often look best without facial hair, but if you prefer to grow a beard, thick stubble or a short beard can offer a masculine look.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
The square face is much like the round, only the angles of the head are far sharper, providing a more masculine, chiseled appearance. Square face men have jaws and foreheads that are almost exactly the same width. As a matter of fact, these symmetric qualities are what many people find attractive in a man. The best haircuts for square faces accentuate the manly features you already have by keeping hair short.
For starters, hairstyles for men with square faces should start with a fade on the sides. Then think about short to medium length styles with just a hint of volume on top. If you want longer hair, consider a high skin fade or undercut to increase contrast, emphasize the height of your hair, and elongate your face slightly. Short sideburns are excellent choices for square faces as well.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
The best hairstyles for square face men are those that mimic the outline of the face – styles that are clearly structured with clean, neat lines for a strong look. A hard side part with a bald fade can highlight your rugged features. Also, a textured pompadour is always a great choice, particularly if you choose a wax or clay for a matte, natural look to your hair. This concept extends to other medium and longer hairstyles, including the quiff, brush back, faux hawk, and comb over.
Nevertheless, the square face allows for guys to get very short to short haircuts, including the buzz cut, crew cut, high and tight, and French crop. We highly recommend that any cool cuts and styles for square faces be paired with short faded sides or an undercut.
As for facial hair, shorter is better, but be sure to avoid a thick, long beard that can hide your strong jawline rather than accentuate it. Growing a beard can be awesome and badass, but heavy stubble is the hottest style you can wear.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
The oblong face, also known as the rectangular face shape, is a more elongated version of a square face. A long face shape is generally the most aesthetically-pleasing and well-proportioned, even though it is more long than wide. Though the square face shape is often referred to as the most attractive, the truth is that men with long faces can pick from all the best men’s haircuts and hairstyles.
The only thing you truly need to avoid as a long faced man is a style with too much volume on top or too short sides. This can make your face appear even longer and take away from the angular characteristics of your cheekbones and jawline. Instead, find cuts and styles that are very short to medium-length without height.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
The best hairstyles for long face men include classic and modern styles. For example, if you want a clean-cut and low-maintenance haircut, then a buzz, crew cut, crop top or fringe will suit you well. Bangs that falls across the forehead can even serve to shorten the length of the face. However, instead of a very short hairstyle, you may consider a taper or low fade with a comb over, slick back, textured quiff, man bun, or top knot.
Guys with long faces can grow facial hair, but the best beard styles will range in length from light stubble to thick, short beard. Ultimately, haircuts for oblong faces need to maintain the head’s dimensions and avoid making anything look longer than it actually is.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
A triangle face is fuller near the jawline and narrower at the forehead, only slightly resembling the geometric shape. If you have a triangle face shape, the outline on your mirror is narrower around your temples than your jaw, with angular features that are sharper rather than rounded. While there are a number of awesome triangle face shape hairstyles, some are more ideal than others.
Haircuts for men who have a triangle face shape require some thickness on the sides and plenty of length on top. You will want to create the illusion of volume from the temples upward and guys with thick hair can get the hottest medium to long men’s hairstyles.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
The best haircuts for the triangle face shape are classic tapers and low fades that build width on the sides. These cuts work especially well for men who have curly or thick hair. Couple your tapered or faded sides with a long comb over, pompadour, quiff, textured brush up, modern faux hawk, or messy hair. An angular fringe can also be styled to highlight the forehead and minimize the strong chin.
Men with triangle faces should consider clean-shaven styles; otherwise, avoid a full beard and instead opt for very short and well-groomed beard styles. A short, thick beard or light stubble can maybe soften the chin and jawline.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
A diamond face is one with a well-defined chin and jawline alongside high cheekbones. If your face is longer than it is round, and if your chiseled, sharp jaw is the widest part of your face, you likely have a diamond face shape. The best haircuts for diamond faced men are numerous, but the diamond shape is well-suited for the “rugged” appearance, complete with longer hair and a full beard.
If you have thicker hair, think about growing it out long and using it to your advantage to create flowing layers that sweep over your forehead. For plenty of movement and a free-flowing style, think textured, natural hairstyles with volume and height. Because your face is angular, avoid cuts that are too symmetrical or consist of completely clean lines. Instead, always think textured, and use a good pomade, wax or clay to separate sections and add volume to your hair.

Titre: Best Men’s Haircuts For Your Face Shape
Description:
Diamond face shape hairstyles offer limitless potential. Expert stylists say that the best haircuts for men diamond face shapes include the full fohawk, a long slicked back, comb over fade, textured quiff, and medium-length to long men’s hairstyles that fall to the shoulders. Tousled and messy styles can also create handsome looks.
As for the hair on the sides, don’t pick a bald fade or undercut that blends down to the skin. Instead, a scissor cut such as a classic taper haircut will look good without further narrowing your face. Finally, a full beard, thick stubble or even a goatee can help add width to your jaw and chin.

Though the fade haircut has been around almost as long as barbers themselves, the taper fade continues to be the basis for most men’s haircuts. This is a testament to how good fades look with so many different styles, providing a low-maintenance, fresh cut that focuses the eyes on the styled hair on top.
While there are various different types of fade haircuts to choose from, the cutting technique and finish is generally the same. To cut a fade, barbers will blend hair short to shorter down the sides and back toward the nape of the neck.
There are high, mid, and low fades to determine where the tapering starts. The high fade starts at the top of the sides and back of the head and the low fade begins right above your ears and neckline. Guys can also ask for a taper fade or skin fade, which tells the barber how short to trim the fade.
If you need a more conservative, business professional haircut, a low taper fade is your best bet. On the other hand, if you want a seriously bold cut with lots of contrast for an edgy hairstyle, the high fade is far more noticeable.
Furthermore, the skin or bald fade can offer a very aggressive finish, blending the hair into bare skin. And if you really want a rugged fuck boi look, pair it up with a thick beard. This combination of faded sides, medium to longer hair on top, and a rugged, full beard basically represents the fuckboy starter pack.

The undercut is much like the fade as they are both cool short haircuts for men. The difference between a fade and undercut is that, instead of fading the hair, the undercut is all one-length around the sides and back. As a popular hipster haircut, the slicked back undercut may have been the original fuck boy haircut.
However, with a good disconnected undercut and length on top, guys can create some of today’s best styles, including the pompadour, quiff, and comb over. Undercut hairstyles work nicely for men with straight, thick hair, but the trim can also look great with wavy and curly hair.

The comb over is easily among the most timeless men’s hairstyles. With so many ways to style a part your hair and style comb over haircuts, guys should really consider this iconic look. Although the comb over hairstyle was once associated with balding men trying to cover thinning hair, the comb over fade or undercut comb over has completely changed that outlook.
In these cases, the comb over can be styled with a shiny or textured finish. The classic look generally requires strong pomade for slick styling, while the modern textured version is best achieved with a medium hold, matte pomade or low shine wax.
Moreover, the comb over can be styled in different ways. One is with a thick, well-defined part and all the hair swept over to one side for a neat, structured look. The other results in hair being brushed over more naturally for a loose styling.
Ultimately, the comb over hairstyle will give you a great deal of flexibility and allow you to create a number of awesome styles – classic or modern. With the medium-length to long hair on top, guys can get the quiff, pompadour, slick their hair back or spike it.

The quiff is a signature fuckboy hairstyle. The modern textured quiff haircut is casual and relaxed, giving off chill vibes. Especially popular for younger men, it does require some maintenance which lends to the metrosexual stigma. However, the quiff is more than worth the time to style.
A mere 3 to 4 inches of hair on top is all that’s needed to create this voluminous style. You might opt to fade the sides or keep them all one length. The choice is yours, but remember that the shorter the sides, the more dramatic the quiff.
To style the quiff, simply use a wax hair product if you want a textured, natural look or a pomade for a sleek, shiny finish. Apply the styling product while your hair is still damp, then brush your hair back (or use your fingers if you have natural waves or curls) and blow dry it, paying special attention to the hair at the roots. This will give your quiff its distinctive lift.

Slicked back hairstyles never really go out of style. Slicked back hair is ideal for anyone who wants a hint of the “bad boy” image without taking things to extremes like getting a mohawk with shaved sides. Certain versions of the slick back are almost certainly fuckboy hairstyles, and the one that stands out the most is textured brushed back hair.
Hair styling wax, clay, or even mousse will help you achieve the natural flow and volume you’re after; otherwise, a pomade is perfect for the more retro, greaser slick back style.
The best thing about this fuck boy cut is the fact that it’s easy enough to take from business to pleasure with nothing more than a brush and your favorite product. Slick it back with a wax that offers moderate shine during the day, then in the evening, work in a little pomade at the roots for a badass hairstyle. Either way, you’re sure to look amazing.

The faux hawk is a fresh take on the mohawk and spiky hair. Also known as the fohawk, the haircut is versatile and stylish yet less dramatic than the traditional shaved sides mohawk. The best version of the style is the fohawk fade, with the short sides highlighting the thick hair on top. The faux hawk hairstyle requires a minimum of 2 to 3 inches of length that you can choose to spike any way you want. The styling on top can be narrow or wide, but the more pointy the hair on top, the bolder the fohawk will look.
Hawk hairstyles are also very flexible because the longer length allows guys to change their style. From brushed up hair to a long fringe to a messy hairstyle, men have a range of options. Similarly, using the right pomade, wax or cream can help a great deal here, but be sure to choose one with the appropriate level of hold for the best results.

A barbershop favorite is the small or mini afro – a low-maintenance style that allows you to grow your hair out on top without the headache of managing a big afro. Plus, a regular trim can keep your hair healthy by cutting off split ends to allow new growth.
A big afro will require time, but the final look is well worth the wait. We recommend you get a barber or stylist to help with your long afro to make sure it comes out perfect!

Long afro hairstyles give guys many options. Some black men prefer to grow out their hair and keep it styled high and big. This requires regular combing and excellent hair care, but the end result is a badass big afro with shape, volume, and size. Others prefer to let their long afro flow down. This can be especially stylish if you have long curly hair or twists.

As your hair grows out longer, a curly afro is inevitable. This is because most black men already have thick, kinky hair. Fortunately, curls can add a lot of awesome texture and shape. In this case, combine a long curly afro hairstyle with a high or low taper fade on the sides and you’ll have a badass look.

This low tapered afro with a line up is a perfect example of good styling. The all around taper afro is shaped evenly and naturally. The sideburns are slightly faded, and the full beard offers a stylish finish.

Nom: High Skin Fade + Line Up + Afro
Description: Long curly afro hairstyles are perfect with a high bald fade on the sides and back. Faded sides that cut down to the skin focus the eyes on the longer hair on top. This example also comes with a clean edge up. Starting along the hairline and curving around the temples and to the beard, the sharp edges give this style a modern look.

Growing a short curly fro is a good way to use your natural hair’s texture to your advantage. While curly hair can sometimes be hard to manage and control, styling a curly afro with short hair is the best way to get a simple yet trendy black men’s hairstyle.

This high skin fade with short twists provides a unique take on very short afro styles. If you want to style an afro but don’t want to deal with growing out long, nappy hair, then this easy hairstyle is for you.

Whether you have naturally curly or nappy hair, afro hairstyles work well with all hair types. In fact, one way to stand out is to combine a unique texture to create the different types of afros. This tapered afro with thick kinky hair on top and goatee results in an edgy modern hairstyle.

Afro twist hairstyles are very popular these days. Afros with long twists are special to black men and can be paired with a taper fade on the sides. However, guys can also leave the hair long everywhere and enjoy a big afro twist.

The best twist hairstyles for men are often styled as messy afros. This long afro twist was fashioned out of long kinky hair. The short, thick beard and big afro give off an edgy, rugged look. If you already have a small afro and want to take your style to the next level, this picture should inspire you.

Nom: Mini Afro + Part + Cool Beard Shape
Description: An afro with a part is a cool way to customize your haircut. Whether you want a side part afro or just a thick part shaved into your hair on top, ask your barber to give you the afro part.

Nom: Low Fade + Short Afro with Curls
Box Fade + Line in Hair + Beard
Curly Afro + High Fade + Edge Up

Description: This low burst fade still keeps the sides and back short, but doesn’t ride too high. For guys who need a professional hairstyle but still want an edgy haircut like the burst fade, this version works best. With a natural textured style on top and a fresh taper on the sides, we highly recommend this look. Plus, it’s the perfect example that guys can ask their barbers for any type of burst fade – high, mid, low, tapered, or skin.

The burst fade mohawk is the most classic version of the haircut. This wide mohawk with kinky hair is paired with a high bald burst fade on the sides and an edge up along the hairline and temples. The clean cut finish makes this mohawk fade cool, classy and sexy all at once. As one of the best hairstyles for black men, you really can’t go wrong getting this style.

The burst taper offers the option to trim the sides short without exposing skin. This burst taper fade is combined with thick, straight hair on top styled into a mohawk. Badass and modern, this type of fade can be combined with any number of popular hairstyles for men to create an awesome look. To get this natural, textured finish, guys should use a strong pomade or hair wax.

This burst fade haircut is a good example of how this cut transcends hair types. The best types of fades look good on all guys – Black, White, Hispanic, and Asian. Here, you’ll find a low bald fade and shape up with thick, natural hair on top. Brushed back in the front and slightly combed over, this short to medium-length hairstyle offers excellent volume, movement, and flow. Use a high-quality clay or cream to replicate this look.

Blended short on the sides and back, here’s a burst taper fade with curly hair on top. The messy curls and styling are reminiscent of the curly hair fade. One of the best ways to manage and control frizzy curly hairstyles is to use a cream and enhancer.

The burst fade comb over provides a special take on a classic hairstyle. The comb over fade is often styled with a traditional low, mid, or high taper on the sides, but a burst will help you stand out in the crowd. The hair is then brushed over to one side, creating a parted look. For volume and texture, use a high-quality matte men’s styling product.

Here is the burst fade faux hawk with a textured finish, shaved back, and thick beard. The faux hawk, also known as the fohawk, styles especially nicely with a fade on the sides. The surgical line or part adds a sweet hair design. To keep your fohawk fade styled all day, guys should use a strong hold, low shine wax.

For black men, a burst fade with short curly hair on top is a trendy style. This mohawk with tight curls and a skin fade is easy to get and maintain. Further, grow out a long, full beard and you have a very masculine look.

The burst fade can be customized to suit your personal style with a hair design on the sides. Cool hair designs can range from symbols to writing. The thick, long mohawk with highlights and nappy curls (or twists) looks awesome and edgy. For an extra clean finish, ask your barber for a fresh line up along the hairline.

While the mohawk fade is generally a more popular haircut for black men, this styling also looks good on white guys and anyone who likes the hairstyle. The low burst taper fade merges seamlessly into the sideburns and beard, and you’ll notice the sweet shaping of the hairline around the temples. If you can pull off this look, we highly recommend you try it this year.

The flat top mohawk pictured here provides a unique version of these styles. While a flat top fade is a classic look, the burst fade makes this cut different. Along with the edge up, mohawk and length at the back, this modern hairstyle offers a stylish profile.

Proof that the burst fade works with all types of hair, including thick, straight hair. Unlike the kinky hair common to black men, this straight messy hairstyle offers the perfect contrast. Following the short sides, long top hair trend for men, the styling is sleek and modern.

Nom: South of France and Burst Fade
Description: The South of France hairstyle is another name for the burst fade mohawk. What used to be Usher’s signature cut, this look features a high burst fade tapered down to the skin. The wide mohawk on top is made of thick twists or curls. Without nappy hair, this styling is clean and trendy.

Nom: Mid Skin Burst Fade with Line Up
Description:
The burst fade haircut comes in a variety of forms, including a mid bald fade. The very short spiky hair on top is a combination of a blowout and mohawk. To build some contrast on the sides, the barber was forced to use zero fade clippers and an edge up trimmer along the hairline. The result was this ultra cool hairstyle.

Description: The pompadour might be named after Madame de Pompadour, making the pomp a decidedly European hairstyle, but the hairdo didn’t take off until the King of Rock and Roll, Elvis Presley, sported the look. Formerly a female hairstyle, the pompadour has become one of the trendiest hairstyles for men. A traditional pompadour is worn with short sides, as the hair is swept upwards and backwards. Today, there are a variety of pompadour hairstyles to try out, ranging from classic, angular, extreme, and modern cuts.

If you’re not ready to fully embrace the pompadour, tease the look by trying out the more versatile quiff instead. Whether it’s the short and spiky quiff, long and textured quiff, or the voluminous messy version, there’s a quiff style for everyone. No matter the varied sizes of the back and sides, they should always be kept shorter than the front to emphasize contrast.

A popular hairstyle choice for men has always been the taper fade. Men who preferred short hair were usually the demographic of choice, but today, fade haircuts are being embraced by men of all hair lengths and styles. There are plenty of directions to take the fade haircut: high bald fade, low skin fade, burst drop fade, comb over fade, disconnected fade and more.

There’s no better way to look sleek than with a slicked back haircut. The modern slick back involves keeping the sides and back of your head in an undercut or high fade haircut, while the top has enough length to “slick back” with pomade. The hairstyle may date back to American greaser culture, but modern men are taking the slick back in bold new directions.
If the modern pomp, quiff, and slick back didn’t inspire you, here are a few more Euro hair styles that may better fit you!

Description: If you’re looking to change your look, here are the best blowout fade haircuts to get right now! As one of the coolest men’s haircuts, this cut and hairstyle looks trendy on all hair types. From curly to wavy, thick, and straight hair, the blowout can take your style to the next level.

Here’s a beautiful example of a design that combines different lines and shading on the sides with a sweet faux hawk on top.
As you can see, there are limitless possibilities. Ultimately, how stylish your hair design comes out depends on your creativity and your barber’s skills.

Nom: High Skin Fade + Faux Hawk + Design
Description: One of the best ways to incorporate a design is to cut different types of fades into your sides, switching between hair and skin to create unique styles.
Placement is critical when etching art into your scalp, and this buzz cut and low skin fade make the look stand out!

Nom: Hi Lo Skin Fade + Messy Hair + Neckline Design
Description: Neckline designs are becoming more popular these days, and these crossing lines don’t disappoint.
Continuing with the short sides, long top hairstyles of late, this style customizes the fresh comb over fade.

Nom: High Drop Fade + Short Top + Leaf Design
Buzz Cut + Zig Zag Hair Design

Description: Messy curtains are an excellent choice for skaters who aren’t afraid to let their hair get longer. Also known as a modern middle part, this versatile style can work well with straight, wavy or curly hair to achieve the ultimate skater boy vibe. Full of texture, the hair on top is given layers, so it falls naturally over the back and sides, and a lightweight product will help lock in the look without weighing it down.

The buzz cut is a practical haircut for skater boys who value form and function over style and want to focus on developing their skills. While low-maintenance, this short hairstyle can be masculine and edgy when paired with a high skin fade. For a tailored approach, dye the hair on top to stand out.

Popular in the 90s, the shaggy skater style is a classic look for guys that looks casually cool and timeless. This low-maintenance haircut allows young men to go weeks without hitting up the barbers and still look fresh. Impervious to helmet hair, it’s ideal for the guy who wants to get on his board and go.

The short messy fringe is a reliable cut for the skater guy who wants a clean-cut look. With cropped sides, the longer top comes with textured bangs that combine the right amount of messiness and flair. This effortless fringed style will enhance your look with volume and flow.

For the skater who wants a style that screams “devil may care”, try leaving your hair long, messy and brushed forward. Simple and unstructured, this layered haircut features texture and effortless style. Let your hair air dry after the skate park or use a sea salt spray after a shower to add more grit.

Try a brush back for a stylish look that lasts all day. This trendy cut is achieved by pushing the hair back while it’s wet. You can either let it air dry or use pomade to lock in the look. An undercut tames the sides and lets the top flow.

The long bro flow is the practical option for the man who lives on the vert ramp. Let your hair get long in every direction and have your stylist trim up the ends to keep the look in check. Styling-wise, you can leave your locks natural or spritz sea salt spray for a beachy look.
The quiff is the quintessential skater boy hairstyle that boasts texture and height while fitting under a helmet. When you’re off the half-pipe, you can use a medium shine pomade to dress to impress.

Nom: Thick Wavy Crop with Low Fade
Description: A short wavy hairstyle with a clean fade can be a modern and flattering look for guys who want to show off their texture. This iteration helps elevate naturally thick waves and will keep your look fresh with a low fade. Your friends at the skate park will be skinning their knees wondering how to copy your cut.

Nom: Undercut with Long Side Swept Hair
Description: For a haircut you want to be able to do yourself, let your mane grow long and then give yourself an undercut. Since it doesn’t All you’ll need is a number two guard on your clippers to clean up the back and sides right up to the corner of the head. You won’t need any product to work this look.

Nom: Long Side Swept Hair with Low Temp Fade
Description: If you don’t want to go for an undercut, try sweeping your long hair to the side with pomade. This gives a sleek look while the low temp fade adds style without looking too severe.

The modern mullet is the envy of everyone at the skate park. It’s edgy and bold and not a look that even Tony Hawk could rock. You know the drill. The hair is kept long over the top and into the back and you can opt for a fade to keep the sides stylish and short.

Nom: Crew Cut with High Skin Fade
Description: A crew cut is the simplest look you could achieve. Done completely with clippers, ask for a number four on top with a high skin fade. Helmet hair will be a thing of the past! Have fun with color, so all the guys go green with envy.
Sometimes the right move is to ditch the fade and let your long curly hair loose. Just grab your hat and your board, and this look will have your curls flowing in the wind.

The classic long part is an iconic skater hairstyle that will look flattering on most dudes. Longer bangs can be paired with this look to showcase length and volume without getting too shaggy. Only a strong skater can rock a look with this much personality.

The choppy shag is a popular look for skateboarding trendsetters. Boasting length and layers, this look adds texture throughout to make sure everything pops. You can try a strong matte product for this look, but you probably won’t need it.

The skater bro flow is both practical and eye-catching. Let your locks flow wildly and try parting it down the middle for a look that stands out from your friends. If you’re not shredding it at the park, try using hairspray to lock your waves in place.

Since some skaters are also surfers, a longer style is a versatile choice for boys who want a stylish look that still offers flexibility and flow. This manageable cut features texture and layers that will complement your hair. Use a matte styling product to add grit and natural movement.

Nom: Blonde Faux Hawk with High Fade
Description: This faux hawk with a high skin fade is a simple and charming haircut that will look great for any occasion. With its texture and spikes, it will never go out of style. Getting it with a high fade only elevates the cut. Ask your stylist for a bleach and tone to see if blonde men really do have more fun.

When you think of what a skater looks like, what comes to mind is a dude with a long shag. The look is timeless and is an embodiment of the sport. There isn’t much technical here. Ditch your barber and aim for long and shaggy.

The man bun is the ultimate goal for the skater who has achieved growing their hair longer than six inches. This exceptional look goes hard for style points and is great for the trendier man. It’s in the name, gents. Put your long locks in a bun and you’re ready for anything.

Going for a fringe with curly hair is a cool cut that will emphasize your natural waves and offer a stylish edge. A mid fade lets you bare some skin without getting too wild and keeps you cool while you shred at the skate park. As a popular curly hairstyle, this look will get you noticed anywhere you go.

Nom: Choppy Fringe with Low Skin Fade
Description: The choppy fringe is a fun option for the guy who likes to be edgy and bold. This unstructured cut is done by keeping the back and sides short with a low skin fade, allowing the texture on top to stand out. Use a high-hold clay to keep the choppiness at a maximum.

The comb over undercut is a modern style that will showcase your texture and volume on top for a handsome look. This casually cool haircut works beautifully on teenage boys and young men. Grab a scoop of pomade or a dime-sized amount of gel to let your ruggedness pop on and off the ramp.

For a subtler faux hawk, ask for a taper instead of a fade. This helps soften the sides without going too high or too close to the skin. This gives your style more structure without sacrificing the edginess.

Nom: Spiky Hair with Mid Bald Fade
Description: Thick spiky hair with a mid skin fade is a low-maintenance style that will upgrade your look. Point cutting on top adds unrivaled texture, while a mid taper fade keeps the cut tight as could be on the sides for killer contrast. A clay product is your best friend here.

The best way to style wavy hair is to lean in and embrace the texture, creating a parted look for a devilishly handsome finish. With longer waves all around, all you need to do is brush your hair to one side and use some texturizing product for texture, volume and bounce.

The angular fringe is a solid choice for the emo skater boy who wants a retro and moody style. Once you let the front of your hair grow over your face, ask your barber to trim the ends at an angle so it partially covers your eyes. Forever idyllic, layers and texture styling will help you nail this dapper look.

The two block is a trendy haircut for men that started with K-Pop culture and has made its way into the mainstream. This style showcases a sharp part down the center of the head, and layers are added to give its characteristic bounce and volume. A lightweight product will help lock in the look and make it last under your helmet all day long.

Nom: Fluffy Curls with Low Drop Fade
Description: For a voluminous style that embraces your natural kinks, try a fluffy curl look. What makes this look different is the low drop fade that keeps the line low all the way around while keeping weight at the corners of your head and lower in the back. Let your locks flow over your forehead for a fresh look that’s a breeze to style in the morning.

Nom: Blunt French Crop with High Skin Fade
Description: The blunt French crop is an idyllic look for the stylish man with an active lifestyle. Ask for shorter layers here and a strict fringe in the front. A high skin fade tightens the entire look for a cut that rocks.

Nom: Spiky Side Part with Mid Fade
Description: For a change on the typical side part, go for texture and spikes on top for something flashier. A mid fade with this cut helps balance out the face and sharpen your jaw.

The long angular shag is the epitome of easygoing. While this cut may lean on the younger side, men of any age can try it out to see what all the fuss is about. The look is made better with point-cutting and layering the hair which helps elevate the overall style.

For the skater with a tighter curl to manage, long twists are the best way to go. Keeping your twists long looks unique without being too heavy or needing too much maintenance, which is perfect for the guy who’s never too far from his skateboard.

The brush up is a refreshing hairstyle for the modern teenage guy who needs a stylish and easy look. A short taper strengthens your jawline and seals the deal on this manly cut. Try out a strong hold pomade to keep your style on point.

Textured spikes is an easy skater hairstyle for men that requires minimal effort to look good. Ask your barber to keep the top long and textured to give your look more movement. A mid taper helps elongate your face and emphasize manlier features.
