With longer hair on top and tapered sides, he most often wears a comb over fade or a textured messy spiked crop. In the past, he used platinum highlights to add dimension to his naturally dark locks. When styling, use a matte hair product like clay or wax to keep your hair in place on the field while creating a natural textured finish.

David Beckham is an English professional footballer who has created several hair trends for men. While he retired in 2013, this soccer legend still turns heads with his dazzling good looks and trendy men’s hairstyles. He’s rocked everything from a practical buzz cut to flowing locks during his career but favors classic short sides with a long top these days. To achieve exceptional volume, Beckham sweeps gel through damp hair and gently blow dries the hair back. For formal events, he often slicks his hair back with gel for a clean-cut feel.

Cristiano Ronaldo is best known as a world-class forward and captain, but this professional soccer player is also a complete heartthrob. He usually sports a neat and timeless cut that combines a mid fade with an elegant slick back, but he’s also experimented with mohawks and shaved sides during his career. When he’s on the pitch, he’ll keep his locks in place with a firm-hold pomade or gel.

Oliver Giroud is a universally renowned French forward who always looks professional and handsome with a stylish soccer haircut. Whether he’s styling a disconnected pompadour with tight tapered sides or spiking his hair up, Giroud creates a masculine style that can be replicated with a skilled barber and matte products. Paired with a full groomed beard, this footballer has become a men’s style icon.

Granit Xhaka is a talented Swiss footballer who keeps his look modern and clean-cut. He’s no stranger to shaved lines and vibrant long locks, but Xhaka’s refreshing cropped sides and comb over are the perfect everyday pairing for cool guys.

Neymar is a popular Brazilian soccer player who is usually seen with a stylish and modern drop fade haircut. To replicate his unique and daring cut, clip your sides into a high taper and leave around 2 inches of hair on top. For enviable lift and volume, spike the hair upward for a playful feel. If you want to recreate Neymar’s iconic look from 2020, grab a box of pink dye and completely shave your sides.

Kylian Mbappé always looks sensational with a low-maintenance and athletic buzz cut and a mid skin fade. This handsome French player uses clippers to create a uniform cut that’s nearly buzzed and channels his youthful energy with a sexy line up, mid fade and a goatee beard. When he wants to change things up, he’ll create waves in his short haircut for an added dimension to his style.

Sergio Ramos is one of the most celebrated footballers in Spain who has become best known for playing center-back for Paris Saint-Germain. When he’s running around the pitch, he generally styles a cool haircut that makes a statement. His most stylish hairstyles are a quiff with a fade, a long man bun with an undercut, a comb over with tapered sides and spiky hair with a shaved cut. He will combine a full beard with his trendy style to create a ruggedly handsome look.

Karim Benzema is an attractive French soccer player who keeps his look practical with a high and tight style and a striking bald fade. This trendy cut is characterized by a very short back and sides which are paired with minimal length on top. Throw in a full faded beard for a rugged appearance that you can maintain with regular trims.

Zinedine Zidane may have left his days as a player behind, but this dapper Frenchman is still turning heads as a manager with his iconic shaved head. To achieve his clean-cut look, completely clip the hair before shaving it smooth with a razor. If you want more structure, grow a light scruff along the chin and jawline. As complete baldness is an extreme style, you’ll need striking features and a strong bone structure to pull this look off.

Whether you’re a Tottenham Hotspur fan or simply appreciate the English national team, you’ve probably heard of Harry Kane. This tall and striking soccer player is known for his signature brushed back side sweep, scissor-cut locks and tapered sides. You can achieve this timeless style by asking your barber for a short back and sides with decent length on top for an elegant finish.

Luka Modrić is a Croatian footballer who is currently impressing soccer fanatics as a central midfielder for La Liga. He’s been seen with classic cuts like taper fades and quiffs, but he usually wears his long blonde hair loose and long. To add dimension to flowing locks, incorporate subtle layers around the front of the face and pull it back with a thin hair band.

Kevin De Bruyne is a testament to Belgium’s footballing talent and has played for Chelsea, Gent and Manchester City over the years. This expert player often styles his ginger locks into a classic short quiff with a mid or high fade, but you’ll occasionally see him rocking an elegant tapered look. Pair this cut with a clean shave for a sexy and masculine appearance.

Mohamed Salah has been impressing Liverpool fans with his stunning goals since 2017, but it’s his curly afro that first turned him into a style icon. He achieves this cool and textured appearance by cutting his sides short and fading the edges up to a mop of curls on top. If you prefer his iconic faux hawk from 2020, cut the sides short and ask your barber for faded edges.

Robert Lewandowski is a Polish player who has sailed through his incredible soccer career with a classy tapered haircut and a textured fringe. The longer length on top perfectly balances his features, and the modern fringe can be worn mussed for an undone feel or slicked back for a sleek finish. When he’s feeling playful, Lewandowski will also shave cool designs near his temples.

Vinicius Junior is a Brazilian professional footballer who started his career at Flamengo before moving over to La Liga. He’s sported high and tight styles and braids throughout the years, but he also appreciates a striking mohawk with faded sides and a slick lineup. If you want to channel his youthful energy, add some shaved lines to the mix.

Antoine Griezmann is one of the most successful soccer players of his generation and has made his mark as an exceptional striker. He has worn short spikes and blonde tips in the past but is often seen embracing his natural curls with long hair or braids. To achieve Griezmann’s effortless flow, use curl-defining cream or a sea salt spray for a beautiful textured finish.

Carlos Vela is a Mexican footballer who has been breaking hearts for years with his thick locks and masculine beard. He’s partial to short and medium-length styles and usually combs over his locks on top with a gel before fashioning the hair into a playful side part. When he pairs his look with a short but full beard, it’s easy to see why this soccer player turns heads.

Zlatan Ibrahimović is a Swedish professional footballer regarded for his incredible strikes and signature man bun. To achieve his laid-back look, slick your strands back with a light gel and secure your long hair at the middle of your head. You should end up with a trendy style that’s practical and bohemian.

Eden Hazard is captain of the Belgian national team and wears his hair in a conservative and low-maintenance blunt cut. This short style is easy to achieve and the low taper makes this cut look fresh and masculine. To add visual interest to his look, Hazard will often throw in a heavy scruff or beard.

Mario Balotelli is an Italian footballer who showcases his rebellious spirit on the pitch with a frohawk and shaved sides. Balotelli combines his voluminous Afro-textured hair with completely shaved sides to create a style that’s packed with edginess and attitude. If you don’t have natural texture, use flat irons and wax to force the hair upward and recreate Balotelli’s daring pomp.

Virgil van Dijk is a Dutch player who proves that long locks can be practical and stylish. He sometimes wears his naturally textured hair as an afro, but he usually rocks it in a low man bun that’s complemented by a sleek line up and subtle chin goatee for visual interest and balance. To maintain the health of his natural hair, van Dijk likely uses moisturizing products.

Thorgan Hazard is a classically good-looking Belgian footballer who proves that simple and refined cuts never go out of style. He rocks a short crew cut with a gradual taper that creates effortless contrast between the top and sides. As a short style, you can maintain your smooth and textured finish with some pomade and regular trims.

Yannick Ferreira Carrasco is one of the most successful Belgian soccer players around and has been known to pull off several stylish cuts during his career. Although he’s sometimes seen with a low-maintenance buzz cut and connected beard, he also appreciates a faded back and sides with a classic pompadour. To achieve stunning volume, he uses a comb and a blow dryer to push the hair backward.

Gareth Bale may have retired from playing soccer professionally, but he can still be seen rocking his trendy man bun and undercut. The striking undercut draws attention away from thinning temples, making it a stylish choice for slightly older men. As a popular soccer player with long hair, his top knot and undercut combination has been an inspiring look for guys who may have a receding hairline but want longer locks on top. You can pair this style with thick beard stubble for the ultimate masculine edge.

Toni Kroos is a German professional soccer player who appreciates sleek hairstyles that look classy and professional. He rocks a short back and sides with a classy slick back that adds volume and dimension to his style. He’ll smooth the hair down with gels for a sexy wet look or use a matte pomade for a more relaxed and timeless appearance.

Miguel Veloso has sported some of the most iconic soccer player haircuts on the pitch across his successful career. This Portuguese footballer draws attention to the natural volume on top by buzzing his sides short and blending his sideburns into surrounding facial hair. To highlight any uneven length and create texture, Veloso uses strong-hold styling products to lightly pull the front of the hair into stiff spikes.

Raheem Sterling is known for his bold personality and excellent attack work, making the burst fade mohawk and short curly afro the perfect picks for this feisty young player. The daring v-cut of the burst fade complements the natural texture of the dense coils on top. This cut can easily be maintained with moisturizing products and regular barber visits.

Gianluigi Buffon is a skilled professional soccer player who often styles a slicked over or messy side part. This traditionally masculine style leans slightly retro and you’ll want to have at least 6 inches of hair on top to create a striking side part. You can add wax to damp hair and gently sweep the hair over or use a matte clay or pomade for all-day hold. This sleek style looks incredible with a clean shave but can also be dialed up with a masculine full beard.

Mathieu Debuchy is a popular French footballer who appreciates fresh and modern cuts that showcase his thick locks. He’ll often rock a slick comb over undercut for professional events, but it’s his daring mohawk and cropped undercut that put him on the map as a style icon. To secure his locks on the pitch, Debuchy uses a strong pomade, gel or wax for the perfect finish.

Stephan El Shaarawy boasts one of the most unique soccer player haircuts, pairing his spiky mohawk with a burst taper fade. To achieve this long textured mohawk, use a strong styling product like pomade or wax. The faded sides and bold shaved lines provide the perfect contrast to complement this edgy style. While shorter than his original mohawk, he’ll still rock spikes with a high skin fade for a badass look.

Aaron Ramsey is a Welsh soccer player who has been turning heads with his short and textured Ivy League style since he first burst onto the scene in 2006. This timeless cut can be mussed slightly with pomade for texture and worn with a faded back and sides for striking dimension.

Marco Reus is a German professional midfielder known for rocking a versatile and eye-catching side part undercut. He’ll occasionally fashion his bleached locks into youthful spikes but is more commonly seen with a combed over and slick cut and blonde highlights. His next-level volume can be achieved by blow-drying the hair upward and to the side with a small amount of hair gel.

Alexis Sánchez is an attractive Chilean soccer star who complements his enviable bone structure with a refreshing short haircut. His signature styles are the comb over fade, high and tight with shaved sides and a bold buzz cut. You can ask your barber to trim the sides with a guard before finishing the top with scissors. Complete the style with dry wax for a polished look with an all-day hold.

Lukas Podolski is an established German soccer player known for his explosive strikes and practical buzz cuts. He keeps his hair uniformly buzzed on all sides for a sleek and flattering look that doesn’t interfere with his moves on the pitch. If you want a slightly longer style, his short Ivy League style is an excellent option.

Radamel Falcao is a talented Colombian soccer player who has become an expert in balancing practical cuts and attractive texture. His signature look combines long hair on top with a high skin fade on the back and the sides. To tame the locks on top, he often slicks the hair back or combs it over to the side with a generous amount of gel. When he’s looking to attract attention, he rocks cool spikes to add height to his hairdo.

Francisco Román Alarcón Suárez is an incredible attacking midfielder, but this Spanish soccer player has also been making waves on the pitch with his thick locks. You can achieve Suárez’s signature textured look by working styling products through the front and combing the hair to one side. Pair your cut with a full beard, mustache and soul patch for the perfect copycat style.

Jo Hyeon-woo always makes a statement with his impressive work in goal, but it’s his colored mohawk that steals the show. He creates breathtaking contrast with a colored dye that contrasts his natural black hair and dials up the intensity with edgy buzzed sides. Although he’s been seen with straight styles over the years, he’s favored cute and bouncy curls in recent games.

Filip Kostic is a gifted Serbian professional footballer who has rocked everything from a classic buzz cut fade to a crew cut with a side swept fringe. To manage his locks on the pitch, Kostić usually gels down the top of his hair, but you can leave your style natural for a slightly softer look that contrasts well with faded sides.

Ramin Rezaeian is an Iranian professional footballer who has risen to prominence as a defender for the national team. He often rocks his curls in a reimagined mohawk that features a towering pompadour on top. This is then paired with shaved sides and a full beard for a rugged finish. If you don’t have any natural texture to keep your hair upright, hold it in place with clay or a strong-hold pomade.

Fabian Johnson is a professional soccer player who often wears a low-maintenance buzz cut or a short curly hair fade to manage his natural curls. Simply ask a barber to buzz all your hair to a uniform length and pull out the trimmers every couple of weeks to maintain this clean-cut, military style. If you want to recreate Johnson’s earlier cuts, pair a clean-shaven face with a classic afro or curly mop top.

The buzz cut is a popular summer look that offers a short and uniform style to keep you cool during the blazing heat. To complement the buzzed hair on top, add a mid to high skin fade on the sides and back for a sharp contrast. To cut your hair at home, choose an all-over buzz haircut that’s easy to maintain.

The crew cut is a stylish summer haircut for men who want a short, cool and low-maintenance look. While a military-inspired style, the modern crew cut comes with a fade or undercut on the sides and slightly longer hair on top to create a versatile, fuller look.

A French crop is a trendy and charming style for guys who want to create effortless texture and flow in their locks. The traditional cut is mussed with a lightweight pomade for dimension, while the bangs are cut straight and styled forward to highlight features without overwhelming them. Rock your crop with a connected beard and faded sides for an edgy finish.

A textured quiff is a classic and timeless style that lets thick-haired guys showcase natural volume and length. You can create a dapper and laid-back look by brushing up your strands with a small amount of matte pomade. A clean-shaven style is handsome for professional settings, but a full beard and a high fade always look exceptional.

A comb over fade is a timeless and masculine hairstyle that can look classy, professional and effortlessly stylish. The comb over can be paired with tapered sides for flattering contrast with the longer hair on top. You can also embrace your wild side with a bald fade for a daring look that will stand out.

Short curly hair can be more difficult to manage than straight styles, but embracing your natural curls during the summer offers a cute and flexible look for younger guys. It’s worth using a curling cream or gel to neatly define your coils. You can then pair the volume on top with cropped sides for visual interest.

A messy brush up combines long hair on top with cropped sides for a textured and refreshing summer style that looks effortlessly voluminous. The textured shape will flatter most face shapes and you can incorporate faded sides or an undercut for a youthful finish for a modern touch.

A slicked back undercut is a sleek and sexy hairstyle for guys who want an attractive look for warmer summer nights. You should comb or pull the hair back with a strong pomade or gel to secure damp locks and create light volume. For a dramatic and bold look, experiment with an undercut fade, shaved lines or hair designs.

A high and tight fade is a popular cut that features short tapered sides with longer hair for a clean and masculine look. A bold high bald fade always looks eye-catching, while tapered sides and low fades can be jazzed up with a few voluminous spikes on top.

Long surfer hair can be a casually cool style for guys who want a low-maintenance and flowing look. Naturally popular with surfer guys, a surfer hairstyle is a fun and youthful choice that will look great on vacation in California, Australia or any beachy environment. Growing your hair to the right length will take time, but you can style this look with a light-hold matte pomade or a texturizing sea salt spray for a beachy, textured finish.

A brush cut is a military style that combines a very short back and sides with minimal length on top for a cool and practical look that won’t require any styling. Not only can it hide a receding hairline, but your locks won’t get mussed or disturbed if you choose to wear a baseball cap at the beach.

Short shaggy hair is an ideal choice for guys with natural curls, offering a youthful, versatile and refreshing style that’s perfect for the warmer months. Get the back and sides neatly cropped for a classic look with tons of contrast before adding flow to the length on top with a pomade or clay. For an edgy style, consider a bald fade that blends seamlessly into the scalp.

A bro flow is a practical and rugged cut that works well for guys who don’t want to spend time styling their locks before enjoying the summer sun. You can leave your strands natural or tousled with a sea salt spray for a boyish and rugged appearance packed with volume. For a chic look, gently pull the hair backward using your fingers and a matte pomade for texture and light hold.

A blowout with a taper is a classy and flattering hairstyle that combines volume on top with tapered sides that blend gradually into the back. Combining a voluminous top with a low taper allows guys to rock a conservative and professional look that transitions perfectly from the office to the beach.

Nom: Hard Side Part with Faded Sides
Description: A hard side part with faded sides can allow you to create a textured and daring style that instantly draws the eye. The deep shaved part and faded sides bring visual interest and contrast to the longer hair on top. This haircut can then be brushed back with a matte pomade, wax or clay for lift and body.

A textured brush back can be a sexy and fashionable summer hairstyle for men blessed with thick locks. To achieve a timeless look, ask your barber to cut tapered sides or a sleek fade before working a sweat-resistant styling product through the length on top for an all-day hold.

A cropped Caesar with a long fringe is a modern and sophisticated look that offers guys a youthful and blended finish. The sides are usually shaved or faded to contrast the length on top, but you can experiment with a tapered look for something more subtle.

A faux hawk is a rebellious look for modern guys who want a daring style that instantly commands attention. This trendy cut can be paired with tapered or faded sides for a masculine edge and rocked with a sleek line up or shaved lines to highlight chiseled features.

A side-swept Ivy League is a low-maintenance cut that features a clipped back and sides for a clean-cut and cool look. Sweeping the hair to the side with a strong-hold pomade lets you add unbeatable volume to your locks. If you prefer a rugged and bohemian look, muss the front of your cut into a playful fringe.

A modern mohawk fade combines sexy tapered sides with a spiked top to create a daring style that’s surprisingly easy to work with. The fade slightly softens the traditional punk rocker look that usually features shaved sides, making it a great option for rebellious guys who want to retain a professional appearance.

A short pompadour is a classy and chic style that boasts impressive length and lift at the front of the head. The shorter length at the top removes a lot of styling time compared to longer cuts. You can achieve all-day hold with a medium-hold pomade, a comb and a light spritz of hairspray.

A ponytail is a simple and versatile summer look that never goes out of style. Depending on the heat and humidity where they live, guys can pull back long locks into an elegant high ponytail or flick it underneath a hair elastic for a modern and bohemian take on the classic man bun.

A short spiky hair fade isn’t for the faint of heart, but this trendy and textured style can be a great way to keep hair away from the neck on warmer days. It’s a good idea to create striking contrast and dimension with a bald fade, but don’t be afraid to incorporate shaved lines and highlights for a result that turns heads. For next-level volume, use a small amount of hair powder at the roots.

If you’re experiencing a really hot summer, a shaved head can be a suave and stylish way to keep cool. You can get a completely buzzed style with no facial hair if you have a strong jawline and handsome features. For something more forgiving, a small amount of stubble on the head paired with a light scruff on the chin and jaw can be extremely attractive.

A messy quiff with a skin fade is an effortlessly cool summer haircut that will always look fashionable and fresh. You can choose a high, mid or low fade depending on how short you want your cut to look. The result should be a heavily textured style that can be easily brushed back and tousled with pomade or clay.

Nom: Classic Taper on the Sides and Back
Description: A classic taper is an elegant haircut on the sides and back that uses clippers and scissors to seamlessly blend the hair for a youthful and refreshing style. It’s worth keeping extra length on top for a laid-back and breezy look that can be slicked back or worn naturally. This polished style is equally flattering as a short cut.

The short curly afro is a textured natural hairstyle for black men who want to show off their beautiful curls. To keep your afro looking slick and attractive, invest in high-quality moisturizing products that will strengthen your locks while adding shine and volume.

Waves are a classy and refreshing summer haircut for black men who want to incorporate texture and dimension into their style. You can get classic 360 waves with a sleek shape up and a full disconnected beard or a 180 cut with a high skin fade for a youthful vibe.

George Clooney has had countless short haircuts throughout his career. When looking for a George Clooney short hairstyle, the military-style crew cut he wore for several seasons on the hit show ER might be a recognizable example.
In “O Brother, Where Art Thou?” he wore a voluminous pompadour. He often switched between more mature styles in later years, such as a slicked-over side part with a thick salt-and-pepper beard, a charming side part quiff, or a short buzz cut paired with a full beard.

George Clooney with flowing stylish long hair was his signature look in the ‘80s. While it may be difficult to imagine him with long hair now, Clooney was proud to rock a thick, wavy mullet and a fashionably parted bro flow style when he was younger. At one point, he preferred a relatively short and curly mullet with hair that barely reached his shoulders.
A while later, he had grown it out to medium-length waves in the front and on top with hair well past his shoulders in the back. He wore another long style in 1990 when he was promoting the film Red Surf. This time, he shocked fans with gorgeous feathered layers cut into his shoulder-length hair. Many people believe these flowing hairstyles helped him reach heartthrob status.

The George Clooney Caesar cut is a classic style for men who want a short cropped look with bangs that fall over their forehead. During the 1990s, before his hair turned into a gorgeous salt-and-pepper color, Clooney cut his long, luxurious layers in favor of the standard Caesar haircut. The sides are trimmed only slightly shorter than the top, and the hair is gently swept over from a side part.
The defining feature of the Caesar cut is the modest wispy fringe adorning the forehead. With several cool variations, it’s hard to find anyone who can wear this style better. He even went back to it a few short years ago, and he paired it with a full beard.

George Clooney’s comb over is a modern and classy hairstyle for men who want a clean business professional look that will always be fashionable. While many men wear a comb over to hide thinning hair at the crown, George Clooney made it his signature formal style. Sometimes he swept it back and over, and sometimes he went for a dapper 1930s-inspired textured comb over.
To recreate this style, leave the hair on top three or more inches long, create a side part, and brush your hair over from the part. If you like the wet textured look, use a strong hold styling gel on damp hair, carefully comb the hair over from the side part, and let it air dry.

The George Clooney side part is an elegant gentleman’s style with a modern twist that looks cool and masculine on older men. In 1997, George Clooney’s face was on the cover of People magazine after he was dubbed the “Sexiest Man of the Year” For the photo, he wore a stunning textured side part that men around the world have emulated ever since.
The side part was fairly pronounced, and thanks to his naturally thick waves, a bit of texturizing pomade or spray added definition to individual sections of hair. Although this specific style is great for men who have a similar hair texture, George has worn multiple side part haircuts throughout the years that would look classy on thick, curly, wavy or straight hair.

If you want a casually cool look, the George Clooney messy hairstyle is an effortless choice for men who want to create a relaxed and youthful vibe. Most people know him for his flawless looks with every hair in its place, but Clooney is no stranger to messy styles.
In 1998, he shocked the entire world when paparazzi snapped photos of his new white-blonde messy style and glasses with thick black frames. It didn’t last long, though; he quickly grew it out into a classic side parted style and went back to his beautiful dark hair.

To add visual interest, George Clooney often styles a short spiky haircut to create volume and dimension. He has been known to sport a few more refined spiky hairstyles in his time, including the time he spiked up the front of his Caesar cut and paired it with a small but dapper black bow tie.
He’s worn a short pompadour with spikes in the front paired with a short silver beard, as well, and back in the 1990s, he sported a medium-length side part with some of the dark hair in the front spiked up for volume and height. More recently, he took the classic gentleman’s cut to the next level with a deep side part and brushed-up spikes in the front.

The George Clooney crew cut is a short, low-maintenance masculine style for guys who want an effortless look. To date, the crew cut is the shortest haircut the handsome actor has ever dared to wear. He’s sported it a few times during his career, first when his hair was still dark, and again more recently after his hair had turned silver. During the 1990s, he cropped the hair all over his head to less than an inch long, which drew attention to his very pronounced (at the time) widow’s peak.
At the 53rd London Film Festival in 1999, he wore a short crew cut with a barely noticeable side part and paired it with a perfectly shaven face. Finally, in 2009, he promoted “Up In The Air” with a very closely-cropped crew cut paired with thick sideburns.

The fade is the most popular teen boy haircut around the world because it works with and elevates any guy’s hairstyle. There are many types of fade haircuts to choose from so talk to your barber about the right faded cuts for you.
For a classy look that is clean-cut and fashionable, get a low taper fade. For a bold cut, a mid or high skin fade will create plenty of contrast and focus the eyes on your styling above.
With short hair on the sides and back and longer hair on top, your style will be modern, versatile and trendy. From tween boys to young men, fade haircuts will always look good.

An undercut is a fantastic option for teens that want to stand out because the contrast is stark and edgy. The undercut starts high on the sides and back and trims the hair short.
Stylish and cute, undercut haircuts are perfect for short, medium length and long hair on top.
For a shorter cut, guys can ask for an undercut fade and really highlight their cool hairstyle. Whether you want to style a comb over, quiff, slick back, shag top, or side swept fringe, girls will love this look on you.

Fresh and masculine, short haircuts for teen boys will always be trending because they are low-maintenance, sleek, and hot. The best short hairstyles start with a fade or undercut on the sides and back to complement the short hair on top. For an easy yet flattering cut, get a mid to high skin fade or a disconnected undercut.
From a crew cut with a fringe to short and spiky hair to a high-volume messy top, there are a number of styles to experiment with. Use a high-hold hair product like pomade or wax to keep your hairstyle in place all day.

For teenage guys who want a little length to play with on top, medium hairstyles offer the perfect balance. Boys with medium length hair can style many of the most popular looks. With tapered, faded, or undercut sides and longer hair on top, you can style a comb over, faux hawk, slicked back hair, angular fringe, quiff, bro flow or loose brush up.
With endless styling options, medium length haircuts are ideally styled with low hold products like cream, clay or mousse for a textured, natural finish. Maximize volume and girls will swoon over your thick, lush hair.

Sexy and unique, teen boys who prefer long hairstyles have a variety of styles to choose from. Whether you want long hair on top with short sides or a long style all around, you’ll need to grow your hair out for awhile. Fortunately, long haircuts offer the styling flexibility to pull off a casual look with minimal effort.
Best for guys with wavy, thick or straight hair, you can get long layered hair that is shoulder length and flowing. Alternatively, you can tie up your hair into a man bun for a hipster vibe. Use a matte product for a textured finish that will give your hair a natural shine.

If you have thick hair that’s full of volume, a quiff is an iconic hairstyle that has is casual and classy for guys. Timeless and easy, the quiff haircut is a trend that all boys in middle school to high school should experiment with. To get the modern quiff style, get short tapered sides with short medium to longer hair on top.
Apply pomade, wax or clay through your hair and brush it back with your fingers. Leave the styling loose and textured for a natural flow. Blow-dry it into place for volume and movement.

The comb over haircut continues to be one of the most versatile and handsome styles to get for school. Whether you’re a 13, 14, or 15 year old boy or a young college student, the comb over can be styled in an edgy way for a cool look. From an undercut to a taper fade on the sides and back, you’ll want this cut to be a short sides, long top hairstyle.
Style your comb over to the side or diagonally for lift. Use a light touch for volume and to avoid a flat over-brushed look. Great for straight, thick, and wavy hair, you can’t go wrong with a cool comb over.

All the best new hairstyles for teenage boys come in textured styles for a natural, healthy look. Textured hair is achieved with a low-shine or matte hair product. This styling technique serves to thicken your hair naturally for a fuller look.
Moreover, textured hairstyles look clean as opposed to overly-shiny, greasy, or oily. Add texture for a natural finish to a comb over, quiff, pompadour, brush back, faux hawk, or any of your favorite styles.

While slicked back hair has traditionally been a retro style, there are modern ways to do slicked back hairstyles with new trends in mind. The slicked back undercut tends to be the most popular variation, but the brushed back taper fade is an excellent choice, too.
With short sides and medium to longer hair on top, this teen guy haircut takes some styling, but is easy to pull off. Use a small amount of low or high shine pomade and slick your hair straight back for a smooth, sleek look.

Wavy hair is perfect for teenage boys who want a cool style for their unique texture. Although long and medium-length locks can be hard work, the trick is to grow your waves out, keep your hair hydrated and conditioned, and use just the right amount of product.
From messy all over to pulled back, make sure to use your fingers instead of a brush or comb for a relaxed finish. Your fingers make the waves appear more natural and add texture.

The crew cut has always been one of the best haircuts for boys, especially if you want easy-to-maintain short hair. While some crew cuts are the same length all around, the modern crew cut fade delivers more contrast for an edgy style.
With faded sides and slightly longer hair on top, the crew cut hairstyle offers a masculine and athletic cut for active teens. Add a line up to create a sharp trim along the hairline. Fresh and stylish, it’s a good haircut for school and the summer months. To change things up, guys can sweep the front to the sides or comb it down to create a short fringe.

The classic taper haircut is ideal if you want a timeless look. With scissor-cut sides as opposed to a fade, the taper keeps the sides longer for a softer look. The extra length works well with medium to long hairstyles. Style your hair with sea salt spray or a lightweight clay to boost flow and texture.

Unlike 90s styles, spiky hairstyles today come with textured thick spikes formed with wax or pomade. No longer is gelled spiky hair the look you want. With a fade or undercut on the sides and back, opt for short haircut on top. A high or mid bald fade is incredibly flattering in contrast to the distinct spikes.
Then choose a high-quality styling product that won’t dry out or flake. Sexy and charming, your spiky hair can be styled messy and pointing in all direction or in a uniform shape for consistency. Either way, a teen’s spiky hairstyle is sure to impress when done properly.

With a fade on the sides and longer hair on top that is brushed up and out, the blowout haircut can be styled at different lengths with a variety of styles.
From a taper to a skin fade and short to medium length hair, this hairstyle is great for teen boys of all ages. If you want volume, texture, and a cool look, blowout fade styles are all the range this year.

A messy fringe is a smart way to switch up a long or medium length style without too much effort styling your hair. With short to longer hair all around on top, all you need to do is let your bangs grow out and style them naturally by letting them fall across your forehead.
Applying clay or wax will allow you to play around with your hair and incorporate texture with a laid back vibe. Ask your barber to cut the sides and back shorter for contrast that will focus on the messy fringe hairstyle on top.

Similar to the Caesar cut, the French crop is a modern short hairstyle for guys with cropped bangs and even shorter sides. The most common variation of the cut is the crop top fade haircut, although you can always go for the undercut on the sides and back.
The short cropped top can be combed forward or styled messy, and the styling is often left textured for a natural finish. With so many haircut ideas for teen guys, the fact that the crop top is trending all over Europe and the US is testament to the styles unique aesthetic.

Also known as a ‘fro, the afro is a popular hairstyle for black men who naturally grow out their kinky or curly hair texture. Huge in the 60’s, 70’s, and 80’s, the afro hairstyle is a stylish way to let your full head of thick hair take center stage. Of course, you also have to ensure that the extra volume is a gift and not a curse.
To do that, black teen boys can cut the curls shorter so that they aren’t as wild and combine the style with a taper fade on the sides. Even an undercut works well with an afro as it provides a level of contrast that you wouldn’t normally associate with the haircut. Add flair to the style with bleach or highlights to grab attention when you walk into a room.

A faux hawk is the classy and versatile version of the mohawk. Also known as a fohawk, the faux hawk fade is an excellent alternative to the mohawk with shaved sides. Synonymous with teenage boys because it’s rebellious and daring, the fohawk haircut looks edgy and bold but still allows you to style other hairstyles.
To make a faux hawk simple to style, tell your barber you want a mid to high fade on the sides. For a shorter cut, ask for a skin fade and you’ll have the closest cut to a mohawk. This way, when you mold the longer hair on top into position, it should contrast perfectly against your back and sides. Add a strong hold pomade to the mix so that your hair stays in place all day.

Bold and masculine, the buzz cut is one shortest haircuts you can get before you shave your head. While some guys like buzzed hair all around, the ideal trim is the buzz cut fade. With faded sides and very short hair on top, the cut creates some blending and contrast.
Reserved for guys with sharp features like a chiseled jawline and high cheekbones, the buzz cut haircut is truly an alpha guy’s haircut. Add a shape up to the hairline and grow a beard for a very manly finish. Similar styles include the military-inspired high and tight and short crew cut with a side swept fringe.

The side part is a classic boy’s hairstyle that has stood the test of time, making it suitable for all teenage boys. While you can always opt for the traditional version with tapered sides and short hair parted to the side, we recommend the modern side part fade. Smooth, soft, and perfect for the modern gentleman, the side part with a fade haircut will underscore your boyish charm.
While a low taper fade is more conservative, teens can ask for a mid or high bald fade for an edgier look. Apply pomade and use a comb to sweep the hair to one side and create a clean-cut look. Add a thick shaved line for a hard side part hairstyle that is sure to stand out.

For rebels and guys who want to look like bad boys, the mohawk can be the right hairstyle. However, if shaving your sides seems too intense, the mohawk fade has become the new trend. Pair a high skin fade or burst fade haircut on the sides and back with short to long hair on top and you can enjoy all the benefits of being a fashionable punk.
Run a strong pomade or styling product through and style the distinct spikes you want. Another option is to keep the style less extreme and more brushed back with a thick strip of hair in the middle.

If you have naturally straight thick hair, then you may prefer to keep your hair short and easy to maintain. Thick hairstyles work better with a taper fade haircut on the sides and back. Alternatively, a disconnected undercut with longer hair can look textured and elegant in equal measure.
The best hairstyles for teenage guys with straight thick hair require proper hair care. A high-quality shampoo and conditioner that moisturizes, softens, and conditions your hair will ensure volume without frizz.

The curly hair fade is one of the best short hairstyles for teen boys with curly hair. Thick curls can be a pain to manage and style, so curly hair teenage guys often want a short haircut to minimize the trouble. A taper fade haircut on the sides can trim and blend your hair for a low-maintenance look. Keep the hairstyle on top short to medium length for some styling flexibility.
When styling a curly hairstyle, you’ll want to start with fresh, clean hair. A top-rated shampoo and conditioner is necessary for hydration, volume, and frizz control. After towel-drying, apply sea salt spray, pomade, or a curl-enhancing smoothie for a balance of control and moisture. Comb or brush your hair into place and finish by blow-drying on light heat.

Whether you have fine hair or a big forehead you want to cover up, the Caesar haircut is a stylish look to consider. As a ’90s hairstyle for men that is making a comeback, the Caesar cut is often styled with a fade or undercut and a textured top.
You can do this by combing your hair forward so that it creates a fringe along your hairline, and ruffling the middle section so that it’s messy without being wild.

If you want to make your haircut unique and fun, talk to your barber about adding hair designs to your cut. Cool haircut designs are a barbershop trend that lets teens embrace their defiant, formative years by shaving a lines, shapes, logos, and creative styles into the sides and back of their hair.
Your barber will use a clipper or detailer to shave your desired design into your undercut or fade haircut. Experiment with different hair cuts and let your personality shine.

Similar to a quiff or pompadour but with more volume and height, brushed back hair is cool and sexy. Also known as a blowback, this high-volume textured style is one of the best haircuts for high school boys because it’s casual, modern and trendy. After all, teen girls love guys with nice thick longer hair who look like they don’t care. Whether you choose a taper fade or undercut, the cut looks flattering with short sides and long hair on top.
To get the look, brush your hair back with a comb and then loosen the strands by running your fingers through. Apply a matte hair product with medium hold that will stay in place without feeling stiff. For extra hold, use a blow-dryer on low heat while you push your hair up and back.

The Ivy League is a longer crew cut with a side swept fringe, creating a stylish variation that elevates the look. Also known as the Harvard or Princeton haircut, the Ivy League hairstyle is great for preppy teenage boys who want a clean-cut, masculine image.
Styled by Hollywood heartthrobs Zac Efron and Ryan Gosling, you can keep some length on the sides with a taper haircut or go shorter with a fade or undercut. To be able to sweep the hair in the front or style a combed over hairstyle, leave the top with short to medium length hair. A high shine pomade will enhance the final look.

Messy and cute, shag hairstyles maintain length for a simple, chill look. Growing into one of the most trendy haircuts for boys, the shag can be paired with a taper fade on the sides and back or styled with long hair all around. Whether you want to style a shaggy mop top one day or a quiff, faux hawk, or comb over another, teen boys will love the versatility of this haircut style.
Another benefit is that tousled shaggy hairstyles look good with straight, thick, fine, or wavy hair. Of course, if you want to hide an uneven hairline or a large forehead, you can do nothing and let the fringe fall naturally. From short to medium long hair, use a light hair product to keep the cut natural and textured.

Don’t be ashamed of your curls. While curly hair may require more effort than straight hair, hairstyles for curly boys are packed with volume and texture for a unique look no one else can pull off. If you’re done with letting your kinks grow out, get a low, mid or high fade on the sides to focus the eyes on the styling above. For an easy style, keep the hair on top short to medium length.
Hairstyles for teenage guys with curly hair can be brushed up for volume, combed forward to create a fringe, left naturally messy, or cut very short to control the curls. By sectioning off your hair, it helps you to achieve a unique curly style that’s trendy and cool. Curly hair teen boys have access to a variety of cuts and styles, so you’ll never feel bored with your look.

The pompadour has been a modern teen hairstyle for years now. Whether you style it short or longer, the pomp fade is a great way to show off your healthy thick hair. To do a pompadour, you need to take your quiff to the next level by styling the front and middle sections of your hair up and to the back.
For extra creativity, guys can even brush it up and to the side for a unique diagonal finish. A disconnected undercut will give your cut more definition, especially if your hair is curly or wavy, but the pompadour fade still reigns supreme.

An angular fringe with side swept hair is the latest hairstyle for boys to enjoy. While styling a fringe has been fashionable since the curtains hairstyle became a hit in the 90s, teen guys are embracing the look now more than ever.
Coming from the emo culture that stemmed from the punk generation before it, swept hairstyles are chic and rebellious. However, the new style is also big with preppy and pretty boys, making it popular all-around. The difference comes down to the styling. Use a matte product for texture to soften and smooth out the look.

Dreadlocks are perfect for black teens who want a cool style to suit their personality. From the dread fade to the dreaded undercut with hair tied up in the back, this hairstyle is versatile and refreshing.
While long dreads continue to be stylish, most boys choose short dreads for easier upkeep. You can also transition your look to a braided hairstyle like cornrows or box braids for a new style.

For teenage guys with really long hair, the man bun is a go-to choice. Long hair boys may not always want to style and deal with their locks, and the bun can be a great hairstyle that’s easy to do and maintain.
To do a man bun, just pull all your hair back into a bun and tie it up with a band or by wrapping the extra strands around the base. Your man bun can be neat or messy, but the style will always look rugged and charming.

Teen boys with layered hair are blessed to be able to style all the coolest hairstyles. Layers are great if you have thick hair that needs to be thinned out for easy styling. You’ll want to talk to your stylist about layering and the haircut you want. Short, medium or long, there is plenty of inspiration for layered haircuts.

If you have shoulder length or long hair, then experiment with a fluid hairstyle called the bro flow. Created just for medium and longer hair, this flowing hairstyle is brushed back and often pulled behind the ears.
The flow haircut can keep length on the sides or cut the hair short, but the most important part is that the hair on top grows out enough to sweep back. Keep your styling products light and to a minimum for good movement and volume.

Brad Pitt is a world-famous American actor and producer best known for appearing in Seven, Mr. & Mrs. Smith and Once Upon a Time in Hollywood. These Brad Pitt haircut styles are timeless, stylish and masculine looks from his impressive career, making him an iconic celebrity. From the sleek undercut and slick back from his time in Fury to his long and beachy locks in Troy, this attractive star proves that he has the angular bone structure to pull off any style.

David Beckham is a professional soccer player and style icon who has inspired several haircut styles for guys. A heavily textured and slicked-back style is his calling card for high-profile events, but it’s his low-maintenance and youthful buzz cut that turned him into an international heartthrob. Whether he’s modeling for Calvin Klein or working as an ambassador for UNICEF, Beckham’s hair is always center stage.

George Clooney is the definition of a silver fox and has been breaking hearts since his first role as Dr. Doug Ross on NBC’s ER back in 1999. Despite being over 60, Clooney has managed to hold onto his timeless thick locks which give this sexy actor a professional and sophisticated appearance. He’s usually found sporting a modern comb over with a matching beard on the red carpet, but his salt-and-pepper side sweep was all the rage in the early 2000s.

Ryan Reynolds is a popular male celebrity who has become known as Hollywood’s funnyman. He has showcased his good looks in everything from The Proposal to Deadpool. Reynolds keeps his style simple but refined and usually sports a defined Ivy League hairstyle for a clean-cut look. In his younger years, this charming guy experimented with a voluminous pompadour, quiff and shaggy haircuts.

Tom Hardy is a fashionable and rugged British actor who always looks perfectly groomed. Although he wasn’t afraid to buzz his hair for a military-based role in Black Hawk Down, this attractive star looks just as trendy sporting spiked hairstyles and an unkempt beard when he’s off-set.

Henry Cavill first burst onto the scene playing Charles Brandon in The Tudors, but this mountain of a man secured his spot amongst Hollywood’s top stars portraying Superman in the DC Extended Universe. Because Cavill has flattering dark locks and a thick head of hair, he’s usually seen wearing a sexy gentleman’s cut with a clearly defined side sweep and sharp lines.

Ryan Gosling became a household name after his breathtaking performance in The Notebook alongside Rachel McAdams. He won the hearts of women around the world with his floppy layers and mid-length textured cut, but he’s equally popular for his sharp short sides and charming side part.

Bradley Cooper is an American actor, director and filmmaker who is best known for his work on The Hangover, Silver Linings Playbook and A Star Is Born. Although he’s a chameleon when it comes to his hair, it’s Cooper’s signature medium-length swept-back style that won him People Magazine’s Sexiest Man Alive Award in 2011. But don’t be surprised if you catch him reprising his old-school short and spiky cut in a few years!

Nick Jonas is the youngest member of the iconic boyband The Jonas Brothers. This attractive star has also showcased his talent in Les Misérables, Smash and Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle. He started his career with adorable long curls, but he eventually ditched this youthful style for a sophisticated and tapered crew cut that convinced the Indian beauty Priyanka Chopra to say: “I Do”.

Chris Hemsworth is best known for playing Thor in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, but this Australian celebrity started his career in the beloved series Home and Away. He has rocked parted long hair, a versatile crew cut with a disheveled vibe and a stylish side sweep with volume. Classy and iconic, the Chris Hemsworth hairstyle is generally a long, sleek and pulled-back look.

Leonardo DiCaprio began stealing hearts in Titanic, but his boyish charm and unmatched talent have landed him roles in everything from The Wolf of Wall Street to The Great Gatsby. This Hollywood veteran is usually seen rocking a parted slick back which draws attention to his striking features, but the soft bangs and floppy haircut he wore as Jack Dawson will never go out of style.

Channing Tatum is an American actor who first danced onto our screens in the 2006 movie Step Up. Since then, he’s appeared in blockbuster flicks like Magic Mike, 21 Jump Street and The Hateful Eight. Based on his filming schedule, Tatum can be seen wearing a daring buzz cut, handsome taper fade with spiky hair or a short crew cut.

Colton Haynes is an American actor and model who rose to prominence playing Jackson Whittemore on MTV’s Teen Wolf. He’s often seen with a slightly formal and clean-cut style with a taper, but don’t be surprised to see him experimenting with playful spikes during interviews and at public events.

Drake is a Canadian rapper and singer who has become a successful star. This handsome celebrity has never been afraid to showcase his natural locks and sported a curly afro during the early years of his career. These days, he’s partial to a slick buzz cut with a daring line-up and a masculine beard.

Keanu Reeves is a Canadian actor who first graced our screens in Bill & Ted’s Excellent Adventure with an overgrown mop top. Since his starring role in The Matrix, he’s continued growing his luscious locks and is best known for his center part and silky long hair. This disheveled look has served him well for years and he shows no signs of chopping his strands anytime soon.

Jake Gyllenhaal is an American actor who first rose to fame starring in the 2004 flick The Day After Tomorrow. You might recognize him for his incredible work in Nightcrawler, Love & Other Drugs and Spider-Man: Far From Home. Gyllenhaal usually supports his all-American appeal with a side-swept crew cut, but he’s switched up his look with a dapper comb over and a daring buzz cut over the years.

Bad Bunny is a Puerto Rican rapper and singer who is widely recognized for his reggaeton and Latin trap tunes. After skyrocketing to the top of the charts with “Diles”, this talented musician leaned into his signature style by rocking everything from protective braids to dyed buzz cuts at his sold-out concerts.

Christian Bale is a renowned English actor who started his career in Empire of the Sun at just 13 years old. Since then, he’s impressed critics with his committed performances in The Machinist, The Dark Knight and Vice. Bale likes to wear a clean-cut and slicked-back hairstyle with a side part, but he’s most comfortable with long hair and a touch of rugged stubble.

Justin Timberlake is a popular male celebrity who first rose to fame as a member of the Mickey Mouse Club in the late 1990s. Although he’s better known for his solo singing and acting career, the star’s N-Sync days were responsible for the rise of infamous frosted tips. He’s embraced his natural curls throughout his career, but never fails to turn heads with a sleek slick back and a hint of manly scruff.

Adam Levine is regarded as one of the most famous musicians in the world thanks to his work as lead vocalist and guitarist of the pop band Maroon 5. Since the singer’s rise to global stardom in 2002, Levine has showcased his signature style with everything from refined crew cuts to trendy faux cuts and dapper comb overs.

Zayn Malik is one of England’s finest exports who first rose to prominence as a member of the pop band One Direction. Malik has channeled his inner wild child with spiked hair and pastel dyes, but he’s also a fan of fashionable pompadours that showcase his gloriously thick locks.

Maluma is an attractive Colombian singer, songwriter and actor who has been rocking the radio waves since he was 16. Although he’s best known for his hit song “Qué Pena”, fans will also recognize Maluma from the movie Marry Me with Jennifer Lopez. Whether he’s rocking a low-maintenance buzz cut, a relaxed man bun or a bohemian bob, this edgy superstar remains the envy of all.

Timothee Chalamet is an irresistible American actor who has been impressing audiences since his first appearance in Homeland in 2012. Known for his boyish charm and relaxed personality, Chalamet is usually seen with long and tousled layers that highlight his naturally thick strands.

Harry Styles has carved an extraordinary solo career from the ashes of One Direction to become one of the most successful singers in the world. Although he’ll always be remembered for the curly mop of hair from his X-Factor days, Harry Styles has also turned heads with long bohemian waves, a disheveled side part and a modern short hairstyle.

Johnny Depp is an iconic actor who remains best known for playing the clumsy and loveable Captain Jack Sparrow in Pirates of the Caribbean. From the Elvis-like quiff in Cry Baby and the bold low ponytail in Chocolat to his everyday loose waves, this popular actor proves that he’s able to rock just about any style with confidence.

Best known for his enviable physique and next-level resume, Michael B. Jordan is an American actor who deserves every coveted role he lands. While he’s typically seen with a flattering buzz cut that highlights his chiseled jaw, you can’t beat his badass dreadlocks and contrasting fade in Black Panther.

Chris Evans is a classically handsome American actor who has been stealing hearts since appearing as Johnny Storm in Fantastic Four and Captain America in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. To highlight his angular features, he keeps his cut simple with an effortless side sweep that is slicked to perfection. You’ll occasionally see him clean-shaven, but Evans often dials up his sex appeal with a well-groomed beard.

Simu Liu is relatively new to the film industry, but this Asian-Canadian actor made major waves in Hollywood with his performance in Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings. He’s a big fan of a classic comb over and side sweep, but he’s also showcased his wild side with a bold bleached look.

Simon Baker is an Australian actor who has starred in hit flicks like The Mentalist, The Guardian and The Devil Wears Prada. He’s blessed with natural blonde locks and is most commonly seen with long waves that are sometimes slicked back or swept to the side for a playful and refreshing feel.

Tom Holland is an English actor who started his career in the West End production of Billy Elliot. Fans will be most familiar with his portrayal of the friendly neighborhood Spiderman! Holland has always embraced his youthful energy and wears his mid-length wavy hair in a textured and soft style that is occasionally slicked back for red carpet events.

Snoop Dogg is an American rapper who has been dazzling the music industry since the release of “Deep Cover” in 1993. Snoop Dogg’s hairstyle has been classic braided pigtails, cornrows and dreadlocks, but fans should keep an eye out for his slicked-back ponytail at formal events.

While he may be better known for his award-winning performance on Peaky Blinders, Cillian Murphy has been bona fide Hollywood royalty since his first appearance in 28 Days Later. Murphy is no stranger to radical hairstyles as he wore his hair in a daring texturized crop as gangster Tommy Shelby. When he’s off the clock, you’re more likely to catch him with a shaggy side part and long locks.

James Dean was one of the most iconic American actors of his time and remains a symbol of rebellion and self-expression for guys around the world. Whether he was starring in Rebel Without a Cause or East of Eden, Dean was turning heads with a slightly messy swept-back style that works beautifully with natural volume.

Oscar Isaac is a Guatemalan-American actor who has been treading the boards since the early 2000s. Although you might recognize him from X-Men: Apocalypse, this famous face has appeared in everything from Robin Hood and Scenes from a Marriage to the 2021 blockbuster Dune. He keeps his look refined on the red carpet with a dapper quiff and an elegant side sweep that showcases his natural curls or mid-length locks with a disheveled feel for casual days.

Liam Hemsworth is a clean-cut Australian actor who first rose to fame as Josh Taylor in Neighbours and Gale Hawthorne in The Hunger Games. As he has sharp features and dazzling blue eyes, Hemsworth usually opts for an old-school quiff that’s lightly swept to the side to add a hint of texture to his look.

Zac Efron is a stylish and sexy American actor who has been charming audiences since his breakout performance in High School Musical. While he may have left the soft side-swept fringe of his Troy Bolton days behind, his masculine buzz cuts and messy tousled hair of his later years are just as attractive.

Ashton Kutcher is an American actor, producer and entrepreneur who has maintained a stylish hairstyle. Whether he’s keeping his look casual with a mop top or dressing up for the red carpet with a short tapered style and a side sweep, this handsome devil remains a style icon.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: The long beard is a stylish look that can take time and effort to grow. While a challenge to achieve, this thick and rounded style is designed to create a striking contrast with your bald head. Grow out a rugged Viking beard for an old-school masculine feel or keep the hair well-groomed with moisturizing oils and regular trims. To elongate your face, trim the sides neatly and keep the bottom slightly longer for a chiseled appearance.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: A full stubble beard can give a casual and sexy look that you can easily maintain with an electric shaver. Try to keep the stubble even around the entire face, but feel free to blend your facial hair with any regrowth on the head for an edgy and cool feel that looks intentional.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: The long boxed beard is a worthy choice for any man with the ability to grow thicker facial hair. Whether you are balding or have a buzz cut, the sharp angles around the chin allow you to shape your jawline while the impressive length provides modern and refreshing contrast with a clean-shaven head.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: If you have trouble growing a full beard, keep your look boyish and rugged with a heavy scruff. To achieve a bedhead feel that doesn’t look overly styled, leave a few stray hairs around the mustache or the bottom of the chin for a wild appearance that oozes charisma.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: A full-rounded beard is an excellent option for guys who want to add softness to square faces or tone down the harsh appearance of a fully shaved head. Keep the sides and the front of your beard evenly trimmed for a sleek finish that highlights your masculine features without overwhelming them.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: A long thick beard pairs well with a bald head as it creates daring contrast while adding dimension to rounder faces. This iconic beard uses long strands and meticulous grooming along the sides and around the mustache to create a badass biker feel that will have all eyes on you.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: A bushy beard can be a rugged way to showcase your carefree personality. This style works well with even volume around the face and minimal patchiness, but you can create an edgy and refreshing style by playing around with different lengths near the chin and around the sides.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: While a short full beard might look simple, it’s a dapper and reliable style that is easy to maintain for most guys. You will need a quality beard trimmer and to grow your facial hair out to achieve a uniform and crisp look.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: A lined-up beard is a sleek and suave pick for guys wanting to naturally add structure to the face with sharp angles and light fading. For a manly appearance keep the neck and chin lines defined from ear to ear and trim the beard hair until it is completely uniform.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: Guys with slightly shorter facial hair can create breathtaking contrast and playful texture with a classic scruff. To avoid a patchy and one-dimensional look, keep the length short enough to show a hint of skin and make sure all lines around the neck and cheeks are clearly defined.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: The full goatee is a stylish facial hair style that takes confidence to pull off, making it a cool choice for guys with strong facial features. The rounded and elongated shape of the goatee can add effortless definition to rounder faces and men with darker hair and pale skin can easily achieve dramatic contrast with a neatly clipped and clean-cut style.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men

The extreme contrast between the untrimmed sides and neckline creates a rugged look and the extra length acts as a badge of honor for most men. For Viking flair, play around with light braids or mustache twists.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: Guys with chiseled jawlines can fashion their facial hair into an enviable angled beard. The sharp angles and uniform length of this style create a defined structure by the cheek, giving even round faces a striking contour. To add more dimension, add light fading around the ears.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: A rounded full beard with no mustache can allow you to skip the facial hair on the upper lip for an edgy look. The no-mustache style is a bold trim for men who want to elongate their face with a rugged design.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: You can rock the clean-shaven look if you want to take advantage of a naturally sculpted jawline and a clear complexion. You’ll get smooth and sleek results with a straight razor, but electric razors are a convenient option for men who need to maintain the look by shaving each morning.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: For a stylish and trendy look for guys, put down the razor and embrace the heavy stubble beard. Having perma-stubble on the face requires regular trims but you can maintain the perfect five o’clock shadow by gently trimming your beard every two or three days.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: A stylish boxed beard with neatly trimmed sides and sleek cropping will keep your look manly and clean-cut. The neat and even trimming around the entire face instantly adds shape to a round jawline while a thick mustache and texture around the chin add depth and dimension to square and diamond faces.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: To draw attention to thick facial hair and highlight strong facial features, consider a Van Dyke beard. But the old-school charm and effortless masculinity that you’ll get from this advanced style are worth the effort.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men

Blend the hair seamlessly for a relaxed style or use your razor to create sharp lines for a more dramatic feel.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: The sexy salt and pepper beard is a stylish choice for older men who want to show off their graying facial hair. You can keep this style long for a classic and clean feel or leave it slightly longer to showcase more a textured two-toned look.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: If you have impressive facial hair but don’t want to deal with the upkeep of longer styles, a medium-length beard is ideal. Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: The short faded beard adds dimension and interest to a relatively low-maintenance hairstyle. Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: The short lumberjack beard is designed for guys who adore the look of thick and rugged beards. You’ll need to grow a full beard and a long mustache to achieve the traditional handlebar style, but you can also keep your look timeless with a uniform trim around the chin and the cheeks.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: A thick and round beard allows guys with sharp, angular features to soften their look with a sleek style. The circular shape creates a clean and uniform appearance that won’t look out of place at the office or the club.

Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: Styling a short Van Dyke beard is a playful and contemporary look that never fails to command attention. Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: When you want to channel your inner rebel, a thick and daring lumberjack beard is the way to go. Titre: 29 Best Beard Styles For Bald Men
Description: If you’ve lost the majority of your hair up top but want to create a masculine appearance with scruff, the silver fox look is extremely flattering. While boys short haircuts will always be in style, long hair on top has been a strong trend in recent years. With short faded sides and longer spiky hair, these types of cool haircuts for boys are trendy and edgy.

As kids haircut styles continue to evolve, you’ll notice a couple unique twists in the example above: the line up around the temples and hairline, and the hard part shaved into the hair to create a cool side part. This awesome look will keep your little boy super thrilled about his latest haircut.

Nom: Comb Over with Hard Part and Skin Fade
Description: The comb over continues to be a cute boys haircut that styles great on every kid. Versatile and dapper, this modern comb over hairstyle is paired with a fade on the sides and hard part. If your little boy has thick, straight hair, he can get away with styling the look naturally without product. However, a good pomade or gel for kids will offer a beautiful shine with some control for special occasions.

The taper fade is a popular short haircut style for boys who want a cool and low-maintenance. The most common short hairstyles are the crew cut, comb over, side part, faux hawk, brushed forward crop and other modern looks.
With short sides to create contrast and highlight the short hair on top, the styling is textured for a natural finish. This stylish short style also incorporates side swept hair in the front for a modern, cute look. We recommend using a little matte hair product for the perfect amount of texture, volume, and flow. For an easy-to-get, simple-to-style kids haircut, this example is an all-around favorite.

Fun and effortlessly stylish, longer hair is a cool choice for boys who want to show off their texture, volume and flow. Long hairstyles can suit all textures and occasions, making these an easy to get if your little boy can grow his hair out. Whether you have curly, wavy, thick or straight hair, kids can show off their unique personality.

With a taper fade haircut on the sides and long curly hair hanging off the forehead, this trendy hairstyle stands out. The style also delivers volume and movement without rigidity, making it a perfect school boy haircut for active kids.

Description: For a more edgy fade haircut for boys, try this slicked back fade with hair design. The mid fade looks great on the sides and back, and the unique blending is super modern and short. With short to medium-length hair on top, boys have the ability to style a variety of good looks. This textured hairstyle features a brushed back top for easy styling.

The faux hawk has always been a cool hairstyle for little boys. With short sides and long hair on top, kids are able to style some of the best hairstyles. Loose, textured, and natural has been the growing trend in recent years, so this faux hawk for little boys is on point and worth trying.

A textured modern quiff is a trendy style for older boys who want to make a cool statement and still have styling options. With a short fade or undercut on the sides to accentuate the longer hair on top, the quiff hairstyle will require some styling prowess. To keep it in place and styled nicely all day, boys will need a medium to strong hold pomade or cream. Considered very fashionable, we highly recommend this look as a middle school boy’s haircut.

The choppy layers give this cut a casual and chill look, while the length allows them to experiment with everything from comb-overs to faux hawks if they want to switch things up.

A cool medium-length hairstyle can be a balanced look for boys that offers dimension and fullness to achieve a fashionable finish. The most popular medium haircuts generally have fades or undercuts on the sides and back with longer styles on top. The short sides are low-maintenance and simple, while the medium-length hair can accommodate several handsome hairstyles. You can slick it all back, brush it forward to create bangs, let it flow naturally, or comb it over for a clean-cut look.

Long hair is back with a bang, and boys with sleek and straight hair can take advantage of their natural texture with messy and flowing locks. Feel free to style bangs into place with a light pomade, but this cut can easily be brushed back or pulled behind the ears for a no-nonsense and fluid feel.

Nom: Short Taper Fade with Spiky Hair
Description: Allow your kids to embrace their wild side with devilish spikes and edgy tapered sides. Description: The spiky ivy league style works beautifully with a low fade to create a smart and sophisticated cut for boys. Description: If your older child wants to experiment with highlights and bold colors, spiky blonde highlights are a great choice. Pair the long and daring spikes with subtly faded sides for a sharp and refreshing style that looks rebellious without being unkempt.

For a look that will always stand out from the crowd, try a hard side part with a daring taper. Pulling the hair to one side creates fascinating asymmetry while the hard part and tapering keep the style looking clean-cut and effortlessly slick.

A stylish brushed up fringe is an easy way to create volume, texture and lift at the top of the head. It’s a good idea to use a medium-hold pomade or wax to muss the hair for a rebellious feel, but boys with thick hair can rock their natural locks by lightly brushing the hair back with a light hold product.

With so many short to medium-length hairstyles to choose from, sometimes the easiest look is to style messy, textured hair on top. Mixed boys have a range of cuts and styles to choose from, and it’s important that all kids find the right haircuts to make them look and feel good. Description: The side part haircut is a classic hairstyle that will allow boys to pull off an iconic gentleman’s look. Add in fresh tapered sides and a shaved line for a hard part and you have a modern version that stands out.

Description: Rocking a taper fade with a strong part and a dapper comb-over is a youthful and eye-catching style that will make any boy king of the schoolyard. This style can be slicked back with gel for an irresistible look or paired with a radical taper fade for an edgy style that showcases his boisterous side.

With the right pomade or wax, you can transform unruly hair into a flattering and spiky style with youthful and refreshing contrast. Spiking the hair upward is a popular choice, but boys might want to mess around with direction and have their sides completely buzzed to keep things fun and fresh.

The textured crop is one of the top styles for young boys, and the addition of an angular fringe adds visual interest that frames the face. Keep the top layers choppy for an undone look and go for a side-swept fringe with varying lengths for a daring finish.

Nom: Thick Layered Hair and Taper Fade
Description: Boys with thick hair have several cool options for haircuts, but bold layering paired with a contrasting taper fade never fails to impress. A low taper fade is perfect for school-age kids but adding spikes and texture with pomade takes things to the next level.

Nom: Side Swept Short Hair and High Taper Fade
Description: The short waves, light texture and serious contrast in this dapper cut create a clean-cut and stylish finish that boys adore. The high taper fade gives this hairstyle a daring feel and you can even incorporate a hard part or subtle shaved design for a fun summer style.

Nom: Classic Side Part and Low Taper Fade
Description: For a clean and suave style that’s perfect for special occasions, you can’t go wrong with a classic side part. It’s best to keep the taper fade low for a clean-cut and charming feel, but you can create a deep side part to flatter a child’s features and add shape and texture to the style.

Justin Timberlake’s short hair has taken many forms over the years. As a men’s style icon in Hollywood, the undercut was one of his best looks and marked a change in his public persona from the preppy young star to famous musician. His signature haircut style featured a taper fade on the sides and back with longer hair on top for an effortlessly stylish look. This hairstyle gave the star flexibility to rock red-carpet events with a formal side part or keep his look cool and casual with subtle texture for everyday wear.
If you want to sport Timberlake’s short hairstyles, you’ll want to ask your barber for a mid to high fade with 2 to 4 inches of length on top. You can style your hair messy and textured, parted to the side for a comb over, or keep it really short to get a high and tight.
For a balanced look, you’ll want to try a crew cut with the front part combed to the side to get an Ivy League style. The result is a simple, sexy look that draws attention to masculine features. To get a very short and low-maintenance style, experiment with a buzz cut and pair the look with a beard for a rugged, edgy appearance.

Justin Timberlake’s long hair has featured many of the coolest cuts and styles for men. His longer hair has come with a fade or undercut on the sides and back with a slick back, comb over, quiff or pompadour on top. While he never grew his hair too long, he has played with extra length over the years. With straight thick hair, his hard comb over has proved particularly suave at red carpet events and gave Justin a stylish formal look packed with texture and volume.
To get his longer hairstyles, you’ll want to ask your stylist for a mid taper fade on the sides and back with medium length to longer hair on top. When styling, use a strong pomade with a matte finish and brush your hair diagonally back for a classy textured finish. For a more retro version, emphasize the parting and style a modern side part. Use a hairdryer to give your strands added volume and lift.

Justin Timberlake has curly hair that he has tamed and styled to create several sexy looks. Timberlake’s curly hairstyle was popular during his younger teen years but he transitioned to straight hair with time. In case you’re wondering, yes, Justin’s hair was naturally curly. Timeless and cute, his curls helped him create a boyish charm and youthful appearance, making him the most famous member of NSYNC.
