From tight to loose, the singer pulled off many cool curly haircut styles.
To create JT’s classic curls, you need to start with excellent hair care. Curly styles require a high-quality shampoo and conditioner to maintain moisturize and minimize frizz. Once your hair is dry, you can add texture and movement with a curl-enhancing smoothie or a light-hold pomade.

Justin Timberlake’s 90s hair was characterized by serious curls and volume, making him a style icon of the decade. In the 1990s, NSYNC was one of the most famous boy bands around and Justin Timberlake started influencing men’s fashion with his blonde curly hair and good looks.
To achieve the signature style from his glory days, you’ll need naturally curly hair and a pomade or wax to keep them tight throughout the day. Work product through your locks and define each curl to prevent them from clumping. Since 90s Justin Timberlake was just a teen boy still finding his look, you’ll want to focus on his latest haircuts and styles. These masculine hairstyles are perfect for guys with straight, thick, wavy and curly hair who want a versatile look.

Justin Timberlake’s ramen hair is one of his most iconic looks and can help you take your naturally curly hair to the next level with a bold and stylish finish. While the ramen noodle style should be left in the past, Timberlake’s short sides and voluminous curls worked perfectly with his bleach blonde frosted tips. For a modern variation, you’ll want to get subtle blonde highlights or just keep your natural hair color and invest in a quality styling product for curly hair that won’t flake or crunch.

Justin Timberlake’s straight hair is an excellent option for guys who want a fashion-forward and sleek look. His straight thick hair offers a low-maintenance and versatile look, allowing you to experiment with several different styles such as messy spikes or the slick back undercut. You’ll need a matte hair product like wax or clay to get the style with volume and a textured finish.
For an impressive look, blow dry your hair straight and gently pull your strands over to one side to create an attractive part. You can use a strong styling product to mold your hair into place. Timberlake is known for his dapper style so it’s important to tame flyaways and cowlicks to avoid looking unkempt.

The Justin Timberlake buzz cut is a military-inspired hairstyle for guys who want a low-maintenance and masculine look that will make the most of their strong facial features. His buzzed hair complements his chiseled features and symmetrical face, giving him a clean-cut look that always looks fresh on the red carpet. This style is easy to maintain at home with clippers, requiring only regular trims to look dapper. If you want the haircut at the barbershop, ask your barber for a high skin fade and a number 2, 3 or 4 buzz cut on top.

The Justin Timberlake comb over is a timeless hairstyle that looks classy and charming for the modern gentleman. The comb over style is a classic look but the celebrity keeps things modern by pairing the look with an undercut fade. When styling, you’ll want to sweep the longer hair on top to the side for a smooth finish. Whether you want a casually chic look or a business professional style, the comb over offers a trendy men’s hairstyle.

The Justin Timberlake cornrows is one of his most iconic looks despite being a divisive style. JT wore his braids close to the scalp to create a tight look that was extremely low-maintenance. If you’re thinking about getting braids, there are many braided styles for men to consider.

Justin Timberlake’s blonde hair is an edgy style for guys who want to make a bold statement. While the famous singer may be better known for his beautiful brown locks, his striking blonde hairstyles made him a ’90s heartthrob. Despite a dark natural hair color, Timberlake had bleached blonde hair or frosted tips for contrast. Somewhat grungy, the style gave his look depth and dimension when paired with his curly hair. For a modern twist on this late ‘90s style, ask your barber for an ombre fade.

Justin Timberlake’s bleached hair will allow you to turn heads and stand out anywhere you go. With his tight curls, good looks and sudden transition to platinum blonde hair, this bold move helped cement Timberlake as a fashion icon. The celebrity rocked his bleach blonde hair with curls and paired the style with a short cut on the back and sides.

The Justin Timberlake perm is a great way to get curly hair if you aren’t blessed with natural coils. Permed hair gives off a carefree, energetic vibe, so consider your choice carefully if you work in a professional setting. You may want to bring a photo to your appointment since the results of this chemical treatment are semi-permanent and not easily altered.

The Justin Timberlake slick back is a cool hairstyle that looks great when paired with a high fade or undercut on the sides. Slick back hair offers a stylish way to balance between retro and modern looks. To achieve contrast and dimension, you’ll need to have medium length to longer hair on top with a layered cut. A pronounced fade can give you a modern edge, while the timeless slick back keeps your look polished and classically handsome. Timberlake often rocks his slick back with a rugged beard for a sexy style that transitions effortlessly from casual to formal events.

The Justin Timberlake beard offers a masculine look and can be an impressive way to take your style to the next level. Facial hair can instantly elevate your appearance by adding depth and dimension, creating a manly finish. Round face shapes can benefit from a beard, as it creates a natural contour and automatically slims the face. Equally, square and oval face shapes can accentuate their chiseled features with well-kept facial hair. Timberlake generally prefers light stubble or a well-groomed short beard.

The modern mullet is a cool men’s haircut that pairs a long tail with very short hair on the sides and back. The modern mullet hairstyle starts with a fade or undercut and comes with short to medium-length hair on top. This hipster cut allows for variations, including a high skin fade with a pompadour or slick back that seamlessly flows into the look.
Whether you want long or short hair, a nice mullet style will stand out in any crowd. When styling, use a matte hair product to create a textured look with volume and flow. As one of the most popular country boy haircuts, this retro look has transitioned into the mainstream.

The short mullet is a charming men’s haircut that offers a low-maintenance and stylish take on the classic look. The short mullet haircut can be defined by shorter hair in the front, back and top with a taper fade or undercut on the sides. As the most common variation, this short hairstyle works great for guys with straight, thick, wavy and curly hair. When styling, you’ll want to use a strong styling product like pomade to keep your hair in place all day.

The mullet fade is a fresh haircut for men who want a low-maintenance style that is easy and stylish. The mullet fade haircut starts by blending the sides to complement the longer hair on top, creating contrast that brings attention to the style. You can ask your barber for a low, mid or high fade to get the perfect cut for your look. Guys can take it a step further by pairing a skin, drop, burst or taper fade to tailor the style. Great with all types of fades, you can choose between a short and long mullet to suit your hair type and desired haircut.

The burst fade mullet is one of the most popular styles to consider, offering short sides that highlight the longer style on top. Trendy with short and long hair, the burst fade haircut tapers around the ear and drops down the back to the neckline for a unique touch. This faded cut has become a great way to create a mullet mohawk without the extreme shaved sides. If you’re looking to pull off an edgy look, the mullet haircut with a burst fade is worth talking to your barber about.

The long mullet is a versatile hairstyle featuring medium to longer hair on top and in the back, creating flow and volume that can be youthful. The long hair mullet requires more effort styling but the results can be amazing, giving guys a chic and eye-catching style. This longer men’s hairstyle can be paired with a taper or undercut on the sides and you should use a textured hair product for a natural finish.

The straight hair mullet is the most common variation because the style is easy to cut and create. The straight mullet can be brushed to the side, slicked back or styled messy but always looks best textured and natural. Classy and handsome, guys with straight hair can experiment with a fade or undercut and short to medium length hair on top combined with a longer back. Use a light matte styling product like cream or wax to boost volume and thickness for the perfect finish.

The curly mullet can be a cool way to tame and control your curls with a trendy look. A mullet for curly hair will often start with a shorter cut on the top and sides, leaving longer curls in the back to make a statement. To achieve a modern mullet hairstyle with defined curls, you’ll need to keep your curly hair hydrated and healthy while styling with a light to medium-hold product.

The country boy mullet is a handsome hairstyle with textured styling, offering a clean-cut look for modern men. The mullet is a country style you can flaunt on any occasion and continues to be a fashion trend in the United States, especially in the South.

The Asian mullet is a popular Korean hairstyle that commands attention when styled properly. This mullet style generally features a fade or undercut on the sides and short to medium-length hair on top, making it a cool and modern cut. Asian men with flair and masculine confidence can pull off this haircut with style.

The wavy mullet is the perfect modern style for guys who want a cool haircut with a twist. For those with curly or wavy hair, the mullet hairstyle will involve a layered cut and minimal styling. A mullet with waves provides a unique dimension that few can copy, allowing you to stand out in any crowd. For a soft touch, use a matte product like clay or sea salt spray to get beachy waves.

The mohawk mullet is a fresh haircut for edgy guys who need to make a bold statement with their hair. Versatile and sexy, the mohawk mullet hairstyle creates a daring look that can be spiked up or styled to the side. Although some guys like to experiment with an undercut or shaved sides, the mohawk mullet fade is the most popular version for the modern man. When choosing a taper fade, you can get a high, mid or low fade haircut. The high skin fade will get you close to the classic mohawk, while the low to mid drop fade can look classy. To maintain the style, use a textured hair product to keep your hair up all day.

The mullet undercut is a sleek style that pairs buzzed sides with smooth styling to create a fashionable look. The undercut offers a soft and clean haircut on the sides to contrast the longer hair on top. Great with a beard, a mullet with an undercut can be a great way to experiment with the hairstyle.

The classic mullet is an iconic men’s hairstyle that requires long hair in the back and natural styling. This retro haircut has been coming back for years but with a modern twist and offers a masculine look. Also known as formal in the front and party in the back, this vintage style has become a barbershop favorite in the South.

The faux hawk mullet is one of the coolest men’s hairstyles when it combines a fade with spiky hair on top. The faux hawk mullet haircut is a bold look for modern gentleman who want to stand out with a stylish cut. Textured and messy spikes with long hair in the back can help create the perfect vibe.

The pompadour mullet is a chic hairstyle for men with a longer front that is styled up. By mixing classic and modern styles, a classy mullet with a pompadour will give your style personality. With a taper fade or undercut on the sides, you’ll want to use a matte styling product for a voluminous textured look.

The Euro mullet is a trendy haircut that continues to be a fashionable choice for guys. Popular in barbershops all around Europe, this mullet style comes with short thick hair on top and in the back. Styled with texture and volume, this European hairstyle looks universally-flattering when done well.

The shaggy mullet is a youthful hairstyle where the hair on top is brushed forward and covering a part of the forehead. The mullet shag can be a cool option for guys who want a disheveled and casual look.

The shaved sides mullet is a daring hairstyle choice for men looking to fashion a sleek style. By shaving the sides, the mullet haircut becomes a variation of the mohawk, giving you a refreshing and extreme cut.

The hipster mullet is a fresh haircut style that takes the retro vibe and tailors the look with a modern cut. Hipster hairstyles are often fancy and bold, creating a unique look from classic styles. Whether you shave the sides, dye your hair or exaggerate some dimension of the original trend, you can find a way to make the mullet suit your desired look.

The flat top mullet is a classic cut that combines popular men’s styles from the 80s. A flat top with a mullet features short hair that is styled level and longer hair at the back to produce the symbolic tail.

A mullet with a beard is a masculine look that can help some guys pull off a ruggedly handsome style. Some mullet styles work better with a nice short beard, while others are perfect for longer facial hair. For a sleek touch, ask your barber to blend your taper fade into your beard.
A bleached mullet can be a great option when you want to feature a bold look. From blonde to platinum, bleached hair can take your mullet to the next level with extra flair.

The messy mullet is a texture style that leaves the hair on top looking casually shaggy and effortlessly cool. Using a matte styling product like wax or clay, a messy mullet hairstyle can be designed to add volume with spikes and layers.

The Kentucky waterfall mullet is a cool country boy hairstyle with textured longer hair in the front, sides and back. The Kentucky waterfall haircut gets its name because this mullet style is popular in the state and guys wanted to create new terminology since the classic cut has a bad reputation. When styled appropriately, the Kentucky mullet can be a dashing and refreshing look.

The punk mullet is the perfect haircut for teenage guys and young men who need a cool style that stands out. This punk style is a very short cut that exposes skin, providing an edgy and bold look. Stylish with long and short hair, you can style your mullet with spiky hair all over or experiment with a mohawk and create tall spikes in the middle. You’ll need a high-hold styling product to achieve this daring look.

The permed mullet is a fashionable hairstyle for guys who want to add curls and take their style to the next level. A mullet with a perm can be created by curling the hair in the back or perming all your hair for an eye-catching look. For best results, you’ll want to start with longer hair and get a fade haircut on the sides to accentuate the styling on top.

As a fashion icon, Harry Styles has pulled off short hair many times over the years and his new style always looks good. His short hairstyle is a trendy look with flow, volume and height that enhances his sex appeal. With tapered or undercut hair on the sides and back, this teenage heartthrob has rocked some of the most popular short haircuts such as the comb over and slick back.
The celebrity’s most iconic hairstyle was a mop of cropped curls from his initial X-Factor appearance. This classic side-swept look was achieved using light styling products for a loose and natural finish. You can copy his signature style by asking for a simple crop with a uniform length across the top, back and sides.
If you want to give your look a modern and edge cut, you’ll want to ask our barber for a mid fade or undercut to create contrast. The short hair on the sides and back will elevate the longer hair on top for a cool style.

Harry Styles’s long hair is an iconic style that maximizes volume, flow and texture for an irresistible look. His long hairstyle has traditionally been shoulder length and longer, but the star does like to get a haircut and rock a cool bro flow that reaches his nape. While his most popular style is loose and free-flowing, the English singer does sometimes tie up his hair into a man bun for a neat finish.
On several occasions, Styles has also pushed his hair back with a stylish bandana or silk scarf for a looser, modern look. Long hair is more versatile than shorter styles, so don’t be afraid to experiment with braids, half ponytails and other updos to switch up your look.
When he was with One Direction, Styles experimented with cuts that went past shoulder length for a low-maintenance and trendy look. To achieve his healthy flowing locks, restorative hair oil and high-quality shampoo and conditioner products are must-have items. To give your hair subtle lift and movement, you’ll want to ask your stylist for a lightly layered haircut and use a blow dryer for instant volume.

Harry Styles’ curly hair is a youthful and charming style that has become with synonymous with the star’s younger years. His naturally thick and dark brown curls gave him a handsome boy-next-door look that captivated music lovers worldwide. In 2011, Styles’ hair was understated and incorporated a side-swept fringe that was popular at the time.
Around 2012, Styles started using styling products like pomade and sea salt spray to add texture and movement. These products encouraged Styles to push his hair away from his face, drawing attention to his chiseled features and providing a messy, bohemian hairstyle.
At red carpet events, Styles was often seen sporting bold slicked back styles to give lift and dimension to his longer hair. To get Harry Styles’ curly hair look, you’ll want to invest in a quality sea salt spray for a textured matte finish that will add volume and fullness. To dial things up, use pomade and work it through the body of your hair for more lift.

Harry Styles has rocked straight hair on stage and in movies. From short to long, his straight hairstyles have all contributed to his status as a heartthrob. During the war flick Dunkirk, Styles’ straight style came into focus when he sported a longer brushed back look with short hair on the back and sides. While he retained his signature length on top, his hair was practical and timeless. Although naturally wavy, the shorter length required minimal straightening at the ends to lie flat and sleek against the head.
For red carpet events, Styles often styles a quiff for a debonair vibe. He chooses to slick the top of his hair back with a sculpting pomade to create a sexy, masculine look. To showcase his wilder side, the Hollywood star has also been seen with wispy straight hair that isn’t held down with a strong-hold product. By leaving his parting free and adding texture and fashionable volume with a styling cream, Styles created a handsome and contemporary style fit for any modern gentleman.

Harry Styles’ middle part is a stylish hairstyle for guys who want to experiment with longer cuts. His middle part style made its first appearance in 2019 on Saturday Night Live. Many fans believed that this haircut style harked back to his younger days with its cropped length and slightly disheveled appearance. In addition to perfectly framing his face, the middle part allowed Styles’ natural texture to shine.
If you wish to channel this loose style, ask your stylist for short to medium length hair with layers. Harry Styles wears this look without much product, but he may use a light-hold pomade to give his strands definition and shape. A top-rated hair product can also keep flyaways and cowlicks at bay.

Harry Styles messy hair is the perfect hairstyle for guys who have medium to longer hair. As he became more confident with his rock ‘n’ roll fashion sense, Styles began to wear his hair in a relaxed, loose style that complemented his easygoing stage persona. During these years, his tighter curls took on a looser medium length wave which softened his features.
He often wore this style pushed back with a pomade while performing, keeping the back and sides long for a deliberately casual appearance. For the ultimate natural bedhead look, use a small amount of texture paste to shape the hair.

Slicked back hair has been one of the most popular looks for Harry Styles and offers guys a modern take on a retro style. With short sides and longer hair on top, the slick back is a timeless hairstyle that requires a strong pomade for a wet finish or wax product for a textured look. Cool and flattering, most modern gentleman can pull off this style with the right cut.

The blonde mohawk fade is a modern hairstyle that suits black men who want an edgy and trendy look. Guys can choose between a high, mid or low taper fade haircut on the sides and back. To take the style to the next level, ask your barber to pair your mohawk with a skin, temp, burst or drop fade. For maximum contrast, a high bald fade will make your cut look punkish and daring. When experimenting with hair dye, you can pick a blonde, platinum, white, silver or red color for extra flair. If your hair is coarse and dry, you’ll need a high-quality moisturizing shampoo to avoid breakage and dullness.

The blonde fade is a fresh haircut that always looks stylish on black men. With so many different types of fades, guys may want low, mid, high, skin, temp, drop or burst taper fade haircuts. Shades of blonde that lean darker work best for this style, as platinum hair can be too harsh on darker skin tones. Blonde hair with a fade haircut works well with masculine face shapes and can accentuate sharp features with a crisp, clean line up. For a professional look, you’ll need to visit your barber regularly.

Fashionable and eye-catching, a blonde curly hair fade is a daring hairstyle that’s ideal for trendsetters. Guys with long hair can take advantage of their coils with an extreme fade to maximize contrast. For a more polished look, ask a barber to trim your curls down for a style that’s professional enough to wear at the office. This cut will highlight any volume you have on top and works best on men with naturally thick hair. Consider growing a thick beard alongside your fade for a rugged, masculine finish.

Blonde dreadlocks are a trendy and charming hairstyle that allow black men to pay homage to their ancestry while maintaining an easy and cool look. Dread styles can be worn up or down to create several different fashionable looks. Some guys will want to choose micro dreads to avoid overwhelming their features, while others may prefer thick locs to soften their square or oblong face shape. When getting blonde dreads, you’ll need to grow your hair out or ask your stylist to attach extensions that can be braided with your natural locks. To keep things interesting, go for square or triangular roots to give a unique pattern on the scalp.

The blonde buzz cut is one of the most popular hairstyles for black guys who want a low-maintenance and effortlessly cool look. This short haircut looks best when you are confident with your facial features and want to highlight your masculine bone structure. To turn your clean-cut style into a fashion statement, consider adding a light fade around the sides with additional length on top. Ideal for athletes and military men, this practical haircut only needs a touch of moisturizer to remain smooth and sexy all day long.

The blonde crew cut is a cool haircut style for black men who want short hair for a low-maintenance and masculine look. The crew cut hairstyle has been popular since the 1920s and features short, even hair on top paired with tapered sides. The crew cut is traditionally clean and professional, but this simple style can be a modern look with a low or high skin fade and a striking blonde dye job. When styling, apply a light-hold wax or gel to keep things sleek.

The blonde afro is a popular haircut that will help you embrace your natural texture while offering black men several cool styling options. Some guys with thick, curly hair will find a tall afro is a realistic goal, whereas others with short, tight coils may look better rocking a shorter style. For a unique cut, consider featuring a taper fade haircut on the sides to create a retro high top with a blonde twist. To give your barber a healthy base to work with, keep your hair conditioned with essential oils and rich butter for a few months before taking the plunge. Whether you choose a warmer blonde or decide to go platinum, the afro hairstyle is sure to turn heads.

Blonde hair twists are one of the trendiest styles for black men that work well on all hair lengths for an effortless and fashionable look. As the name suggests, this hairstyle is created by dividing the hair evenly and twisting individual sections around each other. If you have short hair, pair your twists with a striking mid fade for contrast without the hassle of upkeep. Medium and long hair gives guys more freedom to express themselves as the added length allows you to create patterns on the scalp. Classic, low-effort and unique, blonde twists are a badass way to emphasize what you were born with.

Bleached hair can be a bold statement style that is modern and fashion-forward, taking your look to the next level. Whether you get bleached blonde or platinum hair, there are many different colors that black men can dye their hair. If you choose to go with a platinum hairstyle, this tone can lean white or silver on black skin, making it less attractive than warmer alternatives. Any blonde dye will offer a bold contrast on darker skin tones, making it ideal for those wanting a dramatic transformation. For a masculine touch, pair your vibrant locks with a trendy fade or undercut on the sides and back. This adds dimension to longer hair and will transform any bleached cut from sloppy to chic. Regardless of what length you choose, invest in quality hair products to minimize damage from the bleaching process.

Blonde hair tips are a stylish look for black men who want to add flair and color to their style. These blonde frosted tips will contrast black hair and can be a great way to draw attention to the longer style on top. With a fade haircut on the sides and back, guys can experiment with a burst fade mohawk, high top fade, short curls and other popular hairstyles. If you’re considering dyeing your hair, frosted tips offer an edgy and fashionable finish to any cut.

When it comes to fashionable masculine haircuts, Zac Efron’s short hair draws attention to his chiseled features and is the actor’s way of distancing himself from the longer sweep of his younger days. This neat cut is kept short and faded on the sides with length on top to keep styling options open. To create his trendy short hairstyles, Zac Efron uses styling products that add texture and volume for a cool look. Not only does this give the hair effortless movement that looks suave on the red carpet, but it keeps his style on-trend and masculine.

Zac Efron’s long hair is a youthful and boyish look that was part of his charm during the height of his High School Musical fame. To recreate these iconic long hairstyles from his teenage years, you’ll need to grow your hair out a few inches. You can then add textured layers that are long enough to create a side-swept bang. This style works best on perfectly straight hair, as you will simply struggle to tame any wavy or curly hair into submission. To keep your look in place, start with day-old hair and apply a light hair clay or styling cream. For versatility and styling options, you’ll want to talk to your barber about the most popular medium length hairstyles with a fade or undercut on the sides and back.

The buzz cut is a short men’s haircut that looks great on Zac Efron and represented a shift towards more serious roles. This military-inspired hairstyle is ideal for guys who want a low-maintenance look that requires minimal styling. To achieve this classic style, ask your barber to clip your hair to approximately 1/4 to 3/4 inches. For a more dimensional appearance, pair your buzz cut with a skin fade for a tapered cut on the back and sides. This short haircut style will suit most face shapes but looks best on men with masculine features and square jawlines.

The crew cut is a simple haircut for guys who want a preppy style that’s easy to maintain and never fails to look fashionable. Zac Efron loves the crew cut since it suits his naturally thick hair texture and is extremely practical. This classic Ivy League hairstyle takes more effort to style than the buzz cut but is still low-maintenance enough to be styled irregularly. For a clean-cut look, there are many different types of fade haircuts to consider, including the high, mid, low and bald fades. Create the ultimate college aesthetic by staying clean-shaven and styling your hair with a light matte pomade for a textured finish. Guys can feature a beard for a rugged and handsome look.

The comb over is a timeless hairstyle for men who want a classy and fashionable look that will suit most occasions. The Zac Efron comb over is generally longer and more conservative, with a classic taper on the sides and back with the hair in front swept to the side. For a modern variation, you’ll want to ask your barber for a hard part and a short taper fade haircut. You’ll be left with a voluminous style that can be locked in place with a strong wax or pomade. To avoid unsightly cowlicks, brush your hair in one direction and keep your parting sharp.

The quiff is one of the most popular hairstyles for guys who want a casually stylish look like Efron. To mimic this cool style, start with a short fade haircut on the sides and back with medium length to longer hair on top. When styling, you’ll need to brush your hair up and back to create a high-volume look with a natural finish. This fashionable haircut is perfectly suited to thicker hair types and can be dialed up for Hollywood glamour or down for a casual night out with the girlfriend. The impressive volume created by a quiff is eye-catching and can be paired with a skin fade for greater contrast. To prevent your hair from drooping, keep it in place with a strong pomade, wax or clay.

The faux hawk is a daring choice that holds up well with the right styling products. This cool men’s hairstyle is less extreme than the traditional mohawk as it features short sides instead of fully shaved sides. Also known as a fohawk, this cut still provides enough contrast to be eye-catching, making it an excellent option for guys who want to express their unique personalities without looking unprofessional. You’ll need enough length on the top of the head to spike upwards and the sides should be kept short and neat. To avoid looking disheveled, keep your hair in place with a wax or pomade.

Zac Efron’s spiky hair is the look that took him from teenage heartthrob to bona-fide fashion icon. Adding a touch of danger to his previously clean-cut look, a daring spiky hairstyle made him the talk of Hollywood. This style typically features short sides and medium-length hair on top that can be styled into spikes. To replicate Efron’s style, pair your spikes with faded sides and keep your locks in place with clay or wax for a rebellious look that won’t budge.

Messy hair is making a comeback and this easygoing style is the perfect solution for an unsightly bed head. Zac Efron rarely chooses this look for red carpet events, but you can recreate this casual style for running errands or hanging out on the weekend. Though this hairstyle requires mid-length to long hair, you can still work hair wax through shorter strands to create impressive volume. For maximum lift, blow-dry wet hair before applying any styling products.

When it comes to stylish hair in a movie, the Zac Efron Baywatch haircut has become one of the most popular styles that guys have looked to copy. While some may have been preoccupied with the actor’s impressive physique, his hairstyle still managed to steal the show. During the movie, Efron sported a disconnected undercut with longer hair on top that was brushed back loosely. This modern men’s hairstyle gave him a beachy look that complemented his role and strong facial features. To elevate your look, apply a sea salt spray before styling and gently work this through your hair for natural movement and texture.

The Zac Efron beard can add a rugged and mature look to your appearance. His facial hair is well-kept and sleek, offering just enough stubble to outline his jaw and add dimension to his haircut. Regardless of whether you want to keep your facial hair subtle or grow it out further, keep an eye on any patchiness that might ruin your cool appearance.

The taper fade is a popular haircut for guys who want a clean and low-maintenance cut on the sides and back. The light skin taper fade will take your hairstyle to the next level, creating style and contrast that will draw attention to the longer hair on top. Light skin men can experiment with many different fade haircuts to achieve their desired look.
The low taper fade offers a classy and professional cut, while the mid and high fade haircuts can provide a sleek and edgy finish. You can also ask your barber for a drop, burst, skin or bald fade to further tailor the look. The taper fade can be paired with dreadlocks, braids, curls and mohawk styles to create a stylish look.

Being light skin with dreads is a trendy look for those who want a cool and low-maintenance style. As one of the most versatile light skin hairstyles, dreadlocks can be rocked in several different ways. From long to short and loose to tied up, dreads and light skin guys are a natural combination.

Braids for light skin men have become a popular hair trend, offering a simple and unique style that looks flattering. Whether you choose box braids, cornrows or braided dreads, this low-maintenance light skin hairstyle can be paired with a taper fade, undercut or shaved sides to design an fresh look. Some may want to experiment with different designs and colors, resulting in brown, red or blonde braided hair.

If you have light skin and want short hair, there are many classic and modern men’s hairstyles to choose from, including the buzz cut, high top, cornrows, mohawk, twists and loose curls. Short light skin haircuts generally feature a fade on the sides and back with shorter hair on top. These charming styles will require guys to use a high-quality shampoo and conditioner to maintain moisturize, enhance thickness and minimize frizz. When styling, you may need to apply a hair moisturizer for all day hydration before using a strong product to keep your hair styled.

Light skin guys with long hair will want to experiment with refreshing styles like dreads, braids, twists, Afros and man buns. To fashion a unique look, you may want to dye your hair brown or blonde to complement your skin tone. With the right styling products, long hairstyles can look great with wavy, curly and straight hair.

Curly hair light skin guys have many cool haircuts to consider, resulting in the latest and hottest styles. From short to long, the most popular curly hairstyles start with a fade on the sides and back to create contrast, bringing attention to the curls on top. Whether you prefer tight or loose curls, the curly hair fade is a versatile lightskin haircut for men that will allow you to transform your look. For maximum volume and bounce, use a styling cream that will moisturize and control your curls without weighting them down.

The mohawk is a modern hairstyle for light skin men who want an edgy and youthful look. While there are different types, the mohawk fade continues to be the most popular haircut style. Most guys will get a burst or drop fade to customize the cut. With short hair on the sides and back, this hairstyle offers a great way to style thick kinky and curly hair.

If you have naturally kinky hair, the Afro is a retro hairstyle for black men that will elevate your look. An Afro always looks great on light skin guys and can be a great way to stand out in any crowd. While the classic look requires longer hair all around, some modern Afro styles combine a short top with a fade haircut on the sides for a sleek finish. You can feature dyed hair or highlights to create extra flair.

Cornrows are an iconic braided hairstyle for black men who want a fresh look and don’t mind the spotlight. By choosing a cool design and maintaining their scalp, mixed guys can pull off this stunning style and make a bold statement.

The man bun is a masculine long hairstyle for light skin men that can be styled with ease. Ideal for shoulder length to longer hair, the bun can be tied up in the back or on the top of the head. This hipster style is well-suited for all hair types, including straight, wavy and curly locks.

The undercut is a cool light skin haircut that starts by buzzing the sides and back short with one length. Whether you choose the classic or disconnected undercut, this low-maintenance hairstyle can be combined with straight, thick, wavy or curly hair to achieve a flattering look. For a ruggedly dark and handsome look, you can feature a short full beard to contrast your skin tone. Quality beard products can help maintain and care for your facial hair.

Light skin boys have many stylish haircuts that look cool and are easy to maintain. Teenage guys and little boys may experiment with dreads for a simple and eye-catching style. Boys with curly hair who want a cute hairstyle for school should try a fade on the sides and back with thick longer curls on top, creating an effortlessly chic vibe. The curly hair can be cropped short for simple styling or left long and brushed out for a voluminous messy finish.

The short two block haircut is the perfect look for guys who want a sleek and low-maintenance style. With short hair all around, the two block hairstyle can be paired with an undercut or fade on the sides and back for a sharp, fresh cut.
Great with thick straight or wavy hair, the short two block is easy to style and looks best with extra volume and flow. You’ll want to use a light pomade, wax or clay with a matte finish for a textured look.

The long two block hairstyle features short trimmed or cropped sides with medium-length to longer hair on top, creating a flowing stylish look that is popular for Asian men. This cool hairstyle offers a bold contrast with many different styling options, allowing you to style business professional and casual looks depending on the occasion. If you have naturally straight hair, use a light styling product to get volume and movement for a fashionable finish.
With longer styles, you’ll need to get regular haircuts to maintain the undercut or fade on the sides as well as keep the length on top. While some guys may want to let their hair grow out for a modern messy style, too much length can result in a shaggy and unkempt look.

The two block undercut is a stylish haircut for men who want to look fresh and emphasize natural volume. Popular with Korean men, the undercut is a popular way to cut the sides and back short to contrast the longer style on top.
This KPop undercut hairstyle can be tweaked to complement your face shape and offers a disconnected cut that highlights the two block styling. Whether you have short or long hair and want a middle or side part, this cut offers an edgy and handsome look.

The two block fade is a versatile haircut that looks great with a sleek finish. As a blended style on the sides and back, the taper fade haircut is a popular choice with Asian men. When asking your barber for a cut, there are many different types of fades that look good with the two block style and the right cut for you will depend on your desired look.
The low and mid fade haircuts are ideal for business professional men who want a clean cut without drawing too much attention away from the longer length on top. If you add a fringe to your hairstyle, you may want a mid to high fade cut for a bold and edgy look.

A two block middle part is a daring style that works well on men with strong features. While most guys choose two block styles with bangs or side parts, the middle part can be appealing for those who want to be unique and different. This parted hairstyle will frame your face and look natural so make sure to use a light styling product that won’t weigh down your hair.
When styling, you can get a middle part that is slightly off-center for a more relaxed look or make a bold statement with a strong part down the center of your head. If your hair is very straight, it’s worth asking your barber to set this style in a partial perm with gentle waves. This will keep your middle part secure and reduce styling time in the long run.

The two block side part is a stylish hairstyle that will look classy and elegant on most Asian guys. Whether you have short or medium-length hair, the side part will add flair to your two block haircut, offering another dimension to the style. To rock this popular Asian hairstyle, you’ll need hair that is long enough to be combed over to one side.
If you have naturally textured hair, consider adding a subtle fringe for enhanced definition of the part. This asymmetrical style will be eye-catching and casually charming. When styling, work a light-hold pomade through your hair for some control without sacrificing natural movement. For a formal look, use a strong pomade or wax and then blow dry your hair into place.

The two block with a long fringe is an effortlessly chic and sexy style for guys who are trendsetters. There are many ways to style a longer fringe hairstyle with your two block cut. The hair can either be left to fall directly over the eyebrows or be pulled to the side for a sweeping, dramatic finish.
If you choose this style, you should add some light layering to any hair on top. Without layers, this cut can lack dimension and look underwhelming. For a youthful, K-Pop feel, work some pomade through your hair to create light lift and subtle texture. As the long fringe is the standout feature of this cut, you should avoid over-styling the remaining hair.

A messy two block hairstyle is a more unruly style that pairs a short back and sides with a long top. Although this style looks amazing with a casual outfit, it’s seen as unprofessional in corporate settings. For a sexy bedhead vibe, use pomade or clay to add volume and texture to your hair. When styling a charming messy two block hairstyle, you’ll want to focus on achieving the proper shape and maximizing volume. For a thicker look, you should work texturizing products through your hair for extra volume.
If you’re working with wet hair, use a round brush to blow-dry your hair upside down and then in different directions. Once your hair is dry, tousle it with your fingertips and allow strands to fall naturally. For best results, make sure you have ample length on top. It’s possible to achieve a messy two block style with shorter hair, but it’s more difficult to style and the results rarely last all day.

The curly two block is a cool haircut for guys who want to let their natural curls take center stage. Curly hair can add an awesome contrast to undercut or buzzed sides and they require minimal styling. You’ll need about six inches of length on top for hair long enough to curl properly. Asian men with straight hair may want to get a perm to create a curly two block hairstyle.
Male perms typically last between three to six months, depending on your hair texture and thickness. To keep your curly cut in good condition, invest in high-quality shampoos, conditioners and styling products that are designed for curly hair. Good products should nourish and protect hair while minimizing breakage and frizz.

The Korean bowl cut is a popular men’s hairstyle that’s short, easy and low-maintenance to style. A bowl cut can be great if you have a strong jawline and want a classic look that will balance your features.
With an even cut all around the head, this layered haircut comes with natural volume and requires minimal styling. You’ll want to maintain the style with regular trims to prevent the hair on top from looking unkempt or ruining the signature lines of this style. For an interesting contrast, keep your shaved sides closely buzzed with a fade or undercut.

The realization that you’re going bald is a difficult pill to swallow. It’s tempting to try and hold on to your luscious locks, but once your hair starts thinning, it’s only a matter of time before you should find a new hairstyle. One of the worst things men with thin or thinning hair can do is try and conceal problem areas with a comb over. Not only will this hairstyle draw attention to your bald spots and hairline but it can look unprofessional and embarrassing.
For many guys, balding causes anxiety and embarrassment. However, all men will face hair thinning and balding during their lifetime, so it’s nothing to be ashamed of. The best thing to do when your hair starts balding is to take the plunge with a clean shave, buzz cut or crew cut hairstyle. These styles are stylish and low-maintenance, and often look striking when paired with a beard.

Stupid haircuts are ridiculous styles that guys get when they’re trying to be creative but end up with an awful and embarrassing look. These men’s hairstyles just represent some of the ugliest and dumbest-looking cuts that men and women universally hate.
If you ever want to break up with a girl but don’t know how, experiment with these really bad haircuts and she’ll take care of the rest. If she doesn’t laugh at your hilarious hair and leave you immediately, you may want to reconsider the relationship because she’s a keeper and in it for true love.

Gelled spikes may have been all the rage in the ‘90s, but they’re rarely considered a stylish choice these days. Although this hairstyle can look effective on occasion, it usually takes incredible bone structure and punky clothes to pull off well. It’s worth noting that gelled spikes are frowned upon in professional settings and are unlikely to align with strict corporate dress codes.

The country mullet is one of the worst hairstyles for guys to get right now and should be avoided at all costs. While the modern mullet offers many cool variations that are stylish and fashionable these days, there are several types of mullet styles that just look awful.
Consisting of a short front section and a long back, the ‘80s mullet is an infamous men’s hairstyle that tends to look bad on everyone. For this reason, it’s considered an ugly haircut that will get you noticed for all the wrong reasons.

The skullet may be the most ridiculous and ugliest haircut of all time. The skullet is a stupid style that combines a traditional mullet and a shaved head, leaving the top of your scalp bald with longer hair on the sides and back. As this cut requires a lot of bravado and confidence to pull off, it’s typically only seen on expressive types who aren’t afraid to stand out from the crowd.
As a style that is deemed both harsh and controversial, the skullet is a cut that isn’t worth the risk. If you’d still like to rock an edgy style, there are various mohawk or Viking hairstyles that make an impact without being an eyesore.

You may have been forced to sport a bowl cut as a kid, but there’s no excuse for carrying this unflattering style into adulthood. Although bowl cuts can look decent on those with hyper-masculine features, they tend to overwhelm most faces and force your hair to lie flat against the head.
This cut first burst onto the scene during the Crusades of the 15th century. Despite enjoying various resurgences throughout the years, this blunt and unforgiving cut should remain firmly in the past.

The rat tail haircut features a shaved head with a small section of hair dangling down from the nape of the neck. This haircut generally makes men look unkempt, unprofessional and unpresentable as it offers very few styling options. Although it can certainly turn heads, this bizarre style is best avoided for all those who value their dignity and reputation.

A bad fade haircut can just ruin your entire look, resulting in an ugly hairstyle you don’t want to be seen with. Whether it’s just a barbershop cut gone wrong or a freak accident that causes a horrible haircut, your fade must be clean and perfectly tapered to complement the long hair on top.
Depending on the situation, some barbers may offer to fix your haircut but some cuts are too messed up to correct. In most cases, the only way to solve the problem is to let your hair grow out and find another professional to give you a cut.

Oily-haired men can often lean into greasy styles out of habit. They may not necessarily be going for a slicked-back look, but thin-haired guys may be tempted to slick their hair back to avoid washing their hair too often. However, neglecting proper hair care and overusing oil-based hair styling products is a recipe for disaster when it comes to any hair texture. Although thin hair is more prone to looking greasy, even thick-haired men can fall foul to bad greasy hairstyles if they overuse product.
To keep hair pleasantly slick for a wet look, invest in a water-based pomade and keep your application technique light. This should tame any pesky stray hairs while keeping your overall look sleek and professional.

Long asymmetrical men’s hairstyles can look striking on the runway but tend to look garish and unbalanced in the real world. As one side of this cut is significantly longer than the other, it can make styling incredibly arduous and is usually more trouble than it’s worth.
If you insist on trying an asymmetrical cut, ask your barber to work balance into your locks. You can certainly have statement elements at the front, but having massive contrasting sections is asking for trouble when it comes to maintenance and styling.

Frosted tips is a dated hairstyle for men that features spiked hair and bleached tips. Although frosted tips were once considered the height of style back in the 1990s and early 2000s, this men’s hairstyle has truly fallen from grace.
To avoid looking tacky and outdated, it’s worth taking the plunge and bleaching your entire mane. Not every man will be able to pull off platinum locks, but a bold dye job will make a statement without incorporating the unsightly contrast of frosted tips.

The wannabe rocker hairstyle may have made women swoon in the 1980s but it tends to look messy and out of touch when showcased by modern men. Long hairstyles look particularly amazing when they’re cut in a rugged, Viking fashion. However, the wannabe rocker style doesn’t have the same impact as traditional masculine cuts.
When worn by older men, this pushed-back style looks as though you’re trying to hark back to your glory days. To avoid embarrassing yourself, it’s a good idea to opt for cleaner, versatile cuts that give you more freedom when it comes to styling.

First modeled by the artist Skrillex, this unique style is defined by a half-shaved head. The rest of the hair stays long and the resulting contrast creates an edgy, intimidating look that is extremely difficult to style. Although this haircut aligns perfectly with Skrillex’s rebellious image, it’s far too jarring for the average man.

Simon Cowell is best known for his harsh critiques and harsh commentary, but he’s also known for sporting his signature flat top hairstyle. Despite looking acceptable on Simon Cowell, this overly rectangular style is unflattering on most face shapes.
To avoid looking too much like Britain’s harshest TV personality, ask your barber to add shape and texture to your cut. Even men with straight hair should incorporate some layering into their locks if they’re not opting for a buzz cut or crew cut. Even having slight movement in your hair will prevent it from looking like Cowell’s flat top disaster.

Known for his messy, unkempt hair, Boris Johnson’s typical look is a style that no man should strive to replicate. Not only does Johnson go far too long between haircuts, but he also seems to make no effort to style his mane. Despite letting his hair lie flat against his head, he always seems to struggle with hair pointing in different directions.
Men with thick hair can easily avoid looking like Boris Johnson by working pomade lightly through their locks. However, those with thin hair should take extra care to avoid hair lying straight down. This will simply draw attention to grease and make hair look even patchier.

The emo fringe typically features side swept bangs that are heavily straightened, brushed forward and styled over the forehead. You may have seen this emo hairstyle take over Tumblr back in the noughties, but this is now a style that looks outdated. If you’re committed to the punk movement, you may consider a short fringe for a subtle look.

In the right circles, colorful hair can be a great way to express your creativity and make a statement. However, bright, colorful hair is typically frowned upon in business professional careers and you may find it a struggle to be taken seriously if you take the plunge with a box of purple or blue dye.
Color can still look stylish when dyed professionally, but it’s a good idea to stick to natural tones to avoid drawing unwanted attention to yourself. If you currently have brown hair, a transition to blond or auburn should give you a large enough shift without looking garish.

Although great barbers will be able to recreate a look for you from a photograph or description, it’s always wise to learn barber terminology to get your point across effectively. All hair is different, so being able to express exactly what you want in terms that barbers associate with is sure to help you achieve your desired outcome. If you’re not sure how to describe what you want, then bringing a photograph along is a great idea. This should give your barber an idea of the style you want without relying on words alone.

When asking your barber for a haircut, you’ll need to request the best hairstyle for your face shape. Guys should educate themselves on the different haircuts that suit their facial features and look. Barbers are experienced, but having intimate knowledge about your hair type and what cuts work well for you will save you from getting a bad haircut.
Oval face shapes usually suit a wide range of cuts. This is because oval faces are naturally well-balanced. For a look that’s sure to impress, ask your barber for a pompadour to draw attention to your perfect features.
Conversely, square faces suit undercut hairstyles well as these cuts feature harsh lines that beautifully highlight strong jawlines. Finally, round faces should opt for hairstyles that elongate and add dimension. Quiffs work particularly well here, as they create a wonderful balance and height that makes any facial roundness less prominent.
The final thing to consider when you’re choosing a hairstyle is styling. It can be tempting to choose an impressive high-maintenance hairstyle but few men are willing to put in the effort to style complex cuts each day.
If you’re unsure about the cut you have in mind, bookmark examples of your favorite haircut styles to show your barber. They should be able to fill you in on the styling steps you’ll need to go through each day to keep your locks in top condition. If the upkeep is too much for you, be sure to discuss viable alternatives.

Good hair care is an essential part of getting a stylish hairstyle. When considering proper care and maintenance, there are many hair tips and products to learn about to keep your scalp and locks healthy. For starters, you’ll need to know how often you should wash your hair with shampoo. Washing your hair too often is sure to strip your hair of natural oils, but not washing it enough can make your hairstyle look greasy and ugly.
Striking the perfect balance is all about trial and error, so be sure to experiment with different shampoo and conditioner schedules to figure out what gives you the best results. When in doubt, ask your barber for their professional advice!
It’s also important to keep up with regular barbershop visits. Letting your hair grow too long will make it look shapeless and encourage breakage. To keep your cut fresh, visit the barbershop every four or five weeks. This should keep your hair budget manageable while maintaining the health of your hair.

The mohawk features harshly shaved sides and longer hair on top for a sharply contrasting look that won’t look good at work. This style represents rebellion, non-conformity and self-expression, which may not be the ideal workplace hairstyle. The mohawk cut looks punk and casually cool, and can be intimidating for most business settings. Although it wouldn’t appear out of place in a tattoo shop or club, the daring mohawk is unlikely to be the right look for Wall Street. Professional guys in need of a stylish cut for a corporate environment shouldn’t get a mohawk.

Hair designs can be extremely unique and are an excellent choice for guys looking to get an edgy haircut. This style incorporates shaved lines and designs into a fade haircut, resulting in eye-catching shapes and patterns. You can get all kinds of designs, ranging from simple lines and zig-zags to complete images on the sides and back, allowing you to customize your look. While artistic and fun, asking your barber for a design will create an unprofessional look.

Long hair is a cool style that looks effortlessly stylish on most men. While being an impressive look on the streets, longer messy hair doesn’t suit corporate life. Some guys may cut their long hairstyle and maintain a shorter haircut, while others may choose to style it neatly to minimize the look. To abide by company dress codes, you should tie your hair into a low man bun or ponytail. For an even sleeker finish, complete your look with a light-hold hairspray. This slicked back look adds a professional, polished touch that is sure to be appreciated by upper management.

Bleached hairstyles are incredibly striking and edgy but may draw negative attention in a corporate workplace. While bleached hair can make a bold statement, most employers will see this style as a distraction that can reflect poorly on the company during meetings and sales pitches. Bright flamboyant looks aren’t generally accepted in the professional world so avoid colors that deviate too much from the norm. If you want to dye your hair a blonde color, you can choose warmer tones. When styled with finesse, these hues still look impactful. Most platinum and bleached styles are likely to be considered too harsh and unprofessional, especially when darker roots start showing.

While all the rage back in the 1970s and 80s, the mullet isn’t nearly as common these days. Featuring short hair in the front and sides with longer hair at the back, mullet hairstyles are difficult to pull off without looking too country. Some employers may not mind the mullet if styled neatly and well, but most corporate dress codes frown upon long or extreme hairstyles.

Cornrows are a trendy braided hairstyle for guys who want a low-maintenance and fashionable look. Although cornrows are culturally important and look amazing on Afro-textured hair, this braid style may be considered unprofessional in some office settings. While braids have been around for decades and continue to be cool, Corporate America has been slow to adapt and accept the look. With increased workplace education and diversity, conservative environments will eventually be more open-minded.

Braided hairstyles are generally considered inappropriate for men to wear at work. From Viking styles to box braids, this look can make textured and coarse hair much easier to manage. While there are many different types of braided styles, it is best to avoid these designs in the corporate world.

Frosted tips are not a good hairstyle for modern gentlemen. Defined as short spiky hair with bleached tips for contrast, this style was the hottest men’s hair trend of the 1990s. Although you may get away with very subtle frosted tips at the workplace, overly bold and contrasting cuts are usually out of the question. The style tends to look too laidback on most guys and rarely pairs well with a sharp suit. Therefore, frosted tips should be left in the past to avoid any unwanted attention at business meetings.

The blowout taper fade is one of the most popular hairstyles for teenage guys and young men. Managing to look suave and on-trend with almost any outfit, it’s a stylish haircut that relies on plenty of volume up top and a pronounced taper fade around the back and sides. The blowout taper is a great look when going to a club or bar, but guys shouldn’t style their hair this way for the office.

A long shaggy hairstyle is surprisingly low-maintenance and is perfect for men who love to rock a casual look. Also known as the shag haircut, this style relies on volume, long layers and texture. Hair is purposefully cut to fall messily and the finished product oozes masculinity. Although you may feel like a rockstar when wearing your hair in this long shaggy style, your employers will probably spurn this edgy cut. As it’s naturally scruffy, it’s considered too informal for most professional settings. It’s possible to style the shaggy haircut in a way that looks less rebellious, but it’s best to stick to shorter styles or less layered cuts that allow you to slick hair back when required.

As one of the worst haircuts for men, the skullet is a very unprofessional style that should be avoided at all costs. This hairstyle is a balance between a clean-shaven skull and mullet, creating a rebellious dimension that stands out. This unique look is usually reserved for bold individuals who want a creative way to showcase head tattoos or prominent scars. Wear this style to work and your boss will question your judgment or sanity, and you may see yourself quickly escorted out of all but the most forward-thinking workplaces.

Although many men deem the top knot a polished and professional way to style longer hair, this hairstyle is considered too hipster for the corporate world. Understandably, men with long hair will want to keep their locks out of their eyes. In these instances, a low man bun may be more appropriate. Keeping your hair low-key and nicely groomed is crucial to maintaining a professional appearance at work.

Whether you style it messy or neat, the ponytail is a modern style that looks amazing on healthy hair. This longer hairstyle can range from the classic low ponytail to the half-up-half-down version. With so many styling options, the look is versatile and easy to do. Although this style can look neat, the ponytail doesn’t look polished enough for professional dress codes, even when you use a firm-hold hairspray.

While this 90s-inspired hairstyle has made a small comeback, bowl cuts are not work-appropriate styles worth asking for at the barbershop. Also known as a mushroom haircut, this style features bluntly cut bangs all around the head that are brushed forward for a dramatic look. Some guys prefer a shorter fringe, but most bowl haircuts feature heavy bangs that cover the forehead. The longer length may seem weird and over-the-top for some employers and may be seen as an unprofessional choice. Constantly touching and adjusting your hair in the workplace won’t be taken lightly either, so this look is unlikely to be a success in the office.

The faux hawk is a cool men’s hairstyle that bears a striking resemblance to the mohawk. With a fade or undercut on the sides, the longer hair on top is spiked up and pushed towards the middle of the head. While casually stylish and modern, this style looks great on teenage boys and young men as it projects a youthful and edgy vibe. The faux hawk can easily be toned down, but not enough to be appropriate for the office. You can style a faux hawk fade in your personal life, but you should comb over or slick back your hair for a business professional look at work.

A simple headband can be a godsend for keeping unruly hair off the face. You can purchase practical sports headbands or subtle wiry bands that look more discreet. When it comes to the office though, these accessories shouldn’t be worn. They’re generally accepted for women but look far too casual on men to be acceptable. To keep unruly hair at bay, invest in some excellent styling products.

A rat tail is characterized by a long, thick strand of hair that falls down the back of the neck. This hairstyle doesn’t have much styling potential and never looks good. Extremely relaxed and too eccentric when styled, it’s not appropriate for the workplace.

Asymmetrical haircuts can enhance your features and offer some interesting styling options. Asymmetrical cuts require more volume on top than some other styles. With this comes a casual look if the hair isn’t painstakingly styled each day. Despite being a great cut for framing the face and drawing attention away from insecurities, it’s not a suitable cut for the office as it requires longer hair that cannot be easily pulled back.

Bright, colorful hair is one of the easiest ways through which to express your personality. Whether it’s fiery red or regal purple, colored locks set you apart from the crowd. While some colleagues may think your hair looks awesome, having unnaturally colored hair is generally not accepted in the workplace. If you’re looking to make a change without putting your job at risk, you can dye your hair a natural color. Blonde guys can go brunette and dark-haired guys can pick lighter colors.

From short and kept to longer and groomed, there are many professional-looking beard styles to choose from for guys that want a ruggedly handsome look. To be office-appropriate, your facial hair must be cleaned, trimmed and styled regularly to ensure it is well-maintained. Although some employers may emphasize a clean-shaven look, most companies will allow nice facial hair. When grooming, make sure your beard length is just 1 to 2 inches long. You’ll need to avoid growing out your facial hair too long, resulting in a poor look.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: A crew cut is an excellent way to manage thick hair as it’s short and easy to maintain, yet it also provides guys with several styling options. Unlike a buzz cut, crew cut haircuts are longer on top and not the same length all over. The key is to keep the back and sides short with a taper fade haircut to create a cool contrast for a handsome hairstyle. Versatile and stylish, your crew cut can look sporty and casual or professional and neat to suit your style and the occasion.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: The comb over is a brilliant option for men with thick hair as your luscious locks will already provide the volume. As a result, you can play around with different trends to ensure that your cut never goes out of fashion. A common option is to pair combed over hair on top with an undercut or fade on the sides, allowing for greater definition and contrast that are impossible to ignore. If you want something softer than the hard part comb over fade, you can sweep your hair to the side instead of combing it over fully for a more sophisticated aesthetic.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: A short quiff is when you push your fringe and front hair up to create this iconic men’s hairstyle. Guys like short quiff haircuts because the modern styling is messy, stylish and usually textured compared to the traditional quiff, and it’s particularly flattering for men with thick hair as the volume makes it full and flowing. You can choose to complement the quiff with a fade or undercut on the sides and back as well as a cool beard. Use a strong, matte hair product for control and texture when styling.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: The buzz cut doesn’t leave you with many styling options, but it’s a firm favorite among men for its lack of maintenance and the fact that it promotes a masculine appeal. There are several buzz cut styles to experiment with, ranging from the military-inspired versions to the modern haircuts with different types of fades and undercuts. What’s more, you can grow out the length on top to style a crop top or Ivy League crew cut. Consider shaving in a hard line on the sides or growing facial hair to add dimension and texture to the style.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: The side part fade is a fantastic way to always look your best as it’s effective and simple. Usually, the side part is soft and provides a subtle contrast between mid to low faded sides and longer hair on top, but you can opt for a relatively hard side part if you get a high skin fade. With the latter, guys get an edgy look, especially if you comb the hair up and to the side to highlight the shaved line. Regardless, the side part haircut is timeless and effortless when you use a good hair product.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: The crop top fade will never go out of style and continues to be a popular hairstyle trend for guys. Well-suited for men with thick hair, the French crop is a short haircut that’s easy to cut and simple to style. Most guys get faded sides and then brush the short hair on top forward with a textured finish. To change things up, you can mess up the middle section of your hair as the thickness will create a rugged appeal that’s visually striking and modern. Like a high and tight fade, it works best with straight hair as opposed to wavy and curly.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: The Ivy League haircut, also known as a long crew cut with a side-swept fringe, is a classic hairstyle that will never go out of fashion because it’s perfect for business professionals and casual looks. The back and sides can be faded, while the short to medium short hair on top can be parted to the side for a classy style. Aside from the limitless styling options, the Ivy League hairstyle is ideal for all hair types such as thick wavy, curly and straight hair.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: Messy hair is a fantastic way to achieve an effortlessly cool hairstyle while being able to switch up your look quickly and easily. An undercut or taper fade haircut on the back and sides will create the contrast you need, while the short thick hair on top will give you the volume and coverage to pull off messy styles. Whether you want to keep all your hair tousled for a bedhead look or just parts of the front and middle sections, this natural-looking hairstyle is trendy and smooth.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: The high and tight with a fade is best for guys with straight, thick hair as it typically minimizes all styling and looks ruggedly handsome. You need around one to two inches of hair on top with a fade haircut on the sides that seamlessly blends the cut. As a hairstyle that lands somewhere between a buzz and crew cut, it has a manly aesthetic since it’s short and trimmed close to the head. Perfect for the warm summer months, the high and tight fade is easy and simple for guys.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: Slicked back hair is an easy option for guys with overactive follicles as it removes them from your line of vision. Thick hair when it’s long on top is hard to handle as it falls all over your face, yet slicking it back will make sure it flows in the opposite direction. You can combine it with an undercut or high fade, but this adds extra effort into maintaining your style. For a classic slicked back trend, you only require a comb and a strong pomade or wax to keep it in place all day.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: The faux hawk is ideal for men who want to stand out from the crowd with a distinctive look, but who aren’t ready to commit to an authentic mohawk. Apart from eye-catching, the fohawk is also a clean look since you can line up the sides to ensure there’s another dimension to the cut. This haircut works well for men with thick locks as you need plenty of hair to pull it off. It’s also a smart choice for shorter guys who want to appear taller.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: The short pompadour with a fade or undercut on the sides and back is a modern take on a classic men’s hairstyle. While many men still enjoy the timeless and vintage appeal of a pompadour, the coiffed fringe and front sections can be a little much to style and maintain. By choosing a shorter length in the front, you still get the same hipster vibe and sophisticated appeal without the hassle of doing a big pomp.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: A blowout taper fade lets you use your thick hair to the fullest as the tapered sides are cut short and your short haircut on top is brushed up and back. Blowing it out incorporates texture as well as volume, which is ideal if your hair is naturally straight, curly or wavy. You can get a blowout taper for a classic look or choose a short skin fade haircut on the sides for an edgy modern style. If your hair on top gets too wild or hard to maintain, don’t be afraid to slick it back, sweep it to the side, or leave it messy.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: Spiky hair is ideal if you have lots of natural volume as the spikes will be thicker and bolder. This is perfect because part of the draw of men’s spiky hairstyles is that these trendy styles draw attention, which is inevitable for men with short thick hair. For something subtle, ask your barber for a longer taper on the sides to minimize the contrast whereas a high bald fade will ensure your spikes stand out.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: Fringe haircuts are styles where the sides and back are trimmed short and the hair on top is longer with defined bangs. The angular fringe sweeps the bangs to the side for an asymmetrical finish in the front. Modern and textured, fringe hairstyles work well for guys with thick hair who want to cover up a big forehead. To style the look, just brush your hair forward and let it hang over the forehead in the front. This trend continues to be popular with young men and teen boys.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: Short textured hair is well worth trying as short hair can fall foul of the stereotypes. The good news is that your cut will never be boring if you simply apply a matte pomade, wax or clay to define the strands, and use your fingers to create waves and curls. If your hair is already wavy, play into your natural hair type for a fresh look! Short and textured hair works with pretty much every style, yet the most iconic is the crop top, crew cut fade, and messy hair.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: Side swept hair for men is modern and accessible when styled with thick hair, although it does require some maintenance and styling in the morning. Still, if you’re willing to get up earlier to look good all day, you can benefit from the fresh, clean-cut style that a side sweep brings. From a side swept undercut to a combed over fringe with a fade haircut, this cool short hairstyle will always impress. Alternatively, you can make it less work by shaving in a hard part so that the top hair is not as tough to put into position.

Titre: 75 Best Men’s Short Haircuts For Thick Hair
Description: A mohawk fade is a popular new trend for guys who want the contemporary version of the classic mohawk hairstyle. With a short thick patch of hair in the middle of the head that runs from the front to the back, guys can get an edgy haircut that’s unique and daring. Instead of shaving the sides fully, your barber will fade the sides high and create the effortless appearance of the timeless mohawk.

Short and messy hair is the best option for guys who want a textured style without constant maintenance. Plus, it works for men with all hair types, including thick, thin, wavy and curly. For this look, you need to use a matte styling product for a natural textured finish. Tousle the pomade, clay or wax so that it hits the tips and leaves you with a messy, wild hairstyle packed with volume.
Men love messy short hairstyles because these modern haircut styles are trendy, masculine, and versatile. Whether you’re a business professional or just want a cool style, this cut is perfect.

Long messy hair is harder to maintain, but it’s well worth the effort when you get it right as it has a rocky, edgy feel. Guys with long and thick locks pull this cut off the best, so if your hair is thinner, you may have to opt for a sharper and neater trend.
To maximize a messy long hairstyle, wet your hair and apply a styling product like mousse or cream. Similarly, sea salt spray works fantastically well because it’s designed to provide a light hold with a textured healthy shine. Let your hair dry naturally and you won’t have to contend with frizz or a dull, flat style.

Medium-length messy hair is the middle ground if you don’t like your hair short, yet can’t be bothered with growing it out. To get this look, the trick is to take a relatively strong hair product and run it through your hair. Don’t touch it as you need it to fall organically to achieve a laid back, relaxed style that’s smart and casual at the same time.
If it’s a little long and looking wild, you can sweep medium-length messy hair back for a style that’s a combination of sleek and disheveled. Apply a light-hold mousse, cream or sea salt spray to add volume and natural shine while controlling frizz.

The messy fade is the most popular version of this fresh hairstyle. This is because messy hair on top with a fade haircut on the sides is an excellent way to create contrast that’s hard to ignore. There are many different types of fade haircuts to consider. Whether you want a high, mid or low fade with a taper, skin, bald, burst, or drop cut to complement, the messy hair fade can look modern and sleek or classy and timeless.
For long messy hair with your faded sides, let your locks flow for maximum volume and movement. For a short haircut, ask your barber for a high skin fade to highlight the scruffy look on top. Apply a light styling product all around and then define the style you want to do the perfect tousled loose hairstyle.

The messy undercut combines the cool undercut hairstyle with messy hair on top. Buzzed short and to all one length on the sides and back, the undercut accentuates your tousled look. Ideal for all hair lengths and types, the men’s messy undercut can be styled with a side part, slick back, brush up, or bangs.
As one of the trending haircuts for men right now, you can’t go wrong with this look. Guys with short hair will want to use a matte product for a textured finish. To style medium length to longer hair, mousse or styling cream can add texture, boost natural shine, enhance volume, and minimize frizz. Make sure to always use a quality shampoo and conditioner for healthy hair.

The bedhead hairstyle is a favorite of men with messy hair as it’s low-maintenance and charming. Moreover, girls find it sexy and fun, which makes it an incredible look for a casual first date.
