Apply hair powder to boost volume and enhance flow. For more control, you can use a light to medium-hold wax or pomade and apply it to the tips of your hair.
A textured tousled hairstyle will also make your hair look thicker and fuller, making it ideal for guys with thin or thinning hair. Men with thick straight hair can pull off this style well, but it’s particularly a great wavy or curly hairstyle because the product will define your curls or waves for an effortlessly hot look.

The messy fringe hairstyle continues to be a strong men’s hair trend around the world. As one of the most popular short haircuts for guys, a messy fringe is usually paired with faded or undercut sides. The longer bangs are kept flowing and styled over the forehead using a light styling product.
Common for men with wavy or curly hair, fringe cuts can work to even out your facial proportions, especially if you have a big forehead. However, the haircut style is trendy and universally flattering. Just spread your clay pomade or wax all over and leave the front messy for a casual look you can wear anywhere.

Nom: Messy Hairstyles For Men with Thick Hair
Description:
Messy hairstyles for men with thick hair offer an alternative other than slicking it back all the time. You should work matte wax through the roots and middle of your hair to increase the volume if you’re blessed with dense hair that’s thick and robust. Let your locks settle naturally.
You will find that messy hairstyles for men with thick hair create soft and dynamic layers at the same time. Short and medium-length hairdos are ideal for this style.

Curly, messy hair and bed head hairstyles have a lot in common in that they should both appear effortless and untouched. However, curls are hard to tame, which means you will require patience.
For the best results, add a mouse or foam to your wet hair and scrunch them with your finger to add volume. Let them fall naturally for a style that women will swoon over.

Messy straight hairstyles are a classic look for men who want a bold and edgy style. From short haircuts like the crew cut or crop top to longer styles like the comb over, quiff or spikes, straight messy hair is flexible and easy to work with. Start by asking your barber for a taper fade or undercut on the sides; how low or high and short or long you cut will determine how much contrast you want.
Guys with straight hair are blessed because they can style all the best hairstyles. Run your favorite hair product through to achieve any look you want. With proper hair care, you can tousle and rough up your haircut for a unique scruffy style. Whether you’re a business professional in need of a new cut for work or just going out with friends, this hair style just looks good all around.

Messy textured hair has become one of the best styles for men to get right now. Sexy and easy to achieve, textured hairstyles offer a healthy shine for a natural look. Guys can add texture to any trendy haircut to thicken hair and create a fuller look. To create texture, you’ll want to use a matte styling product such as low-shine pomade, wax, or clay.
From the comb over to the slick back, faux hawk, side part, and pompadour, messy textured hairstyles look good with all hair lengths and types. A no-shine finish can be particularly useful for men with thin or thinning hair.

If you want to add flair for a stylish look, wavy messy hairstyles deliver an easy and simple way to style your hair. Men with wavy hair enjoy a unique texture that enhances volume and flow. With a fade or undercut on the sides and short to medium length hair on top, apply a light to medium-hold product to define your wavy hair.
Messy hair leverages this look to achieve a fresh style. Whether you want a comb over, brushed forward fringe, or a short crew cut, take your waves to the next level with a tousled finish.

From short to long hair and classic to modern styles, messy top haircuts are incredibly versatile and fashionable. With limitless styling ideas, most guys pair a messy top with short sides. Whether you prefer a fade haircut on the sides and back, an undercut for a clean-cut look, or a taper for more length, the messy hair on top will get all the attention.
For a short haircut, try a longer crew cut or Ivy League hairstyle with a side swept front. For longer hair, get a modern quiff or blowout. Complete the look with a matte pomade, gel or styling cream for a naturally textured finish.

Young boys should keep their hair medium to long in length and use a light-hold hair product to add texture. Boys who want to style messy hair will want to combine the look with a fade or undercut on the sides and back.
Modern and cool, the short sides will highlight the longer messy hair on top, creating a contrast that will elevate little and teen boy haircuts.

Short shaggy hair is the perfect hairstyle for a casual and stylish look. Easy to get and simple to style, short shag haircuts look good with all hair types, including curly, wavy, thick, and straight hair. Some guys may want to ask their barber for a low taper on the sides and back to contrast the longer top. When styling the look, short shaggy hairstyles can be swept to the side in the front, brushed forward to cover the forehead, or parted down the middle to maximize flow. You’ll want to use a strong wax or pomade to maintain control for a cool textured style.

When it comes to lengthy styles, long shaggy hair is a cool men’s hairstyle that will look fashionable and sexy. Perfect for thick straight hair, longer shag hairstyles offer a layered look with an edgy rockstar vibe. While long hair requires more upkeep and styling, the results can be worth the extra effort. You’ll need proper hair care, starting with a quality shampoo and conditioner. For styling, apply sea salt spray on damp hair to get a healthy and natural look. You can also use a styling cream for more control that will minimize frizz. Keep the look messy and flowing or combed all over but flared out.

Medium length hair works well with shaggy hairstyles to create a trendy wispy look. Popular with teenage guys and young men, this fluffy layered style has plenty of volume, movement, and flow. As the perfect balance between short and long hair, medium shaggy haircuts are effortlessly chic when brushed to the side, parted down the middle, or left messy and relaxed. Experiment with this charming cut by applying some styling product and allowing your layered locks to fall into place naturally.

The shag fade is a great way to get a layered cut on top with short hair on the sides and back. A fade haircut will keep the sides cropped and tapered to create a low-maintenance cut, allowing the shaggy style on top to get all the attention. There are many different types of fade haircuts that will look flattering with your cut. Most guys prefer a low fade for a classy look, while others may get a mid or high cut fade for an edgy finish. Combine your shag haircut with a skin, bald, temp, or drop fade to take your look to the next level.

The shaggy undercut is a bold fashion statement that combines these trendy haircut styles to create a unique look. With a short undercut on the sides and back, all the attention is focused on the longer shaggy hair on top. You can style this look messy, neat, brushed forward or parted to the side for the perfect finish.

Messy shaggy hairstyles are a natural fit and result in a fresh look that exudes confidence. With the right layered haircut, men can pull off a classy messy look that styles nicely without much work. To achieve messy or shaggy hair, use a light hold styling product to tousle your locks with the intention of creating a bedhead look. When styled properly, guys can enjoy extra volume and flow for a sexy style.

Curly shaggy hairstyles offer a trendy way to style your curls without weighing them down. Shaggy hair is a popular look for men with wavy or curly hair since it allows them to leave their curls loose and bouncy. Great with short, medium or long curly hair, you’ll want to locks conditioned and moisturized to minimize frizz, while also using a quality styling product that won’t dry out your look. With some effort and styling prowess, your haircut is sure to impress.

Shaggy hairstyles are ideal for thick hair, giving guys a full look with plenty of styling options. Universally-flattering and attractive, you can create a messy and textured style with thick shaggy hair any time you want a sexy, low-maintenance look. Make sure to apply a matte pomade, wax or cream to get a natural, healthy shine. If you’re sweeping the hair to the side or down over your forehead, use a strong product to keep your hairstyle in place all day. For more volume and flow, consider a light clay or sea salt spray. Growing your hair out can help if you have stubborn locks.

Layered shag haircuts are stylish looks that will complement your length and texture. Versatile and eye-catching, most shaggy hairstyles require a layered cut to achieve the right style. While the layers are easy to work with when you have medium length to longer hair, skilled barbers can layer short hair to give you a fuller look.

A beard can add a manly and rugged touch to a shaggy hairstyle. A full beard can offset the youthful vibe of shaggy hair, giving guys a more mature and edgy look. You can grow out a long, full beard with quality care products or maintain thick, short facial hair by using a top-rated trimmer. The result is a messy shag haircut on top that balances out your sexy beard style.

Shaggy hairstyles for boys have always been popular and trendy, offering an easy and simple style that looks great. The boy’s shaggy haircut is a layered cut that starts with longer hair on top and shorter tapered sides. Some guys prefer getting a fade on the sides and back for contrast, while others want length and layers all around for a smooth finish. Well-suited for all types, boys with shaggy hair should use a light-hold sea salt spray and let their locks fall naturally. For extra styling and control, lightly apply a medium-hold cream and style the hair into place.

Nom: Wavy Comb Over Fade + Hard Part + Beard
Description: If you’re going for a look that combines the best of classic and modern – or one that looks just as professional as it does chic – it’s hard to go wrong with this excellent comb over fade hairstyle. The hard part adds the hint of classic refinement, but the wavy hair paired with a modern comb over styles perfectly. The short, well-maintained beard adds balance and ties it all together.

Nom: Wavy Textured Top + Undercut + Line Up
Description: This is a bit of a new take on the classic crew cut, which involves short hair on the sides and longer hair on top. To create this wavy textured hairstyle, you’ll need your hair to be about two to four inches long, and you can choose to fade the sides or keep them all one length for an undercut. This style is best for men who have thicker wavy hair; a good pomade can help provide the lift and hold you need to maintain it all day long.

Nom: Low Skin Fade + Short Wavy Slick Back
Description: This is a favorite style among men who have naturally wavy hair, and it’s possible to create it with thin or thick hair. Hair on top should be anywhere from two to three inches in length, and hair in the back should gradually taper down into a low bald fade. To create the textured slick back, add a bit of pomade at a time until you have the desired definition, then use your hands (with a bit of extra pomade) to push and brush your hair back.

The quiff is one of the hottest hairstyles for men today. It’s easy enough to create in minutes before you head out the door, especially if you start with an amazing cut like this one. The hair on top is anywhere from three to five inches long, and the faded sides are low and super short for a skin fade all around. To style a textured wavy quiff, apply some lightweight pomade and separate individual waves with your fingertips. Then, gradually pull these textured sections forward and create the signature quiff sweep at the front.

Sometimes you just want to make a statement without being too over-the-top, and that’s exactly what this wavy faux hawk hairstyle can do. The traditional undercut on the sides leaves a wide strip of hair from forehead to the back. You can play with different lengths here, but three to four inches is ideal. Add some pomade, clay, or wax depending on your hair’s texture and sweep your hair upward and back as you use your fingers to separate individual waves.

Nom: Side Part Wavy Hair + Undercut Fade + Line Up
Description: If you want a look that is part messy and part refined, this wavy side part hairstyle is perfect. The sharp lines around the temple, forehead and hairline are clearly defined for a fresh shape up. Furthermore, the side part is styled loose and casual with messy waves on top. Styling this parted haircut at home is simple enough. Just apply matte styling cream throughout your hair and leave everything messy and tousled with a slight part to one side.

Nom: Short Textured Crop + Side Swept Fringe + High Fade
Description: This style signifies power and sexiness, and it’s easy enough to accomplish on your own with the right cut and styling products. Leave the top of your hair a medium length – anywhere from two to three inches – with a high fade on the back and sides. Then use a styling clay, cream or wax to sweep your wavy hair to the side in the front while loosely combing over the rest.

This is a classic look for men who prefer long wavy hair. It’s easy to style and maintain, and it’s a perfect transitional style if you’ve decided to grow your hair out. Ideally, you will want to keep your hair just at shoulder length in the back with layers. All it takes is an excellent light-hold styling cream or clay to separate and define your waves while holding them in place throughout the day.

Nom: Textured Angular Fringe + Low Taper Fade
Description: This bold style is ideal for creating volume if you have thin or fine hair. The hair in the front is thicker and longer than elsewhere on the head, and the low fade starts very gradually just above the ears. All that’s required for styling this angular fringe is a good cream or curly enhancer (depending on your hair type) and a couple of minutes to place individual strands of hair exactly where you want them.

Coupling medium-length to long hair with a beard is easily one of the hottest men’s hairstyles for guys with wavy hair. Much like other long layered wavy hairstyles, hair should be anywhere from three to six inches in length and cut into layers to add volume, flow and definition. Use your favorite hair product to style your hair while sweeping the front over to one side and giving it a gentle twist. The short beard simply ties the look together and creates a more rugged appearance.

Nom: Short, Thick Wavy Hair on Top + High Bald Fade
Description: Short haircuts are always trendy for guys, and the best part is how easy these cuts can be to style. In fact, much of the styling starts in the barber’s chair with the medium fade that is tapered down to the skin on the sides and back. The bald fade really accentuates the short but thick wavy on top. Much like a crew cut, this textured hairstyle is low-maintenance and simple to style with just a small amount of matte pomade or clay.

Nom: Messy Wavy Fringe + Low Taper Fade
Description: Fringe hairstyles are fashionable right now, so if you’re going for this look, pay attention. The low taper fade is fresh, clean-cut, and easy to maintain. To style a fringe at home, work a good hair product through your hair, from root to tip. Then pull all your hair forward and leave it tousled and messy for a casual, sexy finish. The goal should be a carefree, windblown look.

Thick Wavy Crop Top + High Drop Fade

Wavy Brushed Back Hair + Low Skin Fade

Thick Curly Hair + Low Bald Fade

Description:
One of the biggest breakout stars of the 2010s, ASAP Rocky got his start in music young. He was rapping even before getting his GED, to some underground recognition. After that, he was noticed and championed by fellow artist Drake, leading to the release of his official debut album, Long.Live.A$AP, back in 2013. He’s been enjoying a lot of international success ever since as a solo musician, producer, and featured collaborator.
Where his hairstyle is concerned, ASAP Rocky is faithful to his braids. He styles them in various ways, often in a ponytail. The box braids give him an eccentric look, which we’re guessing is exactly what the rapper was going for.

A more recent entry on the rap scene, Lil Yachty scored his first platinum single with One Night in 2016. Fast forward a couple of years and he was already a Grammy-nominated artist. The rapper is widely known for his upbeat style of music which he likes to describe as bubblegum rap.
The first thing you notice about Lil Yachty is his braids, dyed bright red and styled with beads. These red braids are not for everyone, but the look suits the rapper well. His music is all about the importance of staying positive and his hairstyle emphasizes that message, projecting an aesthetic that’s whimsical and fun.

Travis Scott’s musical style is a mix of hip hop, lo-fi, and ambient. He got his first major-label deal in 2012 and released a debut album, Rodeo, three years later. Affiliated with Kanye West and T.I.’s labels, Scott quickly became a bona fide superstar with numerous platinum singles under his belt.
But besides churning out hits, Scott is also known for his top-notch sense of style. His braids have inspired millions of fans around the world. They’re effortlessly cool and easy to care for, making it the perfect hip-hop hairstyle.

From rapping to acting, Ludacris is a true renaissance man. The artist debuted in the late ‘90s and spent the 2000s scoring hit after hit, to the point where he became a household name and sought-after collaborator. As an actor, he is best known for appearing in The Fast and the Furious series, but he also had roles in other films like Crash and New Year’s Eve.
As the years went by, Ludacris’s hair underwent several changes, from a big Afro to a buzz cut to braids. The rapper’s cornrows will always be iconic because this braided style symbolized his signature look during the height of his success.

Snoop Dogg is one of the best rappers of all time and needs no introduction to most fans. Emerging in the early ’90s, the artist evolved beyond his hardcore gangsta rap beginnings to become a pop culture fixture. Whether he’s releasing a new song or starring in a fresh reality series, Snoop has always been eager to show fans a new, unexpected side of him.
Besides being a beloved media personality, Snoop Dogg has styled all the coolest black men’s hairstyles. While trying different cuts and styles, the rapper’s flawless cornrows remain his most iconic look yet. Throughout the years, Snoop’s braids have been his go-to style. We would go as far as to credit him for making cornrows mainstream.

Xzibit started as an underground rapper before becoming a popular MC, actor, and TV host. Since 2013, he has been a part of the hip-hop group Serial Killers and takes on regular acting gigs, including TV shows such as Empire and movies such as Sun Dogs.
Another believer in the power of cornrows, Xzibit wore them for a long time during his early rapping days. If you’re eager to follow in his footsteps, you’ll be happy to know that cornrows allow you to freely express your creativity. Don’t be afraid to ask your barber to create unique patterns that will help you stand out from the crowd.

Coolio achieved mainstream success in the mid-to-late 1990s, being well-known for his Grammy Award-winning single Gangsta’s Paradise. The rapper has also become an accomplished chef, with his own cooking show, Cooking with Coolio. He likes to joke that he is the “ghetto Martha Stewart”.
As for his hairstyle, Coolio’s braids are best described as absolutely insane. Always sticking out and up, his braided hair is instantly recognizable. There was even a time the rapper would wear his braids in two pigtails. Fortunately, Coolio has the swagger to pull off this look with style.

One of the most refreshing hip-hop talents in recent memory, Meek Mill embarked on his music career as a battle rapper and gained recognition thanks to a series of stunning mixtapes that chronicled his difficult upbringing. Once he released his debut album in 2012, he was already a big deal.
Mill is currently sporting a polished look, so you might not even know that the rapper wore braids throughout his childhood and mixtape days. Quite the contrast with the classic Caesar cut he adopted once gaining notoriety, his new haircut likely signals his newfound prestige. Nevertheless, Meek Mill’s cornrow braids continue to be a stylish hairstyle for men.

Speaking of crazy braids, enter the late Ol’ Dirty Bastard. One of the founding members of Wu-Tang Clan, he was responsible for some of the most influential hip-hop to come out in the ’90s. Unfortunately, he was also the loose cannon of the group and started to have numerous difficulties with the law soon after embarking on his solo career. It all culminated with his death due to an accidental drug overdose.
But while his personal life was troubled, his iconic spiked-up braids were always on point. The look might even work today as long as you have the dedication to maintain it.

Bow Wow released his first album, Beware of Dog, at only 13, to major commercial success. He struggled to achieve that same amount of acclaim in the years that followed but kept releasing music. The artist also pivoted to kick off a career as an actor and recently appeared as the Frog on the hit show The Masked Singer.
Back when he was still Lil’ Bow Wow, the artist was very into braids, which gave him a tough look despite his young age. He’s now sporting a buzz cut, which highlights his defined facial features.

The butch cut is similar to the crew cut, but the main difference is that the crew cut haircut is longer all over with extra length in the front. Butch haircuts are really short and don’t need any styling or product. Meanwhile, the fringe of the crew cut is generally swept to the side for a parted style.
It’s also easy to do a butch cut at home using just your clippers, but we advise you to visit a barbershop to get a crew cut. The best crew cut haircuts are faded on the sides and back with longer, layered hair on top. Getting a properly tapered fade is essential to pulling off the hairstyle.

The burr cut is a popular version of the butch haircut and can look good with all hair types. Also known as a short butch, the burr haircut is slightly longer than the induction cut, which is the type of haircut given to new recruits in the military. The induction is achieved by buzzing the hair completely with no guard on the clippers.
To get the burr cut, you’ll want to use a #1 or #2 guard all over. Your hair will be very short, so your facial features will take center stage. For a rugged manly look, grow a full beard and get a fade on the sides to complement your short hair.

If a butch cut appeals to you but you’re worried that your hair will be too short, you can go for a short brush cut. Also known as a long butch cut, this longer hair buzz cut is edgy and bold. The brush cut haircut can be spiked up, parted to the side, or styled flat.
If your hair is naturally curly, the cut will begin to show it. Black men who get this haircut can create waves with their tight curls. In general, this style offers more options if you want to experiment with styling your look.

The butch cut fade is one of the most popular haircuts for men who want very short hair. Guys can ask their barber for a low, mid or high fade to determine the level of contrast between the sides and top. You can also get a razor, bald or skin fade that will taper the sides and back down to the skin for a shaved cut. This sharp cut looks stylish when it’s fresh, but it will need a touch-up every couple of weeks as the hair grows out.

The best thing about a butch cut is that it looks stunning with a beard. Celebrities like Tom Hardy and Nick Jonas love to pair a buzz cut and beard because the look is edgy and sexy. Regardless of the beard length, the contrast between the short haircut and facial hair will give you a masculine and cool style. This combo is also ideal if your hair is thin or thinning because it will take the focus off the hairline and onto your face.

If you want your butch cut to stand out, consider adding a shaved line into the mix. You can add one or two shaved lines into your fade to create a trendy look. The line can be on one or both sides of your head.

Just because your hair is short doesn’t mean you can’t style it, and there are many cool butch hairstyles worth styling. You can use a strong hair product to spike it up or lay it flat, depending on the look you like. From bad boy to daring gentleman, butch haircuts can be fashioned to fit your style. If you want to take your buzzed head to the next level, you can even dye your hair blonde or platinum. Stand out from the crowd with a dyed platinum blonde buzz cut.

An eBoy is a guy who has an emo-inspired style and a huge online presence. Blending modern hipster and emo fashion, eBoy hair is usually styled with a curtains hairstyle. The eBoy haircut starts with longer length hair on top and a shorter cut on the sides. The hairstyle is then parted down the middle to achieve curtain bangs, which flow loose and freely to frame the face. Bold, dark and on-trend, young guys and boys can pull off the eBoy look with flair.

The curtain haircut with a fade is versatile and modern, allowing guys to change up their style without a cut. Depending on how long you want your hair on top, you can get different kinds of fades, ranging from a low taper to high skin fade. The faded sides contrast the middle parted curtains to accentuate the styling. Use a light to medium hold product to enhance volume and movement for a fuller look.

Undercut curtains offer a very popular version of the classic look. The middle part undercut is classy and sexy on most men because it’s a timeless clean-cut style. As one of the best short haircuts for men, the undercut will elevate your curtains hairstyle whether you have short, medium or long hair.

If you want a low-maintenance style, get curtains with short hair. To style a short middle part, you’ll need a strong styling product to keep the hair in place. With short middle parted hair, guys will need a shorter haircut on the sides and back to accentuate the look. Stylish and chic, short hair curtains are definitely worth trying.

Long hair naturally lends itself to a middle part. Styled by the likes of Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt and Kurt Cobain, long hair curtains look sleek and fashionable. From thick straight locks to wavy or curly hair, long middle parted men’s hairstyles exude sex appeal and style perfectly with the right product. Alternatively, guys can always try side swept hair when they want to change up their look.

A wavy hair middle part adds personality and texture that is hard to match. Guys with wavy hair are blessed with a unique type that flows beautifully with curtained cuts. Waves also provide another dimension for extra volume and thickness.

While curls can be hard to manage and style, curly curtain hairstyles offer a flattering look you can experiment with. While short curly hair can be tempting, longer curls leverage the weight of your hair. With the help of a good curl-enhancing cream, achieve the center part and get this cool hairstyle.

Split hairstyles have been around for centuries in one form or another.Whether you split your hair down the middle, prefer an off-center part, or want a side swept hairstyle like the classic side part, this style is handsome and versatile. Grow out your hair, cut it just right, and style a fresh hairstyle that will stand out in any crowd.

One of the most popular hairstyles for Asian men is the middle part. Inspired by K-Pop hair trends, the Asian curtain haircut features tapered or undercut sides and a longer fringe. Asian guys are often blessed with thick straight hair, so the center parting is easy to get and style. Apply a strong pomade to keep the look intact throughout the day.

Cute and nice-looking, the middle part has been a cool boy’s hairstyle for years. From toddlers and little kids to teenage guys, boys love the curtain haircut because it blends modern and classic styles. The resurgence can be partially attributed to a recent revival of 90s fashion. Using a small amount of product, the boys middle part styles best with a soft smooth finish.

The 90s curtain haircut was a major men’s hair trend followed by celebrities like Nick Carter, Johnny Depp, David Beckham, Skeet Ulrich, Brian McFadden, Robbie Williams, James Van Der Beek, and Jared Leto. Known as a pretty boy hairstyle, women just love curtains for men. Get the split parted cut and you’ll find that the girls all around you will swoon!

Nothing screams the 80s more than men’s permed hair. A favorite of rock stars like Bon Jovi, this hairstyle was textured and voluminous. Created by treating the hair through a specific process, a perm was the go-to way to embrace cultural trends. Curly hair has shifted over the years to create something with less poof and more definition.

When it came to men’s hairstyles, the standard big hair with volume was considered one of the best options. Think David Hasselhoff in Knight Rider – cool, thick long hair with enhanced flow and fullness. Typically coiffed with the assistance of hairspray and some comb teasing, this 80s hairstyle was one of the most fashionable and memorable looks of the decade.

Men with natural hair embraced the high top fade during the 1980s. With added length on top that was perfectly trimmed into a square shape and a clean fade on the sides and back, the high top haircut was visually striking and effortlessly unique. Carefully placed styling product and sheer force of will were needed to keep the shape in place all day.

For men who wanted something sleek, slicked back hair was the way to go. Handsome and masculine, this retro hairstyle was a favorite of the Hollywood elite and Wall Street stockbrokers alike. Easy to cut and simple to style, the slick back hairstyle needs a good haircut with strong styling product for the perfect shiny finish. Ultimately, slicked back styles have evolved with time. The modern version of the slick back now has a fade or undercut on the sides and back.

Made famous by the King of Pop himself, Michael Jackson favored the distinctive Jheri curl in the 80s. Numerous African American artists followed in his footsteps, as did an array of teenagers around the world who wanted to embrace this fashionable hairstyle. Textured and perfectly styled, this glossy hairdo was created with a specific chemical treatment provided in barbershops and salons across the globe.

The ultimate low-maintenance short hairstyle, the buzz cut has been trendy for decades. Fresh and masculine, short hair works well for men who want to be able to get ready with minimal effort. You’ll need some general upkeep for the hair to stay short, but overall, this is a great option for men who shy away from styling. You don’t have to be in the military to embrace this blunt look as it’s considered flattering for a variety of face shapes.

Mr. T paved the way for the mohawk in the 1980s. A favorite of men who embodied the punk music movement as well, the daring mohawk hairstyle was perfect for those with an edge. The height and overall styling of the mohawk varied based on preference, but the style was striking no matter what. Cut by shaving the sides and back down to the skin while leaving only a strip of hair in the middle, long mohawk styles are achieved with strong styling gel. The modern variation pairs a mohawk with a fade or undercut to create a less extreme finish.

Though looking back on mullet hair paints this hairstyle in an unflattering light, there was a moment during the 80s when this was one of the trendiest styles around. Notable celebrities like Billy Ray Vaughn and Rob Lowe rocked this look which was partially disheveled and partially sleek. This is one of the few hairstyles that likely won’t see a revival as the trends come back around.

If you were preppy in the 1980s, you probably went for the pretty boy hairstyle. Clean-cut with the slightest hint of texture, this was a popular look for men who wanted a reliable look. Most recognizable on Emilio Estevez, this hairstyle was favored by many who wanted a tame alternative to other popular styles.

Bold and eye-catching, dyed hair was preferred by men who wanted to stand out in a crowd. Common among those involved in the punk movement, hair dye was as popular for men as it was for women. Whether blue, green, red, or something in between, this trend was an easy way to show off your own unique style.

Popularized by Billy Idol, spiky hair was often combined with blonde highlights or frosted tips. Created with strong-holding hair gel, the spiked look took dedication and concentration to perfect. Whether you want short or long, thick or thin, neat or messy, spiky hairstyles have always been trendy and fashionable.

Feathered hair wasn’t just for Farrah Fawcett. The hairstyle saw a surge in popularity among male celebrities like James Spader, who made this textured hairstyle cool and classic. If you’ve seen and loved any movie produced during the 1980s, you’ve probably seen firsthand how the feather hair look was rocked by man men of this generation.

Where would this decade be without the 80s rockstar hairstyles popularized by bands like Poison, Mötley Crüe and Bon Jovi? Whether embracing volume and hairspray or using styling gel to create defining looks, these hairstyles were known for being daring. With some dedicated teasing and perfectly placed products, men could emulate their favorite musicians for a night out.

Embrace your inner James Dean with a classic rockabilly hairstyle. Also known as greaser hair, rebellious rockabilly men’s hairstyles were first made popular by movie stars and singers of the 1950s. This look experienced a resurgence in popularity during the 1980s, thanks to The Outsiders. The iconic actors in this famous movie embraced the rockabilly style with perfectly styled hair that was held firmly in place with the generous use of pomade.

Sid Vicious is one of the most notable examples of the 80s punk hair trend that took the world by storm. Mohawks, spiked hair, and dyed hair were only a handful of options available to men who wanted to look cool and edgy. Liberty spikes, sharp undercuts, and sleek pompadours were also embodied in this movement. The style you chose was dictated by your commitment to this loud, in your face lifestyle.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
The Caesar cut is a classic men’s hairstyle that takes its name from the Roman Emperor Julius Caesar. The Caesar cut features short hair all around with a uniform fringe in the front. The hair is then brushed forward and the bangs are allowed to cover a part of the forehead.
The Caesar haircut offers the perfect way to hide or minimize a big forehead. It can also be used to cover up bald spots or a receding hairline. If you have fine or thinning hair, add texture to the style to create volume and a fuller look. The cut fits all men’s face shapes, making it one of the more versatile styles.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
The buzz cut is a military-style haircut created by using electric hair clippers to buzz your head and create a short, uniform length throughout. The buzz cut allows you to define the hairline you want with the option of leaving a short fringe.
Low-maintenance and stylish, most buzz cut lengths don’t require guys to use styling products. Ideal for men with oval or rectangular face shapes, this very short men’s hairstyle can even be cut and maintained at home. Truly transcendent, White, Asian, Hispanic and Black men with big foreheads can try buzzed haircuts and all can pull it off successfully.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
One of the most popular hairstyles for the modern man, a French Crop is longer in the front with the bangs coming across the forehead. With a fade haircut on the sides and back, this short hairstyle is also trimmed shorter as it blends from front to back.
The crop top is similar to the Caesar as it fits all face shapes, but is different in the fact that it can have a shorter or longer fringe to hide the forehead and hairline as necessary. The textured crop top fade has been trending strong in recent years and continues to be a cool look for men.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
The side swept undercut is a modern and stylish “short sides, longer top” hairstyle for men. With an undercut or undercut fade on the sides and back, the cut works better with medium to longer hair.
Great for straight, wavy, thin or thick hair, you’ll want to use a light to medium-hold pomade. Similar to a comb over or side part, you’ll want to sweep the hair to one side. The goal is to let some of the fringe hang over the forehead for a slightly messy finish.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
The crew cut is a timeless and low-maintenance haircut for men with large foreheads. Longer than a buzz cut but shorter than the Ivy League hairstyle, the crew cut can be achieved with 1 to 2 inches of hair on top paired and a taper fade or undercut on the sides. Men with high foreheads will want to consider leaving more length in the front.
Easy to get and simple to style, the crew cut hairstyle maximizes coverage while minimizing styling needs. You can style the cut by applying hair product and combing to the side, spiking up the top, or leaving it messy and textured. Sleek and classy, this hairstyle suits men of all ages and hair types.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
Why mess with a hairline that highlights your forehead when you can shave your hair off and go with a masculine bald head. This style eliminates the issue of a long forehead by completely getting rid of the hairline that distinguishes its size. It also works for men with thinning hair, bald spots, or receding hairlines.
Guys can use balding clippers for a very short cut and then a razor for a clean shave. Try growing a beard or some heavy stubble to balance out your face by accentuating your jawline. While not the right look for every White, Asian, Hispanic or Black guy, it helps that many women find rugged men with shaved heads very attractive.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
The long fringe is ideal for men who have large foreheads. With medium-length to longer hair, a long fringe can extend to the eyebrows and help conceal the entire forehead. The layered hair on top is particularly sexy and fashionable as it enhances volume and flow.
To style a fringe hairstyle, most guys opt for the angular fringe. Styled straight, textured, or curled, a fringe is great for informal and formal settings.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
Military haircuts come in many styles, depending on the length of the hair. Fortunately, military styles all present the same vintage look. Pairing a military cut with a mid or high skin fade can minimize the contrast of your hairline. For instance, the high and tight fade pulls attention to the haircut on top.
Alternatively, you can ask your barber to keep the hair longer on top and style a gentleman’s side part. While it may seem that only more hair can hide a big forehead, short haircuts can in fact understate the area with a clean look.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
A brushed up hairstyle can be trendy and hot. High-volume styles can make the forehead smaller by elongating the face. A brush up requires medium to longer hair and can be paired with a fade or taper on the sides.
Guys can then style the look brushed upward and back or even directed towards the front like a quiff. A strong pomade, wax or clay will keep your hair styled all day.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
Inspired by the grunge bands of the 90’s, a layered long hairstyle for men can look chic and badass. You can leave shorter layers in the front to shape the face with longer hair throughout for movement and flow.
Not ideal for thin hair, this look is best for men that have thick straight hair. Apply a matte styling product to get a textured, natural finish.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
The choppy crop top fade is a stylish look that’s been trending around the world. This haircut chops up the bangs in front to create asymmetrical cuts along your forehead. Choppy bangs drape over your high forehead to prevent others from seeing where it begins and ends.
While the sides and back should be cut short to provide some contrast, the hair on top along the hairline should have some length. Style your hair messy or neat with your preferred products.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description:
The side part is one of the best business haircuts guys can get. Whether you choose a retro side part or a modern parted cut, this hairstyle is classy, fashionable and handsome.
For an edgy variation, try the side part fade. Then add a shaved line for a hard part. Style the look lightly to get some volume and height instead of the traditionally flat finish.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description: A short and messy hairstyle can be an effortlessly cool way to style your hair. Not all haircuts for big foreheads require a fringe or styling to cover up the hairline. This hairstyle uses texture to achieve youthful and unique tousled finish. A low-shine or matte styling product will allow your hair’s natural shine to be the focus point.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description: The bowl cut fixes a receding hairline or a high, big forehead. Also known as the mushroom cut, the bowl haircut is trimmed uniform and blunt all around the head. Pair the mushroom hairstyle with an undercut or taper fade for a fresh look you can pull off. If the style doesn’t work for you, style a long crop with a fringe to change things up.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description: Spiky hair has always been a popular option. With short to medium hair on top and a fade, spikes are bold enough to make the forehead seem smaller. Whether you choose thick spikes here and there or little spikes all over, you can’t go wrong with this styling. Just make sure you have thick, full hair as opposed to thin locks.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description: The blowout haircut is a new hair trend. Brushed up and back, the blowout taper fade comes with plenty of volume and flow. The big style can make your forehead look more proportionate and add another dimension to your hairstyle.

Titre: 35 Best Hairstyles For Men with Big Foreheads
Description: Textured hairstyles have been huge lately. In contrast to the shiny gelled styles of the 90’s, modern men prefer a more natural look. Textured styles combine healthy hair with matte styling products for a clean, full look.

Short haircuts are the traditional look for balding men. Short hair on top with a fade on the sides and back minimizes the contrast and takes the attention away from bald spots. Similarly, guys with thinning hair on the crown, a widow’s peak, or a receding hairline can get very short hairstyles to make the balding hair part of their look.
Young men who can pull off edgy modern haircuts will want to ask their barber for a high skin fade and a buzz cut or crew cut on top. Even a short comb over fade with a side swept front or slicked back undercut can look nice.
To maximize coverage, volume and texture, use a matte pomade or wax and style the short hair messy. Avoid gels that clump hair together.
Older men may not be able to get very short bald fade cuts that blend into the skin and expose the scalp. Good haircuts for older balding men include a high taper fade on the sides for a classic look. The styling on top can be brushed back, parted to the side, or styled messy and textured.

Bald men with long hair may prefer to find longer hairstyles to try. While it may seem counter-intuitive, hiding bald spots with long hair is actually harder unless you also have thick hair.
In fact, guys with thinning hair can exacerbate the issue and make it more obvious that they are trying to cover up certain areas. For this reason, we highly recommend a medium to longer hairstyle on top with short sides.
For instance, men with widow’s peaks or receding hairlines can get shaved or faded sides. A high fade can blend the hair for a gradual transition. Long haircuts for balding men include the pompadour, slick back, comb over, modern quiff and messy mop top. Textured styling with wax or clay can give your hair a thicker, fuller look.

The buzz cut is a simple and easy men’s hairstyle that looks great on guys who are balding, have thinning hair around the crown, or a receding hairline. This very short haircut will focus attention back to your face and is especially ideal if you have a masculine face shape.
While there are different types of buzz cuts you can get, men can generally cut their own hair at home. Using professional hair clippers, apply a number 2, 3 or 4 guard size and buzz your entire head one length. One variation of a buzzed hairstyle is the high and tight fade, where the short hair on top is complemented by faded sides.
If you want low-maintenance haircut styles for balding hair that are effortless and require no styling, you’ll appreciate the buzz cut.

The crew cut continues to be one of the most popular hairstyles for men, whether they are balding or not. Like the buzz cut but longer, the crew cut is versatile and manly. With more length on top and a taper fade haircut on the sides, the crew cut allows for styling options.
Men can brush the hair forward to cover up a widow’s peak and style a textured crop or sweep the hair in front to the side for a classy finish. Apply a matte wax styling product to thicken your hair for a fuller texture.

The comb over is an excellent hairstyle for thinning hair. When cut and styled properly, the modern comb over fade can do a great job of incorporating your receding hairline or widow’s peak into your hairstyle.
With medium to long hair on top and a fade haircut, combing your hair to one side can give the illusion of more volume.
When styling a comb over, the goal is to use a small amount of light product, comb your hair back and to one side, and not make it obvious you are trying to hide bald spots. The brushed hair should be subtle and airy, not flat with thick clumps. Use a wide-tooth comb with a light touch.

The textured crop top hairstyle is a trendy look where you style your hair forward. With a skin fade or undercut on the sides, short haircut on top and some extra length in the front, styling a French crop will actually hide your receding hair.
Use a medium-hold pomade, wax or clay with low to no shine for a textured finish that works well with the thinning hair on your crown. Lightly comb your hair towards your face and leave the top messy while the front hangs over your forehead. Guys with longer hair in the front can even style a fringe to hide balding areas.

Balding men love slicked back hair. As a balance between classy and cool, slicked back hairstyles draw attention away from your receding hairline or bald spots and focus it back on your sleek look.
Depending on your level of baldness, you can style a short or long slick back. For deeply receding hair, we recommend keeping things short. Start with a high fade or undercut on the sides to limit contrast and make the thin hair on top look thicker.
After applying some men’s hair product, slick your hair towards the back of your head with a brush or comb. As you comb back, make sure to lift to add volume.

The fringe could be the perfect haircut for balding guys who want to conceal a bad hairline. Short sides and short hair on top with longer bangs, fringe hairstyles are achieved by combing your hair towards the front and letting it partially cover your forehead.
You can ask your barber for a short or long fringe and sweep it to one side for an angular styling. The rest of your hair, especially around your crown if you have thin hair, should be tousled to avoid exposing the scalp.

The faux hawk is a badass, edgy haircut that will definitely keep people engaged with how you styled your hair and not any male pattern baldness. Spiked up and bold, the faux hawk fade requires you to push your hair towards the middle of your head.
While your hairline may be more exposed here, the fohawk plays into your hair loss and makes it part of the style. Keep the top short to medium-length, and use a strong pomade for styling.

The side part has been known for generations as the gentleman’s hairstyle. Like a comb over but with a defined part, the side part haircut is neat, sophisticated, and stylish.
Some guys may be concerned about parting their hair and highlighting a bald spot on one side, but you can ask your barber to cut a very high skin fade on the sides to better blend the transition.

The pompadour has traditionally been a medium-length hairstyle with a poof in the front. To work with thinning or balding hair, guys will need to style a short pomp.
With short hair on the sides and 2 to 3 inches of length on top, you’ll want to brush your hair up and back.
A soft touch with a blow dryer can also add volume and flow for men dealing with hair loss.

The quiff haircut looks great on guys with short to medium hair who want a casual yet fashionable style. The modern quiff is often paired with a fade on the sides.
Styling requires a light hair cream or mousse, and generally styles best when you run your fingers through your hair for a relaxed finish.

Spiky hair is one of the best hairstyles for a balding head. For starters, you’ll want short spiky hair that is short in the back and longer in the front. Spikes can be flattering when styled messy with a matte product. Avoid the bad 90’s spiky hairstyles by not using shiny, sticky gel.
The textured haircut styles will give your spikes a thicker appearance, while the messy finish will cover more surface area on your head. Furthermore, guys can spike the hair on the sides forward to hide bald spots along the hairline.

The high and tight is a simple, military-inspired haircut that will hide your hair loss and thinning hair. Functional and easy to get, the high and tight fade is similar to the buzz and crew cut, except it isn’t one-length all around.
The high and tight starts with a high fade on the sides with a very short haircut on top. Cropped and faded, it’s one of the best haircuts for a balding crown, receding hairline or guys with fine hair. While you don’t need to style a high and tight fade hairstyle, a little product can add texture for a natural but fuller finish.

If you’re bald on top with hair on the sides, we highly recommend you simply shave your head. A bald head can be sexy and masculine, especially since women starting loving bald men with beards.
Use balding clippers and trim your hair very short before shaving it all off with a top-rated razor.

Blonde highlights on dark hair look hot when done well. The long textured slicked back hair with high fade and line up on the sides is simply augmented by the contrast between the blonde and darker hair colors.

Nom: Blonde Tips on Brown Hair Guys
Description: If you have dark brown hair and want a natural look, we would recommend light brown highlights for a style that won’t look artificial.

Nom: Silver Hair Highlights on Black Hair
Description: Another version of getting highlights on black hair is getting streaks of silver. This picture demonstrates silver hair highlights on the fringe. Normally, you wouldn’t really notice the bangs brushed back in thick strands, but the silver catches your attention.

If you’re craving brown hair with blonde highlights, this example is gorgeous. With thick, medium length hair styled messy on top and a full beard, you can’t go wrong with this subtle, sun-soaked look.

This low taper fade and thick, textured brush back is already stylish on its own. Pairing black hair with blonde streaks simply brings out the additional layers and give the hairstyle a little something extra aesthetically.

Nom: Platinum Blonde Highlights on Black Hair
Description: The strong contrast between the platinum blonde hair on top and the black hair underneath and on the sides makes this hairstyle edgy and rebellious. Plus, add the cool textured modern pompadour and the high undercut fade, and you have one of the hottest dyed hairstyles around.

While red highlights on black hair don’t create as much variance as other hair colors, the beauty of this dark red is that you really notice the difference when the sun hits your head. We love red highlights and streaks as a summer hairstyle.

Nom: Light Brown Highlights in Black Hair
Description: This comb over undercut looks stunning with light brown highlights throughout. The blending of the colors and hairstyle just make everything come together perfectly.

Nom: Light Brown Streaks on Dark Brown Hair
Description: On dark brown hair, guys will generally find light brown highlights work better than blonde. While some men can certainly pull off the look, light brown streaks are understated and more appreciated.

While frosted tips will inevitably remind you guys of the 90’s, when done right, they can look good. For example, frosted tips on dark brown hair or black hair is the best way to go. Other hair colors just don’t feel natural with this tone.
Lavender hair men have got to want to make a bold statement to go with such a vibrant color.
For one of the coolest hair colors for guys, consider ash brown. Ash brown hair for men is a striking choice, especially on light-skinned dudes.

Nom: Blonde Highlights on Dark Brown Hair
Description: Guys with thick, medium-length hairstyles who want the top layer to catch the eye should get blonde highlights on dark brown hair to further tailor their style.

Although blonde hair tends to be the color most commonly discussed, in recent years, platinum highlights for men have surged in popularity. Although bleached hair requires more upkeep, it can certainly be a game-changer for some guys.

Nom: Dark Brown Hair on the Sides with Long Blonde Top
Light Grey Spiky Hair with Shaved Sides
Hard Side Part + Faded Sides + Blonde Hair

Titre: White, Hispanic and Asian People with Waves
Nom: Hair That You Can’t Make Wavy
Description:
These are hair types that won’t wave. While we welcome you to try, thick straight hair is very hard to make wavy.
Simply put, depending on your hair texture, some guys can make their hair naturally wavy and style 360 waves. This is why black guys with wavy or curly hair can get waves while black people with straighter hair can find it challenging, if not impossible.

Titre: White, Hispanic and Asian People with Waves
Description: For starters, you’ll need to figure out your curl length. This is the minimum length of hair you’ll need to have to start getting waves. Longer hair is easier to make wavy, while short hair can quickly lose its waves. The amount of hair is different for every guy and it ultimately depends on how straight and coarse your hair is.

Titre: White, Hispanic and Asian People with Waves
Description: Once you’ve achieved the minimum length of hair, you’ll need to use a medium wave brush. Regular brushing with a high-quality wave brush is the most important step to getting a 360 wave hairstyle. For this reason, we recommend guys buy one of the best wave brushes on the market.

Titre: White, Hispanic and Asian People with Waves
Description:
The Torino Pro Wave Brush is made with 100% boar bristles and is the most popular, top-rated 360 waves brush you’ll find. Alternatively, if you want a curved wave brush that fits in the palm of your hand for convenience, this Torino Pro All Purpose 360 Waves Brush can help you comb your hair with ease.
You’ll want to brush your hair into a wave pattern multiple times a day. Be gentle to avoid damaging your hair follicles or pulling out strands. And always brush your hair in the same direction to create the same 360 pattern.

Titre: White, Hispanic and Asian People with Waves
Description:
Lastly, guys should buy a good durag. The durag is used to keep your waves in place and protect your brush work. While you don’t need to wear a durag during the day, you should always sleep with it on to keep the wave pattern locked-in. This also avoids your waves getting messed up at night, thereby destroying all the progress you made from brushing.
If your hair is perfect for waves, you can make your straight hair wavy overnight. Otherwise, repeat this process consistently to get 360 waves. Straight hair wavers should start to see progress within a few days!

The modern quiff is one of the most popular hairstyles for men to try. The modern version of the classic style is often combined with a taper fade or undercut on the sides. The short sides contrast the longer hair to create a cool look.
The messy quiff is effortlessly cool and stylish, allowing guys to style a look that is casual yet fashionable.

A quiff hairstyle with a fade haircut on the sides and back highlights the styling on top for a bold look. Choose to get a high, mid, or low fade paired with a bald, skin, or tapered cut. The result is a quiff fade you can wear anywhere.
The undercut quiff combines incredible haircuts for a flawless finish. The undercut is a clean and sophisticated cut on the sides and back that will perfectly complement your modern quiff style.

If you want a low-maintenance look, the short quiff might be right for you. When styling short hair into a quiff, you’ll want to leave the style textured and messy for a full look. Great for guys with all types of hair, a short quiff haircut is easy to get and simple to style everyday.

For a sexy and charming hairstyle, style your long hair into a quiff. If you can grow your hair out and want a long hairstyle that will do your locks justice, a quiff with a taper fade on the sides might be the ideal choice.
If you like the smooth and suave retro styles, the classic quiff can give you the look you want.
The curly quiff is one of the best hairstyles for guys with curly hair. Handsome and trendy, a short to medium length haircut will keep your curls manageable and healthy.

Description: Check out the disconnected undercut or pompadour if you’re curious about other trendy hairstyles!

Titre: 37 Best Widow’s Peak Hairstyles For Men
Description: Short hair is generally the most popular way guys deal with a widow’s peak or receding hairline. This is because short hairstyles like a crew cut and French crop on top paired with a fade or undercut on the sides minimize the difference between your hair and bald spots. For guys with thin hair or hard-to-manage curly or wavy hair, cutting hair short to blend into a widow’s peak may be the only solution.

Titre: 37 Best Widow’s Peak Hairstyles For Men
Description:
Long hair can work beautifully with a widow’s peak if you pick the right hairstyle for your face and hair type. Medium-length to long hairstyles have been trending, so the only challenge is being patient enough to grow out long hair and taking the time to style it every morning.
The best short sides, long top haircuts right now are the textured slick back, comb over, quiff and fringe. All of these styles will allow you to incorporate your widow’s peak into your long hair.

Titre: 37 Best Widow’s Peak Hairstyles For Men
Description: Styling a cool widow’s peak hairstyle with curly hair can be especially tricky. Because wavy and curly hair are already difficult to control, men will need to get a cut that takes advantage of their unique hair type and then use a strong styling product. Curly fringe styles or a thick curly hair undercut may be the look you need.

Titre: 37 Best Widow’s Peak Hairstyles For Men
Description: The buzz cut is one of the best haircuts for men with a widow’s peak. The buzz cut haircut pulls attention away from the receding hairline because there is no hair to contrast the look. Plus, this very short cut and style is masculine, simple to get, and easy to maintain. In fact, guys who like the buzz cut can even trim their own hair at home with quality clippers.

Titre: 37 Best Widow’s Peak Hairstyles For Men
Description: The widow’s peak comb over is a practical hairstyle that allows you to cover up one side of your hairline. By combing your hair to the side and hiding a part of your widow’s peak, guys can take away attention and focus the eyes on the attractive hairstyle on top. If you have thick hair, we highly suggest getting the messy comb over fade.

Titre: 37 Best Widow’s Peak Hairstyles For Men
Description: The undercut is another barbershop favorite that looks good with a variety of men’s haircuts. Undercut hairstyles work with a widow’s peak by making the hair on top appear to be fuller in comparison. And because the undercut is generally cut very high and short, it can stop people from noticing your hairline. The best part is that guys have so many choices here, from the slicked back undercut to a comb over, pomp or quiff.

Titre: 37 Best Widow’s Peak Hairstyles For Men
Description: The hard side part is a modern variation of a classic haircut. The side part haircut is classy and timeless, but when combined with a thick hard part that accentuates the combing over of the hair, the style takes on a new look. Whether you have a widow’s peak or not, you’ll love side parted hair with a line shaved into your scalp.

Titre: 37 Best Widow’s Peak Hairstyles For Men
Description: If the fade or undercut isn’t short enough for you, then you can always completely shave your sides. A shaved widow’s peak effectively eliminates all contrast and seamlessly blends your hairline with the buzzed sides.

Titre: 37 Best Widow’s Peak Hairstyles For Men
Description: Slicked back hair looks surprisingly stylish with a widow’s peak. As one of the hottest hairstyles for men in recent years, the slick back could be the style you’ve been searching for. To get the cut, just let your hair grow out a few inches on top and ask your barber for an undercut or fade on the sides. Then, apply a strong-hold pomade and brush your hair back for a slick, shiny finish.

Titre: 37 Best Widow’s Peak Hairstyles For Men
Description: The mohawk is a natural choice for a widow’s peak. By combining shaved sides with a mohawk hairstyle, guys can style an edgy yet trendy look. However, if the mohawk is too gritty for you, try the faux hawk fade or a short cut on the sides with spiky hair on top.

Description: The low taper is a classy cut. With the hair tapering just above the ears and hairline, a low taper haircut is the most conservative. Low tapers are often the favorite of businessmen and professionals who need a stylish gentleman’s haircut for the office but want to avoid exposing too much scalp.
The mid taper focuses on blending the hair at a middle point. A medium taper haircut is not as edgy as the high taper, but styles nicely for business professionals.

A high taper starts near the top of the sides, creating more of a contrast between the short sides and longer top. High taper haircuts are stylish and popular, and can be further tailored with a line up around the hairline.

The most popular taper haircut is the taper fade. This low taper blends the hair on the sides and focuses attention on the longer hair on top. But not all tapers are fades, and guys can ask their barbers for a classic cut with scissors instead of clippers. Nevertheless, both types of styles work well with short sides, long top hairstyles.

Nom: Short Taper with Brushed Back Hair
Description: Most trendy men’s tapered hairstyles require short sides for a low-maintenance finish. The short taper is a good haircut for guys who want a classy, sophisticated look for both their professional and personal lives. The textured brush back with low taper offers the perfect balance to achieve this.

This slick back taper combines the conservative, clean cut look of a tapered hairstyle with the edgy styling of a slick back. To style a slick back taper fade, you’ll also need a good pomade and brush.

The tapered sides and back blend seamlessly into your neck and sideburns, allowing the short hair on the sides to focus attention to the thicker, longer hair on top. In this example, you’ll see a blowback haircut, which is a type of slick back style but with textured, natural hair. For a matte finish, guys will want to apply a matte wax, clay or pomade.

Like a fade, there are high, medium, and low taper haircuts. This low taper with a modern comb over is a timeless look that’s been trending hot around the world. For handsome hair that women will love, ask your barber for a comb over taper fade.

The medium taper is another sexy haircut for men. The mid taper haircut starts in the middle of the head and offers a more aggressive cut. The masculine look is complete with the stubble beard and natural comb over.

Similar to a beard fade, guys can taper their sideburns. While you first need to grow a full beard, tapered sideburns allow your hair on the sides to blend into your facial hair for a unique but attractive finish.

Nom: Short Taper Fade with Crop Top
Description: A short taper fade may be your only option if you plan on getting a very short haircut on top. Like the crew cut or buzz cut, the French crop is a clean, low-maintenance look that doesn’t need much styling or product.

Nom: Tapered Sides with Long Comb Over
Description: The comb over hairstyle looks stylish with many different cuts, including tapered sides, fades, and undercuts. Add a beard and a few hairs falling off your forehead and girls will absolutely love this look.
This hard side part is a variation of the classic hairstyle. While the side part has been around for decades, the style continues to be a popular men’s haircut.

Nom: Low Taper Fade with Angular Fringe and Beard
Description: The fringe is a good hairstyle for guys who have thick or curly hair. If you are having a difficult time styling your hair, a fade on the sides combined with a messy fringe on top is an easy yet trendy look any guy can pull off.
If you have beautiful short to medium-length hair, a textured quiff is a cool hairstyle to try. You can get a high skin fade or undercut on the sides, or opt for a more conservative tapered cut.

Nom: Comb Over Taper and Full Beard
Description: The contrast of the comb over taper style is perfect for men who have thick hair. To style the look and give your hair a textured feel, be sure to use a quality pomade and apply it while your hair is very slightly damp.

Nom: Hard Side Part with Taper and Beard
Description: This side part with taper is a cool short hairstyle for men. The addition of the beard can make the style look hipster or very masculine, giving you the option to change your look throughout the week.

Nom: Short Tapered Sides with Textured Brush Up
Description: Here we have short tapered sides with a textured brush up and goatee. This awesome hairstyle can be easily tweaked to style a quiff, pompadour, or slick back.

Nom: Tight Taper Fade with Textured Slick Back
Description: Some tapered haircuts blend all the way to your neckline, creating a neck taper like the one pictured above. And instead of creating a shiny slick back with pomade, this stylist decided to texture the hair for a natural, loose men’s hairstyle.

Nom: Low Classic Taper with Thick Brushed Back Hair
Description: As one of the most classic haircuts for men, here we have thick hair brushed straight back. The benefit of this look is that, with a bit more styling or pomade, he could design a pompadour or slick back.

Nom: Modern Pompadour with Taper and Hair Design
Description: The modern pompadour is still one of the hottest men’s hair trends of recent years. Etch in a cool hair design and you’ve got a super cool style.
Neck taper fades are certainly under-appreciated. If you’re cutting your hair but not getting a very short fade or undercut on the sides, consider tapering your neckline.
This messy crew cut is simple, easy to style, and low-maintenance.

Nom: Medium-Length Taper and Brushed Back Hair
Description: One of the best hairstyles for medium-length hair is the effortless brush back. If you’re thinking of growing out your hair and need a longer hairstyle, this is one option to keep in mind. And if you ever want a more suave look, you can always apply pomade to create a slick back, comb over, or quiff.

Nom: Textured Slick Back and Tapered Sides
Description: Tapered hair on the sides with slicked back hair on top makes for an excellent business or professional haircut.
If you’re getting a low fade haircut, consider getting a beard fade. Connecting your fade to your beard looks hot and fashion-forward.

Nom: Long Comb Over Taper with Beard
Description: If you don’t want a very short haircut because you’re trying to hide a receding hairline or have thin hair, then asking for a long taper on the sides and styling a long comb over on top is an excellent idea.
The men’s taper is versatile and timeless – it works well with short, medium or long hair.
The classic comb over remains an all-time favorite. As one of the most requested haircuts in barbershops today, parted hair will never go out of style.

Nom: Long Taper with Medium-Length Hair on Top
Description: Some men just prefer the long taper haircut. However, the only way a long taper works is if you have even longer hair on top.

Nom: Low Cut Taper Fade with Textured Top
Description: This low cut taper fade curves around the ear and drops down to the neckline. The faded sides are needed to emphasize the natural, short spiky hair on top.

Nom: Clean Cut Tapered Sides For Boys
Description: Tapered hairstyles tend to be excellent for school boys. Before visiting your local barbershop, take a look at these awesome boys haircuts for inspiration.
The Ivy League is another gentleman’s haircut that looks classy. Often paired with a tapered cut and a side swept fringe or part, it’s a sweet style that will get you recognized as a gentleman.

Guys with long blonde hair have always been considered hot and attractive. But with the right long hairstyle, men can take their style and sex appeal to the next level. The best long blonde hairstyles are often left naturally flowing and messy. We recommend you use a light hair clay or cream to give your locks some texture and movement for the perfect styling.

Short blonde hair for men remains one of the most popular choices in barbershops. Men’s short blonde hairstyles are clean, easy and low-maintenance, and range from the crew cut to the crop top and can be styled messy or neat. If you want short messy blonde hair, we recommend a matte pomade or wax for a natural, textured finish.

Medium-length blonde hairstyles have also been trending strong in recent years. Versatile and handsome, medium hairstyles like the comb over, slick back, and quiff allow guys to style many different looks. For maximum styling control, make sure to apply a product with a strong hold.

The blonde fade haircut is the best way to cut guy’s hair on the sides. The blonde fade is the foundation of most short sides, long top hairstyles because it focuses attention to how the hair is styled. And because there are numerous different types of fade haircuts, guys have the ability to tailor their cut to their unique sense of style. From the high skin fade to the low taper fade, blonde fade hairstyles are popular in barbershops around the world.

The blonde undercut is a common alternative to the fade haircut. The undercut starts high on the sides and is trimmed short and all one-length. Although blonde undercut hairstyles don’t fade or blend gradually, they still offer plenty of contrast. Try a comb over or slicked back undercut for an edgy look you’ll love!

Guys with thick blonde hair have the option of getting all the best haircuts. If you’re hair is thick and blonde, you can ask your barber for a faux hawk, quiff, pompadour, side part, man bun or top knot and easily style any look you want. With so many cool hairstyles for men with thick hair, the possibilities are limitless.

Dirty blonde hair offers a unique twist to any look. The contrast between light and dark blonde hair can make any style stand out. We suggest men who want the best dirty blonde hairstyles to apply a low shine or matte pomade to accentuate the coloring of their hair.

Platinum blonde hairstyles are edgy and rebellious. Platinum hair men appreciate the fact that a little hair dye or coloring can add another dimension to their style. And while it may be difficult to achieve a platinum blonde color if you have dark hair, a skilled stylist can help you wear the look perfectly.
Ash blonde hair for men is another sexy style that blends gray tones for a warm-cool color. While not all guys can pull off ash blonde hairstyles, if you can, it’s a deeply desired look.

Blonde highlights for men are back in vogue. Not since the 90’s have we seen so many hairstyles with highlights, but these days, stylists are making the look much more tasteful. Blonde highlights are particularly nice on teen boys and young men. Whether you want blonde tips or streaks of blonde throughout your hair, highlights can work well with modern cuts and styles.

Description: The short side part is a low-maintenance, clean-cut hairstyle. With faded sides and short hair on top, guys can easily style the look. To make short parted hair work well, we’d recommend you have thick hair to avoid bald spots or exposing too much scalp.

Side part hairstyles for medium-length and long hair have been trending strong in recent years. The long side part is a cool variation of a short sides, long top haircut with a focus on the styling of the hair. The beauty of longer hair on top is that it can be styled in a comb over, quiff, pompadour, or messy hairstyle as well.

The side part fade is the most popular parted haircut. Because fades are versatile and look stylish when paired with all types of styles, they make for the best way to trim the hair on the sides. With so many different types of fade cuts to choose, you can tailor your men’s side part fade to your sense of style.

The classic side part refers to how your parted hairstyle is cut and styled. The classic side part haircut usually comes with longer hair on top, tapered sides, and a more rigid, slick comb over of the hair.

A modern side part tends to have some of the more contemporary features and styles of today. For instance, faded sides, a shaved hard line, and a textured, natural finish are all attributes of a modern side part haircut for men.

Description:
Viking braids offer a stylish way to create a unique look. Guys can braid hair of all lengths, deciding to simply intertwine a few strands or all of their hair. Similarly, how you braid your hair and what type of hairstyle you get braided can make all the difference.
For example, a braided part can work nicely for a modern gentleman with a pompadour fade, comb over or slicked back undercut.
On the other hand, guys can loosely braid their top knot or man ponytail. Even a braided mohawk bun can look good on the right dude. Just imagine braids on top with shaved sides and back, and you have one badass look.
Ultimately, if you have the right hair length, cut and style, the men’s Viking braids may be a sexy hairstyle to experiment with.

The Viking mohawk is another classic Nordic warrior hairstyle that was used to evoke fear into enemies. With shaved back and sides, a long mohawk will stand out and emphasize the strip of hair in the middle.
For an even more aggressive finish, grow a long braided beard or a long ponytail in the back and you have the makings of a savage yet trendy style.

If you’re looking for a popular haircut that is both Viking and hipster, look no further than the undercut. The Viking undercut pairs with all types of cuts and styles, and is part of the short sides, long top hairstyle trend of recent years. For instance, you can combine a top knot, ponytail, or slicked back hair with an undercut.
In addition to being easy to style, undercut hairstyles offer a ton of contrast. If you don’t want to shave your head, the next closest option is a Viking undercut or fade.

The shaved head and beard is a timeless Viking look. A bald head and full, long beard can be especially useful for guys who have a receding hairline and want a rugged style. All you need are balding clippers and the discipline to grow a beard.

If you have long, lustrous hair, then skip the shaved head and get a long hairstyle with a beard. While long hair doesn’t always come across as manly, a thick beard style can offer a tough, manly look. It also helps if you add a messy, textured finish using sea salt spray or clay.
Plus, having a lot of hair to work with allows for a variety of Viking styles. From a ponytail to a man bun to a braided top knot, guys can change their look when they have the length to make it happen.

Also known as the Bjorn Ironside haircut from the hit TV show Vikings, a long ponytail with shaved sides is among the coolest Viking hairstyles you can have. Especially when braided, this look is awesome and sleek.
While cool beard braid styles aren’t unique to just Vikings, it still qualifies as one of the hottest ways to accessorize a good haircut!

The comb over and side part quiff is a variation of the classic parted hairstyle. Simply put, instead of combing your hair to the side flat, allow yourself volume and height.

If you’re searching for a unique cut and style, a 50s greaser haircut may just be a stylish change to your traditional look. However, a trip to your barber is the easy part; the challenge is how to get a greaser hairstyle!
Although it may take practice, we highly recommend you use pomade instead of gel. Some of the best pomades in the market, like Suavecito and Layrite, have been specifically designed to do greaser hair.
Now, let’s take a look at the top men’s greaser hairstyles from the 1950s.
