Hair Design Part with High Fade
Description: For more hot hair trends, check out these dope haircuts for black men.

The best haircuts for kids start with short sides and longer hair on top. Even with short haircuts, it’s important that you ask your kid’s barber to cut the hair even shorter on the sides and back. A kids fade haircut or undercut offers the necessary contrast to focus the eyes on the cool styling on the top of the head.
Fortunately, there are many different types of taper fades and undercuts, allowing parents and children to decide how edgy or clean-cut they want their trim to be.
Similarly, hairstyles for boys also range depending on hair type, length, and texture. From short to long, neat to messy, easy to creative, shiny to textured, and classic to modern, kids have a number of styling options to pick. The latest hair trends for kids have centered around the comb over, mohawk, spiky hair, and variations of messy, textured styles.
Some boys like to ask their barber for a hard part or get haircut designs shaved into their sides. Truly, boys hairstyle ideas are endless opportunities to be unique and bold.
Let’s take a look at the most popular kids haircuts to get right now!
From the crew cut to the comb over fade to the short mohawk, there are many cool short haircuts for kids. Great for school and active children, boys short hairstyles are easy to style and wear.

Long hairstyles for kids can be worth the extra effort. Fortunately, little boys are always growing out healthy long hair, offering the perfect opportunity to style all the best new hairstyles.
Use a good shampoo and conditioner with organic ingredients to ensure your boy has beautiful hair.

The kids fade haircut looks nice with any hairstyle. The taper fade blends the hair gradually on the sides and back to create a stylish flow from short to shorter. As the most popular version of short sides, long top hairstyles, we highly recommend taper fades for kids.
Boys can choose from several fades, including the high, mid and low fade cuts. Kids can also pick how short the cut goes. The skin or bald fade tapers hair down to the scalp for a very short and edgy look.
Whether little boy has short, long, straight, thick, thin, wavy or curly hair, fade haircuts can take your child’s hairstyle to the next level.

The kids undercut started as a hair trend for hipsters and slowly flowed to teen boys and toddlers. The undercut is one of the coolest haircut ideas for young and older boys alike.
The undercut features a short haircut on the sides and back that is one length. The name characterizes the cutting technique, whereby your child’s barber seemingly cuts under the hair on top. Unlike the fade, undercut hairstyles are not blended or tapered.
Often paired with a slick back, comb over, mohawk or spiked up styling, the undercut is classy and elegant yet outgoing and sleek.
If you need an awesome 9, 10, 11 or 12 year old boys hairstyle that will really stand out, get your kid an undercut haircut.

The kids mohawk haircut is a new hair trend for boys that looks daring yet cute. While some kids choose to shave their sides, most just ask for a high skin fade or very short undercut and then spike the hair on top.
The less intense version of the traditional mohawk makes the look more mainstream and handsome for young boys and teens.
Use a strong hair product for little boys to make sure the hair stays up and spiked all day.

The kids pompadour is a modern take on a retro style. The pompadour fade starts with tapered sides that accentuate the styling on top. The pomp in the front is styled by lifting the hair up and back.
Use a good kids hair gel or pomade to keep the hair in place with a healthy shine. Trendy and class, the boys pompadour looks best on kids with straight, thick hair.

The comb over for kids is one of the most versatile and best boys haircuts to get. Specifically, the comb over fade provides the foundation to style a number of hairstyles.
Start with undercut or faded sides and back. Parents and boys can decide on a low, mid, or high fade and then determine how short to go. The skin fade will buzz hair very short, and this can be great as a summer cut. Other ways to tailor the cut include adding a hard part or etching a hair design into the sides.
To do a comb over, apply a quality pomade, gel, or wax and spread it through your kid’s hair. Then part the hair to one side with a brush or comb. Use a matte styling product for a natural, textured finish.
The comb over haircut can also be transformed to style a mohawk, quiff, pompadour, messy shag top, or long angular fringe.
Easy to get and simple to style, the kids comb over haircut is certainly a barbershop favorite.

Spiky boy haircuts have been around for decades. Kids with spiky hair always look cool. Casual yet adorable spiky haircuts are effortless to style and perfect for kids with layered thick, straight hair.
With a strong high-hold gel or pomade, run your hands through your little boys hair and lift. To create distinct individual spikes, use your fingers to shape thick groups of hair. Otherwise, leave the spiked up hair messy and textured for a fuller look. Another styling idea may be to just spike up the front.
For kids with thin hair, make sure you use a low or no shine styling product like wax or clay for a thicker appearance.
Ultimately, spiky hairstyles for kids are sleek and fun. Add a fade on the sides with a shaved line or shape up for a unique look that will stand out.

Moms love little boys with shaggy hair. Also known as the mop top hairstyle, cute shaggy haircuts are both low-maintenance and easy for kids to manage.
For starters, shaggy hair only works on medium to long hair. However, shag haircuts look good on all hair types, including straight, wavy, and curly.
To minimize frizz and add natural texture, style this long kids hairstyle with a  touch of light-hold styling cream. Healthy, beautiful, and messy, let the hair fall naturally for the perfect look.

The boys side part is the ideal little gentleman’s hairstyle. The side part haircut is a classy and sweet style that can be worn for both formal and informal occasions.
Start with a side part fade. The faded sides will offer a fresh, clean-cut trim. Ask for a hard part to emphasize your hair’s natural part.
To style the side part, simply comb your hair to one side. Then brush the rest down to highlight the parted style.
One awesome benefit is that the side part fade can always be styled and fix quickly if your kid messes up his hair.

Slicked back hair has been an awesome go-to kids haircut for generations. With short sides and longer hair on top, all moms have to do is brush their little boy’s hair straight back.
Boys can get a slick back fade or undercut. The slicked back undercut provides an elegant style that will make your child stand out in any group.
If you want the sleek classic styling, use a high-shine gel and comb the hair back. For a loose and textured hairstyle, apply a medium-hold, matte pomade to maximize volume and flow.

The faux hawk is a type of spiky style that little boys love. Rebellious, fun and style, the faux hawk works best with a fade on the sides.
To get the faux hawk, your kids hair needs to be spiked up and pushed towards the middle of the head.
As the name suggests, the result is a fake mohawk that’s universally handsome and fresh.

The quiff is a cool hairstyle for kids who want an effortless style. With short medium-length to longer hair, the modern textured quiff looks especially good on older boys who want movement and volume.
Get a taper fade or undercut on the sides and back, or brush the top over for a side quiff – there are plenty of ways to wear this cut.

Messy boy hairstyles are easy, low-maintenance haircut styles for kids and busy moms. Apply a light to moderate hold styling product throughout for texture and you’ve got a messy yet fashionable look.
Furthermore, little boys can add a messy touch to any style. Instead of a structured or neat finish, use your fingers and hands for a more tousled, disheveled top.
Perfect for boys with thick, curly, and wavy hair, messy hair on top is a trend with staying power.

The crew cut is one of the best short hairstyles for kids. With 1 to 2 inches of length on top and a taper fade haircut on the sides, the kids crew cut is a great option for boys who want an athletic style.
One way to make the crew cut different and special is to spike up the front or sweep the hair to the side. Start with a small amount of pomade or gel, bring your hair forward and create a side swept style with your bangs.

Side swept hair can be combined with any cool short or long hairstyle. Ideally, you’ll want long layered hair on top with swept bangs.
You’ll want to apply a light styling cream or mousse, and sweep the hair over with your fingers. The end result is a casual yet chic flowing style.
Try this excellent textured, windswept kids hairstyle for a timeless touch.

The buzz cut is the classic very short haircut for boys. The buzz cut fade is simple and fresh, and great for kids with active lifestyles who don’t want to invest time styling their locks every day.
To achieve some contrast between the sides and top, we recommend asking your child’s barber for a mid or high skin taper fade.

The fringe features bangs that fall over the forehead. While the rest of the hair on the head can be short, medium or long, the fringe adds a lot of style without requiring any volume.
Textured fringe hairstyles work well with thick, thin or fine hair. Similarly, you can cut your bangs for a short fringe or let them grow out for a longer, angular fringe.
With limitless styling options, kids are free to choose their own look.

The brushed up hairstyle is a sophisticated and cute style for young boys. As one of the top hairstyles for men, it only makes sense that the textured styling would look equally cool on little kids.
Combined with short faded sides, a brushed up top can be casual and fun as a school boy haircut or elegant and classy for a wedding.

The fact that the man bun continues to be seen is a testament to its staying power. No longer considered a fad, man bun styles work beautifully for boys and guys who want a simple yet trendy way to rock their long hair. The man bun is similar to the top knot, but this long hairstyle is typically set farther back.
While the top knot often comes with faded, undercut, or shaved sides with long hair on top that is tied up in a knot, the man bun is achieved with longer hair that is kept in a bun in the back. This hairstyle is great for kids who want to embrace their long, straight hair but want to keep it out of their face sometimes.

If your boy wants to try something daring, grow his hair out and go for the top knot. The top knot came onto the scene around the same time as the man bun, but hasn’t enjoyed the same following. While the top knot is remarkably similar to a ponytail, the difference is the placement of the tie up and the often faded, undercut or shaved sides.
Little boys and teenage guys will have to grow out a lot of hair and then cut the sides short, or slowly grow just the top while maintaining the shorter sides. Once you have enough hair on top, gather it into a knot on the crown, and use a hair tie to keep it in place.

Long wavy haircuts offer a stylish look with plenty of character, meaning your boy’s wavy hair can be cut and styled in many different ways. When tousled and styled messy, natural waves make wavy hairstyles low-maintenance and handsome. Perfect for boys with some texture in their hair naturally, this style will keep them looking cool without much effort.

Getting thick hair to grow out to a styled medium length can be difficult, but it is worth it. This haircut will fit right in with the ’70s revival that is currently popular. Make the haircut medium length with some texture and choppiness so it looks young and playful.

A bob is a cool look for kids with medium-length to longer straight hair. The bangs on this cut help frame the face, which works especially well for round faces. This cut works best when the bangs are kept purposely unkempt. This avoids the haircut looking overly manicured.

If your kid doesn’t want too much fuss with his hair and doesn’t like getting haircuts, try letting his hair grow out until it is chin length and the bangs are long enough to be side-swept. This style is as low maintenance as it gets.

If you have long curly hair but aren’t sure how to style it, why not let your haircut simply flow naturally. As one of the best long hairstyles for men with thick hair, this natural look can weigh down your curls while allowing them to add something unique! You may even want to apply some light pomade for a textured finish.

A ponytail is one of the easiest and most common longer styles for boys, teenagers, and young men. Whether you’re in the process of growing your hair long or already have length, you’ll eventually try this low-maintenance hairstyle.

Cool shoulder length hairstyles don’t have to be complicated to look good. You don’t need dreads, braided sections, or some hipster spin that requires regular styling. Instead, you can sweep your hair behind your ears, part it in the middle, or just let everything fall naturally. Similar to a bro flow, shoulder length hair offers a level of fullness and volume that looks trendy and fashionable for boys of all ages.

Nom: Long Curly Bob with Middle Part
Description: For kids with curly hair, it can be hard to find a longer style that works better than this center part. Other longer styles can look crazy on curly hair, but this cut is fun without being too much. This hairstyle is long enough to stand out while still being relatively low maintenance.

For those blessed with naturally thick, tightly curled hair, an Afro is a great longer hairstyle. Popular with cute little black boys, an Afro is a fresh way to have a fun hairstyle that is flattering to your natural hair. Afro haircuts can require some additional maintenance, but the results are more than worth it.

Layering adds a charming style to all hairstyles, so a layered haircut for boys with medium to long hair can be the perfect look. Layered medium length cuts are great for those with fine hair, as they add a little volume. They are also meant to be worn messy, which is perfect for boys and teenagers who want a hassle-free trim. This style has a little inherent devil-may-care attitude about it.

A favorite for black boys who are growing their hair out, dreads are fun and versatile. Once grown out, they can be styled into many different styles, whether they are left to grow out naturally or paired with a fade.

Wavy thick hair is often naturally messy, making it a chic hairstyle for boys and guys who are growing their hair out. Grow it out to let the hair find its natural shape, and have your barber accentuate that. It only needs to be cut every once in a while, making it great for kids who don’t like to sit in a barber’s chair often.

This natural hair isn’t a haircut, it is the opposite. The idea is to let your son’s hair grow out and be wild and messy. This approach is suited for kids with naturally wavy or curly hair. Your boy’s hair will grow out and have its own style without requiring any active styling with product. The only work it needs is a sweaty hand brushing the hair out of your son’s face as he plays outside.

Textured shag cuts are another piece of history that is seeing a resurgence recently. Popular in the ‘70s rock scene, icons like Mick Jagger and David Bowie wore a shag cut. The haircut involves layering the hair to different lengths all around. Traditionally, they were also feathered on top, but it might be best to let the hair lay flat for your boy’s next cut.

If your son has wavy hair but is not quite ready to let it grow out to his shoulders, a medium-length style might be the solution. His hair should be longer and flow past his ears without quite reaching the chin. This flowing hairstyle looks best parted in the middle or to the side. You can also try it with bangs, depending on how your son likes to style his hair.

Easier to maintain than dreads, twists are a great way to embrace thick, textured hair. This style is versatile and fun, giving you options on how you want the final look to come across. You can add a fade to maximize the effect of the hair on top, or keep it twisted all around.

Titre: Best 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Haircuts
Nom: Cool 7, 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Hairstyles
Description: Let’s take a look at the best boys haircuts and hairstyles that are trending this year. Whether your little guy likes long, medium, or short haircuts, we’re confident you’ll discover countless cool ideas to try!

Titre: Best 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Haircuts
Description:
The boys fade haircut is the most popular way for kids to cut hair on the sides and back. Low-maintenance and easy to style, taper fades offer very short haircuts that focus the eyes on the styling on top.
There are many kinds of fades for little boys to choose from. Whether your kid wants a low, mid, high, or skin fade will determine where the tapering begins and how short the hair gets.
The low fade starts just above the ear and tapers down to the neckline. Classy and handsome, this haircut may be good for a 4, 5, 6, or 7 year old boy whose mom wants to retain some semblance of innocence.
The high fade starts the blending process very high on the sides and back, just below the hairstyle above. Edgy and bold, this type of fade may be the perfect short haircut for a 10 year old boy or older.
Finally, the bald or skin fade is a haircut that blends hair down to the skin. Cool and trendy for young tween boys, this clean cut looks nice with fashionable, sleek hairstyles such as the comb over, slick back, mohawk, and spiky hair. Some kids even like to ask their barbers to shave a design or add a hard part into their cut.
Many of the best hairstyles for kids ages 6 through 12 start with short sides and long hair on top. Taper fade haircuts provide plenty of variation and work with most hair lengths, types, and textures.
Just make sure to get your boy a good hair product so he can style all his favorite looks. Alternatively, if you think he’s grown-up enough, check out the top styling products for guys, including pomade, wax and cream.

Titre: Best 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Haircuts
Description:
The undercut is one of the coolest haircuts for boys right now. As its name implies, an undercut involves keeping the hair on the top of the head and buzzing underneath it to shorten or remove hair on the sides and back of the head.
The end result is a one-length cut that looks fresh and stylish for all types of kid’s hairstyles.
As one of the best 9, 10, 11 and 12 year old boy haircuts you can get, the undercut has limitless styling options. Like the fade, it works with all hair lengths and can be styled with slick back, comb over, pompadour, quiff, spiky, and messy styles.
While boys with thick hair pull off the undercut best, the look can work with a variety of types. Talk to your child’s barber to see if the cut is right for your kid’s look.

Titre: Best 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Haircuts
Description:
Spiky hair is universally cute and has been a timeless hairstyle for boys of all ages. Compatible with long, medium, and short hair, spiked up hairstyles can be worn in a slew of ways to pull off vastly different looks.
For instance, short spiky hair looks best when textured on top to create a naturally messy look.
When combined with a high taper fade, short thick spikes draw the eyes to the awesome styling on top of the head.
Medium to long haired boys can choose to spike their hair in the front, style thick spikes all over, or to combine the style with a faux hawk.
A great spiky haircut can really transform your kid’s style and looks flattering on a 8 or 11 year old boy.

Titre: Best 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Haircuts
Description:
Daring and adorable, the mohawk is an exceptional hairstyle for self-expression. While it allows young boys to feel rebellious, wild and crazy, mohawk styles are incredibly versatile depending on how extreme of a cut you let your child try.
From shaved sides to short taper fade cuts, the length of hair on the sides and back of the head will influence the overall look. For instance, a mohawk with shaved sides is much more outgoing and unique than a sleek faux hawk fade.
Nevertheless, how short or long you keep your hair on top will is really what will affect the styling of your mohawk. Regardless of whether your little boy chooses a long or short mohawk, he will need a strong gel or pomade to keep the hair up.
Kids mohawk and faux hawk haircuts work for all hair types, including fine, thick, and curly hair.
Just to note, if your child is looking for the best back to school haircuts and wants something to stand out, we recommend you start with the faux hawk and fade.

Titre: Best 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Haircuts
Description:
The pompadour and quiff are classy retro styles your kid will love. While the pompadour hairstyle was made famous by celebrities such as Elvis Presley and James Dean, the modern pompadour is less structured and more fluid with good volume and flow. However, nothing beats the casual and effortless look of the modern quiff.
Since the styling of each requires creating volume at the front of the head, it’s no surprise that the pompadour and quiff are easily confused.
The difference between the quiff and pompadour is that the famous pomp is brushed up and back to achieve a sleek, rock star look. It requires a good hair product and some effort.
On the other hand, the quiff flows beautifully as it is brushed up and forward to create an airy volume that is equal parts attitude and functionality.
As very cool hairstyles for 10, 11 and 12 year olds, these haircuts are better-suited for older kids.

Titre: Best 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Haircuts
Description:
Shag tops and messy hairstyles are always fun and easy to get. If your boy has thick or curly hair, then shaggy or messy hair can be a perfect fit. After all, this is the ideal time in life for him to experiment with different looks, so embrace the shag haircut and forget about the upkeep that comes with other short, medium and long styles.
The good news is that messy doesn’t have to mean unkempt or dirty. In fact, when styled correctly, these simple hairstyles can be quite handsome and chic, especially for unruly coarse hair and hard-to-manage curls.
The secret to wearing a nice shaggy or messy hairstyle is to add layers to the hair and style it with a light hold cream. In addition to creating volume and texture, the styling cream will maximize control while moisturizing and conditioning to minimize frizz.
Short messy hair continues to be a hot trends, but the curly hair fringe is a trendy idea as well.

Titre: Best 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Haircuts
Description:
The crew cut and buzz cut are cute yet masculine hairstyles for little boys. These awesome short boy haircuts are low-maintenance and simple. As a matter of fact, you can buzz cut your boy’s hair at home with good clippers.
With a kid’s buzz cut, the hair is the same short length all over the head, creating a handsome, clean-cut look that’s effortless. Good for boys with strong jawlines, high bones, and rugged features, it’s generally a great cut for the summer.
Similarly, with the boy’s crew cut, the hair on top is longer. Usually combined with a fade on the sides, a barber will leave between 1 to 3 inches of length.
The extra hair will allow your child to style a number of different styles, including the Ivy League haircut with side swept hair in the front, a textured crop top, or short spikes.
These practical yet stylish school boy haircuts are perfect for athletes and kids who have trouble getting ready in the mornings.

Titre: Best 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Haircuts
Description:
The side part and comb over are two of the most iconic hairstyles for boys, and they look great with any hair length, type, or texture. It’s important to note that the modern comb over and current gentleman’s side part is different than their classic counterparts.
The comb over fade continues to be a popular short sides, long top haircut. Countless men and boys ask their barbers to shave in a hard part for a bold look.
The hard part comb over does add one great functional benefit – it tells your kid exactly where to part and comb the hair to one side.
Whichever style you choose, be sure to use quality shampoo, conditioner, and styling products to keep your boy’s hair healthy.

Titre: Best 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 Year Old Boy Haircuts
Description:
Sophisticated and adorable, slicked back hair is a look every kid can pull off. With a fade or undercut on the sides and longer hair on top, slick back haircuts for little boys just need to be combed straight back.
For a suave and mature look, use a high shine pomade or mousse for a glossy finish. Otherwise, a textured finish for a natural look can be achieved with a matte product such as wax or clay.
For more ideas and styles, check out all the hottest kids haircuts right now.

A low fade haircut starts the tapered cut right above the ears and neckline. The low fade provides less contrast and a little bit more texture on the sides for a more conservative, clean-cut look. Low fades work especially well for little boys with medium-length to longer hairstyles that want their hair to look thicker. Whether you want a cute comb over, a modern spiky hairstyle, or classic messy top, low fade haircuts are flattering and adorable on all kids.

The high fade haircut is simple yet totally versatile and fun. The high fade creates a super high-contrast style that puts the focus on the styling on top. Moms and little boys can combine this faded cut with short or long hair, allowing you to style all the most popular hairstyles of the year.
Similarly, because of the large canvas, many boys explore different hair designs with high fades. Consider a high fade comb over with a hard part and cool design for an awesome, outgoing look. On the other hand, if you don’t want to shave your boy’s hair, the boys mohawk fade is a less-intense version of the classic look with shaved sides.

The mid fade starts somewhere between the low and high fade, offering the perfect balance of edgy and handsome. Mid fade haircuts start in the middle of the sides and back, and can taper very short and fast.
If you have a toddler boy and don’t want to ask your barber for an overly-aggressive haircut, mid fades can offer a happy medium. Plus, you can still enjoy short sides and longer hair on top to style all the latest looks.

With a taper fade, your boy’s barber will cut the sides and back very short with clippers, but not blend the hair into the skin. Taper fade haircuts are known to lead into shorter-length hair as they get closer to the hairline without fading into the scalp.
As a type of fade, boys can choose from high, mid and low taper fades. Slightly more conservative, a boy’s taper fade is all about personal style and personality. Ideal for classy, formal occasions like Sunday church service and weddings, taper fade hairstyles are stylish and fresh.

The undercut fade combines two of the most popular haircuts for boys – the undercut and fade. Similar to the high fade, the undercut traditionally starts very high on the sides and back, is cut all one length, and features a distinct difference between the sides and top. In contrast, the undercut fade blends and tapers.
The undercut fade haircut is often paired with a slick back. Otherwise, the style looks good with a variety of medium and long hairstyles. Try a slicked back undercut or fun faux hawk for chic styling.

Also known as a bald fade, the skin fade haircut blends the hair on the sides and back into the skin. This very short fade haircut exposes the scalp for an edgy yet fresh cut.
As one of the best boys fade haircuts to get in the summer, the skin taper fade looks good with many cool hairstyles. Low-maintenance and super trendy, moms and kids will love this style.

Effortless and easy, little boys love a fade with short hair. Short boy haircuts like the crew cut, buzz cut, and crop top don’t require much styling but still look great on active kids. The short hair fade is often achieved with a skin fade on the sides to maximize contrast.
Even with the shorter lengths, little boys are able to get many styles. For instance, a spiked up or side swept front with short hair in the back styles incredibly well. Use a matte hair pomade, wax or styling cream for a natural, textured finish.

The long hair fade is a mix of longer hair with shorter sides. A nice tight fade keeps the sides fresh and clean, while the medium to long hair on top can be styled neat or messy. Whether your little boy has naturally wavy or curly hair, or just wants a casual style for his thick straight hair, there are a range of hairstyle options.
Boys with curly hair can leave their curls loose and bouncy. Kids with waves can style a wavy comb over for a uniquely textured look. Finally, toddlers with straight thick or fine hair can get a messy shag top, brush their hair back, or sweep it to one side. The short sides, long top hair trend provides limitless haircut ideas.

The comb over fade begins is a modern and classy boys haircut everyone loves. With tapered sides, toddlers and boys simply brush their hair over to one side. Charming and adorable, the comb over hairstyle works for kids of all ages.
Some boys like to add a shaved hard part or line on the sides for a bold look. Ask your barber for a boys hard part haircut and style with a light to moderate hold product to maximize volume and flow.

A popular hairstyle for generations, the pompadour fade features a long top with a dramatic shape. The pomp is ideal for teens and high school boys because it requires more time and effort to style.
You can opt to style a slick or loose pompadour depending on how textured and natural you want to look. Combine the pompadour with a high, mid, or low fade and it will look awesome no matter which you choose.

The high top fade is one of the best haircuts for little black boys. With very short faded hair on the sides, the high top fade hairstyle features a thick Afro or a version of the flat top.
Because black hair is unique, black boys can get the high top fade can combine the cut with a part, dreads, curly hair, twists, or a big Afro. Add in cool hair designs to truly make the fade tailored and fun.

The side part fade for boys has been an adorable haircut for decades. With a short fade on the sides and a defined part to one side, the side part haircut epitomizes a little gentleman’s hairstyle. Although boys can style their hair any way they want, the classic side part looks best with a strong gel or pomade.
For more versatility and styling ideas, leave the hair on top slightly longer and little boys can slick it back, spike it up, comb it over, or brush it forward to achieve all the coolest modern styles. Use a matte pomade, wax or styling cream for a textured finish that will make the hair look fuller and more natural.

The modern quiff and fade have been trending in recent years. Brushed up and back in the front, the boy’s quiff haircut requires your barber to leave at least 3 to 4 inches of hair length. The sides can be faded in different ways, with the favorite being a high skin fade. This creates a strong contrast that emphasizes the hairstyle on top.
To get a cool quiff, use pomade or wax that has little to no shine and spread it through with your hands. Now run your fingers through your little boy’s hair, lifting while brushing his hair back. Leave the hair naturally textured and loose for a relaxed, slightly messy style.

Side swept hair remains a classic look for boys. With a short taper fade on the sides and a short haircut all around, tell your kids barber to leave the bangs in front slightly longer. Also known as the fringe, boys can sweep the hair in front to one side for a cute and fashionable style.
The side swept hairstyle can be customized to style a long fringe fade, side swept crew cut, spiked up front, or short crop top. To perfectly style the look, boys will need high-quality styling products for the right finish and hold.

Showcase your child’s punk rock style with a faux hawk. The faux hawk fade really makes a fun and bold statement, and it looks absolutely cute on every boy from toddlers to teens. Plus, the faux hawk haircut is definitely flexible – kids can style spiky hair one day, a comb over fade another, and any number of the latest new boys hairstyles.
Tell your stylist to leave a minimum of 2 to 3 inches of hair on top. The kind of fade you get depends on how rebellious and intense you want the faux hawk to look. Boys can even experiment with designs on the sides or dye their hair funky colors for an outgoing style.

With so many different types of mohawk cuts and styles to choose from, it’s important to envision how a new haircut will look on your boy or toddler before visiting the barbershop. Browse these cute mohawk haircuts for kids to get your little boy excited about this stylish hairstyle!

The short mohawk can be easy to get and simple to style for little boys. With short sides and short spiked up hair in the middle, kids mohawk hairstyles look great on boys of all ages. Plus, they don’t have to grow out their hair for long to try the haircut.
This cool kids mohawk is the perfect example of an edgy yet handsome little boys haircut. With a high skin fade on the sides that curves around the ear and down the neckline, the hair is cut short but not completely shaved. The short mohawk on top is styled messy and spiked with a shiny gel or pomade.
For a less dramatic haircut, try this wide mohawk. Boys with straight, thick hair will appreciate a slightly spiked, messy style. The taper fade keeps the sides fresh and clean-cut, while the line up trims the hairline around the forehead and temples. These types of little boy mohawk styles leave enough length for versatility, allowing kids to style a number of different hairstyles.

The long mohawk is a type of short sides, long top haircut that maximizes volume and height. If you want to make your boys long hair into a mohawk, you’ll absolutely need to use a strong styling product.
Pictured is an amazing long mohawk haircut that will stand out in any crowd. Fashionable and sleek, the faded sides contrast the pointy spiked hair. Pushed towards the middle to create sharp ends, this style offers a nice balance between adorable and rebellious.
In contrast, this cute toddler mohawk takes a more natural approach. Get a classic taper with scissors on the sides and back to avoid buzzing your boy’s beautiful, shiny hair. Leave 3 to 4 inches of length with layers and moms can style a faux hawk, comb over, slick back or side swept fringe. Use a matte pomade or wax for a textured finish that foregoes the stiffness of gel. This will highlight your kid’s gorgeous, healthy hair.

The faux hawk, also known as a fohawk, is a less intense version of the mohawk, but can be great for formal and informal occasions. Instead of shaving the sides, ask your barber for a trendy boys fade haircut. The kids fohawk is a modern variation that allows boys to experiment with spiky hairstyles without fully committing.
Here is a charming faux hawk fade. With a low taper fade, spiked up front, and messy-all-over style, this bold cut gives off plenty of personality. For a change of pace, kids can always brush their hair forward, back or to the side. As one of the best hairstyles for boys with thick hair, this short faux hawk is worth trying!
This long faux hawk fade looks daring and awesome. The sides are buzzed short with a bald undercut fade that blends into the skin. The 3 stripes lines shaved into the side of the head make for an amazing hair design. And the faux hawk is styled with thick, long, distinct spikes. Altogether, this fake mohawk with long hair is incredibly stylish.
Ultimately, the boys fohawk is super versatile and can be cut and styled in a variety of ways. If you want your little boy’s hair to unique and fresh without going with a full mohawk fade, then a kids faux hawk haircut won’t disappoint.

Spiky hairstyles for kids have always been popular. While 90’s spiky hair with frosted tips is no longer acceptable, short spiky haircuts that resemble mohawks are definitely trending. The side benefit is that these cool styles allow for a wider area of hair to be styled.
This short spiky mohawk hairstyle is prefaced with a low taper fade and shaved line design. The cute blonde hair is spiked in the middle with thick spikes. For a textured, natural finish that lets your kid’s hair truly shine, use a top-rated pomade, wax or clay.

The mohawk is a great example of a cool hairstyle that works with all hair types. In fact, boys with wavy or curly hair are able to enjoy a unique texture and styling few others can match.
This curly mohawk features a nice tapered cut and messy long hair running down the middle. The classic taper leaves quite a bit of length for a more conservative trim, but cuts enough to create contrast. The waves and curls add depth and personality that couldn’t look better.

The classic mohawk with shaved sides is a bold look that takes a certain amount of fearlessness to pull off. Whether you get a long or short shaved mohawk will determine how outgoing the haircut will be.
Although there are several types of mohawks for boys to get, it’s hard to deny that the sharp spikes and crisp hairline make for a clean-cut, adorable style. To shave a mohawk at home, use good clippers with no guard and cut your little boy’s hair. Cutting your kid’s hair at home can save parents a ton of money on visits to the barbershop.
Pictured is a great example of a mohawk for boys with fine hair. This narrow mohawk features a very short haircut on the sides and back with dyed hair on top. Because mohawk styles are meant to be fun, kids can experiment with different styling. For instance, not all the hair needs to be spiked straight up. Apply a light styling product for a balance of height and movement.
In contrast, this long mohawk haircut goes the traditional route. By shaving the sides bald and spiking long hair into a narrow mohawk, this little guy is fully-committed to the look. Boys may even get inspired to dye their hair a radical color. From blue to red, green, and purple, try a temporary hair color spray or wax that washes out.

Little black boy mohawks are adorable and creative, highlighting how this trendy hairstyle can work for all children. As evidenced below, a black kid’s mohawk is cut and styled slightly different to accommodate for kinky, curly hair.
Known as a burst fade mohawk, this cool short hairstyle is super stylish and smooth. A burst fade haircut tapers around the ear and down to the neckline for a fresh style. Paired with a line up that shapes and cleans the hairline around the forehead and temples, this curly mohawk epitomizes excellent barbering. Apply a curl-enhancing smoothie product to tighten the curls and minimize frizz for a perfect finish.
Combined with long twists and curls, this mohawk for black hair takes a much bigger approach. The burst skin fade is cut very short to maximize contrast, and the long curly hair is dyed blonde for a unique style. While it may take some time to grow your child’s hair out this long, the result is worth it.

The toddler mohawk is a way for even little boys to get in on the excitement of styling this look. Because baby boys have gorgeous, naturally shiny hair, we don’t recommend you fade or shave their heads yet. Instead, style a faux hawk and enjoy their beautiful tresses just a little longer.
Ask your kid’s stylist or barber to cut the sides short with scissors, not clippers, to preserve their lush locks. Medium-length to longer hair can be styled in a variety of mohawk styles. Spike and push the hairs towards the middle of the head or just spike up the front with an organic baby hair gel.
Alternatively, this toddler mohawk haircut works well with a short cut. Spiking a mohawk with short hair will need a high-hold product, but the look is charming and innocent as a preschool boy hairstyle.

Hair designs for boys have been trending in recent years as kids try to match the styles of their older brothers or fathers. Stars, lines, zig-zags, and shaved parts are just some of the mohawk designs little boys can try.
This high skin fade is emphasized with a shape up and hard part. The thick, shaved design adds flair to the spiked up hair on top.
A blonde mohawk, dark faded sides, and a shaved line that arcs around the head make this hairstyle sleek and fun.

Cute mohawk styles come in many different lengths and cuts. But the truth is, little boys look good in all kinds of mohawks and modern hairstyles.
This lovable mohawk is low-maintenance and quick to style. Fashion-forward kids can pair handsome outfits with cool faux hawks or mohawks for a happy medium between gentleman and rockstar.

Nom: Crew Cut + Low Skin Fade + Hard Part
Textured Short Crop Top + Taper Fade
Side Swept Fringe + Crew Cut + Low Taper Fade
High Taper + Side Swept Crew Cut
Textured Comb Over + High Taper Fade
Short Spiky Hair Fade + Hard Part
Thick Brushed Up Hair + High Taper Fade

Description: Jason Momoa is one of the most famous actors with curly hair. With gorgeous looks and a charming public image, Momoa is no stranger to accolades. The actor rose to stardom after appearing in the HBO hit Game of Thrones as Khal Drogo, who was only around for a couple of seasons. Still, it was enough to help Momoa bring his acting career to a whole new level. Since then, he has starred in the historical drama Frontier and dystopian series See. He also plays Aquaman in the DC Extended Universe.

The youngest of the Jonas Brothers may have gained international recognition thanks to the band, but his career has expanded in interesting ways in recent years. After the musical group broke up in 2003, Jonas embarked on a solo career and took on lucrative acting projects. Fans could see him in a variety of Broadway plays, in the TV show Smash, and in blockbuster movies like Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle. The Jonas Brothers reformed in 2019 and Nick has married Priyanka Chopra, one of the most beautiful women in the world. Needless to say, he’s been doing marvelously.

Corbin Bleu is an attractive actor with black curly hair who has many talents and just as many professional interests. Widely known for his appearance in the High School Musical film series, Bleu went on to launch a singing career and took on roles in other Disney productions. Additionally, he’s a permanent fixture on Broadway, with roles in productions like In the Heights, Holiday Inn, The New Irving Berlin Musical, Singin’ in the Rain, and Anything Goes, among others.

An English actor, Alfred Enoch played Dean Thomas in the Harry Potter film series. His character was a minor one, but growing up on set and being part of such a beloved franchise shaped his career in a major way. Enoch quickly switched to more adult roles and portrayed Wes in the popular (and addictive) American show How to Get Away with Murder. He’s currently on the sci-fi Apple TV+ series Foundation, which is loosely based on Isaac Asimov’s books.

Justin Timberlake has become one of the hottest male celebrities with curly hair. With a career spanning three decades, Timberlake has been in the public eye ever since he was a toddler gracing the screen on The All-New Mickey Mouse Club. He conquered pop charts as part of the boy band NSYNC before embracing a solo career which is still going strong. In fact, Timberlake is one of the world’s best-selling music artists, with more than 32 million albums sold worldwide. Additionally, he became a prolific actor, with roles in movies like The Social Network, Friends with Benefits, In Time, Trolls, and more recently Palmer.

Kit Harington became one of the most popular actors in the world after playing Jon Snow in the hit HBO show Game of Thrones. The role brought him two Emmy nominations and catapulted him to international fame. Harington also starred in the BBC drama Gunpowder and the historical romance film Pompeii. Since leaving the Night’s Watch, he joined the Marvel Cinematic Universe as Dane Whitman/Black Knight, making his debut in the 2021 blockbuster Eternals.

An Irish actor with talent to spare, Robert Sheehan launched his career in the early aughts and is best known for his television work. He played Nathan Young on Misfits and Darren Tracey on Love/Hate. Fans can currently catch him as Klaus Hargreeves on The Umbrella Academy. As for films, he appeared in The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones, Mortal Engines, Bad Samaritan, and Geostorm.

An entertainment force to be reckoned with, Will Smith is an actor and rapper with countless awards under his belt. While his musical career is what first brought him to the public’s attention, his acting is what turned him into an international celebrity. Smith starred in the iconic ‘90s series The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air and has since appeared in films like the Bad Boys and Men in Black series, Ali, Enemy of the State, I Am Legend, and more recently King Richard. Additionally, Smith also built a solid online presence (especially on YouTube) and released a memoir, Will, written in collaboration with Mark Manson.

Tom Hanks is a Hollywood legend by this point, one that likely needs no introduction. The American actor is one of the most recognizable film stars worldwide with a variety of iconic roles in both comedy and drama. His most successful movies include A League of Their Own, Philadelphia, Forrest Gump, Saving Private Ryan, Cast Away, Sleepless in Seattle, and Cloud Atlas. Hanks has two Oscars, the Presidential Medal of Freedom, and the Golden Globe Cecil B. DeMille Award. He also experimented with filmmaking – he wrote Larry Crowne and Greyhound, among others.

Finn Jones is a famous actor with blonde curly hair and remains best known as Loras Tyrell in Game of Thrones and Iron Fist in the Netflix series of the same name. He also appeared in movies, most notably Leatherface and Awake, and had a recurring role in season 2 of the delightful series Dickinson.

Elba was named People’s sexiest man alive in 2018, but he can easily win that distinction every year as far as we’re concerned. Born in London, the actor became known for playing Stringer Bell in the HBO series The Wire. He had starring roles in the BBC series Luther, the biographical film Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom and Netflix series Turn Up Charlie. Superhero fans probably recognize him as Heimdall in the Marvel Cinematic Universe of Bloodsport in The Suicide Squad. Elba is also a DJ, performing under the stage name DJ Big Driis.

It’s been a while since Mika ruled the world with the successful single Grace Kelly, but the British artist hasn’t stopped making music. Quite the opposite. Mika has released five studio albums so far, the latest in 2019. Moreover, he was a judge/mentor on the French and Italian versions of X Factor and starred in his own Italian variety series, Stasera Casa Mika. In 2022, Mika is set to host the Eurovision Song Contest alongside Laura Pausini and Alessandro Cattelan.

Nolan Gould has already been acting on screen for more than a decade. That’s thanks to the long-running sitcom Modern Family, where he played Luke Dunphy for 11 seasons. After literally growing up on-screen, Gould took a break once Modern Family ended and used the free time to get ripped and figure out what he wants to do next. We’re excited to see what the future holds for this talented actor.

A comedy legend, Will Ferrell made a name for himself in the ‘90s as a cast member on Saturday Night Live. He went on to star in beloved comedy films, including Elf, Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy, and Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby. Ferrell also co-founded the website Funny or Die and more recently appeared opposite Rachel McAdams in Netflix hit Eurovision Song Contest: The Story of Fire Saga.

A Canadian actor, comedian, and filmmaker, Seth Rogen moved to the US to star in the cult series Freaks and Geeks. His career has been on an upwards trajectory ever since. You may know him from Knocked Up, Superbad, Pineapple Express, or This Is the End. Rogen wrote a book titled Yearbook, which came out in 2021, and creates beautiful ceramic vases in his spare time. As far as television is concerned, you can catch him in the recent Hulu series Pam & Tommy.

If that name sounds familiar, that’s because Brody Jenner is the son of retired Olympics champion Caitlyn Jenner. Brody has a lucrative reality TV career himself, having appeared in The Hills and Keeping Up with the Kardashians. He is also a successful model.

Lovingly known as McSteamy thanks to his role in the beloved medical drama Grey’s Anatomy, Eric Dane started acting in the early ‘90s. He scored a recurring role on Charmed before gracing the small screen as Dr. Mark Sloan. Since leaving Grey’s, Dane had a main role in the action drama The Last Ship. He is currently playing Cal Jacobs on the teen series Euphoria.

A radio and TV personality, Howard Stern has been broadcasting on Sirius XM Satellite Radio ever since 2006. He is best known for The Howard Stern Show, which brought him several accolades. He is the first radio host to have the number one morning show in New York and Los Angeles simultaneously, but also the most fined radio host for content considered “indecent.”

Alex Wolff is a charming actor and musician who became known for starring alongside his brother in the Nickelodeon series The Naked Brothers Band. Since the show ended, the two brothers formed the musical duo Nat & Alex Wolff. They released two studio albums so far. Besides, Alex also appeared in movies – including My Friend Dahmer, Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, Pig, Old, and Hereditary. In 2019, he made his directorial debut with The Cat and the Moon.

A prominent American actor, John C. Reilly gained notoriety thanks to critically acclaimed movies like What’s Eating Gilbert Grape, Boogie Nights, Magnolia, Gangs of New York, and The Aviator. Additionally, he is a versatile Broadway performer with numerous productions on his resume. In the last decade, Reilly focused more on comedies and blockbusters. As a result, you might have seen him in Guardians of the Galaxy, Stan & Ollie, Holmes & Watson, or Kong: Skull Island.

A Welsh actor and television producer, Sheen worked mainly in theatre throughout the 90s, collecting praised performances and stage awards. When he first switched to the screen, he focused on biographical films like The Deal, Fantabulosa!, and Frost/Nixon. Sheen considerably expanded his catalog in recent years with roles in the Twilight film series and TV shows Masters of Sex, Prodigal Son, and Good Omens.

There’s a good chance you’re familiar with Sacha Baron Cohen, the actor and filmmaker behind Borat, its sequel and his performance as Ali G. Cohen is a gifted performer with an affinity for doing accents and creating outrageous characters on screen. Despite mainly being drawn to comedy and satire, Cohen also takes on dramatic roles from time to time. Fans could recently see him in Aaron Sorkin’s movie The Trial of the Chicago 7.

Known for playing Vincent Chase on Entourage, Grenier is also a producer, director, and musician. After the HBO series, he appeared in the movies Sex, Death and Bowling, Affairs of State, and Stage Mother. Grenier also produced and directed several films, including the documentary Teenage Paparazzo. In 2021, he starred in the popular Netflix series Clickbait.

A double threat as a singer and actor, Guarini was the runner-up on the first season of American Idol. He released two studio albums, after which he began to focus on acting. Guarini has appeared in plenty of stage productions – something he continues to do to this day. Besides, he released a new EP in 2016 and has been starring as Lil’ Sweet in Diet Dr. Pepper commercials.

Finn Wolfhard is an actor/musician of Canadian origins, who made a splashy debut in Netflix sci-fi hit Stranger Things. He plays Mike, who acts as a leader for the group of kids the show centers on. Furthermore, Wolfhard has had roles in movies; most notably It and It: Chapter Two, but also Ghostbusters: Afterlife, Dog Days, and The Goldfinch. In the music department, Wolfhard was in the band Calpurnia and is currently a member of The Aubreys.

An American actor, Jesse Eisenberg became known for roles in Roger Dodger, The Emperor’s Club, The Village, and The Squid and the Whale. However, he is most famous for his turn in The Social Network, where he played Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg – a performance received with acclaim by critics and mass audiences alike. In recent years, Eisenberg appeared in the movies Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice, Now You See Me, Zombieland: Double Tap, and Resistance.

A short goatee is a beard style designed to lengthen the chin while offering a low-maintenance and masculine look. This classic goatee features a mustache and is often just a simple circle of facial hair around the chin. This fresh and eye-catching style offers half an inch to an inch in length, making it easy to grow and simple to trim with a beard trimmer. If you want something textured but sharp, keeping the length to a light stubble will outline your bone structure but give you a rugged alternative to being clean-shaven. For more contrast, keep stubble on the jawline but clean up any areas around the neck and the cheeks for a dapper finish.

A long goatee is a stylish and manly style that pairs perfectly with an elegant suit and cool sunglasses. While an old-school look, you can style this fuller facial hair with a modern twist by keeping your chin beard groomed and moisturized with quality products for a smooth and refined feel. You can leave the hair untrimmed for a slightly undone and youthful vibe or keep it neatly groomed along the sides for definition. You can certainly grow your beard past the chin, but if it passes the Adam’s Apple it might start to veer into Viking territory.

The full goatee beard is the most recognizable style and connects a circular chin beard with a soul patch and a mustache for a fashionable and bold look. This style works well on square faces as the fullness around the chin draws attention to sharp cheekbones and precise facial lines. If you have a rectangular face, experiment with shorter lengths to highlight angles and add balance to your features. The full goatee typically has straighter edges than a circle beard, and it stops around the edges of the mouth for a sleek and trendy result. To maintain your beard, pull out your trimmers around once a week to keep your look fresh and remove any dead hair that might encourage patchiness.

The chin goatee is a popular beard style that incorporates hair right at the base of the chin, offering a rugged appearance without the maintenance. This chin-only facial hair style has no mustache and expertly disguises a weak chin while enhancing strong jawlines. It’s a good idea to grow your hair slightly beyond the chin for a signature tufted look, but you can easily keep a two-inch patch of hair on the chin for a subtle feel that’s suitable for the office. To showcase your signature style, fashion your tuft of hair into a wide and rounded shape or go for a teardrop shape to elongate the face.

A goatee and mustache is a modern beard style that can be easy to maintain for guys. The slight disconnect between the mustache and the goatee creates interest and texture on the face, giving guys the chance to stand out from the crowd with minimal effort. To achieve this look, grab your clippers and start by carving out the classic goatee shape at the chin using light strokes. You’ll want to keep the cheeks completely clean-shaven for maximum contrast and dimension. Your mustache should be well-groomed for a dapper appearance, but you can channel your inner wild child with stray hairs around the upper lip or a badass soul patch.

The Van Dyke beard offers guys the chance to rock a regal and classy style that will instantly lift any outfit. Although it requires upkeep because of the signature T-shape and handlebar mustache, the historic and sexy appearance of this beard is worth the effort. The goatee beard doesn’t usually connect with the rest of your facial hair and there is a strong focus on the mustache which can be worn straight or grown out and twirled upward. To make your mustache even more impressive, ask your barber to fashion your beard into a subtle teardrop shape and shorten it slightly. The soul patch should also be grown out to match the thickness of the chin beard while the rest of the face is left clean-shaven.

A goatee without a mustache is a cool facial hair style goatee that will draw attention to your jawline and features. This style is perfect for guys who want a low-maintenance style that can be trimmed every week, as mustaches often require regular trimming to avoid irritating the upper lip. If you want to create the illusion of a striking jawline on a round face, pair your goatee with a chinstrap beard with defined upper lines across the cheekbones. For the ultimate low-effort look, opt for an untrimmed goatee for a bohemian and relaxed feel or a playful chin puff.

The thin goatee was all the rage back in the 1950s, but this carefully manicured style is having a serious resurgence among modern men. It’s an excellent option for guys who struggle with patchy facial hair or struggle to grow thick beards as it focuses on interesting lines rather than thickness. Pencil-thin goatees are extremely popular as they circle the mouth and create a sharp look that is effortlessly sleek and defined. This style is also a great choice for men with triangular faces, as the joined lines and sharp edges balance the face without overwhelming it. Although you can style a thin goatee at home, you should head to the barber shop for more precise trimming.

The disconnected goatee is a fashionable beard style that features hair on the chin and lip without connecting. The disconnected look can be a simple way to shape a goatee when you have patchy hair along the jawline and sides of the mouth. You can throw in stubble around the cheeks for an undone and rugged feel but taming your facial hair into a square-shaped beard with a subtle soul patch looks more elegant. The beauty of this style is that it flatters all face shapes. Round faces can opt for a wider style, while square and angular faces can taper their beard for a chic and refined finish.

The Balbo beard is a style without sideburns that includes a carefully trimmed mustache and a chin strap that extends across the jawline. It requires decent volume to look attractive, and you can pair it with a handlebar, pyramid or slim mustache depending on your personal preference. It’s an excellent pick for round and square face shapes, as the fullness around the chin creates the illusion of angular features. This pulls the face down slightly to balance and streamline your look. To create attractive contrast and dimension, keep the sides of your face well-groomed and your cheeks and neck clean-shaven.

The circle beard is a handsome and classic look that you can easily maintain with an electric shaver. It is characterized by a mustache and a simple chin beard that are joined together in a circular shape. To highlight this connection, keep the hair closely trimmed around the neck and the cheeks. You can wear this beard short for a lightly textured look or keep it long for an edgy biker feel that shows you’re not to be messed with. It adds attractive structure to the face, but this goatee doesn’t add bulky volume that distracts from your features. To maintain the health of your style, work a beard oil or balm through your strands for a light shine.

Also known as a landing strip, a chin puff is a beard style that can be created by shaving your mustache and beard but leaving a thick line of hair directly below the center of your mouth. The landing strip must be smaller than the width of the mouth and extend to the bottom of the chin. You can grow your puff into a teardrop or diamond shape for a showstopping finish or keep your appearance modern with a small volume of hair that’s uniformly trimmed along the bottom. Although it’s a suitable style for most guys, it’s an incredible choice for men with coarse or natural hair who struggle to tame longer beards into submission.

The anchor beard is a playful and youthful style that can look similar to the Van Dyke beard. True to its name, this goatee is designed to look like an anchor with a wider beard, a shorter mustache and a strip of hair that draws towards the upper lip. The angular shape creates exceptional sharpness along the jawline and adds volume without the maintenance of a chin strap or full beard. Whether you want to emulate Christian Bale or Tony Stark, you only need to grow a couple of weeks’ worth of stubble to make the magic happen.

Description: If you loved these cool beard styles, then check out our guide on the top goatee styles or learn about all the different types of beards to get right now.

If you’re lucky enough to grow a long beard, you can braid your facial hair in many ways, including a single long braid, two woven strands, a ponytail with a tie and twisted beard hair. While some guys like plaiting the entire beard, others prefer small braids and designs throughout with beads, rings, or colorful strings.
Maintaining a long braided beard can be a challenge, but the style is worth it. You’ll need good beard care products to make sure your facial hair stays healthy, straight, and neat. We recommend you consistently use beard oils and balms to nourish and encourage growth. Guys will also want to undo their braids and untangle their hairs every once in awhile.

Your beard doesn’t have to be very long for you to be able to braid it. As long as you have a few inches to work with and good hand-eye coordination, you can braid a short beard. Whether you want a beard bun, ponytail, wizard twirl, or classic Viking aesthetic, guys with short beards are well suited.
These styles can be easy to achieve and can keep your beard well-groomed. As long as you have thick or full facial hair to make at least a couple of weaves, you can opt for a very short braid. Tighten it well and you’ll be graciously accepting compliments in no time.

The Viking beard braid has been around for centuries and is the epitome of masculine badass. Back in the day, the Vikings used to braid their beards to keep their facial hair from getting in the way during battle. In recent years, Viking beard braid styles are worn by confident alpha males who want to show off their cool facial hair.
Versatile and effortlessly stylish, Viking beards fit men of all face shapes and hairstyles, but the style can be complementary to a top knot, ponytail or man bun. While the most popular version comes with tight braids and beards or rubber bands at the end, we recommend you watch the popular TV show Vikings for inspiration. Ragnar’s facial hair is always fresh and on-trend.

For guys who want a clean look, consider getting a braided goatee. From a simple single strand like a ponytail to two sections of hair, a braided goatee beard will look good while still highlighting your facial features. If you have great cheekbones or a defined jaw, don’t hide them away. The style particularly suits men with round faces, since it creates the illusion of a more angular chin.

For a scruffy look, braid only a strand at the center of your chin to create a cool braided chin beard. While you can still have a full beard in the background, the style won’t monopolize your facial hair yet still offers an edgy and bold look. If you really want to turn heads, consider pairing your chin braid with a hair tie and beads at the end.

Braiding your mustache into your beard ensures an even more masculine look. Braided mustaches can require time and patience because you’ll need to wait until this area of hair is long enough to plait. As long as you have the confidence to pull it off, this look won’t go unnoticed.

As one of the newest trends around, cornrow braids in your beard can elevate your style. While the look is trendy and awesome, it’s difficult to braid a cornrow beard yourself, so we strongly advise you to reach out to a professional.

The French braid is the most common and easiest braided beard style to achieve. If you want to French braid your facial hair, you’ll need to define three equally-sized strands and weave them together. We have a complete tutorial below if you want to try it out. French braiding a beard is a classic look all guys will love, but it does require several inches of length to make.

A beard ponytail is a facial hair style that requires putting your beard in a hair tie. You’ll want to start with a long full beard and tie your hair once or twice. The stylish ponytail in your beard adds unique styling for a badass finish.

A fishtail braid involves twisting and braiding only two strands of hair to create an intricate look. The fishtail braid beard is one of the coolest styles to experiment with, but it does require more effort and styling. Start by separating your beard into the two sections you want to braid. Hold one strand in each hand and take a small section from the outside edge of one strand, adding it to the opposite side. Repeat this step with both sections of hair until you reach the desired length.

Braided beards tend to be more popular among white men, but this shouldn’t prevent Black men from braiding their beards. Pair your black braided beard with a short buzz cut, mohawk or dreads on top and a fresh fade on the sides and back. Sexy and cool, there are many black men’s beard styles worth exploring if you want to change up your look. Just make sure to keep your face and skin healthy with these high-quality care products.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
Also commonly known as a light stubble beard, the term scruff refers to just a couple days’ worth of growth. The stubble beard is a short style any guy can grow and wear because it’s almost as if you’ve forgotten to shave for a day or two. Nevertheless, scruff can be used to describe any full beard that is trimmed very close to the skin. Stubble beard trimmers were specifically designed to help guys get this masculine, gritty facial hair look.
To get scruffy beard styles at home, just let your hair grow for several days, then use a good trimmer at low setting to keep your facial hair one length. You can let everything grow – including your neck and cheeks – or you can trim and shape your stubble in these areas for a more clean-cut finish.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
Heavy stubble can be defined as a thick 5 o’clock shadow but not yet a full beard. Heavy stubble beards are longer than scruff so they take about 10 days to grow, but women find them to be one of the hottest facial hair styles for men. Thick stubble that is three to four millimeters long is ideal, and this cut is best for guys who grow even beards all over without patches.
Stubble beards are easy to maintain with a high-quality trimmer, and like scruff, you get to decide whether to keep your neck and cheeks clean-shaven or just let them grow. As a badass look for most men, we highly recommend heavy stubble beard styles.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
Men who can successfully grow a natural, full beard are perfect for the corporate beard. The corporate beard style gets its name from the well-coiffed and trimmed look that is suitable for daily wear at the office. It’s ideal for professional men who want to have a thick beard and don’t mind good beard care and grooming.
If you’re starting with a bare face, expect it to take you a few weeks (or perhaps months, if your beard grows more slowly) to reach this length. You will need to carefully maintain this short beard by trimming your cheeks, neck, and any longer hairs that may grow out from time to time. A fresh, clean presentation is of the utmost importance, and crisp lines and proper shaping is required. Invest in a top-rated beard trimmer for smooth, close cuts.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
The short beard encompasses many different types of beards, but it’s typically described as one that is trimmed close to your face and no more than an inch to inch and a half long. The corporate beard and heavy stubble are two trendy short beard styles. However, men can grow and groom a number of different short beards.
Guys can grow their facial hair out, with the hair on your chin slightly longer than the hair on your cheeks. Furthermore, you can keep your neck and cheeks trimmed or let them grow naturally. From the short full beard to the Van Dyke to thick stubble with defined lines, the short beard is classy, understated, and stylish.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
Long beard styles include the “lumberjack” and “wizard” looks, which involve growing hair at the bottom of your face for months (and in some cases even years) until they reach beyond your Adam’s apple and even down as far as your chest. There are many ways to grow and style the best long beards.
The trick to really rocking this look involves keeping your beard clean, smooth, soft and healthy. This means washing, shampooing, and conditioning your beard regularly as well as using beard oil and balm to keep your facial hair hydrated and conditioned all day.
Then, as it grows thicker and longer, you will need to use a natural boar bristle beard brush to straighten your beard and maintain the styling. Alternatively, some guys prefer beard straighteners for thick, coarse facial hair.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
Full beard styles epitomize virility and manliness. Full beards grow all over your face, including your neck and checks, and come in both short and long lengths. The full beard offers limitless styling and shaping options for maximum versatility. You may even want to check out these cool haircuts for men with beards to complete your look.
To get a thick and full beard, you’ll need to stop shaving for at least a month. However, you can still trim and groom your beard in the meantime to ensure different parts of your facial hair grow evenly.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
A goatee is a beard style in which you shape your facial hair from the corners of your mouth down to your chin. The goatee beard is one of the most versatile partial beard options of them all because it can be trimmed thick or thin depending on how your facial hair grows. If you have patchy thin facial hair, goatee styles that outline around your mouth and chin can work well.
Moreover, there are short and long goatee styles that look good, so guys get the choice of letting their beard grow out or keeping hair fresh and trimmed. The goatee is the most popular of the chin beard styles, so experiment all you like until you find a look that works for you.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description: The circle beard is a variation of the goatee in which you trim and connect your mustache and goatee to form a circle around your mouth. Contrary to popular belief, goatees don’t always have mustaches. Circle beard styles are adaptable, and guys can experiment with different lengths, shapes and styles.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
The Van Dyke beard is very closely related to the circle beard and the goatee. The Van Dyke features a mustache and facial hair on the chin that becomes pointy. The mustache isn’t connected to the beard and can be shaped into a handlebar.
The Van Dyke beard is among the coolest modern facial hair styles, and you are likely to find that many hipsters love the look. A great example is the fact that actor Johnny Depp has maintained a nice Van Dyke beard style for decades.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
Though the handlebar mustache has been the source of many laughs and is often associated with older men, the truth is that hipsters have co-opted this facial hair style. Whether you wear your handlebars alone with no beard or accompanied by a full beard, handlebar mustaches offer an awesome way to enhance your look and stand out.
To get and style the handlebar, simply grow your mustache out long while keeping the area just above your lip trimmed. You can use mustache wax to twist the ends of the handlebars, turn them up or down, and style the idea any way you’d like.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
The yeard is the result of allowing your beard to grow for a full year without a single major cut. Though you should absolutely get rid of split ends and flyaways as you see them, the yeard requires uninterrupted growth and you should not actually trim the beard for at least 12 months or longer.
Just keep things clean, healthy, and conditioned. This means using a deep-cleansing beard shampoo and conditioner to remove dirt, grime and bacteria while moisturizing and conditioning your skin and hair. Afterwards, guys should apply beard oil with a comb that will reach their skin. This process will stop beard itch, get rid of dandruff, hydrate the skin underneath, and maximize growth.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description: The tweard is a beard that results from two years of growth without any major trims. Like the yeard, be sure to keep it groomed, shaped, and styled for good beard care. You can even cut flyaways or split ends – just avoid trimming off any real length.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
The Hollywoodian is a cool, chic beard style that’s been grown by a number of celebrities in the recent years. If you have prominent cheekbones that you want to show off, the Hollywoodian is a fantastic way to do it. It consists of two to three months of facial hair growth, and requires that you let your beard grow out all over and then completely shave the sideburns.
The Hollywoodian beard focuses your facial hair along your jawline, chin and mouth. The look may not work well with all face shapes, but it is worth experimenting to see.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
The chin strap beard is a thin strip of facial hair that connects the sideburns to your chin. Chin strap beard styles may include a mustache or soul patch; that choice is yours to make. Essentially, when the chin strap beard is groomed and trimmed properly, it looks much like a strap that goes all the way around your head and down under your chin.
The strip can be thick or thin depending on how much hair you have. Ultimately, the chin strap is a good look for men who struggle to grow a full beard.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description: The ducktail beard offers the perfect blend between classy and rebellious. Ducktail beards start on the cheeks and comes down to a rounded point two to four inches below the chin. You can have a ducktail with clean-shaven cheeks, or you can grow your facial hair out everywhere as long as you keep it trimmed and well-groomed. Ducktail beard styles are medium-length full beards that look good, especially if you have rugged features.

Titre: Top 27 Different Types of Beards: Best Beard Styles & Ideas
Description:
Mutton chops, also known as the wolverine beard, are among the most iconic beard types. To better understand how the mutton chops beard looks, imagine growing a full beard from ears to chin, then shaving the area where a goatee would normally grow – essentially like a reverse goatee. This means getting rid of the small patch of hair on your chin and above your lips where a mustache would be.
However, there is the option of getting a version of this classic look – the friendly mutton chops. The friendly mutton chops beard style keeps the mustache and shaves the middle of the chin area. While you can have a mustache with your mutton chops, most men prefer to keep this part of their face perfectly bare to emulate the wolverine beard style. Mutton chops can be thin and sparse or thick and full, so don’t be afraid to experiment with different styles until you find the one that best suits you. Needless to say, the wolverine beard is pretty badass and manly.

Description:
Chin strap beards can be worn with or without a mustache, and can be trimmed as wide or narrow as you wish. This makes for a number of possibilities when it comes to chin strap beard styles. In general, cutting a narrow strip with short facial hair makes for a more youthful look, while trimming a thick strip with long hair adds masculinity.
If the chin strap beard is a style you’re considering, then be sure to check out some inspiration below. We made sure to include different styles, including the chinstrap goatee and mustache options!

Description:
Because the Mexican mustache is a versatile look, there are tons of beard designs and ideas when it comes to how you can wear it. To start, think about how long you want your mustache to grow since the length of your facial hair will determine what styles you can get.
For example, men can combine it with a clean-shaven face for a modern style with Latin American roots. Another option would be to trim a Mexican style mustache with a thick beard and/or sideburns for a truly manly, almost outback look.
Needless to say, there’s a Mexican beard somewhere out there for you, so why not take a look at some of our favorites styles!

Description:
Because there are so many factors to consider before you grow a blonde beard, it’s important to research your options. To help guys compare the different types of beards they could grow, we’ve compiled this gallery of cool blonde beard styles.
