Description: Michael Fassbender is one of the hottest redhead male celebrities in the world. This sexy German-Irish actor and racing driver made his acting debut in the war epic 300 back in 2007. Since then, he has built an impressive filmography, taking on eclectic roles that leave a scorching mark on the audience. Fassbender starred in everything from TV shows Band of Brothers and Hex to blockbusters like Alien: Covenant and eccentric productions in the vein of Frank. He is widely known as Magneto in the X-Men film series. Watch him in Shame for a spicy helping of full-frontal nudity.

Famous for playing Tormund Giantsbane, a Free Folk warrior in HBO hit Game of Thrones, Hivju is a Norwegian actor with style to spare. While Giantsbane was a force to be reckoned with ever since he made his Westeros debut, the character’s infatuation with Brienne of Tarth allowed Hivju to showcase his flirty side, which made him even more attractive. The actor also appeared in films including Force Majeure, The Last King, and The Fate of the Furious. More recently, he had a guest appearance in the season 2 premiere of The Witcher.

With a penchant for starring in biopics and an Oscar-winning hairstyle, Eddie Redmayne needs little introduction by now. His career spans modeling, stage acting and film. Redmayne played Stephen Hawking in The Theory of Everything and Lili Elbe in The Danish Girl, roles that brought him critical acclaim and accolades. He also became an integral part of the Wizarding World as shy magizoologist Newt Scamander after appearing in the Fantastic Beasts film series.

Everyone’s favorite Resident Alien, Alan Tudyk has been on screens big and small ever since the late ‘90s, but first gained recognition when he appeared alongside Sandra Bullock and Viggo Mortensen in the 2000 comedy-drama 28 Days. After that, Tudyk went on to star in Tucker & Dale vs Evil, Transformers: Dark of the Moon and Rogue One: A Star Wars Story. He played a droid in the last one, so we’d be remiss not to mention his incredible voice acting: Tudyk voiced characters in several Disney films. The list includes Moana, Aladdin, Zootopia and more recently Encanto.

Damian Lewis is a popular redheaded actor who became known to US audiences thanks to his roles in popular TV shows Homeland and Billions. Pretty impressive for someone who once worked as a telemarketer, a job Lewis detested. Thankfully, he moved on to bigger and better things such as appearances in the series Band of Brothers, The Forsyte Saga, Wolf Hall and movies like the more recent Once Upon a Time in Hollywood and Dream Horse.

Benedict Cumberbatch is a prolific English actor known for roles on stage and screen. As an Emmy and BAFTA winner, Cumberbatch starred in numerous British shows before his popularity went through the roof once he portrayed the title character in the joint BBC/PBS television series Sherlock. On the movie front, you may recognize him as Doctor Strange from the ever-growing Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Serving double duty as actor and model, Cameron Monaghan began his career at the ripe age of 3, when he graced the cover of his first fashion catalog. Turns out, it was a good omen. Monaghan is best known for playing Ian Gallagher on Shameless and twins Jerome and Jeremiah Valeska in Gotham. He appeared in movies like Amityville: The Awakening, Vampire Academy, The Giver, and Reign of the Supermen.

Eric Stoltz is a triple threat: actor, director, and producer. He made his debut on stage in the ‘70s and eventually moved on to television and film. With a career spanning more than four decades, he’s been a constant presence in the entertainment world, both in front of and behind the camera. You might know Stoltz from Mask, Pulp Fiction, Kicking and Screaming, or Killing Zoe. The actor also starred in the TV show Caprica as Daniel Graystone.

Popular for playing JARVIS and Vision in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Bettany first became known to mainstream audiences in the early aughts for his roles in A Knight’s Tale and A Beautiful Mind. He dipped his toes into directing but seems to be focusing more on acting at the moment. His TV role in WandaVision earned Bettany an Emmy nomination while allowing the character Vision to show his human face more than his usual vibranium form.

Son of actor Brendan Gleeson, Domhnall starred in multiple films and theater projects alongside his father – including in the Harry Potter series. Domhnall played Bill Weasley, while Brendan appeared as Alastor Moody. Gleeson Jr.’s career seriously took off since. Fans could see him in critically acclaimed movies like Ex Machina, Brooklyn, and The Revenant. He also played General Armitage Hux in the Star Wars sequel trilogy and had a lead role in the HBO black comedy series Run.

Seth Green is one of the most famous celebrities with red hair and continues to be a successful Hollywood star. These days, Green is widely known as the co-creator and a frequent voice on the animated series Robot Chicken while also voicing Howard the Duck in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Still, Green is no stranger to live-action, having appeared in numerous films since 1984. Additionally, he starred as Oz on Buffy the Vampire Slayer and is a frequent guest star on TV shows across all genres.

Rupert Grint grew up before our eyes as Ron Weasley in the Harry Potter film series. Since leaving the franchise, the English actor expanded his professional horizons, taking on challenging TV roles in comedy Sick Note, crime dramedy Snatch and psychological horror Servant. He’s not afraid to flex his acting muscle, so it will be interesting to see what projects he picks next.

A famed actor and director, Robert Redford has won countless awards throughout his illustrious career, including the Cecil B. DeMille Award and the Presidential Medal of Freedom. He made his acting debut on stage in the late ‘50s and went on to dazzle movie buffs worldwide with starring roles in Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, Jeremiah Johnson, The Sting, The Way We Were, All the President’s Men and Out of Africa, to only name a few. Additionally, Redford is a dedicated activist. That makes him even hotter.

Josh Homme is the frontman of rock band Queens of the Stone Age, which has been nominated for seven Grammy Awards. A fan of the rock’n’roll lifestyle, Homme was involved in other adjacent endeavors over the years, like musical collective series The Desert Sessions and the band Eagles of Death Metal.

An American actor, Fran Kranz played Topher Brink in the cult series Dollhouse. He also appeared on Broadway and in movies like The Cabin in the Woods, The Dark Tower and Much Ado About Nothing. In recent years, Kranz became interested in what goes on behind the camera. His directorial debut, Mass, premiered in 2021 at Sundance to critical acclaim.

Jake Austin Walker may be young, but his career is already impressive. The American actor played Jared Talbot on Rectify and stars as Henry King Jr. in the superhero series Stargirl. In addition to guest star roles in other movies and TV series, Walker is an emerging pop musician. We’d keep a close eye on this one. His talent is undeniable.

Shaun White wears many hats – including those of a musician and actor. That being said, he is mainly known as a professional snowboarder and skateboarder. White is a three-time Olympic gold medalist in half-pipe snowboarding and holds the world record for the most X-Games gold medals. He plays guitar in an electronic rock band called Bad Things and has appeared in the movies Friends with Benefits and Cloud 9.

The late Darren McGavin began his career working as a set painter. Yet, his talent soon enabled him to switch to acting. His filmography includes over 180 credits in film and television as well as roles on Broadway. McGavin is known for films such as Airport ’77, A Christmas Story and Billy Madison, and shows like Murphy Brown and Riverboat.

Known for starring as everyone’s favorite serial killer in the TV series Dexter, Michael C. Hall is a man of many interests. His acting career features Six Feet Under and Safe, as well as several movies and Broadway plays. Moreover, Hall narrates audiobooks and is the lead singer of the band Princess Goes to the Butterfly Museum.

A Canadian actor rocking red locks, Zack Ward made a name for himself while starring as the bully in the beloved movie A Christmas Story. Ward also played Titus’s stoner half-brother in the TV show Titus. The actor booked numerous guest appearances in series and movies over the years but seems to have a preference for the horror genre. His credits include The Devil’s Tomb, Resident Evil: Apocalypse, BloodRayne 2: Deliverance, and Alone in the Dark II.

Crushing on Faramir from The Lord of the Rings trilogy? He’s played by David Wenham, an Australian actor whose popularity skyrocketed in the late ‘90s when he starred as a diver in the series SeaChange. He appeared in multiple movies and TV shows ever since, including Van Helsing, 300, Top of the Lake, and Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales. Fans can catch him in the 2022 Netflix series Pieces of Her.

Currently a regular on the sci-fi show The Orville, Scott Grimes has been acting ever since the ‘80s. Back then, he appeared in the cult movie The Night They Saved Christmas, followed by roles in ER, Party of Five, Band of Brothers, and Justified. Grimes is also a singer who saw success with Sunset Blvd, a single that spent several weeks on the Billboard charts. If you’re into trivia, he’s the uncle of Camryn Grimes, who played two different characters on the soap opera The Young and the Restless.

Simon Pegg came a long way since creating the beloved sitcom Spaced in 1999. An English actor, comedian, and screenwriter, Pegg gained international recognition after co-writing and starring in critically acclaimed movies Shaun of the Dead, Hot Fuzz, and The World’s End. You might also know him from the Mission Impossible film series, Doctor Who, Star Wars: The Force Awakens or Star Trek. Pegg voices the titular character in the 2022 animated movie The Ice Age Adventures of Buck Wild.

As an action icon, Chuck Norris achieved mainstream success in the ‘80s with roles in the movies Missing in Action, Code of Silence, Invasion U.S.A. and The Delta Force. He appeared in numerous films over the course of his career, most of which became a success at the box office. To top it off, Norris is a martial arts artist, author and brand ambassador. In his most iconic role, he played the titular character on the long-running TV series Walker, Texas Ranger.

Well-known for playing Mitchell on the sitcom Modern Family, Jesse Tyler Ferguson has a tremendous Broadway career. He appeared in The Producers, A Winter’s Tale, A Midsummer Night’s Dream, Fully Committed, and Spamalot, earning praise for each performance. Fans eager to see more can watch Ferguson on the reality series Extreme Makeover: Home Edition, which he currently hosts.

To call Conan O’Brien a comedy genius would be an understatement. He started as a writer for Saturday Night Live and The Simpsons before launching an incredible late-night hosting career. O’Brien hosted Late Night with Conan O’Brien, The Tonight Show with Conan O’Brien, and Conan before announcing his retirement from late-night TV in 2021. Catch him on the premiere episode of Netflix’s Murderville and prepare to laugh out loud.

Brad Pitt’s short hair isn’t as notorious as his longer and medium-length hairstyles, but the heartthrob has styled some of the best short haircuts for men. When he’s not rocking a low-maintenance buzz cut or a sophisticated crew cut, you will see him style a cool comb over with a taper fade on the back and sides.
You can copy it by asking for a mid fade or an undercut and using clay or wax to give it a natural textured finish. Another option may be his famous Fight Club hairstyle, where Pitt’s short hair was spiked all over to reflect his character’s edgy personality.

Medium hairstyles are synonymous with the actor’s effortless and laid-back aesthetic. Whether he’s filming or between jobs, his locks are usually down to his shoulder, or somewhere in between his shoulders and neckline.
Medium-length hair is great for men who want to combine a sexy and handsome cut with their hair type as it pretty much suits everything from wavy to straight and curly tresses. An excellent way to replicate Pitt’s fresh cuts and add a youthful appeal is to slick the front and middle sections back so that all the strands flow in the same direction.

Long hair is hard to pull off, yet Brad Pitt has done it with style for the past decade. The most famous example is his character in an Interview with the Vampire, where his hair flowed down his back towards his backside.
You can keep it over shoulder-length if you don’t like the maintenance element, but you still need to brush it to avoid tangles and matted locks. For a soft and subtle addition that will take long hair to the next level, you can incorporate a part down the middle of your head so that it’s sectioned off and doesn’t become boring.

Not everybody is blessed with sandy blonde hair like Brad Pitt. However, you can obtain the look by bleaching your hair blonde. Regardless of the length, this aesthetic enables you to stand out from the crowd as it’s a bold and daring color, especially if you opt for a platinum shade.
Blonde hair is softer and more sophisticated with long and medium-length locks, which is why it’s better to opt for a buzz or crew cut if you want to be edgy. Plus, highlights elevate a humble traditional cut to another level.

Brad Pitt’s Fury haircut is a homage to the military styles of the 1930’s and 1940’s. It’s an incredibly trendy look that is making a comeback, and you can get it by letting your top hair grow out while trimming your sides down with a skin fade or short undercut.
This creates the disconnected appeal while slicking back your hair softens the trend and adds an air of refinement. The ultimate Fury haircut utilizes blonde highlights and angular spikes for an exceptionally fashionable hairstyle.

Brad Pitt’s Inglourious Basterds haircut is another military-inspired cut with a hard part. Messy yet polished, the trick is to comb over the front and middle sections for extra height and volume. Incorporating a side part should help you to nail the look.
Also, the sides and back are trimmed with a medium undercut to accentuate the longer style on top. When styling this look, be sure to brush your hair up and to the side rather than backward, and try a mustache with no beard for a masculine finish.

The actor’s Troy haircut might not be as historically correct as his Fury or Inglourious Basterds styles, but it’s no less popular. Every guy has sought after his shoulder-length hair with a slicked back, bright blonde cut because it’s a great mixture of manly and handsome. Aside from growing your hair long, you should curl the sides for the full Troy look, yet be careful – this only works for men with thick hair.

Short and cool, Brad Pitt’s Fight Club haircut is one of his most iconic looks. Epitomizing ’90s hairstyles with messy spiky hair, the Hollywood star’s hair added to Tyler Durden’s unique character in the movie. With short sides and longer hair on top, achieve the look with a matte styling clay or wax.

Nom: Brad Pitt Mr. and Mrs. Smith Haircut
Description: Brad Pitt’s haircut in the movie Mr. and Mrs. Smith was a clean buzz cut all over. A close-cut style you can achieve at home with clippers, this classic buzz cut haircut will accentuate your masculine facial features and exude confidence. Plus, the uniform length means it’s incredibly low-maintenance, to the point where you can roll out of bed and throw on a shirt or suit without having to worry about bed head or cowlicks. For a shorter haircut, ask your barber for a buzz cut fade that tapers the sides and back for a universally-flattering look.

Brad Pitt has proved that a buzz cut is a versatile trend with plenty of options for modern men. His Mr. and Mrs. Smith buzz cut has extra growth, which is perfect for men whose hairlines are full and thick.
But, if yours is receding a little, buzzing your head with a number one blade will take the emphasis away from the front of your hair. It’s even less maintenance than a traditional buzz cut, and you can switch up your style with bleach if it gets tiresome. Don’t forget about a beard for extra texture and volume.

The crew cut has historically been one of Brad Pitt’s most popular haircuts. The actor’s crew cut hairstyle is a brilliant middle ground for men that want to follow his superstar trends, yet can’t commit to growing long or medium-length hair.
With a high undercut on the back and sides, you’ll always be ready for the office, and you won’t appear out of place at a bar or an outside-of-work function. You don’t have to use hair products if you prefer the neat and tidy look, or you can add wax for a textured aesthetic that’s a little messier yet still polished.

Slicked back hair is an iconic style that is notorious with Wall Street bankers and power players. Nevertheless, Brad Pitt has given it a less aggressive appeal over the years by laying off the gel. Instead, he uses a small amount of styling product to ensure the slick back is less prominent, making it more sophisticated.
This makes it an incredibly trendy look for older men as the low slick isn’t too modern and works well with silver or graying hair. Nevertheless, if you’re a teen boy or a young man, a cool slicked back undercut is super edgy and trendy these days.

Brad’s undercuts have been pretty dramatic and eye-catching recently as he’s starred in plenty of military epics. The good news is that you don’t have to try the disconnected undercut with a slick back if you think it’s too daring. An alternative is Pitt’s classic but trendy crew cut with an undercut on the sides is a great way to make your hair appear thicker and full of volume. Another option is pairing a tapered undercut with a pompadour for the perfect in-between cut.

A fade haircut is a flattering way to wear your hair without going over the top or trying anything too daring. The fade should get gradually shorter as it makes its way towards your ears and neckline, whereas your top hair is better longer. This gives you more stylish options, such as a quiff or textured locks. A modern choice is to combine a fade with a taper before incorporating a soft side part that’s handsome thanks to its sleek and timeless nature.

Wearing your hair long can be tricky, which is why Brad Pitt regularly opts for a ponytail. A ponytail is fashionable, especially when it’s low, and it’s super low-maintenance for busy guys who have no time for washing and styling. Should your ponytail lack a cutting edge, you can mix it up with a man bun. A man bun isn’t as masculine, but its height brings a new dimension to your style.

A pompadour is a fantastic addition for the guys who want a timeless cut that brings different elements to the table. With long front and middle hair, you get to optimize a statement quiff that instantly catches the eye, while tapered sides are clean and concise with extra contrast. The pompadour is a classic hairstyle, and it’s still around today because it works well with all hair types. Either add height to the fringe or highlights to the rest of your hair for a striking visual.

Like Brad, your beard should complement your cut of choice. When your hair is shorter, a fuller beard provides much-needed volume and takes focus away from your hairline. However, longer hair is a better match for designer stubble as a thick beard can make you appear ungainly.
Of course, your facial hair is dictated by your genetic ability to grow a beard. If yours is patchy or fine, you might want to grow a full mustache without a beard on your cheeks.

A goatee goes with almost any hairstyle. The key is to style it so that it connects as a disconnected goatee and mustache isn’t effortless. Also, Brad tends to utilize a soul patch to bring more proportions to the party. If you do prefer a goatee over a beard, you have to shave the rest of your face regularly to ensure one doesn’t morph into the other.

Currently, Brad Pitt’s latest hairstyle has been medium to long due to the fact he’s been recreating classic Hollywood styles for his movies. A new addition to his medium-length hair is a side part comb over that makes his hair seem fuller and thicker.
Although he used to style shorter haircuts that are easy to get and simple to maintain, it seems that his longer styles are here to stay as he continues to pull off a number of variations. From the middle part to the long bro flow, Brad Pitt’s hairstyles will continue to be trendy and sexy.

Description: The best Johnny Depp hairstyles are effortlessly stylish and beautiful. It’s impossible to deny that the actor exudes a natural style that can’t be beat when it comes to long hairstyles. From ponytail to quiff to slicked back hair, check out our collection of pictures detailing each Depp haircut!

Let’s start with Johnny Depp’s Public Enemies hairstyle – a classic vintage prohibition haircut with a low taper fade on the sides and long quiff on top. What became known as the John Dillinger haircut, this textured style is good for guys with thick straight or wavy hair who want a short to medium-length layered hairstyle. If you’re styling this cut, just remember to use a little hair wax or pomade to keep your hair in place throughout the day.

With so many great hairstyles, Johnny Depp is ultimately best known for his long hair, which he started to grow out in the early 90’s. Depp’s hair at the time was a reflection of the burgeoning grunge culture in Hollywood, which replaced the star’s clean-cut look. In future years, Depp’s long hairstyle worked perfectly for roles in Sleepy Hollow, Chocolat, What’s Eating Gilbert Grape, and Pirates of the Caribbean, just to name a few!

As if having a cool long locks wasn’t enough, Johnny Depp’s short hair evokes envy as well! Whether he was styling Donny Brasco’s slicked back hair or Cry-Baby’s rockabilly quiff hairstyle with tapered sides, it doesn’t seem like there is a haircut Depp can’t pull off.
For more on Depp’s latest new hairstyles, check out our gallery below!

Titre: Jensen Ackles Haircut – Dean Winchester Hair
Description: To pull off any of Ackles’s haircuts, you need thick, straight hair. Afterwards, how you cut and style your hair is a matter of personal preference. For example, his classy crew cut is paired with short tapered sides, but guys can choose a high or low fade for a closer cut. The same goes for Jensen’s messy, layered hairstyles and spiky, faux hawk styles. If you’re planning on getting hair like Dean Winchester, check out the signature Jensen Ackles haircut!

A common question asked is “what kind of braids does ASAP Rocky have”. The rapper’s style goes by many names – dreads, man braids, cornrows and French braids – but asking your barber for one of these won’t necessarily get you A$AP Rocky’s braids. Instead, we highly recommend you show your stylist an exact picture of the hairstyle you want to try! To help you prepare for your next visit to the barbershop, check out the best of ASAP Rocky’s long hair and braid styles, including his rarely seen straight hair!

For now, check out some pictures of Zayn Malik’s haircuts and hairstyles over the years! Our collection is a complete guide to Malik’s short and long hair, starting from when he first became a famous celebrity!
This comb over and thick hard part combine to add more flair to the undercut on the sides.
This hair design looks stylish with the thick part and disconnected undercut. Paired with the textured faux hawk and you have one of the best soccer player haircuts!
Ronaldo loves short haircuts, and this tapered cut with a spiky comb over is easy yet cool to style!

The undercut offers a modern alternative to the fade, and can be a great way to change up your look sometimes. This side swept hairstyle can also be combed over or parted to the side for a more classic look.
The best way to manage wavy hair is to cut it short, making it easier to tame and style!

Nom: Classic Taper + Messy Fohawk + Short Mullet
Description: Hair product allows you the option of styling any look, including this messy fohawk.

Nom: Undercut + Messy Short Hair on Top
Description: When you just don’t feel like managing your hair in the morning, try a messy hairstyle for a natural look.

Nom: Spiky Faux Hawk + Line in Hair
Description: The faux hawk (aka fohawk) continues to be one of CR7’s favorite hairstyles!
See the hawk style again, but with a more textured finish.
As the comb over continues to grow in popularity, more guys are getting this classic yet sexy cut!

Nom: Undercut + Spiky Parted Hair + Highlights + Sideburns
Cool Combover + Thick Line in Side
Textured Spiky Hair with High Skin Fade on the Sides
High Fade with Short Curly Hair
Brushed Back Hair with Shaved Sides
Low Bald Fade with Long Fringe

Description:
When it comes to short hair, a crew cut is one of the two hairstyles that is the most synonymous with Ryan Gosling. For the Gosling look, the trick is to ask your barber to remove the ends from your hair so that it has more texture. The backs and sides need fading in seamlessly, and for the ultimate style, you can pair the cut with a short beard.
This side part with a taper haircut on the sides is elevated by the short full beard. With side swept hair, the style is sleek and hot. Guys can also combine short hair with any of the different types of fade haircuts.
This short haircut looks good with a spiky part and short sides. The stubble beard adds a masculine touch.

Ryan Gosling’s long hair in The Notebook arguably made him the heartthrob he is today. Noah’s look is hard to pull off, but it’s doable if you add layers so that the cut has plenty of volume. You can let the fringe fall naturally or part it for an edgier, manlier appeal, and don’t forget about the iconic blonde highlights.
Gosling also styled a longer hairstyle in La La Land. With short hair on the sides and back to contrast the long hair on top, the Hollywood star wore his signature comb over haircut style with well-groomed facial hair.

Nom: Ryan Gosling Crazy Stupid Love Haircut
Description: Gosling’s Crazy Stupid Love haircut is his most stylish to date as it reflects his character. If you want to replicate his sophisticated aesthetic, you should buzz your hair on the back and sides while leaving it longer on top. With a small amount of hair styling product, you can sweep it back or comb it over so that it’s sleek and fashionable. Gosling has a parting, but a sweep or comb over is still gentlemanly as long as it’s polished.

The Drive haircut is popular with guys because his character is a fantastic combination of manly and sensitive. For this style, you’ll need a short haircut with a long fringe and thick hair on top. Be careful because it’s easy for the top hair to fall flat and appear lifeless. Work in your preferred hair product such as pomade or wax and move everything to the side, including the fringe.

A buzz cut is a decisive look for men who need an effortless style while remaining cool and professional. It’s a little close to the scalp, but you’ll get used to it as it grows back and molds to your face shape. Gosling often wore his buzz cut with a beard or goatee because it incorporates texture and volume to the cut without it looking messy or disheveled.

Gosling has switched to darker hair recently, but he’s a natural blonde whose locks stand out because they’re bold, making him appear incredibly confident. You can do the same by bleaching your hair blonde and cutting in layers to texturize or feather it. You should ask a barber to do the highlights in the beginning and do it yourself once you are more comfortable.

The Ryan Gosling beard offers the perfect balance of sexy, rugged, and classy. Gosling matches his beard to the length of his hair at the time. If you’re opting for one of his longer hairstyles, like the one he styled in Crazy Stupid Love, your facial hair should be fuzzier without being unkempt. A good beard shampoo and conditioner can really help stimulate growth and maintain your facial hair.
Start with some beard balm to moisturize and condition. Use a comb to shape and style your beard properly. Those with shorter hair can recreate a Ryan Gosling beard by ensuring their facial hair is the same length as their hair.

Gosling has had a variation of goatees with several of his famous hairstyles. A good way to copy his style is to grow a full beard and trim everything but your mustache and soul patch. This emphasizes your features and creates an eye-catching contrast.

Nom: Undercut + Faux Hawk + Brushed Up Fringe
Description: Classic Justin, this undercut and fohawk combine with a brushed up fringe for a very stylish look.

Nom: Blonde Hair + Long Textured Brush Back
Description: White, blonde and platinum blonde hair have become immensely popular this year! If you’re ever bored with your style, try coloring or bleaching your hair for a unique look.

Nom: Short Sides + Messy Textured Brush Up
Description: This cool short sides long top hairstyle allows guys to style any number of looks, including the quiff, comb over, and pompadour.
The modern comb over has continued to be trend this year.

Nom: Long Hair on Top + Short Sides
Description: With short tapered sides and longer, textured hair on top, this style looks best natural and messy!
The short, modern quiff always looks great, whether you want to style it for the office or socially!
If you’re thinking about growing your hair out, this long blonde quiff can provide excellent inspiration!
The classic taper cut on the sides works with any hairstyle, and this thick style complements it perfectly!
Short sides and medium hair brushed back makes for an all-natural look.
The shaggy hairstyle put Justin on the map as a teen heartthrob.
